Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Rear Facing

Review: The latch would not unbuckle.  My son couldn't get it.  We could barely unbuckle him.  My husband threatened to cut him out of it several times.  My son refers to it as "THE WORST CAR SEAT EVER".  I loved it until I had to get him out.  I am actually am shipping it back to Graco in case they should do a recall, (at my expense).  Honestly, it isn't safe due to the inability to get him out quickly.  Test it in the store the ONE YOU ARE BUYING.  Some work some don't and they don't "loosen up" as we thought.  Gave it four months.  Went and bought a Britax, (painfully expensive but safety is worth it).  WHile the cup holder is better in the Graco and there is a place for small toys the Graco was a loser for us.  Oh and once the child is old enough for a booster the child is too big for the Graco's crotch strap.  It acually is WAY behind the child so the kid sits on it.  That is even on the largest setting on a small for his age child.  I couldn't imagine what that would do under tension on a small child in an accident.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: latch would not unbuckle; inability to get him out quickly; Graco's crotch strap is WAY behind the child so the kid sits on it; even on the largest setting

Review:
Although our baby hasn’t been born yet, my wife and I are gathering everything we are going to need ahead of time. We were able to examine this car seat very well and install it on our car and truck, but we weren’t able to test with our child in it. We have been around car seats all of our lives, but neither of us paid much attention to them, let alone installed one prior to this one. These are our newbie observations:

• The first and most obvious thing we noticed about this car seat was how cute and cheerfully colored it was, but there is so much more to love about this car seat than meets the eye.
• It is very well made. Nothing on this seat was cheap or flimsy.
• It Installed easily and securely in both of our vehicles using the LATCH system, which uses special bottom anchors to firmly secure the car seat in place. Much easier and safer than using a seatbelt.
• Several things in the seat area detach for easy cleaning or to make room as our child grows, and the fabrics can be machine washed and dried.
• The seat is designed to be used as a rear facing seat for babies 5-40lbs and forward facing up to 65lbs. We liked that we will be able to use this seat throughout all our child’s early development.
• The cup holders were removable and could be washed in the dishwasher.
• The seat is certified to go on aircraft, so we can take our car seat with us when we visit our out of state family members.

This car seat has everything we wanted for our baby and we are so glad to have it!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing seat, forward facing
Weight Range of Child: 5-40lbs, up to 65lbs
Installation Type: LATCH system
Material: fabrics can be machine washed and dried

Review:
First of all - This seat is a tank, and I recommend it 100%. I can't imagine that my child would be safer in any other seat.

Pros - Appears to be very safe and made of high quality materials.

Cons - The pads on the straps are horrible (more on this later). Also, the harness is quite difficult to tighten down on the child. Not a problem for myself, but my wife struggled (it didn't stop us from ordering a 2nd seat for her vehicle).

About the pads - Chicco claims that all seats made after October 2013 have new, removable pads. Conveniently enough, this seat as made in September of 2013. Be aware that even if you're ordering this seat well into 2014, you may get a 1st generation model. Nothing is wrong with this seat, but you may find yourself in the same group of those that absolutely hate the shoulder pads. Rather than "recall" the 1st gen pads, Chicco has made it possible to buy another set at $5 + S&H (thanks Chicco...)

UPDATE: If you receive a seat with the old "non-removable" pads, give Chicco a call (or send an email), and they will send you replacement pads.

With the new pads installed, the straps are much easier to adjust. We still love this seat :)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: harness is quite difficult to tighten down on the child; straps are much easier to adjust with the new pads installed
Material: made of high quality materials; pads on the straps are horrible; old "non-removable" pads; replacement pads

This means that the booster seat moves all over the place when in the car. Every time my child gets in, I have to move around the seat until it’s in the correct place to get the seatbelt connected.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: there is no way to lock this seat in place using the car seat hooks in the back of the seat; the booster seat moves all over the place when in the car

Review:
I'm sure the car seat itself is okay, but check to make sure that the item you receive is brand new. The one we just received was clearly not brand new as advertised. You could tell that someone had used it in their vehicle as there were indentations in the fabric and scuffs on the bottom. We will be returning it and purchasing the same one from Target or BabiesRUS.

Update: We ordered the same car seat (different color) from Target. The packaging was the same. The car seat comes in a box and only the cup holders are in a plastic bag. There is no other padding around the car seat asI was expecting and have been sued to with other models. That being said, this car seat had some light scuff marks on it in the same spots as the other car seat (from Amazon), so I'm assuming that all of these car seats have minor scuffing from the manufacturing/testing process and that it does not indicate previous use. The one I ordered from amazon did have indentions in the fabric on the side that made me think it had been used. The one from Target did not, so I am still not sure about that. The seat itself is fairly easy to install and very lightweight, but we haven't had our child in it yet, so the jury is still out on this one. I am going to contact Evenflo and let them know that their packaging for this particular car seat is somewhat off-putting and a disclaimer would be helpful to let us parents know that it is normal for the seat to arrive without being in plastic and packed in foam/Styrofoam.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: 
Material: indentations in the fabric, scuffs on the bottom, light scuff marks, minor scuffing, indentions in the fabric on the side
Installation Type: fairly easy to install

Review: I waited to write this review until I had owned and used this seat for over a month. It's still rear facing and fits ok in my 2011 corolla. It is very hard to get it installed at the correct angle and in there tight. You have to use a pool noodle because a towel just doesn't do it. I though this was standard in most seats, but the second seat I have for my daughter installed super easy without it. The seat will move inches side to side which doesn't seem safe. The seat is squishy and comfy feeling, my daughter seems to enjoy riding in it. The buckles are awful! The lower metal buckle is so hard to get done up and just as hard to undo. The chest buckle sticks and won't unhook sometimes which scares me because I've almost resorted to cutting my daughter out. The seat is cute and may install better forward facing, but overall I wouldn't buy it again. My second seat is a Safety 1st Onside air protection convertible seat. It was cheaper, easier to install, and seams just as safe (if not safer because it doesnt move back and forth) and comfy.

Review:
We purchased this seat specifically for traveling because it is lightweight, has great safety ratings and is FAA approved. The seat itself is fine and worked great in the vehicle, however using it on the airplane was not fun! The buckle from the airplane seat sits right in the small of the back, we didn't realize it on the first flight, our daughter was complaining how bad her back hurt when we landed. When we looked at her back it was bright red and eventually became bruised. On our next flights we took off the pillow of the seat and stuffed it front of the buckle, it still was not enough cushion so we also placed a sweatshirt between the seat and the buckle which did help, but it still puts way too much pressure on the back. I emailed Evenflo and they are aware of the issue and even address it in the manual. This is the response I got and also the statement from the manual

I’m sorry for the issue you had while using this child restraint on an aircraft. For these reasons, the child restraint instruction manual notes: Because of the fixed length of aircraft seat belts, the belt buckle could be behind the child’s back after tightening the belt. For your child’s comfort, Evenflo recommends cushioning the child’s back by placing a small pillow or folded-up blanket, or a folded-up jacket, over the belt buckle.

We will be getting rid of this seat and finding a new one. I was disappointed that this is a known issue with no other resolution.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

My daughter loves it and says it’s comfortable and she loves taking car snoozes in it! Most of all I know she is as safe as she possibly can be. Wish a lot of crashes on our vegas city I do not care what people think that I extend use of car seats! Call me crazy I don’t care my kids are safe! Buy it now

Review:
I was very disappointed when we first attempted to put our new baby in the car seat and realized that you can not adjust the straps from the front. We almost had to turn it upside down to get them to adjust to the correct position. With previous car seats for my other children we were constantly readjusting the straps to get the baby in and out and to adjust for different thicknesses of clothing. We have already bought a new car seat to replace this after only 4 uses due to the lack of convenience.

Pros: very cute pattern and good material quality, light weight

Cons: harnesses are not adjustable from the front and very hard to adjust from the back ***deal breaker for me***

Review: Seat works great.  Especially like the "quick release" LATCH connectors.  Our last seat just had the clips and it would take 10-15 minutes per clip to get them disconnected when we needed to move the seat.  These its just the push of a button just like a seat belt to get the connector loose (they are always out of reach of the child as well).  The shoulder height adjustment is good too.  You just twist a knob to slide the shoulder straps and side impact protection up and down to fit your kid.  The latch to loosen the straps is much better than our last seat as well.  Although, I saw a better designed one when we were looking that had a side mounted knob to loosen or tighten the straps.  The design on this seat is more of the conventional type with a pull strap in between the kids legs and a loosening latch just below the seat covers, but its operation is far better than average for the seats we tried out.  The only things that are kind of a bother are the weight of the seat and the lack of a good level indicator.  It's by far not the heaviest seat we saw, but it is still a bit heavy to move from vehicle to vehicle.  Also, the seat's only leveling indicator is a line on the side of the seat you are somehow supposed to step back and make sure it is parallel to the ground.  Our last seat had an actual level riveted to the side of the seat frame that was much easier and "dummy proof" on leveling the seat.  For something that all the manuals and experts stress as so important, you'd think they could put a better device on it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: shoulder straps, pull strap
Material: seat covers

Review:
I got this seat because it has the highest height requirement of any five point seat (at least from what I could find in fall of 2013). My tall, average weight, daughter LOVES it. We also have Radian XTSLs and we were looking for a seat for our second car for my wiggly almost 7 year old. Although she is both tall and heavy enough to just use a booster, I don't know that she would always sit propperly, so I needed a seat that would keep her in a 5point for another couple years. Problem solved. The Pinnacle is tall, comfy, and feels more like a big kids seat to her.

Added bonus- we were shipped a seat that had been manufactured within 2 months of us receiving the seat, allowing us to use it for its full life and to hand it down to our other kids. We are very very happy with it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: five point seat, big kids seat

Review: This is the 6th diono I’ve purchased. I have 2 children and my own car, my husbands and my mother’s all have these car seats. I wouldnt buy any other. Both my mother and my husband had britax click tights that had to be replaced with these when they broke or stopped working.  I love the slim fit within the car. They easily fit side by side and dont crowd into the neighboring seat. They are heavy and a beast to move but they are steel framed so thats not a surprise. Super easy to use the seat belt or latch system too depending on whether your child is rear or forward facing and your vehicle. My 5 yo sat comfortably to 3 1/2 rear facing and could have even longer based on height and weight restrictions. My 2 yo is still easily rear facing. I would recommend this seat to anyone and everyone. Just be warned it is heavy

Review:
My husband and I chose the Britax due to recommendations from friends and the general Britax reputation. I'm confident it's a very safe seat, and a fine choice.

However, the seat cover is already fraying along the holes for the adjustment strap. The cushion on the crotch strap refuses to stay on, and the velcro tabs meant to keep the straps out of the way are in an odd location and can prevent the straps from fitting in the buckle or tightening properly.

Overall, I think it's a good seat; I'm just a bit disappointed in a few minor features.

Review:
Overall, I find that this a safe car seat. My daughter seems relatively comfortable. After a couple of incidents, the cover is fairly easy to take off and clean plus it does look nice.

A couple of things that take off a star:

I did not install this but my husband, who is an engineer is and read the installation manual more than once, said this was an extremely difficult unit to install. We had a Britax infant seat and it was easy for both of us install.

Additionally, my daughter is small for her age at over two years old so I still have her rear facing. This unit is not adjustable so sometimes she seems a little cramped, especially for long trips. Once we turn her forward facing it won't be a problem, but she does seem to be a little uncomfortable at times.

Other than that, it's a good size and is a safe unit, just a few things to consider.

Review:
I have too many carseats due to people visiting and travelling. Our main seats used to be Britax Marathon, but they're so heavy and my chest protector thingy broke on one. I had a different Safety 1st for travelling and really liked it, so I got this one for my car while my daughter's dad was borrowing my Marathon (rear facing, so the plastic protector wasn't needed).

I really like this seat. The base is high enough that my daughter (now forward facing) can see out the windows from the center seat. It was a little more difficult to install- took my boyfriend kneeling on it to tighten it properly, but it's solid now. It's easy to adjust the back so the straps can grow with her, as those grey plastic twist things control the height. The removable cup holder is a godsend.

A BIG issue that pops up occasionally is that the straps can sometimes get stuck when trying to tighten. As in, they just don't tighten anymore and it's still loose on my daughter. It seems to happen more when the tightening strap is pulled up (which is how we tighten our other Safety 1st), but it's also just hard to tighten properly in general. I'm glad I didn't have this seat when my daughter was really small, as I can't imagine struggling to get it tight enough. In all though, I do like this seat, but eventually I'll get around to replacing it with the Britax (once I remember to call in for replacement parts). I really prefer the other Safety 1st we have more, but it won't last as long with the height.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: forward facing
Weight Range of Child: really small
Installation Type: install, tighten
Harness Type: straps, tighten, straps, tighten, tightening strap, tighten, tight

Review:
We bought this seat because we needed an extra and thought the revolving feature would make putting our toddler in the car easier. We've only used Graco seats up until this point and have never had an issue.
After installing the seat, it was a little awkward to adjust the straps, as there isn't access to one in the back to help pull them into position.
The handle for the headrest also rattles like crazy! I contacted the company and they said this is normal due to the adjustable headrest feature. Normal or not, it is SO ANNOYING.
I have never had a rattling issue with my graco seats that also have an adjustable headrest.
This is a pretty significant design flaw in my opinion.
I will likely be returning the seat.

Review: This car seat is one of the best I’ve ever used (currently on baby #3) Don’t let the great price make you nervous-the quality is great and I like it just as much as the $600 Britax seat/travel system our baby is graduating from. It is very comparable to the Maxi-Cosy Pria line of convertible car seats but half the price. I installed the seat rear-facing by myself in our SUV in less than 10 minutes. I thought it was so easy that I watched several YouTube videos to make sure I did it correctly. If you tighten the latch strap before you latch it in to the seat anchor, the car seat does not wobble or move around anymore. I have not noticed any problems at all with the straps or harness being difficult or sticking. Our baby LOVES it and actually wants to sit in it whereas he hates his former car seat (the Britax.) Oyr daughter passed away shortly after having this baby boy and my husband and I are raising him so we feel even more compelled than we typically did with our kids to give him only the best of everything.  We actually almost didn’t even buy it because the price was so low but I’m glad we did. After all the research I did I am satisfied with the safety of the seat as well as comfort. It beats the Graco  4 in 1 in design, comfort & price & it’s every bit as good as the high end seats. Get it! You won’t regret it! (No one paid me to say this. I just love this seat that much!)

Installation Type: latch

Review: Buyer Beware! I am very frustrated. I absolutely love this carseat and would have rated this a 5 star but after using it for 1.5 years it began to make this horrible rattle sound when driving. It doesn't matter if my daughter is in the seat or not, it rattles. I have contacted Chicco and sent a video of the rattle. They told me that there is nothing wrong with the seat, it just rattles. I am very disappointed in the customer service. You try sitting listening to a non stop rattle. After spending over $300 on a carseat I expect it to not be annoying. My husband duct taped the entire inside of the carseat to help me so I don't get a headache every time we drive but it didn't make a difference. I am very sad that Chicco doesn't back up there product and basically says to live with it. I used to swear by Chicco. I have two convertible Nextfit carseats, a Chicco Bravo Stroller, and a Chicco Double Stroller. I promise I will not make another Chicco purchase. I am now looking at purchasing a Graco carseat.

Review:
I tried this out in the store and am VERY thankful I did. Even with the recline (which reclines maybe about 1/2 an inch), this seat is super upright, to the point where my 2.5 year old sits slumped forward in it and it pushes his head forward. This seat was hard as a rock and just seemed so uncomfortable. The crotch strap was much shorter than expected and very close and tight, my son did not fit in it comfortably. Honestly, it seemed cheaply made.

Honestly, if parents are trying to go cheap, I would just buy a $40 Cosco brand booster with the 5pt harness from Walmart. My son sat in that while on a trip and had a better fit and equal comfort. If a parent actually wants a quality product, go with a Sunshin Kids Radian, or a Britax Frontier. Britax is selling for $202 right now on Amazon. For $60 more, you will have a safet, more comfortable and well made seat that actually FITS.

If you actually care about how comfortable your child will be on a car ride, don't buy this seat. Get a Frontier or Radian. I would give better reviews to a Cosco Walmart booster.

Review: The Evenflo Go Time LX Booster has a great price point. But after assembling it and using it for a few weeks, it's not what I expected. I will start with what I disliked. Upon assembling it, I had a hard time connecting the back piece. It does use extra force, but a bit more then I expected. The cloth cover is great quality, but I was not happy with how it was connected to the seat. The directions explained there were 2 top hooks to connect to, and there was not on my seat. I looked everywhere and had my husband check to see if I was missing something and there were no hooks. There was a little nub but the straps wouldn't stay on. I did find 2 hooks tucked in another spot but had to really stretch the cloth and it almost tore. So I made it work, but it's not correct. I could also use a tool to pull the strap through the other side of the car seat to try and keep it on, but it was so difficult and not an easy hook like every other one. It's almost as if the hooks were placed incorrectly on my seat. The seat is also kinda flimsy. When my son leaned over to fasten his seat belt it easily would tip to the side. So it did not seem sturdy on the leather seat. My favorite feature was how the seatbelt ran through the back of the booster seat. The seatbelt stayed in place and didn't come out. Which was really nice! It was easy for my 5 year old to reach the seatbelt and buckle it himself. The seatbelt is pretty tight in there so you have to pull a little harder to buckle up. The head rest was also very easy to adjust which was nice. Over all, the Evenflo Go Time LX booster is a great price point, but I'd rather pay more money to get something that was more sturdy and an easier set up. Usually I am all for saving money to set up a product, but the cloth seat issue was too frustrating to deal with
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Booster
Installation Type: connecting the back piece, hooks, straps
Material: cloth cover, leather seat

Review:
I ended up keeping it, but really not so happy with it. The two main problems are:
1. The straps are so close to each other they are cutting into my kids neck. I had to find very thin, small and soft padding to cover the upper part of the straps and now it is OK, but really a bad design.
2. The seat is in a very strait, so when he falls asleep he is not in a very good position and his head falls forward.
Also the seat is very low, so he cant see much out of the window.
We are still using it with the harness, So at least the strap thing will be fine once we change into a booster.
It does attach nicely to the car with the LATCH system, and seems to be sturdy.
Bottem line is that it is a good price, but does need some improvements.

Review:
We did a LOT of research into child seats, and everywhere we went people said that Britax is the Cadillac of child seats. After all of our research, this turned out to be true. These seats are built solid, and they are bulky too - just like a Cadillac.

We considered the Marathon, the Boulevard CS and the Advocate CS. We decided on the Boulevard because the Advocate was just too bulky. We have a 2002 Honda Civic, and we thought the Advocate would take up the whole back seat! As it is, the Boulevard takes up a lot of space, but there is room in there for a second person to sit, even with the seat placed in the center (well, just off-center).

The seat itself is actually really comfortable (or so it looks). The padding is very nice, the belts are well made and do not rub the skin of the child, and many things are adjustable so you can get the little one snug and comfy.

Overall, I am very happy with the seat, and if I had to do it again, I would probably buy the very same seat. The only downside is the bulkiness, but that is because of all the padding and side-impact protection. So I guess I shouldn't really complain.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Boulevard
Material: padding is very nice, belts are well made and do not rub the skin, all the padding and side-impact protection

Review:
This booster seat truly is revolutionary. It's so portable, there is no longer an excuse not to use a booster on vacation and it's so subtle, it is a much more appealing option for older kids.

My daughter is 6 and is happy to ride in a high back booster with head protection. That is still my preferred seat for her. That being said, I needed another seat to accommodate a third passenger when carpooling for school. I have a VW Tiguan so space is tight: A second booster would need to fit between a Kiddy CruiserFix Pro and a forward-facing Britax Boulevard. This fits safely, though it is tight.

My ONLY complaint is that there is no way my kid could get into this herself. Even I find it challenging to lean over the CruiserFix Pro and guide the lap belt through the holders. I'm sure it will come with age and practice, but getting her in and out is frustrating. The existing seats make it tough. Still, this one drawback is not enough to deter me from recommending it and I've purchased a second one for my parents.

We don't use it for everyday use. My now 5 year old prefers his harness car seat. But these are perfect for trips with rental cars, grandparents, last minute carpools, taxis, etc.

My son can get in and out of it himself, just as quick as he can his Harness car seat. We like having these around, just in case.

My only complaint are the function of the red winged things that hold the belt. They only work one way and have to be moved from a slide underneath the seat. Those are a small PIA, but workable. Nothing is perfect. My son doesn't like this seat for longer trips. He really prefers his 5 pt harness seat.

Review:
My husband and I purchased the Annabelle color and love it (I consider it unisex color). 100% recommend and I’ve heard nothing but good things about the Graco slim fit and it’s actually one of the top 3-5 recommended car seats! Many of the other reviews reassure it! The bad reviews I think are mostly just the people that got a bad apple out of the batch and I can for sure see how if their package was handled and delivered the way my was. My LO is 2 mths and to be honest I should’ve gotten a convertible car seat sooner for day one at the fact we never use the carrier car seat OUTSIDE of the car. We either carry in our hands or use the stroller so we always end up taking the baby out of the carrier vs the whole thing. This has for sure helped my decision for convertible car seats for my future children!

The handling in Amazon’s care? Not so great… The person who delivered our stuff was great! But our box was COMPLETELY opened no tape down or anything and the bottom and sides of the box was just BEAT UP. Our delivery person said it was always like that since given in their hands. It was no where NEAR visually appealing. One of the straps came in twisted but it was an easy fix thankfully. That’s my only down fall with ordering big things from Amazon but I needed the product quickly. I’m GLAD nothing was broken but you’d think something was the way it looked. I’m still making sure nothing is broken as we are using it but I’m pretty sure it’s good!

Review:
We were on a trip and suddenly the straps refused to release on our Boulevard car seat. So I rushed to Babies R Us to get a new one to find that they were sold out of all but the Advocate, so I bought it.
A couple of cons that annoy me regularly:

1. The release for the straps is very tight. It almost seems like it hasn't released and you have to tug at it. Not as smooth and easy as the Boulevard.
2. The cost.
3. The size. It's huge! This doesn't matter much in my minivan, but we travel a lot and it would be terrible on the plane. It's also heavy.

So if you're wondering why I bought another, here's why:

1. They redesigned the Boulevard and basically it's now the Pavillion. One of the things they eliminated on the new model was the click safe. It's silly, but I love that feature.
2. Amazon had an awesome sale.
3. I wash the covers when needed and I did not want to have 3 different seats to buy covers for. I couldn't return the seat we'd needed on the trip for the Pavillion and I needed a seat for my second son in my husband's car, so when this went on sale, I bought it.

In the end I still wish the store we ran to had the Pavillion, but oh well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Boulevard, Advocate, Pavillion
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: 
Harness Type: straps, release for the straps
Material: covers

I spent hrs researching and want to make sure my grandson would be safe and protected. This car seat was  it. We the car seat arrived and taken out of the box I was impressed . The picture is good but having it in front of you was better.The cup holders are great, you can close it if not in use. It was a Black Friday and cyber Monday deal. Review: I got this 4-in-1 car seat by Graco because it will last for years and be the only car seat I'd have to buy for one child. It starts off with rear-facing harness belted (4 - 40 lbs), then forward facing harness belted (22 - 65 lbs), then car belted highback booster (40 - 100 lbs), and finally the car belted backless booster (40 - 120 lbs). So far we've only used the rear-facing with harness seat for our infant. I really like that there's a lot of cushioning and support with the infant insert. It helps keep their head for bobbling all around and provides surrounding protection from all sides. I think this is a crucial feature because a baby's head and neck are so fragile and must be fully supported at all times. The harness is easy to tighten/loosen and holds them firmly in place while driving. It also comes with padding on the arm rests, which believe or not, a lot of car seats don't have. The dual cup holders are nice for storing drinks and snacks while driving. My other favorite feature is how easy the cover is to remove and throw in the washing machine after any messes. Then you can easily snap it right back in before you're next trip out. I haven't come across any issues with this car seat whatsoever as of yet, but I haven't had the opportunity to use the older child configurations. Overall I feel very comfortable entrusting my child's safety with this car seat due to its superior design that clearly placed protection at the front of its plan.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing, Forward facing, Highback booster, Backless booster
Weight Range of Child: 4 - 40 lbs, 22 - 65 lbs, 40 - 100 lbs, 40 - 120 lbs
Installation Type: Belted
Harness Type: Harness
Material: Cover, Padding

Review: I was optimistically cautious when I bought this seat because of some of the reviews. It was easy to adjust & not a pain to put in. I have a 2014 Chevy Impala and it fits great. There isn't a ton of extra room behind the passenger seat, but it isn't any different from the infant car seat we had. So no loss there. The little guy would cry going into the other seat & cry a lot while in it. Also, when he slept his head would be cranked over & look uncomfortable. In this seat is head is supported & has been content sitting in it. Definitely a good buy & highly recommend it.

Review:
We bought this car seat with our oldest who is now three and now our one year old is using it.

Both kids love it and the oldest say's that it's very comfortable especially compared to the Graco (that we actually hate but was given to us) that is in my husbands truck. We looked for about a year before we finally settled on this one, what actually sold us was the car crash related reviews & the side impact features.

The kids love the cup holder! It comes off and can be moved to either side which is good if you need to make room in the back or have a smaller car. I have read a few reviews on the recline & belting of this but we have not had any problems with belting it in rear or forward facing. As for the recline.. we have a really good recline with it in my scion xb & my husbands ford truck it may just depend on the vehicle.

The only complaint that we (mainly I) really have is that the older models seems to be kind of wider and not as slim as the newer one's we have seen recently in store. I am 5'2, 125 lbs and at times it is kind of annoying to lug from car to car but my husband is not bothered by it.

We recently purchased a Britax booster for our oldest and I honestly feel that this is just as good of not better in some aspects as the more popular Britax brand. I have noticed that when we moved the Britax to the center seat (my son get's car sick) that the Safety 1st is so wide that it pushed the Britax over to the side some rather then right perfectly in the center of the seat but that is something we are trying to correct. I don't know about the newer models latch but if they would change them to the kind that just clicks on and also the belt path to where it is in front (like Britax) then I would sale the Britax in a heartbeat!!

Overall this is one of the best car seats that we have owned or looked at and I am very confidant that it is very safe should something bad ever happen. We are looking to perchance a newer model of this so that we have a extra for my husbands truck!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing, forward facing
Weight Range of Child: one year old, three
Installation Type: belting, latch
Harness Type: 
Material:

Review: I fit three of these across in the back of my 2017 Honda Civic Si. This particular one (the third) is rearfacing. My only complaint is that it has a longer distance front to back when rear-facing than others I’ve used. The passenger seat has to be pushed as far forward as the car will allow, so anyone taller than 5’6” would struggle to sit in the front seat. Nevertheless, I think these seats are by far the best car seats I’ve owned because they are sleek, simple, and can fit 3 across with ease. I have had Britax and Clek car seats as well, but I wouldn’t buy them again knowing how versatile Diono is. Just FYI, Clek says they can fit 3 across, and they can in most places (like our Honda Pilot), but they will not fit 3 across in a 2017 Honda Civic. Gotta have the Diono for that.

Review: This is rated to 65 lbs, but seems it would be impossible for it to be used up to that weight limit.  My daughter is 38 lbs and the strap that goes between the legs is so short it was pressing into her thighs.  She was complaining of it pinching less than 30 minutes into being strapped in. Her head leaned forward just while she was sitting due to the top portion being thicker than the back.  Her head was falling down as soon as she went to sleep.  The black portions are mesh and I am not sure how they would wear.  I have a Graco MyRide 65 that I love but decided to buy this instead.  I was very disappointed and returned it as there is no way my child will fit into a 5 pt harness.  She barely fit at 38 lbs.  Now I have 2 Graco My Ride 65 and love them!

The car seat was difficult to install but once it was correctly in place is seems to be comfortable for the little one I purchased it for.
It works better in the front facing position. The rear facing position doesn't seem to instal with a tight enough fit.

Review:
We love this car seat and so does our son! His first time using it was an 8 hour car ride and he just stared out the window the whole time - loving how upright he could sit! He has GERD so a comfortable upright chair was important.

My favorite part so far is how easy it is to take it in and out of the car. It has a simple release button that takes all the hassle, struggle and pain out of unclipping regular car seats!

I would definitely recommend this car seat. Looking forward to getting a lot of use out of it!

Installation Type: easy to take in and out of the car, simple release button, unclipping

Review: Got this for a great deal. Our old Graco expired so for baby #4 we needed a new seat. I love the gender neutral color, and and black hides any dirt well. Ours seems a little trick to pop out of the base, but that could just be the angle I’m pulling it out at. This also doesn’t snap into our old Graco stroller: but I would definitely buy another one!

Review: Love the carseat, but pieces started falling out of it starting the week after we purchased the car seat. We've now had 3 springs fall out of the seat, and it no longer click and holds in position like it's supposed to. Extremely disappointed in Graco and this product.

Review: Does Hersey really has a lot to like about it as far as having cup holders and a place to put the straps on the side of the seat so the kid doesn't sit on it however the buckle on and the straps don't tighten very well so sometimes will get to our destination and the straps will be loose even though they were tight when we started our trip. Looking back I wish I would have returned it this when I had the chance.

Review: I purchased two of these inflatable seats to use in rental car and Uber. They were both easy to inflate. It took about 15 seconds to inflate and then easily close. The seat effectively secured my two previous granddaughters that weigh 42 pounds and 73 pounds. When it was time to deflate they quickly deflated and were stored in my backpack. They worked great for our seven day trip.

Review: They said max height for booster is 49 but my daughter was maxed out at about 40 inches. Her shoulder straps were below her shoulders snd her head was at the very top of the chair. Even if I were to switch to the booster feature her head won’t be comfortable without a head rest.
Attribute_Related_Content: Weight Range of Child: max height for booster is 49 but my daughter was maxed out at about 40 inches

Review:
Like the seat. It seems sturdy and well constructed. The seat cushion feels soft. One improvment on the head support cushion would be a way to keep it up behind the back part of the cushion.

My main complaint is the straps used to secure the seat with tethers. Tightening these is difficult. You have weigh the seat down in order to pull the tethers tight. Also, when releasing them you have to again push the seat down against the car seat to make the tethers loose.
When the strap is loosened you can press in the release button and get it loose. But it requires way too much work to do this. If you are leaving the seat installed this will not be a problem.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: straps used to secure the seat with tethers; Tightening these is difficult; You have weigh the seat down in order to pull the tethers tight; when releasing them you have to again push the seat down against the car seat to make the tethers loose; press in the release button

Review: I purchased this car seat for my grandson who is 40 pounds and 42 inches tall! He loves it because it’s comfortable and I love it because it’s safe and looks really good in my car. It has a hidden snack tray and a built-in cup holder. He is able to buckle himself in and I just check for safety as the buckle has to go through the plastic piece at the top in order to securely hold him in place. I do wish however that it had a top safety attachment and not just two for the bottom. However you can’t budge the seat once  it’s installed, it just makes more sense to be able to have a strap on the top to latch it to the top safety bar of my car. That’s why I gave it a four star rating. As for comfort, my grandson loves it the seat is cushioned well and I like that it has side head cushions

Review: We were in the market for a new carseat as my daughter was in the verge of out growing her newborn carseat. I have a sports car with a very small back seat, so it's difficult to find a seat that's small enough/the right shape. My mother showed me this model in a store, and I liked it almost immediately. After ordering and receiving it, I love it. It's perfect. It will grow with my daughter, the color is fun and vibrant, and I honestly feel safer with her in it than I did when she was in her newborn seat.

Review: Would be a 5 star rating if the carseat had a higher quality sun shade. It's not large enough or sturdy enough to really even drape a blanket over it to keep the weather at bay. It is very lightweight however, that has been nice!

Review: My husband and I are budgeting and tight on money considering he recently graduated from the University and is job hunting while I raise our 1st born son, but when it came down to a car seat we did not hesitate about prices! Of course we bit our nails in "yikes" pricey. But we ordered the "open box" Britax Advocate car seat with zero doubt in mind. Our son is our own miracle baby, and if we are blessed with only 1 child,  due to my infertility, we will gladly do everything within our parent responsibility to keep him safe. He's a big boy, and hates being strapped down, but this car seat is "roomy", cozy, soft- bueno! Worth every penny. There are many crazy, hater folks out there on the roads, best to be wise and do the best part we can in being safe. This was a 2 thumbs up buy. We do not regret it. We will be frugal with other things, but not with this. Good buy.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: big boy
Material: cozy, soft

They like that it sits high and they can see better than their regular seat. After a major spill we discovered it's easy to clean, too. Makes the grandparents even grander!

We are all so happy with the choice.  It is easy for our grandson to get in and out and he loves having both the cup holder and snack tray! Review: I heard people complaining about the release button and not being able to get it in right. I think its operator error. I have no problem with just one pushing the button and having it release automatically. Also i installed it with a regular seatbelt and the little locking clip and it doesnt move at all no matter what I do you cant push it to the side it doesnt lift up or push forward. So for the price its decent its not as comfy as the other one I have (Graco myride 65) but it works for a sometimes extra car seat for grammas car. My daughter likes it no problem getting her in an out or getting the harness to adjust. Might just be that people got a lower quality or again arent installing it right because the problems I read about which almost kept me from buying it I don't have.

Review: I purchased 3 of these in 2017. They all have held up very well with daily use. The only complaint I have and it's becoming more of an a daily annoyance is that the head rest keeps falls down. It's a poor design. There is a red lever on top that adjusts the head rest. The problem is the piece in the back that is suppose to keep the head rest at the level you set it is too small. So, every time my daughter gets out of the seat that piece gets bumped and pushed back in causing the headrest to slide back down. She's not pushing back with any great force, just the normal getting out of the car.  This is an on going issue with ALL 3 of the seats. So, every time my daughter gets into the car seat we have to pull it back up. Other than that the seat is great.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: head rest adjustment mechanism, red lever on top adjusts head rest, piece in back to keep head rest at set level is too small, head rest keeps falling down, slides back down when piece gets bumped

Review: Have been with the brand for 10+ years. This time we purchased a Graco convertible because of the overwhelmingly  nice ratings and unbeatable price.  But every time I put my daughter in it, she cried hard.  We bought Marathons again, guess what? Baby stopped crying… we returned Graco and kept the Marathon.  Has been half year, Still happy with the purchase.

Review: I really like this car seat but unfortunately will be returning it. The round key for the click tight feature is too hard to turn! My parents can never get it out (they're in their 70's). If you have someone whos fingers arent that strong i wouldn't recommend this seat...  Sometimes I even have a hard time turning the key. Its too small and in an awkward place :/ I know they changed the key feature in the new click tight one4life seats that are now out...so Im gonna go for that one and see how I like it.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: The round key for the click tight feature is too hard to turn. The key is too small and in an awkward place.

Review:
CONS: I really like this car seat overall but I am disappointed that after relatively infrequent use in the last five months, the fabric around my baby’s feet is incredibly pilly. Pretty disappointed in that for the price. It was difficult to fit my chunky newborn in at first because the straps wouldn’t loosen enough. To overcome that I had to unclip the portion of the strap used to tighten from under the front of the seat.

PROS: As far as everything else, it is very easy to install, my baby seems to like it, and the headrest is easy to adjust. Easy to move in and out of stroller. Baby had a blowout in the seat and it was not overly difficult to remove and clean the fabric. There were also no stains even with the light color.

In general I am happy with this car seat and would recommend it but I wish a few things would change.

Review: We are Britax fans and have both the infant carseat and stroller as well. We love the quality of this carseat and the fact that it not only feels solid and safe for our son, but has the safety ratings to back it up. It's pretty user friendly, but I took one star off because its a little bulkier than it needs to be (flares out on the sides which impedes anyone but a child or very small adult to sit on either side when it's in the middle seat). Also, the hole where you put your finger to release the harness always moves a bit, taking me that extra 30 seconds or so to find (in which my son decides he must get out NOW) which is slightly annoying, but overall I really like this car seat and did a lot of research before buying it.

Review: I bought this car seat after reading about the safety ratings and I must say, I am quite pleased that I own a total of 4.  My kids love it and they are quite comfortable in it - they nap in them on long drives.  The two sets of upholders are great as they can have a cup in one and a toy in the other.  The bottom snaps out so it's easy to travel with - I just have to get a travel bag for these.  Other that that, you can't beat these on safety and comfort.

Review: For rear facing you have to use the harness cover they provide, and it’s an absolute monstrosity. I wanted to really like this car seat but ultimately returned it because the straps pinched my kids’ necks very hard. It is a slim option but there are slimmer options available. The straps also felt loose once we tightened them down. I’m not a car seat noob but our previous car seats felt much safer than these. Color options are great though and love the steel frame. It was relatively easy to manipulate the harness positions and we found the best way to secure it was with the seat belt. The latch option left all too much wiggle room.

Review:
I’m going to try my best to explain this...but here is my review on the Safety 1st Jive Convertible car seat.

I purchased this car seat to put in my moms truck as a rear facing car seat until Posey is flipped front facing. I installed it in my car to begin with so I could make sure it was set up properly and ready to go before we made our trip to North Dakota. I noticed there was a slight issue when I put it in my car but figured it was because I did it quick. So I took it to my moms and installed it in her truck for the trip. Thought all was good and we started our journey. We stopped to get gas the first time and noticed Posey was leaning further back and the level line was no longer level to the ground. Figured I did it wrong again and just reinstalled the seat and continued going. Stopped for gas again and the seat was leaning backwards again. So again I adjusted it and went about our way. When we made it to our destination I made a comment to my mom that the seat just wasn’t securing the right way. Pulled the book out and made sure I did everything as it states and I had. So we just went about our trip. Then we moved the kids seats from my moms truck to my sisters truck and I could not for the life of me get it to sit properly rear faced. So I turned her front facing against my own judgement because it was secure and felt safer then putting her in it rear facing. I felt better about it if she sat front facing then rear at this point because clearly something was off with the seat. We went to leave and head back to California and I installed it in my moms truck again and it just wouldn’t secure right. So I rolled up a blanket and put it underneath it hoping that would help. And it didn’t... so we put her front facing again which in turn caused her to get carsick and vomit all over. So I rolled those blankets back up and flipped her back around and drove home. I wrote the company an email about my concerns and hadn’t heard back. But it just wasn’t sitting well with me. So I called them today and they pulled my email up and spent 30 minutes FaceTiming me to ensure that I was installing the seat correctly. Which I was. They called another employee in to watch me install and tighten the seat into the car. I showed them how easily it pushes backwards and how she would wind up laying on her back just about in the car. They told me the seat isn’t compatible with my car. I told them I have installed this specific seat in not one, but three different vehicles and it does it in all three. They said that it must not be compatible with any of them. I looked on their website to find a compatible car seat list and couldn’t find one. Also read reviews on amazon and their website stating the same issue I’m having. They ended up issuing me a refund and having me destroy this seat and will ‘look into’ others to see if they are having the same issue. I’m not sure how I feel about that but I hope this post sways some people on purchasing this and saves a babies life. Because even the lady on the phone from the company said the seat should not push backwards so far that the baby is laying on their back. Your child should not be able to push their feet on the back seat and move the car seat backwards. Ever. And that was the point I was trying to prove to them. I’m not sure if they even believe me. But by golly I will not purchase another seat from them.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: 
Harness Type: 
Material:

Review:
The major issue I have with this seat is that it is difficult to get it to recline properly without taking up so much space. You need to make sure that the alignment sticker is level with the ground and this is very difficult to achieve. We have a Kia Sorento which is not small, but getting the Stratos 65 level takes moving the front seat up further than you really want to. And even after adjusting the reclining wedge to the max setting we still had to roll up a towel and jam it under the front of the Stratos 65 to tip it back enough.

Otherwise, the build quality seems to be OK. The belts and buckles are designed well and work nicely. However, I would spend more to get a more feature rich seat if that is an option for you especially if you have a small car.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Clicktight

Review: It came it great condition. It's beautiful. The plastic parts are flimsy. And the padding behind the head sticks out further than the padding behind the back section causing the head to be leaned forward with chin going in toward the chest. That is my main dislike. I'm not sure whether to keep it or not.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: The plastic parts are flimsy.

Review: Daughter loves it.  Pretty sure when I bought it the details did not say that it could or could not go rear facing.  It has since been updated.  If you are unsure, please know THIS SEAT DOES NOT WORK REAR FACING.  I would have bought something else if I had known that before but I kept it and it works.  The buckle can he a little hard to get in.  I never loosen the straps because they are too hard to tighten because of the ergonomics of where the tightening strap is between the legs.  Good seat.  It works.  Probably pretty safe.

Review: Brilliant idea but more time should've been spent on it. It's rather difficult for younger ones to do on their own as the seat rides up and the red clips on the bottom DONT LOCK into place. I bought 3 when they were first coming out and I only use them for a quick carpool ride if needed.

This car seat isn’t even 2 years old and there is no way the chintzy piece of plastic holding that bolt in would hold up in an accident. Very disappointed & we have 3 of these in the same model.  Refuse to put her in any of them now so had to fork out $400 for new ones from a competitor.

Review: We bought a Britax car seat because they are the safest car seats on the market, and when it comes to our little ones we would rather spend the money and be sure they are safe than to settle for a cheaper seat and regret it if something were to happen. This color is nice because it’s gender neutral and doesn’t show dirt easily. We also have a cowmooflague version for our daughter and we love that one too. They are a pain in the butt to install, but we also rarely take them out and we love how sturdy they are in the backseat of our car.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: When these work they are great. Easy to carry around with, works as advertised for Uber and travel. The first one I bought worked for a month then sprung a slow leak. After a 15 min ride with my daughter the booster was almost totally deflated, providing no additional safety. Likewise when I’d deflate it and roll it up it would inflate by itself via the same leaking seam or hole. I then returned and exchanged it for a new one. Worked great for a while then again, one month later it had the same problem as the first. I’m about to buy a competing product because this is getting ridiculous. Clearly there is some kind of product defect in many batches of these booster seats.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
we did lots of research before deciding to buy this chicco nextfit car seat.
In my opinion car seats are not designed to accommodate the new rear facing position laws, and I hope there will better choices on the market soon.
That said, I'm very happy with this car seat. It fits into my tiny toyota prius c.
- compact design, does not take up a lot of room.
- installing is a breeze, it takes less than 2 minutes.
- 9 reclining positions make it very comfortable for the baby/toddler.
- very well padded and comfortable.
- the head support is also comfortable.
- easy to put baby in and out of the car, some reviewers complained that they struggled to put the baby in the car. I did not have that problem. But an easy solution is to recline the seat, before you put baby in.
- shoulder straps adjust automatically when you raise the head rest.
- i got the open box seat from amazon (new car seat) and saved over $50!!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: installing is a breeze, it takes less than 2 minutes.
Material: very well padded and comfortable.

Review: I bought this car seat for my youngest when he outgrew his infant seat, at just under 1, since the suggested age to turn a child forward facing went up to 2. He will be 2 in February, and he's already too tall for the harness in the forward facing position. It's very wide, feels cheap and much less sturdy than I'd like, and the strap on the left side has always been tighter than the one on the right for no reason. I will be having to shop for a new car seat for one of my boys in a few months, which means I'd have been better off buying something else to begin with when I bought this one.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: just under 1, 2
Harness Type: harness, strap on the left side has always been tighter than the one on the right

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Just used this product on a trip from Houston to Michigan.  Great product.  My 1 1/2 year old loved sitting in her car seat going threw the terminal waving everyone.  Work as designed and was really easy to remove and place the car seat on the cary-on with out much effort.  The only issue is to make sure your carry-on is as tall as your car seat.  Would recommend this product to anyone traveling.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Perfect second car car seat. This is not the car seat we use for the majority of our car rides. It is in my husbands car for when we need to use both vehicleS. Seat works great! Not super comfy but fine for short infrequent trips.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
The seat is beautiful and I love that I can adjust it pretty much until she’s not a toddler anymore! I am having trouble loosening and tightening the straps while she buckled in the car. It is hard to get my finger in the slot where the push lever is and then very hard to pull the string to tighten it properly. It is also nearly impossible to adjust the recline position while she’s in the seat and rear facing (not sure if that’s on purpose but sometimes she likes to lean back others not).

I like the material it’s soft and comfortable and the color is better than it shows online. My daughter has enjoyed it so far as there’s much more space for her now than in her infant seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Harness Type: straps
Material: soft and comfortable

Review: Beware. I took my baby to daycare and since she was sleeping in the car seat, I took her in with the carrier. She woke up when we got in so I loosened the straps and took her out and took the empty carrier to my car when I left. When I went to pick her up I noticed I couldn't tighten the straps. My husband had to come and take her home in his car seat and then we dealt with it when we got home. We learned that the belt got stuck in the base and he had to use some force to get it out. This resulted in the belt getting a snag. I called chicco customer service and they took my email to follow up. They never emailed me. I contacted them through their website and it took a week and a half to get the answer to my situation. They explained that I could no longer use the belt but I could BUY ANOTHER ONE from their site. Are you kidding me, this was a malfunction with the car seat and the belt getting stuck in the base. If anyone asks I will say this is my top regret in baby gear. Do not buy this product. Also the carrier is heavier than most.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: loosened the straps, couldn't tighten the straps, belt got stuck, belt getting a snag, could no longer use the belt

Review:
Bought this because kid’s head always fall to the sides when sleeping. This booster does the job in terms of support and side impact protection. It feels light considering it’s pretty much a chair. Upholstery feels good to the touch and made from water proof material. Kid loves to sleep on it, great head support on the sides. Bought it on sale at 79, worth every penny.

***After having it for a month I noticed it occasionally rattles when the car goes over large pot holes or real bad uneven surfaces. However, one mitigation is to tape the adjustable backrest with the frame so it doesn’t shift up and down. Other than that the chair is solid.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Material: water proof material

Review:
I absolutely LOVE this carseat. I purchased this for my two year old, as her other car seat, although convertible, she was outgrowing. It took me a minute to read the directions to make the proper adjustments and depending on how you secure it (seatbelt or latch/front facing or rear facing) it can be a challenge to secure. Once it IS secure, the seat is very nice to use. What I like most is the weight limit and it will be the last car seat that I will have to purchase because it is convertible. On the other hand, it initially was a pain to clean and I had to watch a You Tube video on how to dismantle it and clean it best. Once I watched and did it, I had no problems repeating the process. This seat is as heavy as any other convertible seat, there's no advantage in that regard, but my daughter seems to really like the attached cup holders and side pockets for her toys.

The only other thing, is that I found the buckle a little hard to disengage. I have rheumatoid arthritis which has hindered my dexterity, so it has taken me a while to figure out an easy way to disengage the buckle. Because of the way the seat is designed, I definitely suggest that the seat is checked by someone certified to ensure that the height is correct and that the crotch buckle is in the proper position since it can be modified. I also appreciate that the potty training seat covers fit very well in this seat, regardless of brand. Overall, it's a really beautiful seat and I'm glad that I purchased it.
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review:
This is a good quality seat. My little one is on the small-side - a very short, slim 20 pounds, and he looks tiny compared to the seat. Even so, he seems very comfortable in it. We do a lot of traveling and he seems very comfortable and happy in this seat compared to the old baby seat. Maybe it is the soft, fluffy material?

It was fairly easy to install. When the seat was not yet installed, I thought the adjustment handles were going to be difficult to use, but once installed I never noticed any issues (and forgot about it completely).

My only slightly negative comment (I can't even say that it is a complaint) is that the seat is quite large for my vehicle. I have an older Toyota Highland. There aren't any clips in the middle seat, and the middle seat is slightly curved, so car seats have to be installed in one of the outside seats. In our Highlander, the seat folds down to make a larger trunk, with a 2/3 and 1/3 fold. We installed this seat in the outside seat that would allow the 2/3 seat to still fold down so that we can still access the third row seating. However, we can't fold down the 2/3 seat-back because of the giant "wings" on this car seat - without quite a bit of effort. We don't use the third row that much, and often it is just for kids who are happier to climb over the seat anyway, so it hasn't been too much of a problem.

Review:
Many reviewers have commented here that the crotch strap is incredibly short. I spent some time agonizing before I finally ordered, since I did not want to have to return it. But it turns out, the crotch strap is plenty long. I even bought a second one for my other child. Here's what you need to do.

1. Once your child is too large for the smallest setting on the 5 point harness, follow the instructions to REMOVE THE BODY SUPPORT. This is the thing that looks like extra padding in what would be the lumbar region if you could somehow squeeze an adult into the seat. In my copy of the manual it is shown on page 6 under "Features". If you fail to REMOVE THE BODY SUPPORT, yes, indeed, the crotch strap appears to be ridiculously short. So, in conclusion, REMOVE THE BODY SUPPORT per the instructions.

2. Also, as many have commented, move the crotch strap to the second slot. Make sure you are using the second slot in the hard plastic base, not just the second slot in the fabric insert.

3.... Read more
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type

Review: I am so pleased with this booster.  It was easy to assemble and install in the car.  I like that it has the latch system so the seat always feels secure.  My child is comfortable. She loves the cup holder and secret compartment.  She especially loves that it is purple.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: latch system

Review:
So I’d like to give this car seat a fair review. We’ve purchased two of them and there are some amazing pros but also some horrible cons that make me regret ever buying these very expensive car seats, that I am now stuck with FOREVER.

Pros
1. Super easy to install
2. Very easy to adjust as child grows

Cons
1. IMPOSSIBLE to actually clean when you have a messy child.

Let me explain. My three year old son has had this seat for a year and a half. Trying to take the car seat pad off is an adventure in and of itself. You need a YouTube video just to figure it out. But that’s not even the worst part.

There’s no way to clean up a big mess. It seeps down into the actual car seat which you can’t disassemble to clean or fix. My son peed on his by accident. He was asleep and woke himself up by peeing. I cleaned the pad and even sprayed down the seat, because it had pee all down in it. Thank goodness I don’t keep my manual where they suggest or it would have had urine on it as well. The manufacturer suggests that you spot clean or just wash the pad. But that does nothing if the mess is all the way down into the seat. They even say you shouldn’t spray down the seat, but I can’t exactly leave pee sloshing around in it now can I.
So spray it I did, which then water gets in it. Oh the predicament. But water is better than pee right.

Scenario two. My youngest daughter puked on hers. No big deal it’s mostly on the pad and that’s washable. You know what’s not washable, the super high tech straps. First you can’t get them off the seat. So you have to bring the whole seat to the bath, use a bowl of water etc to clean those bad boys. Your supposed to just spot clean those. But that doesn’t really take the puke smell out. So you can incorrectly wash it with some type of chemical and worry that you’ve destroyed the strap or you can live with puke smell. Neither are a good option in my opinion.

Now I’ve only had to clean these a few times but each time has made me want to pull my hair out.

So mommas save yourself the headache and buy a different seat. Because I don’t know to many kids who aren’t messy and you don’t want to keep their mess FOREVER.

Graco please redesign these seats with children in mind. They spill, pee, puke etc all over their seats sometimes multiple times in a week. Make it easy for the mom to clean it up, being a mom is hard enough already without car seats that cause more trouble than they are worth.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Super easy to install
Harness Type: the super high tech straps, you can’t get them off the seat, Your supposed to just spot clean those
Material: Trying to take the car seat pad off, There’s no way to clean up a big mess, It seeps down into the actual car seat which you can’t disassemble to clean, I cleaned the pad, just wash the pad, the pad and that’s washable

Review: Bought for a recent trip, worked on airplane nicely. This car seat is impossible to install in cars... affordable and great for travel (light weight) but I question how safe it ACTUALLY is due to how hard it is to install.. there is something to be said for car seats that come with bases, worth the extra $10
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: impossible to install in cars, how hard it is to install, car seats that come with bases
Material: light weight

Review:
My greatest trouble is the overall length when installed behind the driver's seat as a rear facing seat. It makes me put the seat up pretty far in my mid-sized SUV. I cannot mark down its rating because I have not tried anything else in the vehicle.

The unit I received was manufactured 2-3 months prior and was well packaged.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Rear Facing

Review: This booster seat is just right for my 5 year old grandson; as he outgrew the traditional 3-point harness carseat.  The highback is perfect, because if he falls asleep while we are traveling, his head is somewhat supported.  The price was better than I had seen in our local department stores.

Seat Type: booster seat, highback

Review: Great car seat - the bottom back cushion doesn't stay in place very well and I wish the cup holder was on the opposite side, but other than that I am very happy with this seat.  Great value for the price since you can use it for so long.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: I purchased this seat as it was necessary to go with my quinny zapp stroller. I am very pleased with how light this seat is.  The only problem I had at first was I couldn't find the instructions, I thought that none had come with the seat, however a friend who purchased the same seat later told me that they were attached to the seat on the back, underneath the sun shield.  Once I found them I was so happy!  The straps are easy to adjust, and the seat comes in an out of the base with ease.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Material: Light
Harness Type: Straps are easy to adjust

Review: We have had this seat for 1.5 years order from Amazon. The harness is starting to fray. When any fabric frays it starts to weaken. I call Graco concerned about the safety of my child and the representative (who never put me in direct contact with a CPST) said “it’s safe for now.” FOR NOW!!!!! When does it become unsafe? When it malfunctions in an accident? They tried to offer me $20 off $100 for a $200 seat. End story I had to tell them I’d sue them if anything happened to my child. They are now sending a new seat with no warranty. They were willing to ENDANGER a child!! Absolutely disgusting. I will no longer buy their products or be recommending them.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: harness is starting to fray

Review: I LOVE this car seat for the price. I am a car seat technician and I recommend this one to friends often. It is a bit heavy, so moving from car to car on a daily basis would be a pain, but it installs well, fits most children really well, and the best part is that a child can be harnessed up to 65 lbs! I harnessed by 6 year old in it and he fits well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: up to 65 lbs
Harness Type: harnessed

Review: We bought this carseat for our 3rd child -- our boys used an older model Graco convertible seat.  I bought this one for the reclining feature, the snaps for the seatbelt and the girly pattern.  This seat is enormous -- it's heavy, tall and wide.  But my 12 month old daughter loved it immediately.  And I was thrilled when she fell asleep in it this morning and I could easily reach back and recline it with one hand.  The fasteners are improved, and the seat fits her very well (and she's on the small side for her age).  I can tell it will fit her well for the next several years.  I would highly recommend this carseat.  I didn't give it 5 stars because it is so large -- I can't imagine it would fit well anywhere other than the middle of a large SUV.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Snaps for the seatbelt
Material: Girly pattern

Review: So, after barely two years of use, the harness straps would no longer stay tightened.  I called Britax and they recommended I clean the area where the straps thread in the crotch area with compressed air and that I tighten and loosen the straps 10-12 times.  I did that and the straps remained tightened again.  However, after a month, the same problem occurred.  I followed the steps Britax recommended and it started tightening again.  Well, after the THIRD time this happened in two months, I called Britax again, sent them a video and then was told that my seat was no longer under warranty and I would have to buy replacement parts that, in my opinion, would not fix the issue.  Considering two years is well below the lifespan of the seat, I decided that after seven years and five Britax car seats, they were no longer the company for my family since their products are unreliable and the company doesn't stand behind them.  Boy, am I glad this happened, because now that I am researching car seats again, I've discovered that Britax is no longer the safest brand.  In independent crash test results, this seat scores a 4/10.  The harnessed booster that I have for my son experienced catastrophic failure in crash test.  This brand is NOT to be trusted.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: harness straps would no longer stay tightened

Review: I got this car seat after reading reviews thinking it will fit in my Toyota Camry nicely however it doesn’t sit well rear facing due to the slight dip in the seat and the reason I got a convertible was so my baby can continue to rear face. However it does well forward facing and my son enjoys the comfort and being able to feel like a big boy.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible

Review: I purchased this seat, because my daughter had outgrown her graco snug ride infant carrier. We loved her snug ride, but she was just too long for it. After nearly a month of debating and researching, the safety first grow and go and the graco 4ever, I decided on the graco 4ever. I am more than pleased with my purchase. My daughter absolutely loves this seat. She is only 18 pounds and will have to be rear facing for a while longer. She can now see out of the Windows and has access to two cup holders, for her toys and cup. It is a heavy seat, meant to stay put once it is buckled in. I love how easily the padding comes off to be washed and how easy it is to adjust the recline positions. The seat came exactly as described and brand new in the box. This seat was worth every penny!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 18 pounds
Installation Type: buckled in
Material: padding

Review:
My husband and I spent a lot of time researching booster seats for our son. We really wanted one with the LATCH system install so we did not have to latch it in with the seatbelt when not in use. I drive quite a lot without my son in the car and a flying projectile booster seat is not something I want to deal with in a car accident!

After researching them all, we decided to try this one, the Parkway GTL and the Graco Affix booster. We ended up returning the Graco booster. Both boosters were nice. The Graco had higher armrests, but the fabric was not as nice. The Graco also did not fit as well in the center seat of my Honda CRV, the entire booster was "bulkier." My husband preferred the seating position of the Britax, and my son has an easier time getting in and out of the car with this one.

My husband had also pointed out some reviews that stated on the Graco one of the LATCH system latches could loosen during an accident causing the entire booster to slam to one side, possibly harming the child in the process. This is what sealed the deal for us to keep the Britax over the Graco.

Hopefully this review is helpful. Good luck in your search!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: LATCH system

Review: I cannot believe how well the quality is with this car seat yes it’s at Cosco yes I should already assume that it is in good quality but buying this for my first child will never be a regret even after the third one is still using it !
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Seems like a really good seat, I love that the cupholders can be pushed in or pulled out depending on what you need.  We have 3 of these in different prints.  The kids have never complained about them being uncomfortable or looking too babyish.  I would prefer they were a tiny bit narrower to make them easier to fit multiple boosters/carseats in a row, but I have pretty narrow kids.  So it would work well for me, but they are probably better suited to everyone the way they are.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Material: different prints

Review: This is a very well built car seat.  This car seat is meant to stay in the car.  As far as safety, I give it 5 stars.  It's a pain taking in and out of the car with the child in it.  I have done it many times so I wouldn't wake up the baby.  But now that I've done it so often, I've become very good at it.  In any case, I would give it a 3 star when it comes to mobility.  Nevertheless, I gave this product a 5 star because safety was my only/main concern.  I have other means of moving the baby around (travel system).
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
Fits comfortably behind the passenger seat in my Prius. I can scoot the seat almost all the way back.

My only complaint is that the anchor straps are very difficult to loosen/adjust. If you need to transfer this seat between cars with any frequency, you'll be better off looking for something else.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: anchor straps

Review: We love this car seat. It is so easy to use with the Graco snug ride frame and clicks very easily into it and into the carseat base in the car.  The foam is very soft (Gracopedic foam) and the color is nice and neutral. The material is smooth and easy to clean.  It is so comfortable that our baby falls asleep the minute his body touches it.  It is slightly heavier than the regular Graco infant car seat, but I think that is worth it as it can carry an infant of up to 32 lb.  The only complaint is that the instruction manual was very confusing and we could have not figured it out if the nurse in the hospital didn't show us how to use it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: smooth and easy to clean
Weight Range of Child: up to 32 lb

Review:
This car seat was easy to install and was much more padded and just seemed "safer" than other comparable car seats that we looked at. We bought it for our 5-month-old son and he took to it immediately.

The biggest plus for us is the fact that the shoulder straps are easily adjusted up or down to fit the height of our son's shoulders, unlike other models that require the straps to be pulled out the back of the seat and installed in another slot. This model allows for easy sliding up and down of the straps, which makes it a breeze to make a perfect fit.

Seat Type: Rear Facing

Review: My 6 month old hated the agile car seat but loves this one. He's a bigger baby so I'm glad I changed him to this convertible car seat. He's riding so much better now in this seat. It's very comfy and secure. It does take up more room but it still fits in my tahoe.

Seat Type: convertible car seat

Material: comfy

Review: Best carseat safety ratings I could find. Amazon had best price. Install was easy and the kids said they were comfortable. Safety ratings was our top concern to protect our bundle of joy and this was rated high. I would purchase again. Dark color of fabric never showed any spills or stains. Highly recommended! We also bought the cup holder to add to seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
