Review: I was desperately looking for a seat that would fit three across in a 2022 CR-V, this seems to be the only one currently available in the market. They are very easy to install (using seatbelt) and my kids loved them!

Seat Type: three across

Review: Sure, this carseat is heavy, cause it's literally built like a tank, but it will LAST and LAST and LAST. I love how easy it is to latch it to the car anchors. I will NEVER go back to the old clips, these latches are genius!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: easy to latch it to the car anchors, latches are genius

Review: This is a great car seat, if you have a minivan or a SUV then this should fit. If you have something like a traditional 2/4dr car, good luck. Short of making a front seat uncomfortable this will be a difficult fit when rear facing and reclined.

Review: This is a nice car seat. It does the job. It is nothing (in my opinion) compared to the Evenflo Triumph that we own. The Triumph's straps don't twist up and you turn the knob to tighten- genius! This one, for being one that converts to a booster, doesn't give much room in the straps and I have to fix the straps from twisting EVERY time we get in the car! I guess I'm spoiled with the Triumph because I don't have to do that. Also my kid is 2.5 years old and in the 25th percentile- he's 29 lbs...... and I feel like he's very snug in this seat, like in a bad way. I contemplated returning it but I think the fact that it converts and can be a 5 point harness for so long is a big plus.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: straps twist up, have to fix straps from twisting every time, doesn't give much room in the straps

Review: So I am in manufacturing myself.  Here is what troubles me with Graco as a manufacturer who touts they are about "safety."  Originally, I purchaed three of the Graco TurboBooster Backless Booster Car Seat, Galaxy.  However, this product does not come standard with the latch system.  What troubles me is the fact that I had to buy the Graco Affix Highback Booster Seat with Latch System for approx. $85 versus the backless booster seat for approx. $28.  Now granted I realize the highback booster includes the back but still it forced me to have to buy the entire system just to get the booster seat with the latch system which looks to be as the SAME booster seat for the TurboBooster backless Booster car seat however just less the latches.  Granted I had to purchase 3 of the Graco Affix Highback Booster Seat with Latch System just so I could have the seat with latches.  This cost me approx $300.  I'm not a wealthy individual however for those less fortunate on finances it really puts consumers in a troubling spot.  Graco should do the right thing and put the latches on their standard booster seat whether it is a back or backless set up and which appears to already be the same booster seat for both.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: latch system

Review: This car seat is easier to install than most, light but sturdy, and easy to adjust. My son loved it. I had to replace my former convertible car seat bc it expired it was the one I had used when my now 5 year old outgrew his infant car seat. My son seems think it is comfortable enough. I also really like the size bc I have a compact car and it still easily fits in the back with 2 booster seats on the sides.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible
Installation Type: easier to install
Material: light but sturdy

Review: This is an excellent car seat however I paid extra for the anti rebound bar and my kids were easily able to pop it off with their feet which defeated the safety purpose. The bar itself was loose and useless. I contemplated returning one seat (I bought two and only one had this issue) but we switched to front facing and the bars came off. Just frustrating that these are not cheap seats and that extra safety feature was the selling point. However, the seats are very comfortable and I’m glad we purchased Britax. Our rear seat has middle of the seat cup holders so the car seat missing cup holders is not an issue for us.

Review: Great high chair, but there is a terrible, huge sticker right on the top of the seat. It takes up half the seat. I had to scrape it off with a metal spatula, then get the sticky residue off with vegetable oil. This high chair would be perfect if they could just include a warning label instead of sticking onto the high chair.

Review: I have had a lot a car seats over the years, for my kids, daycare kids and now grandkids.  This seat is very well thought out. The design is slim but not small. The seat belt lock is attached to the seat if you need it and I love how the anchors have a place to store them on the back.  It is very heavy but that is due to the steel frame, which also makes it very sturdy . I can get 3 in the third row of my 2018 Honda Odyssey.

Review: This is the 4th Evenflo car seat we have purchased over the course of having children and we have always been really pleased with their products. There is plenty of cushion in these seats. The installation is fairly easy. My son seems to be comfortable in the seat. I like how this seat will be the only seat we will have to buy for him.

Review: My granddaughter loves being n her big girl car seat!!  I like that the seat is a bit narrower and the cup holders fold out of the way!! The seat is very heavy so I am glad we don’t have to remove it very often!!

Review: Works great. Narrowest seat I could find without taking away comfortability and mostly safety. I cannot get my hand through where you slide the seat belt, my husband either, so we have to slide it as much as possible and then continue sliding through where the crotch buckle is. Annoying, but I really like this seat.

Review: This seat is very small, though it is a tight fit in the middle seat of my 2017 Hyundai Sonata Sport. The 2 outside riders have to get their seatbelts on first before the rider in the middle using the BubbleBum can latch their seatbelt. Even then, the one belt is on top of the other. My child is 8-going -on-9 and is average height and weight (50th percentile). We roll up a towel to put under her knees because the BubbleBum is not very deep and only comes to the middle of the back of her upper leg. She finds it a little uncomfortable without something there. Not sure if I would recommend this booster to anyone. It's not bad but it's not great either.

Review: I almost bought this but then realized I could connect the 3 car seat straps around my carry-on with a bungee cord.  My 2 year old and I have taken more than 20 solo flights using the bungee cord without issue.

Review: I bought this car seat for my grandson who turned 1 year old in May. He has had it for about 6 months or more. As much as it cost it shouldn't be tattered or worn, but it is. The edges are really frayed. I am disappointed in the product for lack of sturdiness. I hope it last till he's over 70 pounds so I won't have to buy a booster seat. Other than that I would say it was just okay.

Review: First off, loved the price, color, and the fact that it’s highly rated. Unfortunately I have a 2012 Hyundai Santa Fe that has bulging headrests that do not remove so using it with the high back isn’t an option for us. Something to consider if your car is similar to mine in feature.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: high back

Review:
We actually purchased 3 of these, one for our two cars and my mother-in-laws car, and therefore wanted to make sure it was a good fit for us before installing all 3. We have had them in our cars for about a month now and are very happy with this car seat. It is fairly easy to get our daughter in and out, and it sure has the appearance of comfort and solid padding.

As for ease of use, it was pretty simple to connect to the car and it is very easy to adjust the head height and the strap tightness. I love that we will be able to flip it around to be forward facing in the future. For the cost, I'm glad we'll be able to use it for a long time.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: connect to the car

Review: We bought our son a backless booster, big mistake. He would jump right out of it while the car was moving. This keeps him safe while the car is in motion. We will try the other seat when he gets much older.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: backless booster

Review: Bought this car seat for my son when he outgrew his newborn seat. I love this carseat. My only complaints are that the clamps to hold the seatbelt are incredibly hard to snap closed and the seat has a hard time sitting straight up.

Installation Type: clamps to hold the seatbelt are incredibly hard to snap closed

Review: This is a good basic backless booster - we bought it for grandma's car.  It was super simple to install.  My only complaint is that it is narrow.  I'm not sure my (average sized) daughter will fit in it comfortably for very long, whereas her everyday Clek Ozzie fits extremely comfortably.

Review: I could not be more pleased with this car seat. Most carseats seem to take up a huge amount of real estate, probably under the theory that bigger is better (or safer). That's fine if you're riding around in a massive car, but not so good with your car is on the smaller side (2010 Mazda 5). I wanted a rear-facing carseat with a short length that would allow the passenger seat to be pushed completely to the rear. Suffice it to say, this thing is perfect for my needs and it looks great too.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Rear-facing

Review: I really liked the car seat however it is hard to re adjust the arm straps after you've shortened them. Very aggravating in that sense. Other than that it is a very good seat I like the retractable cup holder so when we have other people in the car next to the car seat they are not getting poked in the side by them.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: hard to re adjust the arm straps after you've shortened them

Review: We bought this seat 3 months ago for our 4 year old daughter who weighs over 50 lbs and is 43 inches tall. The first issue we have is that it doesn't work well with the headrests in our Volvo. Second, the paint on the strap between the legs had already worn off and looks terrible, the material is threaded around the edges and it otherwise just looks like we have had it for several years. We expected more from Britax. It is easy for my daughter to buckle/unbuckle herself so that's a plus, but I can't seem to find anything else that's great about this seat. Also, when you take it out of the car, the back breaks away from the booster very easily. I think it's supposed to slide out, but it actually snaps away which seems unsafe to me and ours actually has marks in the plastic because if this.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: 4 year old daughter who weighs over 50 lbs and is 43 inches tall

Review: I few years ago Graco changed the buckle on the straps with the latch anchors.  They are very difficult to loosen.  If you need to move your seat between cars frequently, then look for a different seat.  Otherwise I have no problem with this seat.

Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing

Review: This really worked for us, but it is definitely meant more for a carry on sized suitcase. We made it work on a larger one but it needed longer straps so we're going to find a way to make it work. We also didn't have a child in it while we used it, but I could see that it would work fine. For the price, it is a win!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: We have twins, so we needed something with great support that wasn’t as bulky as other car seats. We initially bought a pair of Graco My Ride 65s, but as time went on I began to hate them. They were lightly padded and had no extra support or cushioning for our babies’ heads. They were oddly shaped, too, which caused one of the seats cup holders to stack on the other seat. I finally decided to venture out and buy something other than Graco and I’m so glad I did! My children look extremely comfortable in these seats, and very well supported. They fit perfectly into the back left and middle seat in my VW Atlas. I saw lots of pictures of babies in the car seat, but not many of them installed, so I hope my pictures can help someone who was as curious about this seat as I was.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Material: lightly padded, no extra support or cushioning for our babies’ heads

Review: We bought this for a trip we were taking to cut down on room needed in the car as we have 3 kids and the 2 youngest are still in big bulky car seats. We weren't sure how it would work for our 6 year old, but it fit really well right in between the 2 big car seats in our suv (our graco booster seat wouldn't fit). My 6 year old said it wasn't super comfortable, and it wasn't very easy for her to buckle herself in alone which is a downside for sure! I think if we used this daily, she would be able to figure it out, it's just not as simple as a traditional booster seat for a child to buckle in. But overall, it has great benefits, and I'd definitely recommend if you are tight on car space. Another slight downside is that my 6 year old couldn't see out the car windows as well since it's flat, and her usual booster has a few inches of height added.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Weight Range of Child: 6 year old
Installation Type: buckle herself in
Harness Type: buckle

Review: This is a great carseat. Just looking at it and touching it, you can tell that it is a higher quality than other brands. When installed with a level base, there is enough leg room for an average 18 month old to sit rear facing. A two year old or larger child will probably be a little squished but this is true with all convertible car seats I've seen. It fits in the center seat of my Acura which is not a car seat friendly car. I had to use a rolled up towel as a bolster since the seats are not level but it wasn't too bad. The floor tether has a convenient adapter piece to make tethering easier. I love the fact that you can change the height of the straps without rethreading. The pads around the straps at the shoulders are a little bulky but necessary. The straps can scratch my daughter's neck without the pads.  We haven't turned it front facing yet but I believe it will fit even better that way. All in all, I'm glad we spent the extra money for Britax. You can't put a price on safety and piece of mind!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 18 month old, two year old
Installation Type: level base, floor tether
Harness Type: straps, height of the straps without rethreading, pads around the straps at the shoulders

Review: I love another style of carseat we have in this brand so I thought I'd try this one. Dear Lord, the rattling! The little knobs at the top that allow you to adjust the headrest rattle non-stop! When babe is in it - rattle. When babe is out of it - rattle. When the headrest is lowered - rattle. When the headrest is raised unreasonably high - rattle. I encourage you to find something else unless you don't mind a constant rattle. I have a 2018 sonata with a very smooth ride. It rattles in my car and my husbands dodge truck. We might be donating this one to the grandparents.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Adjustable headrest
Material: Rattling knobs

Review: I originally had my daughter in a Chicco KeyFit 30 but after we came home from the hospital I had a nagging feeling that her carseat was too cheap and flimsy. I did a lot of research and decided to buy this one--the "Rolls Royce" of carseats :) I LOVE IT!! I feel so much better with my daughter riding in this... She is 8 months old now and we are planning to start trying for another baby soon--and I will definitely be buying a 2nd one!! I WILL NEVER use the Chicco infant seat again!!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: The only way we can fit three car seats in one row. I love that my boys (9 and 6) can put it in and get settled on their own. We are taking a trip soon and will be taking them with us because it's easy to pack and will take up no room or baggage fees. We are very happy!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: I love this car seat. My 3 month old was quickly outgrowing his infant car seat and would cry when I put him in it. This one is perfect for our mid size suv. Great car seat for taller babies. He is very comfortable in it. He has plenty of leg room and two adults can sit comfortable on either side of the car seat. However,  I don’t think it would fit well rear facing in anything smaller than a suv.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 3 month old
Material: comfortable

Review: I purchased this booster after my child grew 3 inches in 6-months. After the growth spurt, my child no longer fit into his old booster. I love how the back can be removed or added back easily along with the cover being washable. Review: This was a great car sear for my son from birth up until he turned 3yrs old. Once he turned 3, the 5-point harness became impossible to tighten with the front strap. I guess after my son reached a certain size/weight at 3yr old, and the way the harness is slotted through the car seat, the front strap that tightens the harness became way too difficult to tighten no matter how hard I pulled the strap. When my son was smaller/lighter the strap pulled so easily, but no more. I want to keep him in a 5 point harness for as long as possible so I decided to recycle this car seat and go with another brand. I'm giving it three stars because it did last for three years, my son always seemed to sit and sleep comfortably on long car rides, the material feels nice, installation was easy and it fit in my car perfectly. Just be warned as your child grows, the 5-point harness will become almost impossible to tighten with the front strap.

The cup holder is handy sometimes. I'm not too fond of the velvety cover- it's not too easy to clean and stuff tend to stick to it. Easy to install and and I'm waiting to see how it performs once my son is ready to sit front-facing ( doctors now recommend that toddlers should sit rear-facing until they are 2. I agree. Rear-facing is the safest way for kids to travel and I would keep them in that position as long as I can.)

Very well made (sturdy frame, soft/sporty looking material, easy harness)and a reasonable price. I saw it in stores for $50-150.00 higher than I bought it for! If you're familiar with Graco infant seats, than this one will be easy to use. Can be moved from one vehicle to the next with ease(I use the latch system in my Camry hybrid). The recline is just enough for my sons head not to roll forward. Cup holders and storage are nice as well.

The only drawback so far is the reassembly after cleaning. It takes a while the first time (about an hour). This should be easier now that I know how.

Review: I got this car seat for my first baby because it was cheaper than comparable grow-with-me car seats by other brands. How much different could they be? Is it just as safe? When used properly, I’m sure. But that’s the difficult part. I find this car seat to be so incredibly frustrating. It is so difficult to adjust without completely uninstalling it and VERY difficult to tighten the strap every time I put my daughter in it. It doesn’t matter how big she gets or how many layers of clothes she is wearing. It’s impossible to get it even close to the tightness it should safely be at. I rage internally every day when I go to use it. Our infant carrier was Chicco brand and we LOVED IT. So easy to use. Save yourself the hassle and spend the extra $ for a Graco or Chicco car seat.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: difficult to tighten the strap, impossible to get it even close to the tightness it should safely be at

Review: Um guys I hate to break this too you but this is just an overpriced luggage cart.  Now, a luggage cart is great for car seats in the air port.  I used to live overseas and flew home often with my son and I used a luggage cart with a bungee strap to hold the seat on the rack by looping the bungee chord through the strap holes in the back of the seat and then wrapping it around the back of the cart.  Worked great!  Only difference is my little 80lb compatible luggage cart only cost $15.  I see no feature on this car seat cart that makes it any better than a standard luggage cart and it looks to me like it isn't even universal to other car seats.  Save yourself the money and just buy a standard luggage cart...
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: My experience with this car seat was life changing! My newborn was snuggled in for the long trip we had on an incredibly cold and rainy day. We hydroplaned and slammed into a concrete barrier, almost rolled and slammed into the barrier again before we came to our final resting spot, (middle of the highway). We walked away without any injury and the car seat did exactly what it was designed to.  Every single airbag went off in my car and the car seat stayed in place. We had a Graco booster and I decided everyone gets Peg Perego after that experience.  I immediate purchased the exact seat again but in a different color and a booster (HBB 120). DO NOT GO CHEAP on something that may save your child’s life. This seat is well worth the money and would never recommend anything but Peg Perego.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: stayed in place

Special Features: Removable Tray, Safety Harness, Folds for Easy Transport and Storage
Review: My daughter hates high chairs, and she loves sitting in this chair. We either set in the booth or tie it to the chair at a resturant and she loves it. It's easy to wipe off before we leave and it stores small enough to leave it in the trunk!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
I know this is mean to the manufacturer, but I'm going to tell you the carseat I think you should get instead of this one: the Evenflo Symphony. That carseat costs less than this one, but comes with the amazing "SureLatch" installation system - if you have to take your carseat out and reinstall even once you will be so glad you have it. On that one, when you tighten the straps by pulling the tighten-me strap, the belt tightens from the bottom instead of from the top. This matters because if the belt pulls up from the top like on this carseat it will slide by your child's neck, occasionally giving them a minor "rug burn" of sorts. No, I don't work for Evenflo or anything unscrupulous like that.

OK, so this carseat: it's not bad. I do love that it's good for ten years and can turn into a booster seat. I hate installing it, but you've heard enough about that. It has nice cupholders, it's comfortable enough, it gets the job done. This would be a great car seat (and indeed everything we've gotten from Graco is great - strollers, high chairs, etc), if it weren't for Evenflo knocking it out of the park with their competing product.

Seat Type: can turn into a booster seat
Installation Type: SureLatch installation system
Harness Type: tighten the straps by pulling the tighten-me strap, the belt tightens from the bottom instead of from the top, if the belt pulls up from the top like on this carseat it will slide by your child's neck

Review:
This is the only car seat new parents are going to need. It's designed to work from newborn all the way to 100 lbs, and while I initially dismissed the claim as hyperbolic sales talk...it's actually accurate. I tried this seat in those age ranges and it worked very well for all of them.

This seat also has a lot of design innovations, so many that, yes, it kind of makes me want to have another child. Certainly though, it makes the old fogey parent in me kind of grumble about how easy parents these days have it. Really. But here, let's start at the beginning.

This is a very sturdy, very overbuilt car seat. It's designed to nestle your child in layers of protection, and unlike car seats from even ten years ago, a lot of attention is paid to child comfort as well. Padding is generous and firm enough to last the 6-7 years you'll be using it. Covers are easily removed and machine washable. The frame is pretty beefy and has staying power. Hence, when Safety 1st says this will be the only seat you need, they really did build it with that claim in mind.

Innovations abound. For example, on older car seats when your child grows you need to rethread the safety harness through the appropriate slots on the back of the seat. Not so with this. No, there are two thumb clamps you squeeze and then you can unlock the back of the seat and move it up or down. That's right, no rethreading needed, and the adjustment is fine enough to give your chlld a more or less custom fit. More importantly, you DON'T need to remove the car seat from the car to make this adjustment. Adjusting harness tension is easy, with the adjustment strap and clamp in the front of the car seat.

Another innovation are harness clips on either side of the seat, in which you can place the shoulder harness straps and make getting your child in and out of the car seat that much easier. Having something like that (as opposed to fishing behind your kid for the shoulder straps after you put him in the seat) is a serious convenience.

Two built-in cupholders are included, rubber lined and sized just right for a sippy cup.

Instructions are clear for when it's time to convert this into a booster seat. The harness and buckle all stow away, and there's a clear channel (marked with a helpful red patch) through which the seatbelt is threaded. It works, and works well. Moreover, it's still comfortable, thanks to all that padding. My five year old didn't want to get out of it.

So in sum, this is an outstanding car seat, one that I think is best in class, and one that pays attention to the future of your family. I never liked having to pay money every couple of years for a new car seat, so seeing a product like this that makes such an outlay unnecessary is fantastic. This is a great product!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: from newborn all the way to 100 lbs
Harness Type: safety harness, shoulder harness straps, harness clips on either side of the seat, adjusting harness tension is easy, harness and buckle all stow away
Material: Padding is generous and firm, covers are easily removed and machine washable, rubber lined cupholders

Review:
My husband and I were debating whether to spend the big bucks for a Britax or pick this car seat. It has the same or even better ratings on consumer reports compared with a comparable Britax car seat. Glad we choose this one it saved us money. The price is very reasonable and I actually saved almost $60 when purchasing it here on Amazon with free shipping. At my local Wal-Mart in Hawaii they sell them for $161. Yeah for savings!

We have a 2008 scion xB and this seat fits perfectly in the center seat in the back. My husband who is 6'1" drives with the front seat all the way pushed back and it still doesn't come close to hitting the seat. I think though with much smaller cars it may take up a lot of room but what convertible car seat doesn't? So far my 7.5 month old seems to enjoy having more room to move about.

The head rest though doesn't seem to cradle my little one with enough support but a couple of small receiving blankets around the sides helps to contain his head as you would do with a new born baby in an infant seat.

Over all good seat. Will possible purchase another one for our other car.

Great quality, very comfortable for our son, and very easy to install! It is heavy but I can easily switch it to other vehicles!

Review:
This is our first convertible seat after using a Graco infant seat for the first 1.5 years. I was looking for a breathable material because my child is always hot and sweaty. I liked that this seat had that option and it seems meshy enough that it *might* work.

The biggest reason we chose this one is the strap to tighten it pulls so smoothly and effortlessly. We tried it in the store and were blown away how much easier it was. I got it 3 months ago and I’m loving everything about it. The Graco infant seat was annoying to adjust and I felt I had to pull very hard to get it right enough for my child’s safety, but this is so smooth and easy to pull. This alone has been such a stress reliever when leaving the house.

My second favorite feature is the Clicktight mechanism. I’ve heard how difficult and annoying it is to switch convertible seats between cars, but I’m not even joking that it takes two minutes to move this one. I was surprised that it recommends the seatbelt rather than the latch system. It’s SO much faster and easier. No standing on the seat and tugging a strap to tighten it (y’all know you’ve done it!) or breaking your hands trying to undo the latch hooks buried in the abyss of your seat. You just stretch the seatbelt across and close the seat down to clamp it in. I don’t know how it works but it gets a tight fit every single time with zero wiggle. I watched for sales for a long time (these rarely are discounted if at all) and finally bit the bullet on Cyber Monday. I paid about $220. I have no regrets!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: breathable material, meshy
Harness Type: strap to tighten it pulls so smoothly and effortlessly, smooth and easy to pull
Installation Type: Clicktight mechanism, recommends the seatbelt rather than the latch system

Review: This is a good quality car seat.  We have been using a more expensive Graco ones and I decided to give this a try for our other vehicle.  It is heavy duty, easy to use, and I love the strap holders!  The double cup holders are nice too.  I had a hard time getting it to tighten enough in my car, but once I went to our local fire department to learn how to install it properly, I had no issues.  It was user error, not product malfunction.  Overall, very happy with this car seat, and I am always so nervous about making big purchases like this!

The plastic felt much more flimsy than some of the other convertible car seats on the market. I returned this seat and we will be trying something else.

Review:
Bought this brand new for my son born on 5/24/17. Car seat installed by fire department. My son and I were involved in a car accident on 7/18 at just 8 weeks old. T-boned on the rear passenger side where his seat was installed. Car totaled. My son was not injured even though all airbags deployed on his side. Police officer stated "damn good car seat. It definitely did its job." Was given a brand new car seat from the emergency room. However, filed a claim with my insurance company to get a replacement Britax B-Safe 35. I will be purchasing the same car seat again. I love this car seat.
Thank you Britax!

Review: I bought this carseat because it is a highly rated seat from a safety standpoint, and comes with lots of bells and whistles. It is an absolute breeze to install using the latch system (it honestly does not get any easier than this)! One thing that had me flustered and panicked was how difficult the straps were to tighten at first. I almost returned the seat. BUT, if you keep using it for a couple weeks, the straps become much, much easier to tighten. As for comfort, it's a well padded seat and my son seems to really like it. We almost went with the Maxi Cosi Pria, but it doesn't have a steel-reinforced inner frame. The best part of this seat (besides safety and installation) is how compact it is. My husband is 6'2" and I have a Honda Accord. There's plenty of legroom for my husband up front even with the carseat rear-facing and reclined in the back.

Review:
I was a car seat tech for many years and always love getting to review new car seats. Some of my reviews have not been real popular because I didn't rant and rave about how wonderful the seat was! I'm happy to say, I was very pleased with this seat. It is very user friendly and installs well.

Pros:
- No need to re-thread the harness when adjusting the height. Over the years, I saw a lot of mis-threading mistakes made by parents, so this is a very nice feature.
- Separate LATCH attachments for rear and forward facing. Again, a common mistake is using the rear facing belt bath for forward facing installs. Having separate LATCH connectors should reduce this. I hope.
- Easy install forward and rear facing. Obviously, I can't try the seat in every vehicle, but in the two I did try, the seat installed tight with very little effort. The rear facing recline was perfect without any rolled towels or pool noodles as well.
- The adjuster pulled very smooth and I didn't have any issues with the harness wanting to fold over in the buckle.
- The instructions were very clear.
- Nice, deep sides and good side impact protection. Yes, I realize we don't test for this in the US, but deep side wings are always a pro.
- The infant insert is nice. Unfortunately, my baby is 6 months old so I really can't test out how well the seat fits a small newborn.
- High rear facing weight limit is great, but not real unique in this day and age.

Cons:
The only real con I saw was that the fabric was kind of slick and itchy. It's also booooring, but these things are not big cons at all. They are more like personal likes/dislikes and don't impact the safety of the seat at all.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: High rear facing weight limit
Installation Type: LATCH, Separate LATCH attachments for rear and forward facing
Harness Type: No need to re-thread the harness when adjusting the height, The adjuster pulled very smooth, I didn't have any issues with the harness wanting to fold over in the buckle
Material: The fabric was kind of slick and itchy

Review: I was very hesitant to buy this car seat based on the numerous reviews that said it was a nightmare to install.  I decided that the safety couldn't be beat and we could return it if we had trouble with installation.  After reading through the manual, I secured this in my 2009 Honda Odyssey in about 5 minutes.  It took us about 1/2 hour to 45 minutes to figure out how to correctly secure it in my husband's 2000 Toyota 4 Runner.  However, after we figured out the correct way (the belt long path) it probably takes about 5 minutes to install it in his car as well.  This seat is incredibly secure in both cars, using both the lap belt and latch methods.  My 2 1/2 year old son has had no complaints regarding the comfort of the seat, and I'm planning on buying one for our younger daughter when she outgrows her current car seat.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: secured this in my 2009 Honda Odyssey in about 5 minutes; figure out how to correctly secure it; the belt long path; using both the lap belt and latch methods

The seat is relatively easy to install, but if you have a small car, you might physically struggle a little to get everything settled. Because of the steel frame (a GREAT safety feature), this seat is heavy, and it's easy install is more of a safety feature than for multi-car use.  It's also recommended that you use your car's seat belt, which really isn't any more difficult than using LATCH honestly. My Malibu fits the seat right behind the driver seat, and my husband's Cruze has to have the seat in the center.

The straps were cumbersome and didn’t provide a snug fit, and the overall seat didn’t feel nearly as tight and secure as our Britax seat does now. As for the new fabric, I prefer Diono’s fabric on the old RXT to this 3RXT. I wanted to like this seat, but it fell flat. In addition, we almost couldn’t install it. The size adjustments on the crotch strap require someone who’s either got tiny hands or a contortionist as a side job. Oh, and pink strap covers look cute, but I could tell their light color wasn’t going to wear well at all with age.

It was very easy to install forward-facing in her Toyota Prius. However, I have two complaints -- First, the buckle strap seems like it's not long enough. Both my mom and my husband have pinched my daughter's thighs when buckling her in. Now that we know this can happen, we're very careful to make sure this doesn't happen. Second, and more significantly, every time we put my daughter in this seat, she starts crying after a minute or two and complains that her back hurts. This makes it impossible to put my daughter in her seat safely (with straps sufficiently tightened [not too tight, of course, but secure]) without hurting her.

I have high doubts that they will do anything except fly off if there was a crash. It was between this booster seat and the Clek Oobr and I wish that I had shelled out the extra money for the Clek. I really like the patented adjustable reclining headrest on this booster, and how easy it was to install this booster seat. I don't like that the top part where you put the seat belt in at the shoulder is cheap, flimsy plastic. I'm going to keep this seat and it's going to stay in grandma's car.

Review: So far, this car seat has been everything we could ask for. It's got plenty of room for our little one. The color is pretty neutral so it doesn't clash with the interior of the vehicle. The base is good size and doesn't do any damage to my leather seats. It is big however. You can fit 2 of these in the back seat of a car or small suv. But the middle seat becomes useless. I could fit 3 of these in the back of my 2019 Silverado. If you've got a large back seat, and need the 3rd seat, you're good to go. If you need the 3rd seat and are installing 2 of these in a car or small SUV, IE 2019 Terrain, then you'll want to get something else. The price is good. Styling is good. I've got nothing bad to say about this seat at all. The tightening strap is a little difficult to pull tight at first. Once it's been used a few times though, it gets easier. Also, one of the straps that goes from the bottom of the buckle to under the car seat likes to get twisted. Mostly how I set my child in the seat. If I'm not paying attention, when I tighten it down while twisted, it wont tighten well. You'll want to make sure that all of the belts are straight before you tighten.
Attribute_Related_Content:

I like that this is adjustable at the shoulder level, and not just the 3 or 4 preset adjustments that other kid seats have.  We chose this seat based upon consumer reports, and they were correct.  It's a great seat, easy to clean, study, stylish, and with plenty of adjustments.  It can be used front or rear facing, so this helps us because we can re-use it with our 2nd child.

Review:
We got a bunch of Mifolds for ourselves and our family and I think that their star rating can depend on the use case.

As a travel carseat, it gets 5 stars, easily. This thing is small, it's light, it's safe, and it can save you a fortune. If you rent just one car seat from a rental agency for a week, you'll have paid for it. Additionally, it takes up almost no space in your luggage. On that basis alone, it's worth 5 stars.

As a daily carseat, I think it isn't as strong of a use case. It can be difficult to get set up if you're constantly moving it because of the mechanism that is used to pull the shoulder belt down to a child's height. Additionally, my kids have complained some about the comfort (or lack thereof) with the plastic piece that brings the shoulder belt down. The side adjusters don't lock into any position either, which also presents a bit of a challenge at times as they slide in and out with normal use.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: travel carseat, daily carseat
Material: plastic

I didn't have that problem with the Graco.

Review: My granddaughter who is seven has no problem hopping in and buckling herself up. The red clips on the side are easy for her to manage. I drive a Chevy Spark (yes it is very small) and this is the only booster that fits with enough room for the seatbelt receptacle on the seat to be exposed, which is why she can buckle it herself. The previous one I had was a Graco, and we had to move the booster a little bit 'sideways' to expose that seatbelt clip. It was still too tight a fit for her to do it herself, plus she wasn't completely facing forward. If you've seen the Sparks backseats they are slightly 'bucket seats'. Just slightly, but if a booster doesn't fit right and has to moved towards the door more to clip the seatbelt, then not only is it not completely straight forward, the seat actually tips a tiny bit inward due to the not level car's seat. Can't tell you how happy I was to find this BubbleBum!

Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: seatbelt

Review: We absolutely love this carseat. I love how it will grow with my child threw each stage of needing a carseat. The seat is really padded, which makes it seem really comfortable. The fabric is really soft. I love the knobs on the sides, they make it so easy to tighten the straps. The release button to loosen the straps is a little difficult to push down while rear facing.

Review:
We needed an additional car seat for our 3-year-old and chose this as it will convert to a booster and take him to 100 lbs. I took a chance on this as it gets overall good reviews and is cheaper than many others, but after getting it myself I have to concur with some of the common complaints in the negative reviews:

--The main issue is that we cannot get it tight enough no matter what we do. The top leans to one side even after being straightened up, and there's no way to meet the "it shouldn't move more than one inch back and forth" standard on the bottom. It's just too loose to be safe. We're using the seatbelt secure method (not the latch) given my son's weight. We also used the tether.
--The crotch strap falls down into the seat and I have to dig it out from under him almost every time I put him in the seat.
--The cup holders on both sides are more a pain than a convenience. It makes it even harder to get him in the seat, having to almost drag him over the cup holders--and that's with nothing in them!

He says it's comfortable, but it just doesn't seem secure enough.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible to a booster
Weight Range of Child: 3-year-old, take him to 100 lbs
Installation Type: seatbelt secure method (not the latch), tether
Harness Type: crotch strap

Review: So happy I bought this for our trip! It makes traveling through an airport SO much easier! Literally the most less stress I’ve been since traveling with my baby! It’s like a stroller but with a bigger car seat. 10/10 get this helpful tool for air travel!!

Review: I love Britax and have used this brand from an infant carrier, to a regular forward facing car seat, and was so excited to find this high back booster for my 5 year old. I'm only giving it 3 stars because there is no way to hold the back of the seat to your car! There isn't even any harness point, connection port, anything! So the back of the seat is just free floating and flies forward. I'm extremely disappointed with this product. It will be fine when she's old enough and tall enough to use the seat with just the base, but the high back does not create any additional safety which is what I was looking for.

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
As a new mom of a 5 month old, I was so happy to see I could get a car seat from infant to toddler for a good price. First off, this car seat looks even better in person.. It’s seriously so sleek and comfy looking. When I took the car seat out of the box, it had the instruction manual, snack tray, cups and plastic pieces for the anchors. The padding is already placed on the seat, and can be removed for easy cleaning, which is great for messy babes. Also the cup holders have liners that can be easily removed and washed of juice or snacks. LOVE the double cup holders.

For the installation- I usually have the fiancé install the car seats since I get overwhelmed with installing things, but I took a stab at it myself. It wasn’t the easiest for me, and took me a bit of time, but with help from him I was able to install tight, and correct. This will be timely but he said the installation wasn’t too bad and that the manual was definitely needed. After feeling confident that the car seat was nice and secure, we put babe in and he was nice and cozy, took a great nap in it. The straps were so easy to adjust to tighten on him, but the bottom buckles were a bit harder to clasp.

This car seat is used in our second vehicle for now, since our son is still a baby, and easier to use bucket car seat in and out of the house for traveling. We are excited to get all the use out of this 4 in 1 car seat, watching him grow for many many years. Also glad to know my son will be safe in this car seat Incase of accident with side impact protection. I trust Evenflo with my child’s car seat safety.

A downside to this car seat would be not having the sensor safe clip like we have in our infant car seat. I’ll be sad to not have that feature for upcoming years. That would have been a great addition to this car seat. But overall this is a great price for a car seat you will use for years and I recommend!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: It wasn’t the easiest for me, and took me a bit of time, but with help from him I was able to install tight, and correct. This will be timely but he said the installation wasn’t too bad and that the manual was definitely needed.
Harness Type: The straps were so easy to adjust to tighten on him, but the bottom buckles were a bit harder to clasp. A downside to this car seat would be not having the sensor safe clip like we have in our infant car seat.
Material: The padding is already placed on the seat, and can be removed for easy cleaning, which is great for messy babes. Also the cup holders have liners that can be easily removed and washed of juice or snacks.

Review: This car seat is so unsecured. The bottom straps on this car seat where only attached by a plastic hook. I trusted this brand and I was very disappointed to find out that this is not as secured at all. We were trying to tighten the straps in the bottom and it broke off the seat. I’m returning this ASAP. Review:
This is a wonderful car seat! We bought this for our toddler, whom we want to keep rear facing as long as possible because it's safer. We needed a seat that would rear face a larger child (this one is one of the tallest on the market, and up to 40 lbs), it needs to fit in my small back seat, and it needs to be less than $200.
This seat is all those things! I can put it rear facing behind my passenger seat in my Corolla, and I can sit comfortably in the front (and I'm 5'9", all legs). My son is comfortable in it, and it's SUPER EASY to use! No re thread harness, latch system makes it quick and easy to install, the recline is easy to adjust... I have honestly been very impressed with this seat. I would definitely recommend this seat, I would buy another one like it and I'm so glad I bought this seat.
The only possible downside would be that it's just shy of $200, which seems like a lot, but it's worth every penny.

Review: My daughter is 5 1/2 and tall for her age at 48 inches and 47 lbs. She just outgrew her harness in her Recaro ProSport. Since the ProSport was recently recalled, I was informed that because of the recall we could no longer use the latch in booster mode. So I wanted to replace it with a safe booster seat that latched to the vehicle for safety and convenience. Who wants a 30 lb projectile in their car, not me!! I considered the Clek Oobr and Cybex Solution Q-Fix. The Oobr apparently has a short seat pan and is uncomfortable for a lot of kids, especially tall kids like my daughter. The Cybex looks like a great booster. However I was recommended this booster by a CPST and at more than half the price of the other boosters it was a great value. It also becomes a backless booster which the Cybex doesn't do. It is also rated a Best Bet booster by the IIHS. The other great features that only Britax has is the safeguard which keeps the lap belt in the proper position and the safe cell in the base which reduces the forward movement in your child in a collision. At first when I looked at the booster online I had 2 main concerns. Was it upright and flimsy? I can now say no to both of those concerns. This seat is so sturdy and well made. Very solid and substantial. The fabric is very nice looking and great quality, very thick. My daughter loves the pink and it looks great in our van. The bottom part of the booster where the child sits is very well padded and has a thick cushion. The booster back hinges slightly which allows you to get a great angle in your car. I have seen other reviewers think this is a defect but it is designed like that so you can get a great angle for different cars. This seat fits perfect in my Honda Odyssey 2nd row captain's chair. It is so easy to latch in, it takes about 1 minute. My daughter has a perfect seatbelt fit in this booster. The headrest is very easy and smooth to move up and down. I was very sad to have to move her out of a 5 point harness but seeing her so well secured and comfortable in this booster has put my mind at ease. I have come to love the quality and safety of Britax! My youngest is in a Britax Chaperone and my 3 year old is getting the Frontier 90 to replace his recalled ProSport. Britax has great customer service as well. My ONLY complaint with the seat so far is that it is made in China, I wish Britax would produce ALL of their seats in the USA. Bottom line if you are looking for a booster seat, get this one you will not regret it!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat, backless booster
Weight Range of Child: 5 1/2, 48 inches, 47 lbs
Installation Type: latch
Harness Type: 5 point harness
Material: fabric, thick cushion, padded

I don’t have to worry about it moving a ton when the kids aren’t in it. The kids still love it because they can use the normal seat belt and they get a cup holder that is really steady since it doesn’t go in like the other Graco models. Is it the safest car seat on the market in this style? Who really knows? I appreciate the reasonable price range and the basic features so it’s reasonable to move from car to car for whoever happens to have the kids that day.

This was actually a back-up for grandmas car that we took to use full time when our second son needed a car seat if that tells you how much we truly did like it.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
I wanted to love this, but I didn't. We purchased this for travel.

Pros: It was easy to deflate and fits in a small carryon with plenty of room to spare. It's easy to reinflate and I found it easy to install in a rental car. My 6 year old has no trouble threading the belt or using the shoulder belt positioning strap on the back of the booster. The booster is narrow but still fit her fine. She is toward the lower end of the recommended weight range and the belt could be positioned correctly.

Cons: In our experience, the booster seat slid around *a lot* on the leather seats of our rental car, even when the seatbelt was tightened and locked. My 6yo isn't particularly squirmy but still had a hard time keeping the seat underneath her - the bottom of the booster was super slippery and it slid side to side. This may be less of a problem if you're purchasing the booster to fit 3 kids across, since there wouldn't be as much room to slide. We had to keep reminding our daughter to reposition herself on the seat, though, so it didn't work for us.

The boosters would be great if they were made from a different fabric, though. We have a black one -- maybe other colors are better?
Attribute_Related_Content:

Weight Range of Child: toward the lower end of the recommended weight range
Material: made from a different fabric, super slippery, black one -- maybe other colors are better

Review:
This car seat is pretty great and fits rear facing in the back of my Honda Fit, which was my main requirement. The cupholder is great to have. I would never buy a seat without one now. The cushions are very snug and seem comfortable.

My biggest complaint is the seat belt straps. They get twisted easily, which is annoying. The strap can also be difficult to pull tight. You have to pull really hard to get it tight. Even my husband complains that he can't pull hard enough to get the straps tight. Even more annoying is the fact that when I pull to tighten the straps, sometimes both of the shoulder straps don't tighten! Often, just one side tightens and then the other just remains loose. I try to pull back slack from the tighter one to get them even, but it is very difficult and doesn't always work. I don't want to risk my child's safety by leaving the strap loose, so it's frustrating to have to sit there and mess with it over and over to get it right (especially if I'm standing outside in the rain or freezing cold or in a hurry, etc.) I own two of this exact car seat, so I know it is just not a fluke with my first one.

All this being said, I do really like this car seat. I just wish the strap situation would be fixed in future models.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Harness Type: seat belt straps, shoulder straps

Review:
Our parked car was hit, so we had to replace my 6yr old's booster. I had been wanting to put him back in a five point harness. He was fine weight wise, but he's such a tall kid his torso height was too much for any other seat.

I was told that the Nautilus allowed for a torso height of 21" so I took a chance and ordered it. I figured if he was too tall for the five point we'd just put it in booster mode.

I was so happy when he tried it out, he's still got just a bit of room to go and might be able to stay in the five point until he's 7yr. He can buckle and unbuckle himself. He's even able to loosen the belts for when he wears a heavy winter coat, then tighten it back up. If you have an escape artist this might be a problem.

The seat is rather heavy, but that I like. I figure it will help it stay in place better. The head wrap is very soft for my son, but hard and feels strong from the outside of it. I feel confident that it will protect his head very well from the back and sides. My son says the seat is very comfortable and we both love the drink holder built into the arm.

I was so please I replaced a perfectly good convertible seat my 3yr old had been using to put him in a Nautilus too. He loves the little cubby holes in the arms. They are perfect for stashing small toys.

I found the LATCH instillation goes much smoother with the Nautilus then with our old seats. Removing it is a lot easier too. Our old seats had LATCH belts that were next to impossible to loosen.

We have not tried it as a booster yet, so I cant comment on that aspect. But from the little assembly I had to do, I think they will be great in that function as well.

They are wider then I had expected, and we did lose some room in the back seat so if you need to three in the back seat these might cause a problem.

Over all I'm VERY please with these seats. All the other Mom's now think I'm a car seat Nazi for putting my six year old back in a five point. But the piece of mind I have is worth a little teasing. ;O)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster, convertible
Weight Range of Child: fine weight wise
Harness Type: five point harness
Material: head wrap is very soft, hard and feels strong from the outside
Installation Type: LATCH instillation

My only thing is when he falls asleep his head falls down and is loose. I dont like that and its not safe. It needs to have more of an angle to it to stop something like that from happening.

Review:
Pro:
It will clearly protect children from new born to grade school. as delivered, it comes out of the box and installs as a rear facing seat right into the car. The trickiest part was finding the car's child seat anchor points. Once you know where the anchors are it takes only seconds to put the seat in the car.

Con:
the instructions for changing the seat from rear facing to forward facing were very poor. Once you take most of the padding off it becomes fairly obvious how to configure the latches for the forward configuration. It took me a couple of minutes to figure out how to take the padding off.

Pro/Con;
The seat is big. this is a pro because it has lots of padding and will protect a child really well. it is a con because it does not fit very well in a small car (I have a ford focus) and the rear facing configuration completely blocks the back door window making it very hard to look right and to check the right blind spot. The forward facing configuration is better. Unless you are a small person, it will not fit behind the driver in either configuration.

Review:
The Graco Extend2Fit platinum convertible car seat met all my must haves! Very happy with this car seat!
Likes:
1. It can be used rear facing from 4-50lbs! Wow, that exceeds the limit on any of the previous car seats I have owned. It's important with the new recommendations to keep children rear facing for as long as possible.
2. I love the 2 built in cup holders! Yes, the seat may be wider because of it, but I love having a spot for my toddlers sippy cup and another cup holder for snacks/binkies/toys. Cup holders will fit most types of sippy cups and bottles(see photo).
3. The 'fuss free' harness holder is a great feature to keep the buckle out of the way as you put baby/toddler into seat.
4. The 'Rapid Remove' washable car seat cover is very convenient! I've had numerous diaper blowouts or accidents in my other car seats and removing the cover to wash it was a pain. This feature makes it easy to take off and wash.
5. Appears to be a very cushioned and comfortable car seat, especially for long trips.

Negatives:
1. It's wide, bulky, and not lightweight- if you are traveling via airplane this car seat is a beast. Also if you want to do 3 carseats across, this did not work width wise in my large SUV with my 2 other car seats in the backseat.
2. I'm not a fan of the Graco chest buckle. I've just used other brands and I prefer those.

Overall this is an excellent car seat that will last for a long time as your child grows. It offers the highest level of safety and more convenience features than any other car seat I have owned- very pleased!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 4-50lbs
Harness Type: fuss free harness holder, Graco chest buckle
Material: Rapid Remove washable car seat cover, cushioned

Review: It’s an easy seat to pack away in the bag for flights. We flew and rented a car and I like that I didn’t have to rent a car seat or carry a large car seat through the airport or on the plane. I do think we all prefer the original to this new one.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
I installed rear facing using the seatbelt option in the middle of my backseat (not using LATCH) and it is a very difficult process. You are required to remove the seat cover to run the car's seatbelt underneath where it also has 2 clips to clamp down on the seatbelt. You have to push down on the seat and pull the belt as tight as possible and then force down these clips. Once installed you of course would need to put the cover back however it has to clip in multiple places on the underside of the front of the seat...which is now pressed very firmly against the back of your car! The tighter you install the seat the harder it will be to replace the seat cover.

Once installed usage was horrible. There are 2 sets of straps one of which is only a few inches long and stationary near the top of the large main straps. This means most of the ways that you would instinctively grab the straps to pull and loosen them to remove your child will not loosen them but instead simply pull on these weird smaller straps and stop. You essentially have to leave the chest clip connected and pull on it specifically to get the main straps to loosen.

Then there are these weird rigid rubber things on the front. They are too large get in the way. I think they pinched my baby at least once and made her cry and simply made it difficult to loosen or tighten the straps (second part of the design which inhibited its function). If I had kept this seat I most definitely would have removed these weird giant pieces of hard rubber.

The last straw for me was that I noticed when I finally could tighten the straps they did not apply even pressure. I would get them tight but while on her left side it was extremely snug her right side was still loose, enough to easily get at least a finger under. I checked the straps throughout and never noticed anything out of position or twisted. It seemed to be a flaw in the design where things connected in the back of the seat using a metal bracket which didn't seem to apply pressure evenly.

The only good thing I can say about this seat is that it fit easily in my backseat which is small enough to have been a challenge and certainly some seats, like our Recaro, would not fit properly. Not much of a plus though because I don't think this seat is safe to use.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Harness Type: straps, chest clip

Review:
I bought this to replace my kid's car seat because despite being so petite, she is old enough now that i thought it would be a little strange(and even a little embarrassing) to keep her in a car seat. I was also hoping that it would be easier for her to buckle herself in compares to the multi point car seat straps. We were using a safety first air headrest car seat that has a weight rating up to 60 lbs and my daughter is only 36 lbs.

I ordered this because i like the idea of the head guard in the event of a side impact collision and the seatbelt over the shoulder guides built in to help keep the seat belt from slipping into a bad/ dangerous position.

Upon receiving this booster a few things jumped out at me immediately.
first i noticed how lightweight this booster is. Lightweight is good, but i was put off by it because the second thing i notice was how flimsy the back of this seat seemed to me. The construction and design seems like it would break pretty easy if mishandled outside the vehicle.
I notice some people didn't like the amount of padding on the seat, but it doesnt seem to be any less padded than the carseats we've owned.

A sure-fire plus for me is the narrow width of the seat. With two safety first car seats int he back of my car, we were barely able to fit 5th passengers in our car between them. Replacing one of the car-seats with this booster should make that last passenger a lot more comfortable as now there is about 4 or 5 extra inches for them to sit.

Most importantly for me though, i am unhappy how my daughter is no longer able to buckle herself. This is partially a short coming of my vehicle as the buckles are inset into the seat instead of the flopping out kind. it makes it very difficult (impossible in our situation) for a relatively young kid in a booster to reach under and around to the buckle. I have to get out of the car buckle my daughter in now when i pick her up in a busy line of parents getting their kids., which makes all the other parent s behind me in line, have to wait on me. With a car seat, my daughter had no problem buckling her harness, so now it feels like we have taken a step back in safety and convenience.

I think i am going to look into a seat belt extender to held with the buckle situation, and see if that helps.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Weight Range of Child: weight rating up to 60 lbs
Installation Type: seat belt
Harness Type: multi point car seat straps, harness
Material: padding

My son will soon be to big to travel in this car seat and Im very sad because it is such a nice seat, but I will so be buying Evenflo again!

Review:
We received 3 of these, so I can say with certainty that the problems listed below were not unique to one bad 'lemon'.

While this is lightweight, as advertised, there were several issues.

1.) The headrest is secured by a small piece of Velcro which is insufficient to the job.
2.) The slot for inserting the seat belt for rear-facing installation is too small to fit your hand through, oddly shaped, and has sharp plastic edges which scrape your hand. In order to install the seat belt, the fabric cover of the car seat needs to be un-clipped, and then you can access the slot from both sides of the hold and feed the belt through.
3.) The button/lever for releasing tension on the straps located between their feet is located in a very small hole cut out of the plastic frame. When you pull your thumb or finger out of the hole, it catches on the plastic edge and cuts your thumb. I had a rather gruesome experience with this, and had a friend and a daycare professional test it and they both were shocked at how sharp the plastic edge was and how easily it caught their thumb.
4.) My child who is 7mo old, and average weight/height for her age, does not look comfortable in the seat. It looks like she is sinking into it, and her lower back is not supported, so she is sitting in a C-shape posture.

I was excited by the low price of these car seats, and that they were advertised as light weight and easy to take in and out of vehicles, but they are unsafe for the caregiver, and not a good fit for the child.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Material: Plastic

Review:
We bought this in Porter for my daughter when she was around 7 months and she is now 2.5 years. We've used it rear facing and forward facing. Overall, we like it.

Pros:

LATCH: easy latch, just click and then push the actual seat down instead of pulling. I still have my husband do a final push, but I can get it pretty tight with my body weight.

Comfy: lots of cushion and padding. Extra head and body inserts for little ones

Harness: no rethread, just pull both straps up or down to click into different positions

2 cupholders with bands= most cups fit

Belt tightening happens at the hips. I like this because I don't feel like I'm slicing her neck when I pull it tight. I can buckle everything, pull all slack to hips and then pull tight.

Seat is high up- I like this because my daughter gets carsick if she can't see, but she can't really climb into the seat by herself so it can be a con too

Covers and fully washable

Cons:

This seat is BIG. I measured around 21.5-22" at the cupholders.

Recline: I feel like they could have a few more reclines for comfort- you really only have one option per position.

Need extra positioner. I don't see anyway to install this seat at the proper level without pool noodles or a rolled up towel.

No level- there are 2 arrows that you're supposed to have level with the ground just by eyeballing.

Both cupholders are like half cupholders other a band which is good for diff sized cups, but she can't put snacks in or anything because it falls out.

Porter color doesn't have the advertised buckle pockets.

Most annoying feature- to take off the cover you have to UNSCREW both cupholders. My daughter got carsick the first few times she was forward facing and it was so much fun getting the cover off and on.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing, forward facing
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: no rethread, pull both straps up or down to click into different positions, belt tightening happens at the hips
Material: covers and fully washable

Review: This carseat is easy to use, easy to install in your vehicle and comfortable for your child. I have rheumatoid arthritis in my hands and I have no issues getting my grandson out of the seat.I love that the seat reclines and is easy to clean.

Review: Takes a few minutes to put together but well worth it once your kid is old or big enough. This is way lighter than a car seat and can be removed or moved to the other side of the car with ease.

Great for easy vehicle transitions. The two cup holders are great. One for a drink, one for a snack. However, our 4 year old complained of the seat being hard for the longer trips, over an hour of driving.

They're a standard size so it won't fit those odd shaped sippy cups but it's no biggy. Easy clean up, install, and transfer to another car in no time.

Review: Love this seat! Color's a beautiful and padding has held up well. I purchased 2 in September for my then 5 month old. So she is still currently rear facing and is small so she still has all the padding in. Seems really comfortable and she has no problem sleeping in it.

Review: I bought this carseat after strong recommendations from a lot of people.  My 5yo daughter is at the highest point the headrest can go with the harness.  I can't imagine she'll get more than a few months out of the seat as a 5pt harness.  If I had known that I would have chosen a different booster since I want her in a 5pt harness as long as possible.  She also has a hard time buckling the bottom buckle by herself which was not a problem with her last seat.  I now have 2 kids to buckle into their seats instead of 1 which is not a huge deal, but was a nice luxury with her last seat.  It's a decent seat, but I would only recommend this seat to someone if they had a lower price range.  There are much better seats out there.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: 5pt harness
Weight Range of Child: 5yo daughter
Installation Type: buckle

Review: Attractive looking seat. Minimum efforts put into it. The foam is extremely thin, you can press down on the padding and feel through the plastic. The actual seat itself, the plastic- is not hard like our other Graco. It is flexible and I can bend, push, pull it. For reinforcement, there are two thin one inch bars. Our other seats have much larger and stronger reinforcement bars. I picture in my head, a large vehicle hitting my baby girl side of the car and this seat does not feel safe to me. We are returning and purchasing the Britax One4Life. My heart says no to this seat. My bank was happy but I don’t feel like this would protect my girl in my sedan. This would be better for an suv, van, truck. But overall please check the plastic and make sure you’re okay with it before you use it for you child. It is a great seat because it has a circular cup holder, it only has one but some have square cup holders! So that’s nice. We purchased because the seat cover removes easy and our daughter gets sick in the car easy but I will invest in a steam cleaner just for her Britax. It does not have a removable cover at all, only the headrest from what I read so that is a downside. The cost with the accessories is $500. This seat is budget friendly definitely and much safer than many car seats you can find at Walmart or other places. Nice seat just not safe enough for us.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: foam is extremely thin, padding, plastic is flexible and can bend, push, pull, plastic and make sure you’re okay with it
Installation Type: two thin one inch bars for reinforcement, larger and stronger reinforcement bars in other seats

Review: We got this as a back up for my husbands truck. Our baby mainly rides in my car but needed another incase we were to take his truck/picking up for daycare. It’s very cheap compared to the expensive Greco one that we have.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
My daughter is 7 months old and we recently went on a long road trip and I was debating buying her a convertible car seat since she is very tall for her age and seemed really uncomfortable in her Graco infant carrier car seat. Actually, she screams bloody murder when she gets strapped into the Graco and refuses to sleep unless she's completely wiped out and then she'll take a little 20 minute snooze after fussing for 30 minutes or more because she's tired but hates her car seat....I know they say a lot of babies love to sleep in their car seats but not my daughter! I can count on one hand the number of times she's fallen asleep in the car...since BIRTH....and one of the times she wasn't in her car seat, but rather we parked so I could hold her because she was so tired she was crying but wouldn't sleep!

After doing a TON of research I bought the Britax Advocate, telling myself it would be an investment because we should be able to use it until she's 4 or 5 and we take a lot of long road trips to visit family. I don't know if her other seat was too small for her or if this one with the memory foam is more comfortable, I don't know what the exact reason is but she actually seems to like going in her car seat now. The only time she sometimes cries is when I'm tightening her straps and I think that's just because she hates being restricted. But often I put her in her car seat and she seems happy to be sitting in it and nibbles on the buckle or shoulder pads and then sits quietly while I strap her in and we go on our way. She even fell asleep in it last weekend! Win!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible car seat
Weight Range of Child: until she's 4 or 5
Material: memory foam

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review: Not only is this car seat pretty but the installation is so easy and it feels like it would be very comfortable. My daughter started to hate her carrier car seat so it was time to upgrade. Definitely happy I chose this one!

Review: I hate this seat! The straps are nearly impossible to get tight enough, unless I stand on the running boards for leverage, or my husband does it. I should not have to have the upper body strength of a man to use this seat safely. Spend the extra money and get a Britax.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: straps are nearly impossible to get tight enough

Review: Bought this as people stated this was the safest and can be used for a long time. Thankfully and hopefully has not needed to test its safety. Also, like the color and the feel of the fabric. I am petite though with not a lot of upper body strength and in a dodge journey, I have to really lift (approx 5 inches or more than the base of the car seat) my 20 lbs niece just to place her in the car seat---its a lot of work every time. Most importantly, she's not wide. In fact she is pretty average in weight but she's already pretty snug on the car seat. She's only 9 months so I'm worried I might have to buy another one pretty soon...
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: like the color and the feel of the fabric

Review: This seat is roomy for my 2 year old. We just went on a road trip and she was very comfortable. The only thing I find difficult is the loosening and tightening of the straps. To loosen, you have to actually insert your thumb into the fabric flap and press the button. When tightening, I find I have to pull on the straps behind the seat as I’m pulling on the tension strap to get a good fit. Other than that, this is the perfect car seat for long trips. It has enabled me to keep rear-facing my 2 year old as long as possible. We drive a 2018 Ford Expedition and a 2020 Ford F-150. It is a bulky car seat to have to move between vehicles when we have to. If I could change anything about it, I would have liked a click system with car seat bases like how we had when she used the Chicco Keyfit 30. Other than that I’m very satisfied with this seat.

Review:
We have 8 kids (Yes, 8. And yes, we know what causes that.) and the youngest two have had the blessing of a Britax Marathon. Our youngest three would SCREAM in their infant carriers...from the moment they were buckled in to the moment they were removed. (I bought really nice carriers with the most padding and safety features.) What we realized was that the padding really was nothing compared to the Britax and the shape it held was not good for their backs and hips. When this arrived, I was nervous that it wouldn't stop the high pitched, blood curdling screams that the 3 week old let fly any time she was buckled. But it did! Beautiful golden silence all the way across town...and home again!

We own two now...one of them for 2 1/2 years now and this one was purchased for the new baby because moving the toddler wasn't going to happen!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: padding, shape it held was not good for their backs and hips

Review: I researched several options before deciding on this booster for my 1st grade son.  I like the head support compared to the backless boosters even though he is old enough for one.  I feel like the extra support is helpful in case we get in an accident.  This booster is lighweight and easy to move to another vehicle.  The multiple cup holders is a plus when moving it to different seating arrangements in the back seat.

Review: I have owned a few car seats and this is kind of middle of the line. It does have some nice features, like it is not very hard to buckle and it the seat is decently padded, but it is hard to install. I have installed several rearfacing car seats and the convertible ones are always hard so I'm not really sure of that is relevant. I bought mine used off Craigslist for 25 dollars so I really can't complain. Overall a good car seat, but if I had paid full price I would be disappointed.

Review:
You can tell the difference in construction from most brands as soon as you pick it up. Solid, well thought out design with extras like crash helmet foam and steel skeleton. Its much more comfortable too. Lots of removable padding. My daughter is much happier sitting in this seat than the Chicco we had. The only negative features are lack of leg room and the cover doesn't come off easily for washing. The leg room is an issue when facing backward but this is probably an issue for most convertibles. This is a large seat. It barely fits in my wife's 4 door BMW 3series and leaves no room for front seat passengers. If you have anything smaller, you better do a test install before buying.
While I respect the fact that the cover is well secured, the car seat has to be uninstalled in order to remove the cover due to cleaning. This is not an easy to install car seat. Most of the difficulty directly relates to safety features built into the carseat,so that's not really a drawback. But when you have to install the seat 2x in a week because of leaking diapers, it can be frustrating.
Overall, the piece of mind, solid construction and quality make me very satisfied with the seat. In future design considerations, Britax (pay attention!) can make their seats easier to install, with more leg room and quick cover removal.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: 
Harness Type: 
Material: crash helmet foam, steel skeleton, removable padding

Review:
I purchased this product to pick up my granddaughter and/or grandson. It is very large and barely fits in my extended cab truck. The strap to tighten the shoulder straps on the child does not pull snug for a proper fit. I have to unbuckle the seat belt in the truck , put her in it ,then pull the strap to secure her harness. Then turn it in the rear facing and re- attach the seat belt.
Most definitely must have been a man who designed this( SORRY). Would definitely NOT buy again. Wish companies would use their common sense instead of a degree to produce things.
