Review: Ease of use, Check!  Comfort and safety for baby, Check!  Protective layers and fabric for warm and cold weather, Check!  Quality fabrics and product overall, Check!  This has everything you could want or need in a GREAT carseat, and then some!  Keyfit 30 Magic Car Seat did NOT disapoint and am thrilled with every aspect of this carseat that has grown with my baby and love that you can easily remove things that are no longer needed (one being around the head area) since our little blessing has grown a little plumper these past two months and no longer needed that additional layer :). It's an investment for sure....but worth it....defintely worth it!!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing

Review:
Well I was super stoked about these as our 7mo has grown out of his infant carrier. However, we cannot get them to tilt back enough in the rear facing position. We tried the usual tricks of using pool noodles, rolled up towels, etc and we took it to a certified car seat installer and she ran out of ideas. We are using the infant insert too, but it doesn't help. So, his head slumps far forward when he falls asleep. Bummer.

Other than that the seat is super sturdy, stays cool in the heat (we live in Texas where it is 100 degrees right now) and it is easy to use. Baby loves it when he is awake but I worry about him sleeping in it since his airway is pinched.

At this point we will be keeping the seat because we have had it a couple of weeks since we were testing install for so long and had multiple people looking at it but I might've done more research to make sure it could recline the recommended amount.

Oh and the photo example is before we used the insert and I will say it is slightly better, but the issue still isn't fixed. Considering getting another insert to support his head - the infant cradle product - to see if that helps.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 7mo
Installation Type: certified car seat installer, testing install
Material: stays cool in the heat

Review:
Bought this for our 2nd child but ended up returning it due to it not reclining. The description says it is suitable for infants from 5lb plus, we tried our daughter at 16lb and it just isn't comfortable for young ones. The 3 level recline does not go far enough back and the whole child is still almost vertical which means if they can sleep the head slumps forward which is dangerous. I have no idea how a 5lb baby would fit inside this car as it wasn't suitable for our 6 month old.

The seat looks better for forward facing kids but we did not have a chance to try it out in this mode. It's also not very clear on instructions, I've put in quite a few seats over the last few years and this one would have to be the hardest. To work out how to tilt the whole seat just wasn't clear, yet the rest of the seat is covered in useless sticker info. Also, the seat belt has to go through a very tight space under the seat cover which takes a long time to feed through if you don't want to take the cover off.

It was ok size-wise, after other reviews I was worried about this but fit inside our Honda CR-V fine. It was a pity as we were hoping this seat would last from 6months until our daughter wouldn't need one any more, but we're shopping around for others.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward facing
Weight Range of Child: 5lb plus, 16lb, 6 month old
Installation Type: Seat belt
Material: Seat cover

Review: We bought this as we are frequent travelers! It is so nice to pull (or push) baby like a precious little piece of luggage! This has come in handy for early morning flights when baby fell asleep on the way to the airport and we just transferred the carseat onto the travel cart and we were on our way without disrupting baby! It fits on tight and is simple to install onto cart. It also fits in the carseat cover, still attached, which is helpful for quickly disembarking the airport. We get compliments on it everywhere we go!

Review: This is a great car seat.  I bought it because it was highly rated on Meg's list (she's awesome, every mom should subscribe to her blog).  It was easy to install and the fabric is pretty easy to clean with a baby wipe.  gave it 4 stars though because the straps seem to twist easily and when trying to secure a wiggling toddler in a seat that can be a real pain. Also, the HUGS chest pads are attached to the straps which can make them hard to move up and down without first tightening the straps.  But I think on the new models (2014 and on) this feature has been changed.  Otherwise, I feel very confident in this seats ability to protect my daughter.

Review: Love this car seat. I have no other to compare it to, since it's for my first baby but since I bought it, I've met many other moms who bought the same one. It's easy to use, easy to clean and my baby is comfortable in it. No complaints!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
This is the coolest car seat we have ever owned, and we have owned a lot. The only thing this doesn’t have is tech running through it. The instruction booklet is a must and thankfully, this car seat does have a tray located at the base to store the booklet! For when you need to make adjustments, remove the seat, etc. Also, this isn’t just for you, this is great for the friend, other parent, grandparent etc. that is helping you and may have no idea how this seat works.

I am sure some people are questioning my sanity about this trivial thing; but until you are sitting in a parking lot crying because you can’t figure out how to release the car seat from a locking base you will never understand my excitement of this feature. (Yes, that is a true story. )

The seat cover can be completely removed to wash. I have not had to remove my cover to wash it I have only used wash rags/ wipes to clean up spills. The side panels feel almost like canvas but with a coating on them. While the inside portion (where child sits) of the car seat is covered in a non-abrasive material that is a squishy (feel like memory foam) padding.

There are two removable head pillows, and a lumbar support / booster. I really wish my vehicle had this little thing. The belts expand with a simple push of the button located in the front of the seat, and then gently pull the harness straps. If you loosen too much pull the sing strap at the base to tighten. You can do this one handed.

There is a recline feature on the seat. To engage it once you pull a ‘trigger leaver’ at the bottom of the car seat, it is located in the front (where ankles would sit when taller) just pull forward and seat reclines. Again, this can be done one handed.

The car seat clamps to the vehicle metal U rings located in the back seat area, in addition it uses the seat belt to keep the seat stable & secure. When you first take the seat out of the box the clamps are already attached but tucked up under the outer sides for storage. At first, I thought these clamps were broken because when you press the release (red) button on them nothing happens; however when hooking them on you hold them like a Taser and push them onto the metal bars of the U rings until you hear them click. These will not disconnect unless you hold the red button, just like a seat belt, but you have to pull away from the ring while the button is engaged.

The cup holders lock into place, they are somewhat small but do hold a bottle securely unlike other holders. Larger sippy cups may not fit, I recommend checking yours first. You can remove them, to make the holder area bigger and for cleaning. You can run them through a dishwasher.

Overall this car seat looks and feels like it should be in a space shuttle, it’s very sturdy and not excessively heavy. It isn’t the removable kind you can use in a stroller but if you are looking to buy 1 seat that will grow with your child I believe this is it. This is also really good for grandparents to have so they can easily store it at home or leave it in a car and never have to worry if they have the right seat with them in any situation that may call for them to be the primary pick up.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Clicktight, Seat Belt
Harness Type: harness straps, pull the sing strap at the base to tighten
Material: side panels feel almost like canvas but with a coating, inside portion is covered in a non-abrasive material that is a squishy (feel like memory foam) padding, seat cover can be completely removed to wash

Review: It looks nice and the price is very good but this seat is of very poor quality. It has a very thin layer of fabric over the plastic seat. It is like sitting on a plastic chair which is not good for your kid, especially if you are driving daily with them. We even did not install it and returned it back when we opened the package and saw the product!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: very thin layer of fabric over the plastic seat, like sitting on a plastic chair

Review:
We have had this car seat for 2 years now and my son has never complained to sit in it. This is an easy to clean seat. We have been on long 3 hour drives and he still seems happy and sleeps happily in the seat. I will be buying the same brand for my second baby as well. The car seat does not have excessive padding that i see on certain car seats. This is perfect since for Caliornia weather we don't want anything too warm. One of our friends ended up returning her carseat (which was a different brand) because it was too padded and her son sweat a lot in it even on short drives.

Overall a great buy and would recommend it to all.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: easy to clean, does not have excessive padding, not too warm

Review:
After a long and what seemed difficult search, I came across this beaut. I absolutely loved the features such as the removable seating for washing, the cupholder, and the forward facing/rear facing reverse. The color is a beautiful teal and the quality is superb.
Installation was a breeze. I know the CDC is recommending children be rear facing until at least age two but my daughter was way too long to be rear facing in our previous car seat. This seat has a function that sort of pushes the kids back a little bit so they can sit rear facing, longer. The did not work so well for us because I could just see my little one was too long and she was ready to be turned around. Rotating the seat forward facing was very easy and required minimal effort. I read through the instructions before I even walked to the car and it was no more than a click and a snap before I was done.
I love how this is a forever carseat and I will be recommending it to friends and family with children. I might have even found my new baby shower gift for unsuspecting friends :)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: forward facing/rear facing reverse
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: click and a snap
Harness Type: 
Material: removable seating for washing

Review: Buy this for traveling. Not kidding. Check it or carry it on, whatever. Save your back from hauling your convertible through the airport. I was a fool for not doing this with our first kid. It fits in a duffel bag. You can strap it with a bungee to your luggage and you won’t notice the weight. If you are traveling alone with kids and are trying to figure out how to get 2 kids, 2 car seats and your luggage from long term parking to the gate, this is part of the solution.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
I bought this so I didn’t have to transfer car seats weekly when I have my 2yo niece and also because I have a small vehicle and hated having a massive car seat taking up room in the back.
The cup holder being optional is so neat, I don’t know that it saves extra room having it slid in but the placement of them is a lot less wide than the previous seat I had. Its not as hard for her to reach her drinks now, I don’t know if this is just a specific issue for my tiny girl, but a definite plus for us.
The seat as a whole looks to be more comfortable for her to be in.
* Installation literally takes MINUTES! I can’t begin to describe how grateful I am for the anchor straps that simply click in place. I loooathe having to fight with the hook kind to get them on/off. These you just have to push against the anchor, listen for the click, and pull to adjust your straps. Then to remove the seat all you have to do is push a button to release them! The straps are also soo much easier to grip in order to tighten. The car seat feels more secure and doesn’t budge as much as others I’ve used. The chest straps don’t seem to loosen and need adjusted as much when taking the seat in and out which is a big plus. The chest clip snaps together differently than I’ve saw before so she’s not able to push in the button and unclip herself like she did with the last seat!
If you’re like me and spend 8 years reading reviews before making the purchase, do yourself a favor and go ahead and buy this!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 2yo
Installation Type: anchor straps, click in place, push a button to release
Harness Type: chest straps, chest clip

Review: This car seat is great for my 2014 Jetta and I can easily fit three kids in the back seats! Only down side is the way the seat belt latches into the hooks across the laps, the kids can not unlatch them selves and I have to help get them in and out because of how difficult it is to detach the seat belt from the hooks on the sides. Wish it was more of a clip like the piece that attaches to the shoulder strap.

Review: I have no idea what the heck I am doing. I love this car seat and I am happy with it. I watched a YOUTUBE video that helped me install it. My baby is very comfortable in it. I love the color because it looks classy as well. Overall happy.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: we bought this car seat for the side impact protection and because it is super safe. It is a really big seat, and is made very well. Problem is my son doesn't like it.  He is 9 months old and about 20 pounds and can't see around the giant sides.  He loved his Graco Snugride infant seat and has been crying since we put him in this seat last week.  Since we now are planning on keeping him rear facing as long as possible with the new guidelines to keep children rear facing until 2, we know that we need to exchange this.  We are going to try the Marathon because it has a lower side profile and he should be able to see out the windows peripherally.

Review: Great car seat. I had trouble with the latching rear facing at first but when I watched the installation video I realized there were 2 different locations that the latching strap can go through. Thanks guys for the video! Also we love our car seat very much!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: latching

Review:
I really wanted to find a travel system that would work well, but also be different from all the typical travel systems I see around town. I really researched Combi, and I am happy that I made this purchase. The infant seat and base are great. The harness can be adjusted very easily, and I can tell my baby is quite snug and secure while we are traveling. Only reason I give four stars instead of five is because when in the base, the seat can jiggle a little too much for my liking. I'm not sure if this is common among all bases and seats (other brands), but I would like it to really lock into place and not be able to jiggle. Also, the base cannot angle the seat enough such that the bubble level is centered where it should be for a baby under 22 lbs. There is a line for 22 lbs and under, and I have to place a pillow under half of the base to get the leveling correct.

Purchase and Shipping from Amazon was very nice, as always.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: The harness can be adjusted very easily, and I can tell my baby is quite snug and secure while we are traveling.

Review:
I've purchased Nautilus Car seat for 3 yrs child.
Had to spend some time study instructions.
Overall seat is fine, but there are some design problems:
- Harness buckle is to low (literally between the legs) which is inconvenience.
There is no way to lift it up - Crotch strap is too short.
Other straps are short as well (Adjustment strap, Tether strap).
They are made long enough to fit 1-2 ears child.
Had to buy 3' of similar strap in order to extend them on the back side of the car seat. This is the task not for everyone. But only this way it can be used for the older than 2 years child.

i should have gone with the marathon

Review: I have been waiting for months for this product to come out.  We bought the Gemini (purple) from Babies R Us. My daughter is tall for her age (27 inches at 6 months). We had the Chicco Keyfit 30, and have used it since we brought her home from the hospital. We loved it. I did a ton of research for convertible car seats, and decided this was the best one. The seat is very heavy, but that is a good thing in my opinion. I feel like it is sturdy and safe. I installed it in my car yesterday. It took less than 5 minutes to properly install the seat. The latch system on this seat is super easy to tighten. In the past, I have sat in and kneeled in seats while pulling with all my might to get them tight enough. With this seat, all I had to do was pull each latch strap, and it was in super tight! I think that is my favorite feature so far. I also loved that it has 9 recline options. My car has pretty deep bucket seats in the back, and I didn't want to have to roll up a towel or something to get the proper recline. I didn't have any problems finding the correct angle. The bubble level feature is great! The only complaint I have is that the straps seem a little stiff, and it is a little tough to get them as tight as I like once the baby is in the seat. I feel like that problem will get better as we use the seat more. The seat is very well cushioned. I was pleased with how soft and comfy it feels. My daughter seemed comfortable in the seat. I would definitely recommend this to a friend!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: latch system, super easy to tighten, pull each latch strap  
Harness Type: straps seem a little stiff, tough to get them as tight as I like  
Material: very well cushioned, soft and comfy

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
Used this in the rear facing position only. Bought from Target.

Likes:
1. Cushioning/styling is very nice.

Dislikes:
1. The belts do not slide very well through the slide points. This includes the cinch to take slack out of/put slack in the harness and ESPECIALLY the latch system whether tightening or loosening. These should work with minimal resistance, not be near impossible to pull (it’s like the release button didn’t work at all).
2. The way the seat is balanced in the rear facing direction. The latch system Doesn’t seem to be properly positioned, which causes the seat to not be stable enough to stay in one place. Even with both the latch system and the shoulder belt threaded through there, the bottom rear of the seat (car forward) is rounded and will fall with weight added to the seat back. If you couple this with number one, 2 very seemingly unsafe things will happen (look at the picture): the seat will lay down, as the bottom of the seat starts to ride up the car seat back, and the seat will sway from side to side. I tried sitting all 260 lbs of me onto the car seat to get it to go down as far as possible, then tried securing the latch belt as best I could and the thing lasted 2 days in this position and by the third day started to fall/slide.
3. The seat is difficult to adjust. You have to pull out the seat bottom (booster) completely and make your adjustments, then thread both the latch system AND harness back into the seat bottom, which, for me, a 21 year technician took three hands to do well. A few times I’d get 3/4 belts seated properly, only to have the booster not seat properly back into the seat back, or one got caught in a pinch point and I had to do the thing all over again.
4. The price for what it is. Look, it’s a lot of molded plastic and well padded cushions and at first glance it looks like it should be worth what they’re asking, but when you take into account all the problems I had with it, it didn’t do near as well as the $219 Graco I exchanged it for. Night and day difference. Granted, the Graco doesn’t “look” as nice as this one, but the user friendliness of the evenflo is atrocious.

With all the other positive reviews I wonder if I got a bad apple. I wonder if the system that tightened up the belts needed some lubrication or something, but the design flaws are there molded right into the plastic. I’m happy I got my money back and that the Graco was so much better. I’m not being paid by any company, I just hope some guy doesn’t make the same mistake I did. Buyer beware.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: Harness

Review: This is a great carseat for the price. I never owned a Britax but I did alot of carseat comparisons before deciding to purchase this one and I am glad I did.  It is just as safe as the more expensive Britax with some better features in my opinion.  It weights considerably less than a Britax and that makes it easier to move from car to car.  The adjustments and buckles are super easy.  It has a cup holder which is a real plus. The padding is just the right amount, not too thin, but also not super thick so it won't make baby overheat. You can remove the cover to wash but this tidalwave gray/ aqua color is nice as it does not show dirt.  We liked it so much we bought a matiching one for our other car.  It is a nice size and fits well in our Nissan Altima and our Buick Century.

Review:
Buyer beware: this is a great car seat for traveling or fitting in smaller seat (I.e. sports car) but this seat is not FAA certified. If you read the label carefully you will read that it meets the requirements. It has to state that it is FAA certified in order to be approved for take off and landing on an aircraft.

We were told that we had to remove our child from the seat and we could not use it because the seat was not labeled with an FAA CERTIFIED sticker. We were very upset since we spent almost $400 for this “convenient” car seat to travel abroad with. There is nothing convenient about having an active toddler without a car seat on a super long international flight. Please keep this in mind if you are planning on using this car seat for flight use.

While I like the design, the portability, ease of use and travel bag, I do not recommend the seat because it lacks the certifications required to fly on most airlines.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review: Other reviewers have complained about the lower anchor buckle (goes between the child's legs). It is a problem at times and I often have to "dig" under my 4.5 year old twin grand daughter's little bottoms to find the anchor.  I was also unpleasantly surprised that it comes in so many pieces. It took "grandma" and me "grandpa" a long time to do seat number one, but much less for seat number two. Also make no attempt to pick up more than one seat in a small compact car as the boxes are HUGE.  However, every other aspect of this seat, including the VERY reasonable price is 5 star. The girls sit more upright, have their own little drink holders, and plenty of padding. Front visibility is also greatly improved over their previous seats, also Gracos. This seat will be converted to the next level, saving me the cost of a "booster" seat when they get older and heavier.

Review: This seat replaces a Chicco Keyfit 30 for my 12 month old son.  I have this seat facing backwards in a midsize German sedan. This seat is compact length wise, which gives the driver more space and has more leg room for the child when facing backwards  than the Britax Marathon 70 from two years ago, which is still in use in our SUV.  It is also highly adjustable.  The one deficiency which is almost inexcusable is the lack of a Belly Pad between the child and the buckle.  I recommend the "[[ASIN:B00CU82PKS Britax EZ-Buckle Belly Pad]]d" sold by Amazon for $16 to solve this problem.  It's spring loaded which prevents the child from sitting on the buckle and it protects them from pinching when buckling the belts.  I could have gone with thae new Britax convertible seat, but I have used other Chicco products and they seem to have a higher level of refinement, the buttons, latches and levers are easy to use and work smoothly.  This seat is a great fit for my needs.  And it seems a big comfort improvement over the Chicco Keyfit 30 seat my son was in before.

Review:
Wanted to buy the Elite Nautilus for the feature of having the seatbelt lock attached to the car seat rather than the metal clip that the regular Nautilus has (why on earth do they not make the regular Nautilus w/ the updated seatbelt lock?!). We owned the Nautilus before & loved it (and updated b/c we were involved in a car wreck and the insurance company was paying for us to get new ones...yeah!). If you've ever used that awful metal clip seatbelt lock you know what a huge pain it is and takes forever to install it correctly & safely.
I've owned this car seat (& the other one that they call "Vice" in color) for several months now and we like it. The only difference between it and the regular Nautilus is the seatbelt lock & the head piece can be adjusted on this one (a feature I haven't used yet).
The only downside I've come across is that my son (3YO and average height & weight) complains sometimes that it hurts his peepee. I think it's because at those times that he complains his butt is scooted forward and he just needs to scoot it back. Wish they had a better crotch strap adjust but in the end I would still recommend.

Review: I really wanted to love this seat. It is super easy to install (both seatbelt and latch), has amazing padding, and the adjustable head rest/harness height and recline features are all very good reasons to love this seat. Now the bad, and it's a biggie...the harness is extremely difficult to tighten (moving the pads down helps a little, but it is still difficult). And it wasn't just me - my husband had to use all his force and sometimes it was still too loose. This is a huge safety concern. Comfort, style, and convenient features are not enough for me to overlook safety. I would much rather purchase a budget seat that's a pain to install (as long as it installs safely), with less padding, and fewer features as long as the harness can be tightened as much as it should.

Review:
I’ve been using Graco car seats for 15+ years. This was a change for me. I’ve read that century is owned by Graco so technically this may still be a Graco seat but there are some significant differences between this seat and the Graco Contender.

Installation: century drive on does not have. Leveling ball like Graco seats do. It has a line you want to get parallel to the ground. Other than that installation is about the same as a Graco seat. Neither easier nor harder.

Comfort: baby seems very comfortable in this seat. It took me some work and texting a CPST to get the best fit for this baby, she needs the infant inset in and the crotch strap in the outer position to get the best fit. Once I got that right everything is great.

Cupholders: Graco contenter has one, this seat has two and they must both be installed. I noticed some reviews state that they are removable. If they are installed correctly they do not come off. Make sure you twist down and hear the click.

Dimensions: this seat has a lower profile that the Graco contender, which is one of the reasons I chose this seat. It is easier to lift baby in and out of this seat because the sides don’t come up as high and the whole seat sits a little lower too.

Headrest adjusting: works about the same. It’s easier for me to do one handed on the century drive on.

Harness length adjusting: this is easy to reach and use rear facing with the century drive on. This is an improvement from the Graco seat which has it placed so that it’s buried against the vehicle seat back.

Chest clip: the century drive on chest clip is tougher to open than graco’s. I am able to unfasten Graco’s one handed. For the century drive on I need to use both hands. It will likely get a little easier as I get used to it. I’m not sure this is a bad thing. If your toddler is forever undoing their chest clip, this might be the seat for you.

Overall I am very happy with this seat. It’s quality is definitely comparable to Graco Contender. I love the colors.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Leveling ball, line parallel to the ground
Harness Type: Crotch strap, chest clip, harness length adjusting

Review: Because I am a mom who drives three different carpool groups (preschoolers, kindergartners, and full-day elementary students), I always have a full load. I purchased extra car seats on a classified site, but they are quite bulky. When I needed one more, I didn't know how it was going to work. I found this one, and read the reviews about its portability and compact size, and knew I had hit the jackpot. It fits perfectly between the two larger boosters in the back. The younger kids had a bit of a hard time figuring out how to weave the seat belt through the red devices that make the booster even more secure at first, but they eventually got it. I'm glad we bought the Bubble Bum... even with its goofy name.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Booster
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Harness Type: 
Material:

Review:
Just received this seat yesterday for my 4 year old. We were replacing our Britax Diplomat that she had just outgrown. She looks very comfortable in the seat and has plenty of room. I'm confident she will be able to use the seat for a good while. She is on the small side, about 37 inches tall and only 33 pounds. Aside from all the safety features, my favorite part is the belly buckle is always stuck forward, no more sitting on it.
I previously installed her old seat with the seatbelt as the Diplomat (like the Roundabout but with the side wings) didn't have the independent latch hooks for each side of the seat, I wasn't able to get it as tight with latch. This seat was super easy to install with latch. I fiddled with the seatbelt lock off and that looked relatively simple too, you just have to slip your fingers between the front of the seat cover. The cover is able to be taken off without taking the seat out of the car and taking all the straps off- that may make it easier to install with the seatbelt so you can see what you're doing.
I also love how long the seats last before expiring, and they hold up very well, her old seat will be passed down to our second child, due in June. Britax even makes a foam piece to help newborns fit in their convertible seats, very excited to have our matching "cowseats" when the new baby comes along.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 33 pounds
Installation Type: seatbelt, latch
Harness Type: belly buckle
Material: cover

I like that it keeps the seat off the ground so that the seat base did not get any extra wear and tear. Wheels worked great and the handle extends for taller adults if needed.

Review: It works really well for a travel booster - easy to use, compact, can take it anywhere. I also fold them up and tuck them in the behind the seat pocket when they aren't in use - allowing for adults to easily hop in the car where my kid just was. The downside is that for longer trips, the little legs of the person in the seat sick straight out or criss-cross applesauce. So my 4 year old complains after a while about not being comfortable. The seat itself sometimes slides around a bit, and the kid has to keep their back to the back of the seat for it to stay safe - which is asking a lot of a 4 year old, IMO. But again, as a travel / backup booster, it's pretty darn ideal.

Review:
I gave this 3 stars because it does what it needs to do: it latches into the vehicle securely, it holds the baby in place, and it seems extremely impact resistant. BUT it is so incredibly inconvenient (at best) that I would NEVER buy this car seat again.

It was really easy to install and latch securely (even better than either of the 2 infant car seats we had), the tilting base is nice and easy to use EXCEPT you can't tilt it to readjust once it's latched and tightening the latch system changes the angle of the seat. So we had to install it, check the bubble, loosen the latch, change the tilt, and reinstall it which was pretty inconvenient.

The strap to tighten/loosen the 5pt harness is comically short. I have to loosen it all the way and my 10month old's arms still get stuck in the straps when I try to get her out. Then the strap ends up under the covering and at a weird angle so I have to climb into the backseat and stand up to get the leverage needed to tighten it. It sucks.

My daughter looks obviously uncomfortable in the seat as well. Like her lower back is pushed forward awkwardly and she screams about being in the carseat way more than in the infant seats. But she seemed fine with it in the store that we tested it out at so I'm not sure if it's the angle for the rear facing that is causing the issue or what.

Also my daughter is small for a 10month old (19lbs) and the chest strap and shoulder cushions seem really big on her, I can't imagine putting a newborn in this carseat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 19lbs
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: 5pt harness

Review: This car seat is fantastic! I bought it to replace a Britax Boulevard after I was in an accident. While I liked the Britax's higher sides, the HUGS pads and straps were hard to adjust and uncomfortable for my little one. The Graco 4ever is much more comfortable for her and it is definitely sturdy. Install was easy and the seat is surprisingly more compact than I expected, which is great. The straps are easy to adjust and I love not having to re-thread the straps! Just lift the headrest and go. I anticipate that we will be able to keep the little one rear-facing up to the limits. I really have no clue how they made this seat so comfy and spacious, but still fit so well in my car! It is a bit heavy so if you are going to be transferring this seat between cars, you might want to go with something lighter.  Also, the chest clip sometimes is tricky to release, I don't know if that is just me or the clip.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing
Installation Type: Install was easy
Harness Type: straps are easy to adjust, not having to re-thread the straps, lift the headrest and go, chest clip sometimes is tricky to release
Material: comfy

Review:
I love this carseat so much, I'm going to purchase another one for our other car! I was having a hard time finding a carseat that was high-weight on the 5-point harness that didn't cost a ton of $$. My kid is a car sleeper, so good head support was a must (this is an issue with my other carseat now).

It has great head support for when he falls asleep, nice deep, wide cupholder, and is the most secure fit I've gotten in any of my carseats so far! My 30-month, 30-pound son is very comfy, and it's super easy to adjust around his clothing, etc. NOTE: I don't recommend putting it together in a parking lot at 11PM in winter, as it takes some time to assemble and is hard to do with cold fingers :)

UPDATE 9/24/10: I have to knock this down a star now that my kid has grown some more. We had to remove him from the 5-point harness just before his 5th birthday, even though he's only about 44lbs. The crotch strap on this is TOO CLOSE to the back of the seat. So when we buckle him in 5-point, it smushes his 'stuff' and makes him uncomfortable for the whole ride. It became so much of an issue that we had to discontinue use of the harness and go to the belt. The whole reason I got this was for the high-weight limit on the 5-pt. In addition, it's VERY hard to clean. Easy enough to get the pads off and wash, etc, but when you disassemble it there are a ton of little crevices that are filled with nasty stuff (cracker crumbs, raisins, you name it) that is SO hard to get out! It's at 4 stars (down from 5) due mainly to the crotch strap issue, though...but still very comfy and easy to buckle into.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 44lbs
Harness Type: 5-point harness
Material: hard to clean

Seat-belt guide can be troublesome at times as it's a little flimsy but should be seen as little concern if you plan on leaving it in your car or minimally removing it.

Review:
This CAR SEAT is quite an improvement in the the infant car seat category. The improvement is the safety aspects. And, once I placed a grandchild in it, I noticed the padding. Good padding is critical. The second best thing here is that it separates easily from the base. This makes it easy to carry your child in his own seat, without lugging the base around. I used this for my grandchild and we went into the doctor's office, easily without disrupting his sleep. Plus, we can take this into any other car.....without lugging around the base.

Another aspect of this Car Seat is that it has been tested...... if a company TALKS about the test, then I believe they worked on it.

The car seat is sturdy, not heavy, and the only downside is infants grow up too quick. Therefore you need to adjust your need for a larger convertible carseat.

I like this car seat, mainly because of the Safety construction!

Review:
We returned this after buying the Britax Roundabout G4.1 and comparing them side-by-side... the Britax was better looking and used better quality materials and fabric, and the Graco was very bulky in comparison and it would barely fit into our 2005 Corolla where the Britax fits no problem... the head supports on the Graco seemed like a good idea for safety, but the Britax actually seems to have more safety considerations built in for the more typical fender-bender type of auto accidents as it is designed to transfer much of that energy downward into a shock absorbing base system.

Due mostly to the size of the Graco, we didn't give it much of a chance, but the seat-belt material made buckling and unbuckling a lot easier with the Britax, and the belt material is very thick with the Britax, so it doesn't twist. My wife wasn't happy with the Graco from day 1, but it was nice to see it side-by-side with the Britax to see the quality and design differences between these models. We used the Britax B-agile travel system until about 1 year of age and switched to this non-removable style of carseat around 1 year. I'm writing this review to recommend the
Britax Roundabout G4.1 instead of the Graco... although Graco is a little cheaper, we felt that the Britax outshined the Graco by a pretty good margin. Our daughter loves cup holders, but that actually hasn't been an issue.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: non-removable style of carseat
Material: better quality materials and fabric, seat-belt material, belt material is very thick
Installation Type: seat-belt

Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: straps are easy to fasten

Review: Our son is 10 months old and not heavy at 20lbs, but he is long at 31 inches.  He is too tall to get into his infant car seat.  Expecting to have to use a car seat rear-facing for another year plus, we have been shopping for a convertible seat.  My husband and I were looking into the Britax and Recaro brand convertible carseats.  When we got the Recaro, it's a nice seat but when installed rear-facing in either a Toyota 4Runner or BMW 3-series wagon, it nearly blocks your ability to see through your back window.  We are told the middle is best and rear-facing is best but how dangerous is it for me to drive with reduced visibility?  I know that the baby weight limits are reduced with the Combi Cocorro, but we should be able to use it for at least 2 years and it meets our safety needs perfectly. Not to mention that the seat is adorable.  It is also easy to get our little man in and out of it, which makes us all happy.  I installed it myself in the 4Runner. My SUV is a 2001 so I don't have the Latch system.  I used a pool noodle under it and also installed the tether strap.  It was not difficult and the seat is very secure.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible, rear-facing
Weight Range of Child: 20lbs
Installation Type: Latch, tether strap

Review:
I love this car seat. I am an avid researcher and also work within a reasonable budget. I have an average sized sedan, but it sadly does not accommodate all car seats. I had the Britax B-Safe, and it was a snug fit for any passengers, and any front seat passenger could only recline the seat so far. Rather than buying a car to fit a seat, I figured there will be more options for the convertible car seats. Wrong. I tried every. single. one. at Babies R Us, to zero avail. I was trying to stick within a less than $200 budget so as much as I drooled over the NextFit it was too pricey ($299.99 at BRU).
When I did the test fit, it was considerably comfortable. It is much narrower in the base compared to other convertible car seats. It has multiple recline positions so if you're fitting it in a small car rear-facing, you can adjust it so your baby is safe but the front passengers can also be comfortable. Also, the overall height of the seat isn't ridiculous. For people not in an SUV- other convertible car seats literally were touching the roof of my car (ie all the Safety 1st brands!) They are so tall, I literally fit in them. This seat has a great adjustable head rest so by the time my child is tall enough to fully extend it she will be forward facing and it will blend into the car's headrest but while smaller and rear facing it has a lower height profile.
I am only 5'3 and 100lbs, so getting straps tight has always been a downfall. With a husband deployed, I was honestly really nervous it would be a nightmare. Using LATCH, with the classic style strap to tighten plus the come-along style pulley, I was able to get it so tight it doesn't budge. I do recommend for those with leather, you put non-slip underneath! The straps can extend pretty long, so you wont have issues reaching your LATCH system (the Britax were just barely long enough even in my small car).
My daughter loves her new seat, she can see much more out the windows and its comfortable as far as I can tell. I have zero issues tightening the shoulder/chest straps as others have mentioned. The actual strap you pull is substantial and easy to get leverage on.
I am sure we will enjoy this seat as my child grows. Chicco, I am a convert.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible car seat  
Weight Range of Child:  
Installation Type: LATCH  
Harness Type: shoulder/chest straps  
Material:

The side protectors are really great I just feel this sense of security knowing my baby is really safe. It feels like a 300 dollar car seat. The cushions come off easily for washing. The cup holders are soft. There’s nothing I don’t like about this thing and I am really picky.

Product is incredibly difficult to install and even when installed is INCREDIBLY unsafe. When installed rear-facing the seat has almost 6 INCHES of play. Review: This is a great car seat.  I have a narrow back seat and it let me fit 3 across, two of this seat and a rear facing infant seat.  It is super easy to install when using the upper anchor and a lap belt, we couldn't use the lower tethers since we needed three across.  The best thing of all to my mind is that the liner comes out really simply once the car seat is out of the car, it's also washable, and the strap that goes from the shoulder to the crotch is all one piece that the buckles thread onto so you can remove the whole thing, put the buckles in the dishwasher and the belt and cover in the washer and get it all clean.  The buckle that comes up from the crotch doesn't come out but it doesn't have the crevices that the other pieces do so it wipes down easily.  If you need a skinny car seat or have a travel sick kid this seat is a must!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Upper Anchor, Lap Belt, Lower Tethers
Material: Washable Liner, Cover, Belt, Buckles

Review:
Frankly, I don't know why I even bought this car seat, I think all those positive reviews mislead me.

The car seat is very flimsy. It's plastic and it's thin, it's like a cardboard when it comes to protection. I don't see how it can protect from any significant side impact.

Also, it was constantly sliding around the seat of the car because it's not attached to the seat by latches or any other way.

Finally, my daughter who is only 6 and is below average in height complained that the shoulder strap hurt her shoulder and I couldn't adjust the height I replaced it with a better, safer carseat. I feel much better now.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: plastic and it's thin, it's like a cardboard when it comes to protection
Installation Type: not attached to the seat by latches or any other way
Harness Type: shoulder strap hurt her shoulder and I couldn't adjust the height

Review: It have been 2 years since I bought this seat. Grandson started using it as a rear facing seat and We still use it for our very tall 3  year old. I actually bought 2 of them one for us and one for parents of the child. Its very  comfortable and sturdy! The only problem is - installation!!!! 😠 This seat will be great and comfortable if you are planning to keep it in one car without  moving it, otherwise it will be big pain in the rear! I still highly recommend it as great one for the money and it s on sale right  now , so please feel safe to buy it as wonderful protection for your little one!!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing seat
Installation Type: installation

Review: Great color!  We bought it for our son (I was worried it would be too girly, but it's not).  Super comfortable and easy to install!  It is big, but we have it installed in a small hybrid and it fits fine.  If you already had a Britax Chaperone, this one will fit with about an extra inch or so.

Review: Great car seat for the money BUT a pain to install correctly, finally when all was said and done I got it in BUT  they give you a cup holder and there is nowhere in the instructions that tells you where it goes.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: a pain to install correctly, finally when all was said and done I got it in

Review:
We just purchased the boulevard g4 in Laguna, and this is the fourth Britax seat we own. Currently, we have another boulevard, a frontier and a parkway sgl. I love them, and I will never buy anything other than Britax. Since my oldest was born 10 years ago, I have gone through numerous graco, evenflo, safety 1st and Eddie Bauer seats, that were all junk compared to Britax. I thought all car seats were crappy, and I would just have to deal with them. That is, until I bought my first Britax 5 years ago. Since then, I have done my research on car seat safety, and I personally would never trust a cheap seat again.

The boulevard has many great features. My favorite is the separate latch straps. I get a tight fit every time, and no need to untwist straps threaded through the seat. The easy adjustable headrest, removable cover without unthreading the harness, headwings, hugs, safe cell technology, steel reinforcement and tether that can be used rear facing- all wonderful! Not only great in safety, but also convenience.

There is only one con I can come up with, on this pattern. This would never, ever deter me from buying a Britax.
The material: It is so strange to me, how every pattern that Britax offers, varies in material. Some of them are all velvet/microfiber/plush, some are nylon, some are cotton etc. The Laguna blue color is a cotton material, so it doesn't seem as though it will clean up easily. It seems as though it will absorb any dirt or spills. Also, the black trim is a harder, scratchy material. So that is found on the headwings, infant pillow and strap covers. Now, it does not bother me enough to exchange it. I prefer color on the seats, and this is currently the only color offered. But, I own another boulevard, that is made of a plush material, and it just seems logical to offer a softer material on the head. It doesn't bother the baby at all though, so I don't think it's a huge deal. The only part that bothers me, is the shoulder strap covers. Since they are harder, they don't bend as easily and seem as snug as the other ones I have. The other two seats I own (boulevard and frontier) came in different materials and are a much better fit. And my other boulevard, frontier and parkway all are made of a different material in the middle. That material is easier to clean, and seems more repellant.

So, if buying this again, I would still purchase the Laguna pattern. But if they offered Laguna in the same material as sterling or onyx? I would choose that option. I just don't know why Britax can't be consistent with their material. Oh well! Their seats more than make up for their material choice. I just wanted to point out the material on the Laguna, in case someone would want to know. I look to these reviews, when making a purchase that I can't see in person.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: The Laguna blue color is a cotton material, so it doesn't seem as though it will clean up easily. It seems as though it will absorb any dirt or spills. Also, the black trim is a harder, scratchy material. So that is found on the headwings, infant pillow and strap covers. But, I own another boulevard, that is made of a plush material. The only part that bothers me, is the shoulder strap covers. Since they are harder, they don't bend as easily and seem as snug as the other ones I have. The other two seats I own (boulevard and frontier) came in different materials and are a much better fit. And my other boulevard, frontier and parkway all are made of a different material in the middle. That material is easier to clean, and seems more repellant.

Review: What a beast - never needed to us it in a crash, but I feel like it would be safe for my twins.  It is heavy and i like that.  It is so hard to install at first, until you learn not to tighten the strap SUPER tight. When you push the seat down onto it it tightens in with presure.  I went HULK on it and made it nearly impossible to open (I am a strong 220lb guy).  So with that tip, you should be good to go.  Recommend this!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review: Unbelievably terrible.Let me tell you that a better version of this by some other company could be a winner. I really wanted this to work, I really wanted to like it!  First, the seat is so small and hard that no child will ever sit in it for more then 10 minutes. The entire seating area is about the size of 8.5x11 piece of copy paper. It’s unsafe because no child will sit on it period. My child ask if she could use it with a pillow on her bum because the “cushion” was hard. The top tether digs into the child’s neck and it’s hard to keep in place when they are trying to put it in. Getting out of this thing is also a nightmare. In an emergency no way you take them out. I can go on and on but, I think you get the point. I ordered 2 and I am sending them both back. Good idea terrible execution. 2 Star to make sure people read this.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Material: hard cushion

Review:
absolutely amazing and has allowed us to fit a 2, 4 and 5 year old in the back seat of our mini van (to allow for the newborn and 1 year old in the captain chairs), the 4 and 5 yos use the mifolds. Thanks for saving us $10,000 by allowing us the option to not have to buy a new van!

Seriously though, it takes a littke bit to get used to but everyone complaining how difficult theses are to use confuses me. My 50 month old and my 64 month old can strap themselves in and get themselves out. I feel like the people who complain about this product are short on patience and confidence in their children's ability.

We'vehad zero issues with the straps, buckles, anchors and sliding. Seriously, a young child can do this by themselves and I have seen the proof.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: mifolds
Weight Range of Child: 2, 4 and 5 year old, 50 month old, 64 month old
Harness Type: straps, buckles
Installation Type: anchors

Review: These Costco car seats are wonderfully non-bulky, but the straps are so tight and limited! We have two of the smaller versions that are supposed to go to 35lbs, which is how much my 4 yo weighs. But even with the straps on the highest setting, we can barely clip it around her chest. She is average height and size. So I ordered this larger Cosco seat assuming since it’s rated to hold much larger kids, the straps would clearly be big enough. Nope. She has another 2 in 1 booster from another brand that she fits in great and we haven’t even started extending the straps. We have used 6+ car seats and boosters over the years so we’re not incompetent at how to use them-Cosco straps are just across the board shorter and more limited. VERY frustrating. We returned ours after both my husband and I tried to make sure we weren’t missing something but we both concluded it’s just a poor design.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: supposed to go to 35lbs, rated to hold much larger kids
Harness Type: straps are so tight and limited, straps on the highest setting, barely clip it around her chest, straps would clearly be big enough, Cosco straps are just across the board shorter and more limited

Review: Arrived on time and just as described. Definitely not the padding and extras of higher priced car seats but never heard a complaint yet from my 2 year old. Straps are as all carseats that I tried (cosco, Eddie Bauer, and Graco)  kind of a pain but do the job.

Weight Range of Child: 2 year old

Review:
This car seat seemed to have everything and received such great reviews that I thought it would be perfect....I was wrong and am not shopping for a new seat.

* This seat is not comfortable for an older child. Once the baby insert comes out, it's extremely hard. Infact, my son has a scar on his lower back, right on the spine from it constantly rubbing the spot where the latch is secured to the seat. This is THROUGH all the cushioning. My son has not sat in that car seat for a year and the spot is still visible on his back. I did not realize what was causing this until I noticed my daughter had a scab in that exact spot. Quick fix was to add a cloth diaper under the padding for more support. And it's not just my seat, my nephew has the same spot from his seat as well.

* The crotch strap is really close to the back. This is a huge pain every time my 3 year old gets in the seat. I have to dig under her to find it. My son, who is skinny and short for his age, complained a lot about this strap so I eventually moved him to a new booster. I was attempting to get more use out of this Nautilus by giving it to my daughter. But the crotch strap is a paint for her as well.

* It's not comfortable for long trips, there's no padding, too upright, might be okay for an older child who can sit more upright, but I would NOT recommend this for kids under four.

* The release is sometimes difficult to open. This can be a good thing if you have a houdini child, but when I'm hanging off the back of my driver's seat trying to release her seat belt so she can jump out for school it can be a real pain.

On the plus side, I have washed the covers multiple times and it's held up great in the wash. The cupholder is great (I wish they would put in an insert that could slide out to go in the dishwasher though), as is the hidden toy cubbies.

If you do only local driving, this is a great, inexpensive car seat that will last many years. However, if you tend to drive for an hour or more quite often, I would recommend looking elsewhere. I wish I had known, it would have saved me a lot of money.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing  
Weight Range of Child: older child, kids under four, 3 year old  
Harness Type: crotch strap  
Material: cushioning, padding, covers, cloth diaper

Review: I like this car seat I feel like it isn't to awkward to carry and it has really soft material. I also like how easy it is to adjust to a taller size for my baby as well as it is sturdy and doesn't move once it is installed! Very happy with my purchase!

The middle strap is great to keep the child from sliding down. Really stands up to the wear and tear of day to day use, and very easy to wash the covers.

The ONLY reason I gave the seat 4 stars instead of 5 is that we have found the release for the straps (to loosen them) is not easily accessible and we both fumble around for it.  Otherwise, it's a well-made seat and our son is very comfortable in it.

Review:
DO NOT BUY THIS CARSEAT. We have had this car seat for one year. It was part of the ClickTight recall and we requested and used the recall packet...few months later, the seat is broken again rendering it useless in the event of an accident.

Worst about it is that Britax customer service has not responded to us. Still waiting after over one week.

Please do yourself a favor and purchase another car seat that actually works.

Review:

Love the price and the look (especially with the newborn inserts)

It's not too heavy, and the cup holders are excellent to fold in whenever we travel with 3 carseats in the backseat. It's snug but works for carpooling on occasion.

Review: After reading the great reviews I thought this would be a good budget buy. Now after having and using this seat for several months I can honestly say that I thoroughly hate this car seat.  first, It is beyond difficult to tighten my kid into the seat. Even when I have the straps perfectly even I still have to pull with all my might to tighten.  Which leads me to the second issue-- The seat does not maintain a good and safe angle no matter how I buckle it into my car, ESPECIALLY when I'm tightening my kid in with me pulling on the strap, it tips the carseat out of position.  (I'm using rear facing) On the positive, I do appreciate the size of the carseat, an the light weight.  So if you are looking for a car seat that is small and light but will make you hate your life every time you buckle your kid in, this is for you ;)

Review:

He says he’s comfortable which is great. Has you see, the lower seat belt goes across his lap (AND NOT HIS STOMACH) and the body strap is down by his shoulder (AND NOT HIS NECK AND FACE).

This booster seat is not meant give height but instead places the seat belt as if an adult is wearing it. This item feels like 2 lbs if that. Fits right in my purse, as we’re exploring Cali…. I can put it in and out of my purse.

The cup holders fit their  camelbak water bottles and they like the little "secret compartment" on the other side of the seat. These seats look sleek and attractive in the back seat. Review: I would have given this car seat a much better review until last week.  The plastic on the horizontal buckles has warped.  It is almost impossible to snap them together and unsnap them. This has been annoying at the least and turned dangerous when my son was leaned back throwing up while sitting in the seat and I could not get the buckle separated for a good 30 seconds, that's a very long time in a situation like that, especially when it should take no more than 1 second to unsnap the buckle.  I continue to manipulate the plastic so that the male and female parts fit better but it continues to be very difficult to snap and unsnap this buckle. Something needs to be done by Graco to rectify this situation.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: The plastic on the horizontal buckles has warped, making it almost impossible to snap and unsnap them.

Review: This is the 8th car seat I have had in the past six years and I am planning on it being the last! I always have a hard time getting the seat tight enough with the LATCH system and this seat ELIMINATES that problem! It is so easy to install with the regular seat belt and does not move once the seat is clicked into place. The anti rebound bar (ARB) is a cool feature too. It's purpose is to prevent the rear facing seat from slamming back into the seat during an accident. There are several other safety checks and balances included in this seat. For instance, Britax has basically created an "anti lock" strap that helps absorb the impact in a crash so that baby or big kid does not absorb it. The seat is sleek. I like the black and gray. It is heavy but not as heavy as others that we have owned. Finally, my 14 month old seems to like it too!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: easy to install with the regular seat belt, does not move once the seat is clicked into place, always have a hard time getting the seat tight enough with the LATCH system and this seat ELIMINATES that problem
Seat Type: rear facing seat
Material: sleek, black and gray, heavy but not as heavy as others

Review: When we received this item, I was really surprised because it got to us so quickly. That evening my husband attempted to install it in our Ford Fusion and it was really big. On top of it already being pretty large, my husband had and extremely difficult time trying to install it properly. My daughter liked the idea of a new car seat but when she fell asleep in it she looked extremely uncomfortable. The head rest didn't cradle her head at all and she slumped forward a bit. I was excited to get this booster when I bought it and was upset that it didn't work out for us. It would probably be better in an SUV or something.

It fits perfectly in my Nissan Rogue without crowding the back seat. I am purchasing a second one for my husbands car as it also goes easily in a Dodge Challenger. If your considering keeping your baby rear facing up to 40lbs as the seat permits, you might want to switch to the  graco extend2fit since leg room may become an issue, but it is absolutely what I was looking for. I just returned a safety first all in one seat because it was next to impossible to install and still never felt safe for my baby. I am so happy I decided to switch seats!!

Quality of the maxi cosi is poor. Wabbly handle, horrible design and quality of the canopy and so on. The only thing I like about maxi cosi vs. chicco is the fabric.

I spray the entire seat fabric with SHOUT and wash it and it comes out looking brand new again. It's a very lovely carseat. If for any reason I shall need another, I would most likely repurchase.

Review:
I have had this car seat for nearly 3 years. I have really liked it with the exception of it being a little bulky to change from vehicle to vehicle.

Recently though, we have gotten a tear in the harness strap. I went Graco to buy a replacement strap, but none appeared, so I called. I was told that was NOT an option with this seat. Are you kidding?? A nearly 300 dollar car seat and it's not an option seems unacceptable to me. Especially since this is supposed to be a "forever" seat. I was upset on the phone and was told the most they could do would be a 40 dollar rebate on a new seat. Again still unacceptable. I'll be calling back. Anyway, I highly recommend checking into replacement parts before buying.

Review:
My daughter is almost 17 months old and we've been using our Chicco Keyfit 30 since she was born. It's been a really great seat. The carrier is a little heavier than some of the other brands out there but the padding on the seat is good and makes you feel like there's more surrounding your little one in case of an accident.
One con for us was when she was still too small to ride in the BOB jogging stroller without the carseat adapter, the adapter doesn't work with the Chicco. It does work with the Graco so we bought the cheapest one we could find (Snugride) and wow, what a difference in quality... not to say the Snugride is awful because I really don't know but I do know that the Chicco felt much more substantial and I wouldn't feel as comfortable using the Graco in the car on a regular basis.
Anyways, installation was very easy with the LATCH system and it fit in the middle backseat of my '08 Toyota Corolla perfectly without having to push the front seats forward excessively. I recommended this seat to my friend whose wife recently had a baby and they love it as well.

This seat barely fits in our car( have to move front seat all the way up, and put rolled blanket under carseat to bolster it and it still slides quite a bit.) If your tall, your screwed. Your knees will be in the dash(we have a 4 door 2006 Jetta, for comparison.) and it doesn't work well in our truck either. I think it will likely be fine once we are able to forward face him. But for now..Probably give this one to grandma as a back up and get something else, which sucks because we got this one due to its affordability.

Review:
I kept going back and forth between the Extend2Fit and 4ever and ended up with the Extend2 Fit because it was more narrow, but I didn't realize just how narrow and compact it is until I installed it. It
Much to my surprise it installed in the middle seat of my 2013 Prius very well, even better than the Chicco Keyfit base for the the infant seat. And the multiple recline positions give wiggle room to find the perfect angle while still ensuring proper recline for age. Install was fairly easy, I did have to put my weight on the seat and pull to get a secure fit but I had to do the same with the infant seat base. Like others have mentioned, tightening the harness straps isn't as smooth as other seats but I've found it works better if you pull the slack out of the straps that go across the legs first and then pull the strap that tightens the harness.
I do not like the square cup holders. Its seems trivial but kids love sippy cups and it'd be nice to be able to use the cup holders for all the cups. Evenflo Symphony has the right idea for this. Also, one of the main reasons I switched my 4 month old over early is because the fabric on her infant carrier makes her so sweaty and uncomfortable that she hates being in there, so I was very disappointed to discover the giant warning label printed onto the back of the seat. The fabric seems to keep her cool except in that one spot and there's been a square, damp, sweaty spot on her shirt every time. If this seat didn't fit so well and have good safety ratings it would definitely be going back. It's only February so I'm nervous to see how that label does during the summer.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Harness Type: Harness straps
Material: Fabric

Review: After many months of research, I finally chose the Evenflo Triumph Advance LX.  I purchased this in late 2008 for my 16 month old daughter.  We have used this for about 2 months now.  She has never liked any car seat, and still doesn't really enjoy this one, but I do.  The seat is big and comfy and seems much safer with the sides around the head area.  The best feature(s) to me are the adjustable straps.  The shoulder straps slide easily up and down to the correct position and stay that way until I move them, and the knob for adjusting the lap straps are so easy to use.  I can see now that, unfortunately, my oldest child was probably not secured safely in his seat.  I initially wanted a seat that reclined and this was one reason I went with the Triumph Advance.  However, once I read the manual, it seems that the recline position is only to be used with the rear-facing position and my child is too big for that.  The only drawback would be how large this seat is.  I have a larger vehicle so it is not an issue for me but I don't think this seat would fit in a small car.  We are currently using the back seat, middle position and I sometimes have difficulty in seeing around the seat to back up.  It sits quite a bit taller than our old car seat.  Overall, I am extremely pleased with this car seat and am thrilled with my decision to go with Evenflo Triumph.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing position mentioned
Weight Range of Child: 16 month old daughter, too big for rear-facing
Installation Type: back seat, middle position
Harness Type: adjustable straps, shoulder straps, lap straps
Material: comfy

Review:
I picked this car seat out before my son was even born! I love it so much. It is SOOOO easy to install. I have it installed in my Toyota corolla. I do have to use a large pool noodle to make it level, but it is such a great car seat. So easy to adjust the straps, my son always looks so comfortable in it. We only had one car seat for a while so we were always switching cars, and I have to say, if I had to do that with any car seat, I'm glad it was this one. It is SO easy, just click the things onto the bars in the seat and push down until it's tight! So much easier than the ones you have to pull on the strap to get tight. I can never do those by myself. The cup holders are great because they fit all different size cups thanks to the elastic! I would recommend this car seat over and over again!

If I had to complain about anything at all it would be that the extra padding in the seat, like the top insert feels like it won't last very long. Just feels like it may get smashed over time and not be as cushy. But that's not really a huge deal to me.

Review:
Maxi-cosi Priori convertible carseat in gipsy-

I read so many reviews on this seat and now that it is here and we're using it I really disagree with a lot of the bad reviews it has gotten. It works great for us. My 2 1/2 yr old fits in it really well, (she is a 50% percentile kid if that helps you get an accurate size for her age) and I am not worried about her growing out of it. It took us maybe 15 minutes to get the straps moved up and have it installed in the car. The latch features on this seat are so much easier to use then the past 3 car seats we've owned. It is very secure in our car and it doesn't take up nearly as much space compared to our last seat, which is a big deal because we have to squeeze 3 kids in the back of our jetta. My daughter usually isnt able to see out the window and the first time she rode in it, it was like she was seeing everything for the first time. She was soo happy looking out the window and telling us everything she saw. And the first time she rode in it she fell asleep and I was so happy to be able to try out the amazing recline feature. The recline feature is a huge bonus and I know it will come in handy with all the trips we take. I know some other reviews talked about the fabric being poorly constructed but I would have to disagree. I know we haven't had it long enough to wash it but the construction looks like high quality and i am not worried about it coming apart. Overall I love this seat and would recommend it to anyone. My husband who is the biggest skeptic loves this seat and suggested we should buy another one for our other car.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 2 1/2 yr old, 50% percentile
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: straps
Material: fabric

Review:
Great, easy to use car seat cart for traveling!
Used it for the first time this past week with a Graco Extend2Fit seat - had to pop the recline all the way up but the LATCH hooks popped right onto the little holders and then I used the tether from the back to the bar along the bottom to secure it additionally and it was as snug as can be once I cinched down the straps a little bit.
100% recommend using it for flying - it made bringing our car seat SO much easier to bring through the airport.

My only con to the cart is that how it latches closed is quite tight metal on metal, so it can be a bit tricky to open up or close without nipping your fingers (I learned the hard way once or twice)

Review:
We've had the Peg Prego convertible for over a month now - our son is 10.5 months old, about 23 lbs. He seems comfortable in it - never once complained. He even fell asleep in it today when we were driving, which confirmed for me that he was fine in it.
We had the retailer fit two different car seats - this one (Prego), and the Recaro. We got one whole inch more of space with the Peg Prego compared to the Ricaro (we could move the front seat back a bit more), which is why we decided on the Peg Prego. It's a bit more expensive compared with the other seats, but overall, easy to install, and looks pretty good too. Also, we found that it was easier to seat our son into the Peg Prego since the sides do not rise up very high (for the Recaro, we'd have to risk pressing his head to the ceiling of the car to seat him in the car seat). We have a small car (Acura TSX).

Review:
When my wife and I were shopping for car seats this past Spring (2007), our approach was to find the best rear-facing infant car seat regardless of price (high or low). We live in Atlanta where public transportation is almost never a realistic or safe option and thus everyone has to drive everywhere (especially on the weekends!). So we knew we needed a quality car seat that could stand up to daily use.

In our search, we looked at all of the major brands. Nothing really impressed us until we found the Combi Connection. The quality is really unmistakable--a solid handle, amazingly soft Eggshock foam (I don't think the new Connections have the Eggshock foam, which, if true, is a huge misjudgment on Combi's part), EPS foam, a quality pad cover made from expensive cloth, and a fantastic canopy. The Connection was also very easy to install using the LATCH system. The Combi Connection stroller is also great--we use it everyday and have been very happy with it. Some have criticized the Connection for not having notches to place the seat in the top half of a shopping cart. This is actually a safety feature--the American Academy of Pediatrics and Consumer Reports both recommend that parents not attach infant car seats to shopping carts in this manner.

When I start shopping for my son's convertible car seat, I will again not let price be a consideration (high or low). I now know that a car seat is all about installation. No matter how nice it is, if it is difficult to install properly, your child is not safe. Right now, I'm focused on the Britax Marathon and the Graco Comfortsport.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-facing infant car seat, convertible car seat
Installation Type: LATCH system

My daughter loves the cup holders and feels like such a big girl in this seat (she's 4). She can't undo the lower buckle yet, which is diappointing to her, but I'm hoping with time she'll get it (sure is easier on mom when she can). I highly recommend this seat!

Review:
I chose this model for the cup holders and the adjustable arm rests. My son loves having the cup holders and the fact that they can be pushed in. The seat overall is easy to use and my son figured out how to buckle his seat belt on his own right away.

The fabric is not the best quality. After using for only a week, there are some threads coming out so I'm not sure how long it will hold up, which is disappointing. The plastic part of the seat does seem durable though, which is important. I did expect the arm rests to be more easily adjustable. I have them set at an ideal height now but they lock in tight and I'm not sure how easily I will be able to more them later on. We shall see. And there's only two height settings so there really isn't that much of an adjustment to be made anyway but for a kid, I guess it's sufficient.

Overall, I'm satisfied with the seat, especially for the price, which is quite reasonable.

Review:
Have not had this seat long, but love it so far. Super comfy for my daughter and I feel that she is really well-protected.

Quick tip regarding the click-tight, which I didn't feel was clear in the manual: don't over-tighten the seat belt or latch belt!

If you are coming from any other type of seat, you're probably used to threading the belt and then pulling as hard as possible to get that sucker tight enough. The way the ClickTight is designed to work, is the frame puts extra pressure on the belt as it closes, creating that tension for you. The first time I tried to install, I saw right away why other reviewers have had issues with getting the seat to open back up again (even having to resort to pliers). If the belt is too tight, you have to force the seat closed and then it is nearly impossible to open again. What worked best for me was to just thread the belt through, removing any slack but not pulling it taut. Then close the seat - it should close with one firm push, you shouldn't have to force it - if you're struggling, try actually LOOSENING the belt a little. Once closed, THEN do the wiggle test and hopefully it should be rock solid. I'm really satisfied with the system, and hope that tip helps other people like it better, too!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: ClickTight, seat belt, latch belt, threading the belt, pulling to tighten, belt too tight, loosen the belt, wiggle test

Review: I bought this for a trip to California with my 2.5 year old daughter.  We have the diono radian carseat.  It fit perfectly using the superLATCH connectors.  We flew Southwest and I was able to wheel the cart + seat down the isle with no problems.  Unlatch the seat for setup in the airplane seat, and stow the cart in the overhead or under the seat relatively quickly.  I was traveling without another adult and this made it so much easier!  I could even wheel my daughter (38 pounds) through the airport in her carseat when we were in a hurry. I would recommend this to anyone traveling and planning on using a carseat on their flight. Even if I never fly with it again, this purchase was totally worth the money!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 38 pounds
Installation Type: superLATCH connectors

Review: The seat appears as if it can handle any size child at any point during the life of the seat weight limit, cannot be further from the truth.  The 3 point harness, which is the only factor that really makes the product a stand out, is set so low on the back rest that most kids past 2 do not fit.  What you dont know until you recieve is that the shoulder straps are much lower than an traditional car seat and that the straps must be at or above the child's sholder for the use of the 3 point harness to be possible.  DO NOT ASSEMBLE until you see if you really want to keep it, the head rest is close to impossible to de-assemble.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: cannot be further from the truth, most kids past 2 do not fit
Harness Type: 3 point harness, shoulder straps are much lower than an traditional car seat, straps must be at or above the child's sholder for the use of the 3 point harness to be possible

Her dad has a different Gracias style in his truck, but we notice how much easier car rides are for her when she's in this seat! It's such an easy installation, that on longer rides we will swap the seats.
