Review:
We bought two of these to fit in the backseat of my 2012 Jetta Sportwagen. The biggest selling point for me was the 3 across feature. The seats are slim but my kiddos seem to have plenty of room. We can fit a backless booster with the two car seats and have no problems (none leaning on the other, and access to the belt buckles is fairly easy).

What surprised me is how much I love the seatbelt lock off. Installation was a breeze and I have never had a forward facing car seat so secure that it didn’t budge even a 1/4”!

The rear facing seat for my 1 year old was easy to install and I marveled at the extra leg room it gave her compared to her infant car seat. It has two rear facing recline positions and the level indicator is easy to read. It’s also is a lot slimmer depth wise so my husband has more leg room in the front.

The seats sit lower than our previous car seat so it’s easier to have my 4 year old climb in and out on his own. He loves the double cup holders too. Since it’s fall, I can’t speak about the mesh fabric being cooling yet, but I love the quality of the fabric.

The only complaint I have is minor. I don’t like the chest clip buckle as I can’t unclip it one handed. While it means my 4 year old won’t unclip it while driving, it also means I need to park my coffee cup on the roof of the car to get the kids out. Minor issue compared to the wonderful features of the car seat overall.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 1 year old, 4 year old
Installation Type: seatbelt lock off
Harness Type: chest clip buckle
Material: mesh fabric

Review: This car seat is really padded for both safety and comfort.  The material is very easy to wipe clean.  If there are any "cons" I would say it isn't the easiest car seat to "find" the button inside to adjust the straps and the straps have, on occasion, twisted a little.  But, all-in-all, it's a pretty good car seat and I recommend it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: really padded, easy to wipe clean
Harness Type: straps have twisted, button to adjust straps

Review:
I purchased this infant seat for my second child, and I wish I had it for my first! I think you would be hard pressed to find a better car seat in this price category (especially if purchased with an Amazon Prime registry discount). I’ll just say that with our first we used the seat and base that came with our graco stroller travel system, and it was a pain to use. The base did not adjust, so we had to use a pool noodle underneath one side. The straps did not have the front pull to tighten and had to be manually adjusted in the back (for each time we were putting our son in and out of the seat!). The infant insert was useless and we used rolled up blankets around his head instead. The handle required both hands to adjust. We still used it until we upgraded to a convertible seat around 9-10 months, but it was annoying every time. This time around I was determined to get something nicer.

This seat is the opposite of all those things and more! The handle requires one hand to raise and lower, the straps loosen and tighten with ease, the fabric itself is comfortable and supportive, and the base is adjustable to get the seat perfectly level. The canopy is also lovely and makes this seat look high end. It works with our old stroller too, which is a plus! I guess I didn’t know what we were missing out on before. I scoped out a lot of infant seats before I purchased this one, and hands down, for the price point, this is a fantastic choice and I am very happy.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant seat, convertible seat  
Weight Range of Child: 9-10 months  
Installation Type: base  
Harness Type: straps, front pull to tighten  
Material: fabric, comfortable and supportive, infant insert

Review:
My child outgrew his baby bucket car sear and I needed a new one. This seat meet all the safety requirements, and has a ton of inserts, in case I get trapped into having a second baby with the woman. I have a Toyota FJ Cruiser and this, in it's rear-facing state is a nightmare to get the kid in. I do not blame the car seat, the seat is excellent, It's my fault for trying to hold on to my fun vehicle when I should have bought something more practical for children at this stage in my life. I just love the car and I don't want to give it up. You cant make me. It's mine baby... No. Wait...

In any event, this is about the car-seat and not my personal Peter-Pan / Man-Child issues... The car seat is great. The baby fits comfortably in it and he is safe. I think he will be in this one until he is big enough to sit right on the main seat. I think US Federal law states you need to be in a car seat until age 16...

Review:
This seat is described as fitting children from 5 lbs, but that is NOT accurate. We went to put our very average 7.5 lb infant in this seat with the infant insert and were horrified. Even when fully reclined, the seat does not recline far enough to safely support an infant. There is no head support for an infant. The straps are too far apart to properly secure an infant's shoulders. The infant insert positions the child higher up, but the straps then go across the infant's thighs instead of along the waist.

I am giving two stars because this seat would work well for a larger child. The no-thread straps are convenient. But, please, skip this seat for you littlest ones!

Review: After reading some of the other reviews, it seems clear that most parents have not dealt with this seat long enough to develop complete disdain for it. I initially loved this seat because my son was tall and he quickly outgrew his infant Snug Ride. I was so eager to get him into a seat that fit him that I picked up the first one at Target that hadn't had any recall issues. My girlfriend also had one so I figured safety in numbers. I was so wrong. I took a carseat safety course and they told us if we ever find ourselves saying we hate the carseat to get rid of it because it is unsafe.well I hate it and it is so unsafe! The straps are always getting twisted and are always uneven so one side will be tight while the other is loose. secondly, the side compartments for drinks and snacks are impossible to remove and one broke off on its own. The chest piece never clicks completely and has come undone several times on its own. The bottom point will click and the top point will pull apart. I can always move it more than an inch even when it is latched and buckled in. It is hard to thread the seatbelt through the hole for it and it never seems to fit my son right even after redoing the straps.I will never buy another evenflo and I can not wait to replace this seat with something that will do what it is intended to do. DO NOT BUY THIS SEAT YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review:
Forward facing , this seat is fantastic, sturdy and easy to set up. My kid loves this seat and the cup holders.
Rear facing , this seat is very difficult to install and after watching several videos online and reading a million comments I figured out what I was doing wrong. The manual and the. Videos on the safety site do not explain the correct way to pull the anchor strap at the base. You are supposed to pull the strap through the car seat at an angle to allow the strap to shortened. If this is installed in correctly your seat will tip over the second you make a turn and this is very dangerous for you child. Safety 1st should make it clearer in both their manual and videos how to properly install this car seat, perhaps slow down and zoom in on the anchor strap installation to make sure parents install properly and kids are not swaying around in something that is supposed to keep them safe.
Luckily for me my kid is big enough to start foward facing so that is how it has been installed in our car without any issues.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward facing, Rear facing
Installation Type: anchor strap, install

Review:
The Graco Nautilus 3-in-1 Car Seat is unable to rear-face. Although this is the #1 Best-seller on Amazon, it is less safe for under-2 year olds than rear-facing car seats. Consumer Reports states, "The study states that children up to 23 months old are about 75 percent less likely to die or sustain serious injury in a rear-facing car seat than a forward-facing one." I can't take that chance with my child.

I purchased two of these carseats thinking that Amazon reviewers were probably in the know, but I returned both as this is an unsafe product for those under the age of 2.

Review: This seat was 30% less on Amazon compared to Target.  The latch system which connects to OEM vehicle seats is easy to latch and un-latch.  The latches have a red release button.  Be careful some other car seats including other Graco models have a simpler latch system that has a hook with a spring that is very difficult to release.  The latches in the photo are best and easiest and come standard on this model seat.  The seat tilts easily for adjustment, it has two cup holders that can be removed, and is comfortable for baby.  Great budget seat! Very happy with it. We looked at many different seats.  We are grandparents and we bought this seat to haul our granddaughter around in our car because we get to see her often.  So blessed!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: latch system which connects to OEM vehicle seats is easy to latch and un-latch, latches have a red release button, simpler latch system that has a hook with a spring that is very difficult to release, latches in the photo are best and easiest and come standard on this model seat

It is a little narrower than most seats, and it says it's approved for flying. Outside of that,  it's not the strongest feeling carseat I've ever had, but that's comparing to European brands. For the price point, its an easily adjustable and lightweight carseat. The straps are easy to tighten and loosen, and its fairly easy to raise or lower. It's easy to clean as well. Overall, id recommend  it and use it for transporting toddlers in my daycare.

I researched for days on which carseat to buy for my son. This was by far the best value with the highest ratings. It had everything I was looking for - cupholders, extended leg room, comfortable, and most importantly: SAFE! You do not need to spent $500 on a carseat to keep your baby safe.

Review: We've been using this car seat for about two weeks now and my very tall 14-month-old has no complaints. He loves putting his VTEC toys in the cupholder and it looks as if he is able to fall asleep quite easily on longer car rides as long as he has his pacifier and burp cloth next to his cheek. It's easy to installation. I only struggled getting the car seat into the upright back positio once I pulled it out of the box. The material is very breathable and spills on the material are wiped up quite easily. I wish Graco would consider an adaptation to the non-cupholder car seat arm. It would be much easier for someone to get their toddler out of the car seat if the arm would somehow swivel out or pull down. Since my son is so tall I often have to find a tricky way to maneuver him out of the car seat. Lifting him straight up and over the arm often results in his head brushing the roof of the car or very narrowly missing hitting the door frame. I'm sure it is not comfortable for my son to experience his left leg being brushed every time he is removed from the car seat.

Review:
I bought this when it was a great price for our spare seat in my husbands truck. Here are some of my observations.
-it's HUGE. Like side to side it takes up a lot of space.
-it's very light, which you would think is nice but when it comes to a car seat it makes me nervous. Like how sturdy can it be if it's so light?
-it is a pain in the butt to install when using the latch system. It just has cheap clips not the nice kind that pricier seats have. And I have the hardest time tightening and loosening the latch strap. I have to make my husband do it after I usually end up cursing at it a little bit.
-it doesn't have protective cushions on the straps so my son usually ends up with red marks on his neck from where they dig into him.

Overall, it's ok for a cheap spare but I wouldn't want this for my every day car seat. We have 2 other brands in addition to this one and this is my least favorite of the 3.

Review:
We have been using this car seat for over a year now and it is still in great shape, it has held up well to our two young kids. The quality was great from the beginning and has seen lots of use. It installs/removes easily (relative to other car seats we have tried), it's easy to clean and remove the fabric/padding for washing (my wife's favorite part), it still fits securely in the car and shows no signs of ware (amazingly with the amount of usage it gets, roughly 7-10 driving hours/week and moving between cars periodically). The cup holder and armrests with built in pockets work well for the kids keeping everything within reach. The adjustable seat angle is just right in our Toyota Mini-Van to keep the kids upright yet still comfortable and, of course, safe. The adjustable seat back height allows it to be used for larger kids which was great when or oldest was ready to upgrade to a larger size; we are able to keep using the same seat! We bought this model when our second child was big enough to sit forward, we have the previous model of this seat as well for our younger child (that seat has been in use for about 4 years now) and that seat is also still in great shape! I expect these seat to out last our kids needs, but if we ever had to buy another car seat it would be the Graco Nautilus!

The only down side is the padding around the buckle is constantly in the way for the belt latches and I have to constantly pull it down, this was not a problem with the previous model; this is only a minor inconvenience every couple of uses and compared to the everything we like about this seat it's hardly worth mentioning.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: larger kids
Installation Type: installs/removes easily
Material: easy to clean and remove the fabric/padding for washing

Review: I read so many reviews for lightweight convertible car seats and finally settled on this one. As others have mentioned, it has a lot of sharp edges that make installation uncomfortable. You also can't see the level line but I took a metallic sharpie to that and fixed it.  I was surprised that it does indeed require a towel to be placed under it when rear facing in some vehicles. We live in a city and don't have a car, so I'm an expert at installing car seats using the seat belt. The first Lyft was not a problem - car seat installed fine, even though you will scrape your arms installing it. I'm also still unsure if the seatbelt should go in front of or behind the shoulder straps, which also run under the same area as the seatbelt path.  The second Uber was a no go - I couldn't get it to install correctly no matter what. It really does need a towel. There's no way that I'm going to carry a towel with me and take the time to install it correctly in an Uber. If you're looking for something for uber/taxis/lyft, keep looking.

Review:
Why do I HATE this thing???

1) INSTALLATION: First off, if you anything other than a flat, bench-style backseat it is a HUGE pain to install. I even took it to the fire station and they said that this was one of the most difficult installs (I have a Nissan Rogue) that they've ever done. Additionally, the instructions for using the rear-facing install are ridiculous. After about an hour, the installers decided it was safer to just use the seatbelt instead of the LATCH system. Even in my parent's truck, which is completely flat, when I use the LATCH system, the belt invariably gets twisted and you its a bear to use the release latch.

2) UNCOMFORTABLE: Even with towels and noodles underneath, this thing is at such a weird angle that when my daughter sleeps her head flops to a 90 degree angle from her body. ALSO... the button part of the harness pushes into her belly whenever I tighten her into the seat.

3) HARNESS: The harness catches about every other time that I put her in it. I already contacted customer service for this once and got a replacement, but the new one does the same thing. I end up having to finagle her out of the seat without releasing it and then pressing the release with one hand and jerking on the straps with the other.

OVERALL- this is a ridiculously uncomfortable, behmoeth, or a pain in the neck seat and if I could just afford a new chair this thing would be out of my life so fast and I wouldn't miss it for a mili-second.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Installation is difficult, especially on non-flat backseats; instructions for rear-facing install are ridiculous; installers used seatbelt instead of LATCH system; LATCH system causes belt to twist and release latch is hard to use.
Harness Type: Harness catches frequently; release mechanism is problematic; requires jerking straps to release.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately

I'm going to break down and spend the money to get the sit n stroll carseat/stroller. I really wish I had listened to the negative reveiws which turned out the be the accurate ones for me.

Review: This does NOT fit 5 pound babies. I know because after hours of research in preparation for our new child I bought three of these because they fit the best in our car because of their slim build. When I went to install them the only instructions were in 5 foreign languages, but none in English. I figured it out eventually though. Today we prepared to leave the hospital, and even with the straps as tight as possible our almost 8 pound little girl was not secure at all. We had to leave mom and the baby in the hospital while I ran to wal mart to buy ome of the car seats we were trying to avoid buying because at that point I had no other option. What if I weren't in the position to go buy another car seat? What if the added stress caused complications for the mother (who already just went through so much)?  You guys need to change this and advertise correctly. I'm very pissed off about my purchase and I'll be looking for another car seat with ratings from a company that hasn't already broken my trust, because safety is really important to me and I can't believe that your products are safe any more.

Review:
My 20 month old daughter and I were in a bad crash. Rear ended while stopped, the car hit us at about 40-50 mph which made the car turn sideways and hit the car in front of us (two impacts - rear and driver side). The car seat was installed on the driver side, so the impacts were on the same side as the car seat. Our car is totalled. I was able to walk away but with some very bad bruising and cuts and back injury. My daughter was completely unharmed - not a cut, bruise or bump. She was rear facing (which is important to do, even beyond the legal requirements) which I think helped save her from any back or neck injury. As soon as we got home, I ordered a replacement. I am still amazed at how she was so well protected.

The cover is fairly easy to take off. There are plenty of videos on youtube for demonstration. They are machine washable which is great. It is so easy to adjust the seat and harness height.

One negative: the level attached to the seat is on the opposite side of the tension strap, so when installing you have to be on one side to make sure it's level and the other side to pull the slack in the belt. I also don't like this seat for newborns. Technically it is approved for infant use, but I prefer a "pumpkin" style seat until she was big enough to sit up on her own.

I have bought this car seat 3 times now and would absolutely buy again.

Parents, install car seats correctly. Use the harness correctly (tight, clip over chest bone). Rear face as long as possible (3-4 years). Those can make a huge difference if the unthinkable happens.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear facing
Weight Range of Child: 20 month old, newborns, 3-4 years
Installation Type: tension strap, belt
Harness Type: harness, clip over chest bone
Material: cover, machine washable

If that never happens again, it's not a bad car seat for the price, but just beware of the strap attachment in the back. I'll update this after i get a response from Evenflo.

Review:
Why we love it:
- SAFETY: 5-point harness keeps our 3-year-old more securely in the seat for longer (plan to use until 5 years old)
- LONGEVITY: converts to seatbelt booster for use up to 110 lbs/57 inches
- COMFORT: lots of padding, great for longer car rides
- easy to buckle, doesn't tangle
- great design with lots of detail stitching
- attached to latch system, so it doesn't slide around and is easy for child to climb into
- affordable at under 70 dollars

After many hours of research online, comparing car seats in stores and ordering two car seats as "finalists" from Amazon, we have chosen this one for a number of reasons.

The main consideration for us was keeping our 3-year-old in a 5-point harness seat for as long as possible, but not wanting to purchase a new seat in two years when she moves up to a seatbelt booster. We had to purchase a new seat for her now, because our second child is moving up into her old seat. Technically, our child meets the minimum requirements for a seatbelt booster now, but after reading a few discussion on this, it seems that with every seat "upgrade" (changing to forward-facing, then changing to seatbelt booster) you loose a layer of safety. In fact, even in our car manual it states that due to a child's anatomy, they recommend a 5-point harness until 5 years old (their skeleton isn't mature enough to "properly" handle a car accident if they are using a seatbelt booster this young).

While safety was the biggest selling point for us to choose a convertible 5-point harness/seatbelt car seat, there are a few features that made this car seat stand out within this category. It is very nicely padded and the angle in the car is nice (not too steep or too upright), which makes for a comfortable ride. It's very easy to buckle, tighten, unbuckle, loosen and the straps don't tangle easily. This seat attaches to the latch system of the car, so it doesn't slide around when my 3-year-old climbs in the seat herself (this will be useful when we convert to the seatbelt function as well). As for any carseat that attaches via the latch system, you should check your car specs to see what the weight limit is for using a latch seat.

I also love the colors — sleek and neutral but with a bit of custom stitching and hints of red that give some nice detail. My child loves the cup holders (I never knew she cared, but it's the first thing she noticed...) — they have an elastic band in the front which holds in the cup.

The other seat we had ordered, but ended up returning is the "Evenflo Chase LX Harnessed Booster, Jameson" ([[ASIN:B016UJHJ8K Evenflo Chase LX Harnessed Booster, Jameson]]). The two models are very similar, the main difference was the amount of padding — the Maestro is just so much more comfortable, while with the Chase seat you could feel the hard plastic through the thinner padding.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: up to 110 lbs/57 inches, until 5 years old
Installation Type: latch system
Harness Type: 5-point harness, seatbelt booster

Review: For an almost $400 carseat, I would expect it to be durable. But within the first year, both sides of the foam on the headrest were broken. I finally got customer service to send a replacement, but it was the WRONG part. At that point, I super glued it and carried on. I'm not in the financial position to get a new seat - my father bought this for us. Next, the red piece at the bottom front of the seat (that changes the recline) broke off. It was stuck and I did not realize it - and I thought I wasn't pulling it right, so I pulled harder and it broke off. Now I can't ever change the recline again. It's stuck in a very upright position so my daughter's head lolls around when she falls asleep. On top of all the broken parts, I swear this thing weighs about 75 lbs. If you drive Uber, or ever need to take it in and out of the car, forget it. Also, the strap that holds the seat to the car is iMPOSSIBLE to loosen. We have another carseat - a $70 budget seat - which is much more durable and 100x easier to use. Do not recommend this Britax. If it's all broken apart and almost impossible to use correctly, how safe can it be even with all the bells and whistles?
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: foam on the headrest broken, red piece at the bottom front of the seat broke off, weighs about 75 lbs, strap that holds the seat to the car is impossible to loosen

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: As others have said it works GREAT for small spaces, but we have been using ours everyday for just under two years, and it popped! It also has an expiration date of only 4 years, where other seats have a 6-10 year life span. Also we live in Northern Wisconsin, and the thing was constantly losing air during the winter months due to the cold. Great concept, and idea, also wonderful for travel, but it falls flat for everyday use. I should note that we have 5 children, and the ONLY way to get three kids in the back row (due to their ages, and sizes) was to use the bubble bum for our oldest, as he was 7 at the time, and had out grown the Radian.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: bubble bum
Weight Range of Child: 7 at the time, had out grown the Radian
Material: popped, losing air

Special Features: Forward or Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible, No-Rethread Harness
Review:
The Cadillac of car seats.
Yes, this car seat is a bit more pricey, but hear me out.

We initially bought this when my son turned a year old. Absolutely loved everything about it he sat comfortably in it, super easy and roomy while he was still rear facing and it’s SO EASY TO CLEAN!!!! You just unzip the cover and it pops right out.. no need to fiddle with annoying straps and trying to remember how things went back together. That had me sold until recently.

We were in a really bad car accident, on the side that my son was on. Someone pulled out in front of us and we hit them. Our car was totaled but my son was perfectly safe and completely unharmed. I will be purchasing this car seat for all the future babies I have and will recommend it to anyone and everyone. Make the purchase, you won’t regret it! I cannot recommend this car seat enough! Remember, you get what you pay for. A $99 car seat sounds great, but I doubt it would have held up as good as this one did in our accident. I didn’t hesitate to purchase another one after the accident to replace the old one... seriously the best of the best right here!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Material: easy to clean, unzip the cover and it pops right out

Review: I have the 4-Ever Graco car seat for my 4-year old granddaughter, but needed another car seat for my 1-year old granddaughter. I wanted to save room because the Graco SlimFit would be behind the driver's seat. I love Graco products, and this car seat will not disappoint the pickiest of buyers. It definitely saves room while providing adequate leg room for the child. I highly recommend this product.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 4-year old, 1-year old
Installation Type: behind the driver's seat

Review: I have had the car seat for almost 6 months now.  We bit the bullet and bought 2, 1 for each vehicle.  They are not cheap and I feel fortunate we were able to afford them - but being able to keep our 4 year old son as safe as possible was all I needed.  Super easy to install, easy adjustable headrest, and the ability to keep him in a 5-Point harness longer than any other car seat was the final selling standpoint.  He is 4 years old, 35lbs and tall.  Being able to keep him in the 5-point harness system doesn't faze him - it's what he's used to. Hands down best investment we made for the safety of our son.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: 5-Point harness
Installation Type: Super easy to install
Weight Range of Child: 35lbs

Review: The base is very light and you have to do extra tightening to secure to the car than normal because if making a quick turn in car the base will move with car and yes we have it installed correctly. Just a cheap style car base for carseat.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
This product was easy to assemble and install (well, if you have a child this age you are experienced in reading the cryptic instructions that all products for this age seem to come with, but at least I was able to figure this out quickly). Some reviewers here were concerned about the buckle being difficult, but I had no issues with it at all. The box did say "improved buckle" on it so maybe they saw the reviews and fixed it.

We had a Graco infant car seat that we just graduated from, and one thing to note is that the adjustment strap on this new car seat is extremely easy to adjust after being used to the infant car seat's adjustment. I really don't know that it can be easier to adjust the various straps.

Anyway, it feels very secure after being installed in my car and I have just bought a second one for our other car. Highly recommend!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: adjustment strap is extremely easy to adjust; improved buckle
Installation Type: easy to assemble and install

Review: I purchased this on Prime Day as an extra car seat for our family. For the price, we are extremely happy. Very easy to install and adjust. I love that my son can rear-face longer. My son has been in the 99th percentile for his height since he was 1 month old, so to say he's tall and growing fast is an understatement. I did not realize this when I purchased it, but the bonus is this is machine washable! The other car seat I own is a Chicco Nextfit Zip- which I love because its easy to install and machine washable. Very excited to actually give this a shot this week.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-face
Installation Type: easy to install
Material: machine washable

Review:
I drive a 2018 Wrangler & with three kids, with multiple seats, this seat is perfect for room for older child in middle seat & booster on other end.

It’s heavy, narrow and hight /weight perfect for my two year old rear facing to 45 lbs. simple instructions in rear pocket (begins zipper) - she loves the pink and feels like a big girl. I feel she has more room from her chicco infant seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Weight Range of Child: 45 lbs, two year old
Material: pink

Review:
I needed another carseat for my toddler so my 8 month old could have the seat she has currently been using. My toddler now rides in a Britax Boulevard. I love the Britax brand for its safety, but the price is just really steep. So I decided to look for a carseat without the Britax name.

First of all, I will say that the carseat has a lot of awesome features! It has a built in cupholder, armrests, and comfy foam seating. It is also an excellent price!

The problem was...my daughter is bigger than the average 2 year old. She isn't huge, but she's kind of stocky. She will be 2 in about 2 weeks and she weighs 33lbs. She is a little above average height. I wanted her to be able to stay in a 5pt harness, but still get the added features of a big girl seat. So off to Target I went. The display model stated the seat could be used from 2yrs +. After much debate, I purchased it. I had read on several other reviews here on Amazon that the seat had a small flaw...the crotch strap. I really hoped this wouldn't be the case with us, but as other reviewers stated, it definitely posed a problem for us. The crotch strap was digging into her legs and if she grows much more it won't work at all. However, when we opened the box, it stated 3yrs+ on the instructions. I can't possibly imagine my daughter being able to use the 5pt harness at age 3, but maybe it's because she's above average for weight.

We're taking it back. Had the strap worked, we would definitely keep it!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: 5pt harness, crotch strap digging into her legs, crotch strap was digging into her legs, if she grows much more it won't work at all, can't possibly imagine my daughter being able to use the 5pt harness at age 3
Weight Range of Child: 2yrs +, 3yrs+, weighs 33lbs, above average for weight
Material: comfy foam seating

Review: This seat seems to have it all. We are a rear facing family. My 3 year old just recently got close to outgrowing his previous convertible car seat's rear facing limits, so we turned him forward. This seat's 50 lbs limit has allowed us to rear face him again and that alone is a great thing. It has great padding, is easy to install, adjust, and use. The extended leg room is AWESOME for older kids, and surprisingly does not make the seat take up too much room. The extender boot also gives us more room to load/unload him, which with an older child can be an issue with other seats. This one is so easy! We were easily able to fit it in our midsized vehicle with ease. For the limits and features that this seat has, the price is unbeatable! Can't say too many good things about it. Anything that allows kids to rear face longer, and does so comfortably at that, is always a great thing. Throw in the decent price point and it'a winner! We plan to  buy one for our youngest child, as well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing, convertible, forward
Weight Range of Child: 50 lbs limit
Installation Type: easy to install
Material: great padding

Review: Love it. I feel like my baby is super secure and safe while in it. It cradles ember body perfectly. The only negative thing I would have to mention is that it is kind of heavy even without the baby inside and that the canopy doesn’t go down very far.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: This car seat is the best! The fabric is a dream to clean.  It keeps baby warm in winter and cool the summer.  All it’s extras make the seat so adaptable and convenient.  The seat is safe, durable, and a piece you trust in.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: fabric is a dream to clean, keeps baby warm in winter and cool in summer

Review: My son loves this car seat. He would cry when in his pumpkin seat, but in this seat he only cries for a moment when putting him in there (this is just because he does not like being strapped down). He falls asleep within a few minutes in this seat and sometimes before we even make it out of the parking lot. He smiles and laughs in this seat and will play with some toys when he is awake. This seat was a little difficult to install just because it's difficult to get it tight enough. Once getting in the car and placing my weight in the seat while tightening things up, I was able to get it tight enough. A pool noodle was needed for under the front of the carseat to level it, which I had planned ahead for. My advice would be to just go ahead and plan on using it and putting it under the seat even if it looks level when getting ready to install. I thought it was level but once I tightened the seat I had to loosen it up and place the pool noodle under the seat and re-tighten the seat, as it was illegal after being tightened without the pool noodle. This is a great car seat especially for the price and we are very satisfied with this purchase and you even recommended it to a friend at church for her granddaughter.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: difficult to install, difficult to get it tight enough, placing my weight in the seat while tightening things up, I was able to get it tight enough, A pool noodle was needed for under the front of the carseat to level it, plan on using it and putting it under the seat even if it looks level, I had to loosen it up and place the pool noodle under the seat and re-tighten the seat, it was illegal after being tightened without the pool noodle

Review:
So far, so good. The car seat has a great canopy, better than any other infant car seat that I've seen. It covers the baby completely which is great when it is windy/rainy/very sunny/snowing, etc. The fabric feels very soft and I like that the fabric is machine washable. The Sure Latch base is so easy to install and once installed, does not budge and is so secure. The handle on the car seat is easy to manipulate and comfortable to hold. I have not yet put my baby in the car seat, so I can't yet comment on the reviews regarding contact dermatitis from the fabric of the car seat, but the fabric feels so soft that I can't imagine it would be a problem. As to those who complain that this car seat is heavy, try lifting the Peg Perego Primo Viaggio (which is the car seat I was using until now). The Evenflo Secure Ride 35 e3 infant car seat is light as a feather compared to Peg Perego. I will update this review after I have used it with my baby, in the car.

Update:
I used the car seat with my baby today. It was easy to carry, easy to adjust straps, baby was comfy, and she did not get a rash from the fabric. A+++!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant car seat  
Weight Range of Child: 35 (inferred from product name "Secure Ride 35")  
Installation Type: Sure Latch base  
Material: fabric feels very soft, machine washable fabric

Review: Looks snazzy as hell.  Cover fitment could use some improvement.  Why does it have two separate release mechanisms?  In the car, it's an easy release button behind the seat.  As a stroller attachment, you have to push the two little buttons on either side, then somehow use your third hand to lift the seat up.  Poorly thought out.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Clicktight

Review: To be honest, I was hesitant to purchase this because of the price.  I figured every car seat meets basic federal crash standards, so why buy this one when I could get one for $50?  However, we've now had this car seat for several months and I'm so glad we spent the extra money.  First, the steel bar reinforcement is great - it does make the seat heavier overall, but to me that is a good thing.  The seat sits more securely due to it's extra weight and I don't worry about the car seat possibly getting damaged since it's not completely molded plastic.  Also, the little touches are so nice - the straps do not need to be re-threaded every time my son grows.  It is a minor thing, but as any parent who's had to re-thread a stroller, a car seat, and every other darn thing, you know how nice it is to just not have to bother.  The adjustment of the straps takes literally less than 10 seconds.  The LATCH system attachment buckles are also a breeze.  Usually I let the baby's dad handle switching the seat from car to car, but once we had this one, it was such a breeze to do it myself.  Again, a minor thing, but it makes life so much easier.  Given that our son will be in this seat for at least another 18 months, those little things make the extra cost totally worth it!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: straps do not need to be re-threaded, adjustment of the straps takes literally less than 10 seconds
Material: steel bar reinforcement, not completely molded plastic

I love the clicktight feature and there was absolutely no movement at the beltpath. We have a smaller SUV and there was still room for the front passenger to sit comfortably. If you're on the fence, buy it!

Review: I was so nervous to get a new car seat because I never know if I’m making the right choice... and you want to make sure that your babies gonna be safe when you’re in the car at any time... my friend suggested this car seat to me and I’m so thankful that she did. Not only was it insanely easy to install my daughter looks 1 million times more comfortable every time we go in the car & SO SAFE!

Review:
After having the Peg Perego Infant Car Seat we assumed getting the Peg Convertible Car Seat was the right choice. I purchased this Peg Perego Convertible Car Seat on May 6th 2013 from AMAZON. We purchased it because we were headed to the beach. We rented a Tahoe and the car seat fit well and we were pleased. Once we got home from the beach we attempted to install this seat in my BMW 328i but it was too tight. I was planning on getting a new car within months and we decided to just wait on installing until we got the new car. A few month later in August we purchased a BMW X5. We installed the Peg Perego Convertible Car Seat into the X5 and were very happy. My son loved the extra room, and it worked for us. Now we have been using the seat for 2 to 3 months and the fabric is completely torn and open at the buckle. Considering how much we paid for this car seat, I do not think this is acceptable.

I went to amazon returns link, and it says my return expired Aug 7, 2013. It gives me no other ways of contacting them. I have no idea how I can somehow contact AMAZON to try to get a refund or even a replacement. I am very familiar with Peg Perego products we have many of there products, and something like this has never happen before. This is unacceptable and I am very disappointed. If anyone has any idea how I can somehow contact AMAZON to make them aware of the problem and see about getting assistance, please let me know. Thank you, MOMOF2
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Material: fabric torn and open at the buckle

Review: Great car seat. We got it for our grandson. He is 1 yr old and it is a little large for him but he will grow into it soon. It sits a little more upright than I like but overall it is a nice seat. The only complaint I would have is the way you have to thread the seatbelt thru the seat to lock it down. It is very tight and a poor design.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We knew we were taking our car seat on vacation with us because we were renting a car at our destination and I figured it would be the best way to keep our almost 2 year old son contained on the plane. I considered the GoGoKidz car seat carrier, but didn't want to spend that much money on something that we would only use a few times. So for $15 I figured this item was worth a shot. Once you get the straps on the car seat adjusted to fit, it's not too difficult to remove the seat from the bag and attach again. My son loved riding around on the airport strapped into his seat. And because it is so small you can just put it in the pocket of your luggage when you are not using it. The only problem I had was that my arm and shoulder became a bit uncomfortable on the walk through the airport, but that was really a problem with my bag. If the handle on my rolling case was a bit longer (or I was a couple inches shorter) it would have been perfect.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
This is a great device for what it's intended for - a backup. It is a booster seat that is literally small enough to keep in the glove box. For grandparents, people with friends who have small kids, any kind of 'just in case' use it's fantastic.

If you're going to go on a very long car ride, have a very squirrely kid, or if you're looking for an every-day car seat, I'd give this a pass.

I got this specifically so my parents could take my daughter for the weekend without us having to move her huge/heavy convertible booster seat from our car to theirs. The only problem we've found with it, is that if the buckle end up too close to the belt guides (which they seem to do pretty much always) it can be a real pain to get the seatbelt. If it wasn't for that, I'd have given it a 5.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Weight Range of Child: small kids
Installation Type: seatbelt

Review: We have two Peg convertible seats. The first, we got 7 years ago and the second is 3 years old. I'm replacing the first seat because it expired (they used to expire at 7 years, now it's 10) and wouldn't dream of buying anything else. These seats have lasted through three kids and are still in excellent shape. They are very comfortable on long trips, easy to tighten and install safely (as easy as any car seat can be) and my sons have stayed in them through 4/5 years of age. My now four year old is in the 80th percentile for height and still loves his seat! As a comparison, we got a Britax Boulevard around the same time as our first Peg seat and the fabric is showing wear and tear and no longer stays wrapped around the seat. It is also not as comfortable for big kids. The fabric on the Peg seat does great in a cold wash and comes out like new each time. We have had many Peg Perego products, strollers, infant seats etc. and their quality is second to none. They are definitely worth the investment, especially if you want something that lasts!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Material: fabric does great in a cold wash and comes out like new

Review: I'm the grandmother, and my granddaughter grew out of her infant car seat (the one you can carry around).  Yes, it's expensive, but the features and solid construction make it worth it.  Best Feature:  You can adjust the height of the straps while the baby is right in the seat, just takes a minute (shoulder straps must be above the baby's shoulders, not dipping behind their back, and this seat makes it SOOO easy to keep that safety feature in place).  And, it's good through 65 lbs. Granddaughter #2 is on the way in April, and I will buy another Britax for her when she's about 6 months old.  What helped the most in my purchase decision was a glowing review on the seat by a Mom, so I hope this helps another person trying to decide.  PS: I suggest you sit with a cup of coffee or tea and read through the instruction booklet, then go get acquainted with the seat and features.  In a short time, how to install and all the features will be very clear.  My granddaughter is SO comfortable in it, I can tell, her head doesn't bob forward and she always falls asleep in this one.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: good through 65 lbs
Harness Type: adjust the height of the straps while the baby is right in the seat, shoulder straps must be above the baby's shoulders

Review:
Got this as a gift for my baby shower. After researching every car seat and listening to friend's recommendations I chose the Britax Boulevard. It is super comfy for my daughter and she has fallen asleep in it many times. Little bulky- have had to move front seat up in our Jeep Patriot and now in our Kia Sorento. My husband has a Mazda 3 and had to put it forward facing otherwise it won't fit. It isn't ideal, but I still know our daughter is safe because of the structure and stability of the car seat.
I would love for the car seat to have a built in cup holder, but being that the goal of the seat is safety I will take that over convenience.

Review: For the price of these car seats, they need some serious work on installation and the instruction manuals.  We already own a pair of Chicco MyFits with the adjustable strap height, and it's a joke that at this price on the Radians you have to remove the seat and rethread the harnesses.  I thought they would save more space vs. the MyFits with the cupholders removed, but the two Dionos free up maybe a centimeter compared to the Chicco seats when side by side.  The rear tethers have clips that are too long, so it's really hard to tighten the tether when the anchor point is right behind the head rest.  Don't even think about traveling with these seats - they weigh a ton.  Also, the shock absorber thing you have to install when your child is forward facing and between 20 and 40 pounds is a bad idea because it's hidden after you put it in.  Who is going to remember to remove their car seat, take that thing out, and reinstall the seat a year later when their child is heavier?  Also, the instruction manual was vague as to whether to pop out the bottom angle adjuster thing for my child's weight.  All the installation videos on youtube contradicted the manual on this so I'm pretty sure most people are getting it wrong.  Lastly, what's the deal with no actual installation video on the Diono website?  Why bother having videos at all if all they show is how you open the seat from the box and offer generic tips like 'always read the manual'?  I'm watching the video because I can't follow your manual!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: installation and the instruction manuals, remove the seat and rethread the harnesses, rear tethers have clips that are too long, really hard to tighten the tether, shock absorber thing you have to install when your child is forward facing and between 20 and 40 pounds, remove their car seat, take that thing out, and reinstall the seat, pop out the bottom angle adjuster thing for my child's weight, installation videos on youtube contradicted the manual, no actual installation video on the Diono website
Weight Range of Child: when your child is forward facing and between 20 and 40 pounds, when their child is heavier, for my child's weight
Harness Type: rethread the harnesses

Review: I read lots of reviews online before purchasing two of these car seats (one for each car).  I have two kids, one and three years old.  My son the one-year-old just outgrew the graco snugride infant seat.  My daughter was still using her Britax Marathons that we bought when she outgrew the graco.  We moved my son into the Britax seats, which are designed for babies up to 65 pounds.  First we tried the Graco turbo booster but that was too big and did not seem safe for my daughter, who just turned three and is only 29 pounds.  Then I found this seat, the Graco Nautilus, and I love it!  My daughter had wanted a girly print but once she tried her big girl seat with cup holders, she loved it and didn't care what color it was!  I offered to make her a girly pink cotton cover for it but she really doesn't care anymore what color it is.  We have been using the seats for a couple months now and are very happy with them.  They were also much more affordable than the Britax and seem just as sturdy and safe and well-fitting - a very good value that will be useful for many years.  We have old cars - a 10-year-old subaru forester and a 10-year-old VW Jetta - both without Latch - and it was easy to safely anchor in both cars using the seatbelt systems, and it fit well in both back seats.  It was easy to set up and install.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: up to 65 pounds, 29 pounds
Installation Type: seatbelt systems
Material: cotton cover

Review: This car seat is easy to install and easy to adjust.  It is sturdy and fits very snugly into our Jeep Cherokee - it doesn't budge an inch!  It also has an adjustable crotch strap so you aren't constantly pulling the buckle out from under your baby as he grows.  It is easy to remove the cover and you can put it in the washing machine if it gets dirty.  My husband and I love this seat.  You can't beat the price.  We're going to purchase a second for our other car.

Review:
I purchased this seat after a lot of research, thinking it would fit in my 2016 Hyundai Elantra. It did not fit RF nor FF in middle seat due to the base, and because my middle seat is slightly raised, therefore I had to place it behind drivers seat. I am 5'2, so not much discomfort in that regard, but my 5 year olds Diono (which I had wanted to place next to Mysize originally) had to be placed behind passenger seat. I purposely purchased two "smaller" seats to fit side by side and gain a seat in the back, that didn't work with the mysize.
The mysize was a pain to tighten, even with the latch system. It took both the car seat tech and myself to be able to do so, with a lot of effort.
I post this for those with small cars trying to fit two or three across together, like myself, to save you the aggravation. Buy Diono for that, because this one, contrary to carseatblog post, will not do that.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: Latch

Review: I've purchased and returned a dozen boosters and most are so beyond frustrating that I take months off in between shopping.  This one finally, finally is smart.  It's totally adjustable and will fit any kid.  Our daughter is 6.  The back of it is aluminum, not cheap plastic, so it is actually sturdy.  The rigid latch will secure it to your car, rock solid, even preventing side to side wiggle.  And it's narrow, so you can actually get to the seat belt latch.  The upper part where the belt goes through is also the best design so far, so the belt can't come out  and believe it or not, the "recline" feature actually works.  And works well.  This is quality Italian engineering and you get what you pay for.  Ive confirmed to fit across several BMWs (X3, 5 serie, M3) which are notoriously challenging with latch and rear space, so this should work in any car.  And yes, it's price is outrageous.  Double or triple what the others cost.  It's also better than the cheaper one from the same company because of the aluminum back and adjustability.  So if you're like me and ready to give up shopping for these things, know that this one is finally smart.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Material: aluminum back, not cheap plastic
Installation Type: rigid latch

Review:
WOW
I had the local PD install it.
My two year old LOVES it. The bottle holder and mini toy compartment are really a cool feature.
It is really comfy and very well built.
We absolutely love the recline feature coz on a longer trip we can just tip it back a bit and it makes for a much smoother transition from WIDE AWAKE to Snoozeville :)

Review: My daughter just turned one and outgrew her Graco Snug Ride so we decided to give her big bro's Britax Marathon and get the Nautilus for him instead.  He just LOVES his big boy carseat and this mommy loves that this is the last carseat he'll ever need!  My son is 3 years old and since carseats are good for 6 years he can use this as a booster until age 9.  Brilliant!  Even though Britax is more spendy, we are so much happier with the Nautilus than the Marathon.  The Nautilus comes with a built in cupholder which we all love!  The Britax ones make you pay extra for a clip- on a cupholder and ours broke when I leaned over it putting my son in his seat!  Not so with the Graco where it is all built in and secure.  It's hard to tell from the pictures, but there are also little "cubbies" in the carseat which my son thinks is fun for storing toys.  I'm not sure what the intended purpose is but he loves stashing things in there!  Installation was super easy with the convenient LATCH system.  Can't say enough good things about it.  Buying another one once baby girl is only enough to FF too!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 3 years old, until age 9
Installation Type: LATCH system
Material: built in cupholder, little "cubbies"

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
Product Review: This inflatable booster worked great for us! My husband was quite skeptical but we both thought it was perfect, especially for traveling. My daughter is 6 but quite slim, and since she just clicked over the 40-lb. weight minimum for boosters, she is still in a convertible booster with a 5-point harness because I believe it's safer and she doesn't complain so why not? However, we recently took an airplane trip and since we already had to travel with my younger son's carseat, we did not want to lug 2 full sized seats through airports. We decided since driving on our trip would be minimal once we got to our destination, to go with this booster. I'm so glad we did. It inflates and deflates like a breeze. It rolls up and fit in my daughter's backpack until we needed it. It was easy for her to use, comfortable to sit on, and the belt guides were easy to use and kept the seatbelt perfectly placed on her shoulder.

It will be perfect to keep in my car to use when we have an unexpected friend ride along with us because it's small and will fit nicely in the middle seat between our two very large Britax convertible seats, which hard boosters probably would not. I'd purchase again without hesitation.

Warehouse Seller Review: I ordered this item as New/Like New from Amazon Warehouse Deals. We received it in a torn and re-taped box (as expected) but sadly the item had clearly been used. It had food (?) crumbs all on it, along with a large amount of dog hair. So, we returned it and since we needed it right away, we bought the same item at Walmart for almost the exact same price.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster, convertible booster
Weight Range of Child: 40-lb. weight minimum for boosters
Installation Type: belt guides
Harness Type: 5-point harness

Review:
**Please click "helpful" below if my review is useful to you.

After 2 years of using this car seat and its predecessor, I know it inside out. I bought it when my son outgrew the Chicco Keyfit. He is big for his age and was 25lbs by 8 months old.

PROS

--Very easy to install using lower anchors or belt.
--High quality materials - smooth liner, thick foam pads, sturdy fabric.
--Very roomy, even for a taller and heavier child.
--Easy to clean - my son vomited in it a couple of times, unfortunately.
--Chest clip is hard for toddlers to open - very important if you have a cheeky tot like mine.

CONS

--Really, really heavy! Goodness, carrying this thing feels like carrying out a sentence of hard labor.
--Neck rest is awkwardly placed so that, no matter how you adjust it, it is either too low or too high.
--Confusing manual that is entirely too long.
--Rather wide - this is not the car seat to bring to the airport or install in the center seat of a minivan.

Conclusion: Buy it if you have only a couple of children. You will not be able to install more than one other car seat in the same row as it because it is rather wide. Your child will like it because it is like a well-fortified, roomy throne.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 25lbs by 8 months old
Installation Type: lower anchors or belt
Material: smooth liner, thick foam pads, sturdy fabric

Review:
Fit my newborn (7lbs, 13oz, 21 inches long) great from birth with the help of receiving blankets rolled up on the sides. He seems comfy, doesn't complain when he's in it. I love the material, I've never seen a car seat so easy to clean - and with a newborn you need easy cleaning options!
*Update*
I just moved my son to the next size car seat. He made it to 13 months before he outgrew the height level. He's not yet 32 inches tall as the specs say, but his since he has such a large torso his head was nearing the top of the shell.
I have a lot more to say about this seat now that I've used it for over a year, and I'm leaving my original rating of 5 stars as it is. I still love this seat!
It was so easy to change the height of the straps as he grew, and so easy to pull everything apart to wash when we had accidents. It's quick to install with either the base or without it, and I was never worried about it not being secure.
The recline button didn't get much use in my large truck with it's bench seat, but when we put this in the bucket seats of our scion tc we used it a bit to level everything out. It was simple to use, and didn't take any time to set correctly.
My son is in a high percentile for height, so the leg cover only lasted him about 3 months, and being born in May we didn't use it much - So I can't comment on how useful it was. The few times I used it, it was easy to take on and off, so I can at least say that.
As a side note, we also own the click connect double stroller, and this worked perfectly with it. We've been very impressed by Graco!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 7lbs, 13oz
Material: easy to clean
Installation Type: easy to install with either the base or without it

Great item. Beautiful print and easy to clean! Perfect car seats for my twin boys! This is a definite upgrade from the seat I had for my older boy two years ago. It's lighter weight and streamlined to fit much better in the car. I have two side by side in the 2nd row of a Yukon XL. The base/seat do not interfere with the 60/40 split seat . I can fold the 40% of my second row without touching the base or seat. This is a definite plus since we are constantly folding the seat for access to the 3rd row seats.
It is also very easy to use with the various Peg strollers. I have 3 Peg strollers and the seats are compatible and stable with all 3.

Review: I bought this car seat for the colors and the fact that it has a pull strap in the front to tight the straps instead of two straps in the back of the car seat. It did take some getting used to after switching from a Graco Snugrider but after a few weeks of using it, I love it. I love that it came with a ready-made boot and in colors that I like that are girly, but not overly so. The seat fabric is not plasticy and i love that you just have to twist the knob on the back to adjust the straps up and down, rather than rethread it each time your child has a growth spurt. We bought the matching stroller but have not used it yet. The base is super easy to get on and off the latch equipment in the car. It is a handle with a squeeze lever rather than a hook you have to twist and press to get undone (if that makes sense.)  We have switched to baby trend for ease of use, styling, and comfort for baby!

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
Let me start off by saying I have a love/hate relationship with car seats. I have 5 children, the oldest one is 7, so collectively, I probably have been through 30 car seats in less than a decade. My daughter has been ready to graduate to a booster seat for 2+ years now, but unfortunately, due to her parents procreation habits, she's been relegated to life in a 5-point harness for lack of space. It baffles me that mini-van manufacturers don't consider the fact that you may have kids in car seats. Sure it's great Herb and Ethel sport their Chrysler Town & Country with their teacup poodle Miffy, but we use the heck out of our minivan. So, when the twins showed up, the three bigs got kicked to the back of the bus and we panicked trying to cram three full seats in the back row. Thanks to Radian (and $1000), we didn't have to buy a conversion van. So, after squeezing every moment out of the "baby" seat, I had to find a narrow booster. Our standard graco booster had birthing hips like my wife, and just didn't squeeze in the back. Enter, Bubble Bum. The name and concept are ridiculous, but, by golly, the thing actually works perfect. I was EXTREMELY skeptical about a blow up seat. Sure we want our children to live in a bubble, but to actually sit on one? Low and behold, It fits her narrow booty perfectly and she's now all proud sporting a booster seat. Granted, there are no frills to this thing. No cup holder, no secret pockets, no fun stuff, just base model solidness.
We've had it probably a month and it's still inflated, and working great. Thankfully we haven't done any crash testing in it, so I can't validate it's safety. Hopefully, I'll never have to update my comment about the crash sturdiness. Paranoia, I looked online and sites claimed it was safety checked and legit. Now that school is starting back up, kid #1 is begging to be promoted in dad's car as well to a booster. So, buying a second Bubble Bum.
Only negative thing I would say is my daughter complains the seat is "itchy" around the logo. It is raised, and when she wears skirts or daisy dukes, she complained of scratching. So, we improvised and she put a wash cloth on the seat. I'm glad I didn't pay extra for kittens or something pretty on the seat only to have a dirty rag covering it. Otherwise, works great. If you're tight on space, it's definitely the seat for you. I have one in our Odyssey and soon one in an Avalon (adjacent to two Radians).
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Weight Range of Child: ready to graduate to a booster seat for 2+ years
Material: itchy around the logo, raised logo, wash cloth on the seat

Review: We ordered this booster seat a few months ago, primarily to use as a booster seat at the dining room table (or when going to restaurants). It's super easy to use, easy to travel with and overall a really smart product.  Unfortunately it sprung a leak and would no longer hold air. I don't think it's indicative of the product...more just that sometimes inflatable things spring a leak. I reached out to the company since they mention a lifetime warranty...but wasn't expecting much since there's usually a lot of hoops to jump through. Much to my surprise and delight the response back was as simple as "send us a photo so we can try to avoid this in the future and we'll ship you a new one immediately". I had the new one in hand within a couple of days and I couldn't be happier. Thanks Hiccapop!

I could let her sit in the center seat in the back of my truck and she could see where we were going better, because it boosted her higher. She was getting too big for the car seat, and this is much more comfortable for her and much easier to strap her in using the seatbelts. The only trouble was, the first longer trip we took she fell asleep, and slumped over to the side. There was nothing to hold her up. Since I had bought two I sent one back and ordered another one with a back support which we use when we go on long trips, and When she falls asleep this back holder upright and she’s very comfortable. I have the other one in my wife’s car to transport her to and from school, and it is great!

Review:
It's a very nice car seat. Good quality, nicely instructed in the mannual, very easy to install.
However, there is an issue. No harness covers were there in the assembly delivered. I read some other reviews mentioned this too. But according to the mannual, "Harness Covers MUST be installed when using the 5-point harness for children weighing 18 kg or less." Have no idea where to get the harness covers.
One more issue, system kept telling wrong model number when trying to register the seat on line. But I'm sure I copy the exact number on the label. Have no idea for this neither.
But overall, it's a very nice car seat. Just hope someone could help for the harness cover issue.

Review:
Love how easy this was to install due to the latch system. I am also glad I got the slim fit since I have an Equinox and there is not much room in the back (we put the seat in the center). However there is a tiny bit more room now than when we had the Chicco pumpkin seat in. (I can sit next to the car seat now without it pressing into my leg/side as before. For reference, I am 200lbs, so not a small person.)
Now my favorite parts are that the seat can easily have the height changed. I have a tall baby so that will be great to not have to keep getting taller seats or take a long time to adjust.
Also this car seat has been a blessing because baby (4 month old) will ride in this much longer before starting to get upset and even then she just gets a bit fussy. (I have one of those kids that hates the car seat!!) There are two adjustments for the back facing and one allows her to sit up more (which she loves!) as well as being able to kick her feet (and see her feet). We also have enough room to put one of those music kick pianos (strapped down) at her feet so she can have something to do during the drive since she is still learning her hands.
I appreciate that the cup holders can slide into itself because it would be uncomfortable for a passenger to ride next to the seat if they didn't since as I mentioned before, not much room as it is.

I also like that the side padding next to her head is not touching the side of her head like in the pumpkin seat since that was another thing she didn't like (she would jerk her head side to side trying to get away from it). I still get the safety without her being unhappy.
Even though I can't take her in and out in the seat (which not like she liked that anyway), I really am glad I went ahead and got this one. She can get used to it and not have to worry about getting used to a different chair well into her toddler days and even then we would just have to get the booster. If I had a do over I would definitely have started with this car seat!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Latch
Material: Slim fit, side padding

Review: What more could you want from a car seat on the go? My 7 and 5 year old kids are able to use these correctly and they are a lot less bulky when you are having to deal with three kids in boosters and car seats.

This is a great seat and has lasted us a LONG time.. I would recommend this to anyone!! Also, the belt keeps getting tangled.  I just can't keep them straight.  This seat is simply a pain.  It is comfy for my child though.

Review: This car seat saved my baby’s life. I was hit head on by a driver crossing 3 lanes; my airbags deployed and my car was totaled. I was burned, cut, bruised, had soft tissue damage and more...but my baby? SHE WAS PERFECT. Not a scratch on her, wasn’t even crying. The first responders said that we had picked the best car seat and that it had protected her well. We went out and immediately bought the same one (you have to trash a car seat once it has been in an accident). I would highly recommend this Car seat to everyone!

We have taken the seat out to make sure nothing is caught and it continues to happen. I have contacted Graco for assistance and haven't herd anything back. We love the seat, just wish it wasn't so difficult to tighten. It is our secondary seat in my husband's car so not used as much, but it's still a pain.

Review:
I couldn’t decide on a convertible car seat that I wanted for my son to grow into. I wanted something that was built to last for many years despite “destruction” caused by use and children. After months and months of researching, I decided to stick with Chicco which is also the brand of our infant car seat. For some reason, I couldn’t stop looking at this convertible car seat! It has everything I wanted regarding safety features and looks.

Pros: Leg room. Chest buckle is protected against touching the skin by the “extended” cushioned shoulder straps. Breathable mesh fabric for baby’s back. Zip off pad for easy cleaning!

Cons: Push-release button is very hard to access because it’s hidden by the fabric. I always struggle to maneuver my finger under the fabric to loosen the straps when taking my son out of the seat. If this was more easily accessible, I’d rate this all 5 stars. That’s my only hold back!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible car seat
Material: Breathable mesh fabric, Zip off pad for easy cleaning
Harness Type: Chest buckle, Shoulder straps

Review: we have been calling it little mans "big man" chair it looks alot bigger that it really is but on the same note its nice and spacious so thrilled we got this for this price installation was simple only a slight pain in the but putting the seat belt threw at the angle but once i noticed i could use the hole on top  (where the crotch strap is )with my other hand to help thread it threw it was gravy i have already messaged this link to my cousin with a baby just a little younger than my mason to give her the tip
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review:
his is by far the must rugged, durable and flexible child's car seat that I have owned. Compared to most other seats, this one is built like a tank. That has both positives and negatives though. On the downside, this seat is not very light or simple to move and transport. If you are going to be transferring your child from the car to the house without getting them out of their seat, this is probably not the easiest one to do it with. It's really better used to keep in the car all the time.

On the other hand, it's solid construction makes this the ultimate car seat when it comes to safety and does not sacrifice comfort or any other features along the way. Pretty much every option for positions is available, the upholstery is easy to clean in the wash and it is made to last up to 10 years with the integrated booster seat.

This seat is definitely a little bit pricier than other models, but seeing as it should last until your child reaches 120 lbs. it is an excellent investment.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, integrated booster seat
Weight Range of Child: up to 120 lbs
Material: upholstery is easy to clean

Review: Kind of a basic car seat with some really nice features. It grows with the child, and that is a huge selling point. This is not an item that you will need to replace every few months (or even years for that matter). Sturdy construction with a kind of basic design. the understated design, however makes it appropriate for any gender and it will look classy in any car regardless of make, model or design. This is not one of those oversized, beastly car seats that you have to muscle in and out of your auto. This has a great design feature that actually provides for more legroom for the passenger in front of the car seat. That alone makes it an outstanding item versus other brands (traveling with your child should not be at the detriment of other passengers). All the required safety features are here and this car seat provides for extra side-impact protection. Easy to clean with removable padding and cup holder. This car seat could actually demand a much higher price, but it seems as though the folks at Safety 1st are bringing you a quality product at a fair price without skimping on safety. That should be taken as a huge compliment in this era of "profits over common sense." You really cannot go wrong here. It works, it's safe, it seems comfortable (no complaints), and it has a modern sleekness to it. This is really all you need.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Easy to install
Material: Easy to clean with removable padding

Review: LOVE this car seat so far! My son is much more comfortable in this seat. My only complaint is that it’s tough to tighten, but when pulling the back part of the harness then the strap it works well. I do wish the instructions included something to help figure out which recline setting is best.

Harness Type: tough to tighten, when pulling the back part of the harness then the strap it works well

The only Con is again that it is very large so it does take up a good deal of space in the back, and it is hard to reach over when rear facing. Review: I’m going to start with the positives. I love the large size! I feel like my daughter isn’t crammed into it and has plenty of room. I like the cup holders. I obviously love the rotation. There’s two major concerns, however. One is that I feel like it’s not as secure. Once I get the base tight enough, it feels loose again. And trust and believe I have followed the exact directions. I’m beginning to think maybe it’s just me being paranoid, but when I put my daughter in the seat, it seems too wobbly. My second dislike is that the straps get twisted up constantly. It’s annoying and time consuming. I guess my overall fear is that I spent a ton of money for a car seat that I don’t find as safe. I’m still adjusting and giving it a chance, but I can’t say I’m not disappointed.

Review: We only have 1 car, a Toyota Corolla 2010, and had to fit three kids in the back and this was perfect.  We got 3 across the back using this and two Radians.  We also like the adjustable seat that lets you change strap height without re-threading.
