Review: I just recently bought this carseat and I couldn't be happier!!! I wanted to get the BEST and SAFEST carseat for my daughter and I am SO glad there was the sale cause it made the price drop just low enough for me to convince my fiance that it was worth the price lol.  It was SO easy to install (into our 01 Jeep Grand Cherokee, rear facing in middle).  It fits fine and very securly, I was worried that it would be too big.  It actually fits better on the seat than our Graco snugride (the snugride was too skinny and leaned into the crack of the seats, this seat has a wide enough base to be stable over the crack!  I am so glad I got this car seat my daughter loves it, shes fallen asleep in it already! I am a little disappointed with the pattern it looks different in person than online, but the safety is what I really care about! About the size it is a little big like I have one of those fisher price mirror things and I cant see her in it from the drivers seat but I can from the passenger seat, but I leave the mirror where it is cause she enjoys looking in it lol.  I am VERY happy with this car seat!!!! I feel that my baby is protected! Shes only 9 months old and still fit in her infant carrier but rarely took the carseat out of the car I just took her out so I figured it was time to get a better carseat.  Another big reason I chose this carseat (and a selling point to my fiance lol) was that it will last her a long time!!!! The only bad thing I can say is that I accidentally cut off the user guide, I didnt know you were supposed to keep it on there lol, oh well lol. GREAT CAR SEAT!!! WORTH THE MONEY TO PROTECT YOUR BABY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: easy to install
Material: pattern looks different in person than online

Review: We are pregnant with our first child and currently drive a Mini Cooper. We will be buying a second car sometime in the months after our baby is born, but we wanted a car seat that would fit in the back of both the Mini and a 4-door car. We did our research and decided on the Chicco Keyfit because the reviews said it was compact and easy to install, a must when you are dealing with a cramped back seat. The Chicco did not disappoint. It is very easy to install, and I even have enough leg room to be comfortable in the passenger seat! I also like that the straps are easy to adjust from the front of the car seat for when our baby is wearing bulkier clothes. I was a bit worried about the Chicco because some of the Keyfit reviews I read said the car seat had a horrible chemically smell that wouldn't go away. I can't speak for all of the different fabrics and designs, but the red one (Fuego) we bought does not have this problem. My only issue with the car seat is that the carrier is a bit heavy. I will have to beef up to carry my baby around in it. I suppose that is a good incentive to improve my upper body strength, which I really should do anyway.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: easy to install
Harness Type: straps are easy to adjust from the front of the car seat
Material: red one (Fuego) we bought does not have this problem (chemically smell)

Review: The seatbelt hasn’t come out of the guide once.  I was worried about that from some of the other reviews. I can’t help but wonder if perhaps they didn’t read all the instructions - which tell you how high you need to have the head rest for everything to function properly and for the child to be properly secured. Or it could be just a different car type. Either way my 6 year old was outgrowing the 5-point harness seat he had and this one fits him well. I love that the cup holders are deep enough to actually hold drinks without spillage too.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 6 year old
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review:
we purchased this car seat from a local retailer. we thought that it would be great to have something that would carry our son all the way through. as it turns out we tried to install the carseat into our Lexus and it did not recline properly. we would have been bringing our baby home sitting straight up. we opted to purchase a car seat and stroller set that will better fit our baby when he arrives. we are going to keep the car seat we purchased already and use that when he is older and will fit better into it. the reviews I've read are mostly good so we feel that this car seat is probably pretty decent for older children plus our car has a lot of safety features and high safety ratings. I'm only giving it three stars because it does not install properly as an infant seat like it says. we tried to make it recline more using the towel and the pool noodle trick to no avail. perhaps if our car were an SUV or minivan instead of a sedan it might have worked but it was far less expensive to buy a different car seat than a different car. I hope this helps people out that are researching and considering this car seat.

just a reminder for you parents out there regardless of which car seat or carrier you are purchasing for your baby you can go to your local fire station and have them inspect the installed car seat or carrier to make sure that it is safe and in the correct position. once our new car seat comes in we will be taking it to our local fire station to have it okayed to bring the baby home in. this is a free service and takes no time at all and better safe than sorry.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant seat
Installation Type: install, recline

Review: When the car seat was delivered I was a little shocked it came in a UPS box but opened it anyway. When I opened the box I found the car seat however it was definitely used. The bag the car seat was in was ripped, all the tags were cut off, the cup holders, inserts and instructions were missing. If I had paid for an open box item or a used like new that be one thing but I paid full price and expected an unused item with all its pieces. Now I have to send it back and guess what it doesn’t have an option for no label no box so now I have find a box big enough for the car seat because the one it came in was destroyed before it even got to my house

Even though he’s tall for being 6 we had to bring the foot plate almost all the way to the top but it was perfect fit. His shoes sad perfectly on it. Enough that we didn't even worry about his feet dangling for hours which they didn't because of this. Very easy to assemble, i did notice if you have the foot plate all the way down the adjuster bar that it is a little flimsy but for us it had to be all the way up. Which was rock solid, no movement. Doesn't even shake or rattle when i drive without him in the chair.

Review: I bought this car seat for my youngest child & loved it sooooo much the very same day I got it in & installed it that I ordered a 2nd one in a different color for his older brother. Now my boys (now 1.5 yr & 3 years old) can safely ride rear facing until he maxes out. I SERIOUSLY recommend this one over every other 2n1. Don't pay $400+ for a car seat with worst qualities just because you like the name brand stuff. Your child will be safe & secure in this car seat as long as you follow the car seat manual. & remember Do you never use accessories with your car seat unless approved by the manufacturer for that specific car seat. We are face as long as possible! It is the safest for your child even if it isn't most convenient.

Unfortunately the seatbelt guide built into the backrest has been redesigned and makes it tough to pull the seatbelt through it, and due to this the seatbelt sometimes comes out of the guide completely.  This is a safety issue and also an annoyance, so while the seat still works well otherwise I can no longer recommend it. Review: This carseat just saved my 3yr old 26 point baby girl.  We  were hit by a semi and she has not one scratch on her. The seat took the hit and did exactly what it is suppose to do. Yes, the impact broke it but she made it out perfect.

Review: Love these seats for the higher back, comfortable, easier to keep clean material, bottle holders and tray on either side, however, I do wish they offered more protection for the car seat material underneath the seat with less movement of the car seat in the car.

Review: Automobiles are not built to protect small passengers in a crash - even small adults!  If you want to increase the odds your child will survive a collision, I recommend keeping him or her in a booster seat as long as you are able to do so.  The Britax Frontier 85 is more than just a booster - it is a booster with a top tether which significantly increases the safety of the seat.  A 5-point harness is safer than the seat belt, and that's how my petite 9-year-old rides.  The law says 8 or 80 but I feel that law should be more stringent.  I plan to keep my daughter in the harness until she reaches 85 pounds and the belt-positioning booster until she is 12 or older.  I have taught her that safety is more important than "image" - I don't care that all of her friends are allowed to ride in cars with no booster of any kind.  The vehicle's seats and belts are NOT designed to protect your small riders. I'll say it again - a Britax Frontier 85 is well engineered to increase small riders' odds of survival in a collision.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat, belt-positioning booster
Weight Range of Child: 85 pounds
Harness Type: 5-point harness

Review:
Super easy to set up!

PROS
- for infant or toddler use!
- it even goes up to ages 10, but my kids aren't of age yet so i can't testify to that

- the back height is adjustable to your child's height, it also brings up the seatbelt according to their height
- side cushions feels soft and cushiony
- lots of cushions on each sides for side impacts
- the bottom harness is the easy push in and hook kind so it takes only seconds for it to be strapped in on each sides
- no bottom base needed (SO THANKFUL), easy reclining adjustments if needed

CONS
- NONE

Review: This seat is terrible. I received it as a baby shower gift, and began using it when my daughter turned 1 year. After only 12 months of use, the buckles stopped loosening. The red lever that must be pushed forward to loosen the straps became impossible to turn. I called Evenflo Customer Service, and they told me to try cleaning the seat, which I did to no avail. When I called again and told them it still wasn't working, they told me the piece couldn't be replaced, and I would need to buy a new seat. After only 12 months of use with no accidents or anything that would cause it to break, the seat stopped working and became unsafe, and Evenflo offered me no help since the product was purchased more than a year ago. Unbelievable and totally unacceptable. Clearly they do not stand behind their products at all!

Review: I love this carseat. My daughter likes it too. She says it's comfortable. We have had it for over a year and it's so much nicer toting between cars. The padding is also extremely easy to take off and wash. I really appreciate that feature the most. When my daughter falls asleep her head usually bends forward in this seat but luckily my rear seat reclines so I usually keep it slightly angled to prevent the awkward neck position.

Review:
I've owned this car seat for two years now, so I'll point out the things I like about it.
I own a Toyota Camry. This seat is installed on the side front facing. My son just turned 6 and is still in the 5-point harness (note- harness can be used until your child is 65 lbs and 50 inches tall). I've had no problems getting this seat super tight using LATCH.
Last year my son threw up in this seat and it had to be taken apart and cleaned. It was irritating just like any other seat, but I put the whole cover in the machine and there wasn't any damage done to it. (The fabric and straps on this seat don't have any visible deformities despite it being over two years old.) When I did take it apart, it was nice to see how well padded it is.
One good thing, but also bad thing, about this seat is how wide it is. If you're not planning to put a third person in your backseat, it's not a big deal. However, my other son's car seat is a Recaro Proride (also notoriously wide) so any third passenger back there has to be either an older child or a very uncomfortable adult. The good thing about it being so wide is that it's comfortable for my son. On long trips he likes to cross his legs and will fall asleep that way.
The only other "complaint" I have about this seat is the cupholders. They are not plastic all the way around, but held by a strip of elastic, so something like a toy car is going to slide right out. Top heavy drinks have fallen out during turns. They are irritating, but all the good things outweigh this one small issue.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 65 lbs and 50 inches tall
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: 5-point harness
Material: fabric and straps, cover, padded

Review: I purchased FOUR of these car seats.  We absolutely love them!  We needed rear facing seats for our boys and had purchased a different seat that was really hard to tighten rear facing.  We did so much research on car seats and we are so glad we went with this seat!  It is so easy to tighten and very comfy for our boys on our road trip to Georgia.  Best of all we don't have to buy another seat again as this will grow with our boys!

Review: I purchased this item on good faith in Britax products. We had the previous mode for my older little and it is still going strong after 3 years. I read that the new model was made with slightly less expensive material but still amazing safety. NOPE! NOT TRUE! We have had this seat for less than a year and one of the head protector pieces snapped off. I wouldn’t have even known, except my little got car sick so I needed to remove the covering to clean it. When I went to unlatch the head covering, the entire piece was already detached and just hanging On through the head covering 😡 Seriously started crying, what if she hadn’t gotten sick and we were in an accident? I wouldn’t have known her seat was defective and she could have bn injured or worse. Calling the manufacturer on Monday. This was an expensive buy for something that breaks that easily and puts my babies at risk. One Unhappy momma here!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: slightly less expensive material; head protector pieces snapped off; entire piece was already detached

The Britax went out on the curb with the trash.

I’m small (5’1 / 125lbs) and drive an SUV, I literally have to stand on my runner and pull as hard as I can to get it to adjust/tighten snug enough for him to be safe. Not sure if we’re the only ones, as I read many of the reviews and saw no others with this complaint. Overall the seat is great, I’m just concerned that neither harness will adjust as it should & it could result in the seat not working properly if we were ever in an accident.

Review:
Our daughter loves this car seat. We got this when she was 6 months old, being that she’s been in the 99 percentile for height since birth.
It has a lot of padding, makes me kind of jealous when we go on trips.
The only thing with all the padding and being in Maryland, the humidity and heat durning the summer. Being rear facing I felt like she wasn’t getting as much air flow too her. If I didn’t cool the car down before she would sweat a little.
As far as space, it fits well in my Grand Cherokee and my husbands truck. Although if you had a small car or suv it would be a tight squeeze when it’s rear facing. So if it was behind driver or passenger seat they wouldn’t be able to adjust their seat. Forward facing wouldn’t be a problem.

Cleaning:
P.I.A, unless I have no idea what I’m doing. You have to take the entire carseat out to get the cover off. Cleaning it for the first time made me a little nervous, because it seemed like there was a lot of hooks/bands holding on the cover. Almost thought I wouldn’t remember how to get it back on. Luckily it wasn’t as bad as I thought. Just tedious.

All in all, I would recommend this car seat.

Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 6 months old
Material: a lot of padding

Review: I own 5 of these Britax Boulevards; 2 are in my car, 2 in my husband's and 1 in grandma's.  I've loved all of the Boulevards except the G3 that's being used for my one year old in my car.  I can't say how much I hate this seat.  It is so so so difficult to adjust the straps.  I also think I have a defective car seat.  One of the straps keeps falling off of my one year old's shoulder.  She used to be rear facing so we had the straps below shoulder level as advised by Britax.  Due to this issue, we turned the car seat to face forward and moved up the straps above her shoulders as advised.  The strap still keeps falling off of her shoulder.  I've tried adjusting it to different lengths and I think the slot where the strap comes through may not be aligned correctly (manufacturer's defect).  I contacted Britax but that was two weeks ago and I have not heard back from them.  You'd think after investing over a $1000 in this company's products, you deserve a response.  Anyway, dealing with this car seat has been such a nightmare.  I may have bought the "safest" car seat but I don't think my child is safe in it.  We'll either get another car seat or switch it with one of the others but we still have one with a huge issue.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Harness Type: straps, shoulder level, slot where the strap comes through

Plus several reviews on here for totaled car accidents and the baby was fine which also puts the mind at ease. You will see most of the 1 star reviews complain about newborns or babies <1, but really those babies would best be suited by an infant car seat as part of a travel system. Safety first infant car seat/stroller ($150) followed by this seat ($99) and you are set for 5-6 years. And safe. Love this brand

Review:
tldr: don't let your kids sit in them unless they're installed in the car.

We purchased 2 of these for our 5 and 6 year old and used them for 18 months. They were perfect; narrow enough that someone can fit in the middle seat, allow for them to buckle and unbuckle very easily, and meet all safety requirements. They were also very easy to adjust and clean.

We had them out of the car to clean the interior and the kids sat in them and apparently the backs do not support their weight outside of the car because the back reclined and broke. I understand this is not the intended use for them, but since they collapse forward, we thought there was surely a way to have them reset upright if collapsed back. We contacted Peg Perego and they were no help, so its unclear if they're fixable.

We're currently borrowing boosters from the grandparents and oh how I miss these. Kids cannot buckle themselves and seats just don't feel as sturdy. The price point on these is so high, but as we have a very tall now 7 year old, I feel we must re-purchase them because there is only one other high back option we can find that goes to 63" and it is extremely wide. After the terrible customer service, I just don't know if I can shell out another $600.

I read another older view complaining that these are large and I know that I stated I wish they were an inch or two smaller but that was because I had baby number 3 on the way and could not fit the infant carseat and two booster seats in the back of my scion xb (which is a small SUV). We now have a 8 passenger Toyota Sienna and can fit all 3 seats in one row if we wish to but I still prefer having a seat between the kids when possible because they are always fighting, hitting, yelling and biting when they sit next to each other for too long. (You'd think I had two young toddlers by that statement but now my oldest are 6 and 4). I also did my research before buying the first set and these are some of the slimmest backless booster seats out there.

Review: I returned this car seat for a few reasons.  Although I loved the seat for its size and style, I hated the seat padding.  It had lots of open seams that would velcro together where the seat back met the seat base, and of course after I put my son in and out of the chair a few times they started to come apart leaving him with no padding to sit on but just the hard plastic.  I also did not like the infinite slide harness, that too also left empty space between my sons head and the seat because there was nothing to close up the open seams where the harness slides up and down.  It's a bummer for me, I had an Evenflo Triumph for my older son when he was a baby and absolutely loved it, but this new version I will have to pass.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Harness Type: infinite slide harness
Material: seat padding, open seams, hard plastic

Review:
It is difficult to get the straps to be even. The straps that come out near the leg are also part of the straps that go over the shoulder. This doesn't seem like a big deal until you have a squirming 1yr old you are trying to buckle in. When I try to pull on her shoulder strap to even them out it either pulls it too tight on her legs or her other shoulder. So what I usually end up with is one side of her body being too tight and the other being either the right tightness or too loose. It's not like I can tell a 1yr old to sit straight for a few minutes while I get you strapped in. It would be better of the leg/hip restraints were on a separate strap so each could be adjusted as needed without effecting the whole harness. This is the first car seat of this type I have had to buy, so maybe this how they all are or maybe I am doing something wrong, but it seems like they could change this part to make it a little easier to get them correctly strapped in.

It is also a GIANT hassle to get it in and out of the car. When they (twins) were in the pumpkin style seats, we had Graco and the anchor straps had a button release system to tighten or loosen the anchor strap. This car seat has a tilt forward buckle, which in my experience, never loosens. So if I have to switch the car seats to my mom's car for example, I usually have to put a lot of downward pressure on the seat to give me enough slack to force feed the strap through the belt buckle to loosen the anchor strap enough to where I can unlatch the anchor hooks. I know this part isn't designed to be easy, to keep the seat in place in the event of a wreck, but the graco one was a forceful push of a button to allow slack on the anchor strap. I could swap both of my graco bases in less than 10 minutes, while it takes me 10-15 minutes each to wrestle with these to get them securely in the other car (and I never feel like I can get the anchor strap tight enough).

Summary: If given the choice, I would not buy this again and if we had extra money, I would buy different seats and give these away.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: The straps are difficult to get even; the leg/hip restraints and shoulder straps are connected, making adjustment problematic. It would be better if leg/hip restraints were on a separate strap for independent adjustment.

Installation Type: The anchor strap has a tilt forward buckle that never loosens, making it hard to remove; requires forcing slack to unlatch anchor hooks. Previously used Graco with a button release system for the anchor strap.

The material is so soft and I imagine very comfy for the little babe! It was a little confusing to install, so we just used YouTube, and followed a installation video! It took about 29 mins to install, but we love it! Highly recommend :)

Review:
Bought 2 of these car seats (one red, one blue) for our 9 month old twins, since they are outgrowing their carriers. I was willing to pay the higher cost because these are by far the most narrow seats I could find. We have 5 kids total...3 in car seats and another in a booster. Fitting it all in our van gets tricky. But the narrow design was really helpful. The seats are really heavy so I don't recommend if you're going to be moving them around a lot or swapping cars a lot. But you can tell they're well made. I also like that everything has its own little storage place. So if your not using a certain strap it's tucked away neatly, not just floating about.
I'm considering purchasing another for our 4 year old who's still in a car seat, especially since she can use it as a booster as well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 9 month old, 4 year old
Material: well made

Review: We have a Toyota Yaris and 2 of these fit in the back seat with room to spare in the middle.  SUPER easy to install with the latch system. Our almost-4-year-old rides front facing (he's super tall and heavy!), and he has plenty of room for his long legs.  Only "bad" thing is the cup holders are a little small -- a Nuk sippy cup won't fit securely.

Review:
We have fitted the Advocate in both of our cars and also own a Marathon 70. In comparison, the Advocate looks bulkier due to the side protection components. But, in practice, the seat fits beautifully and it's no more difficult to get our 2.5yr old in or out of it. She seems to be able to see out of it well, too.

Comparable to the Marathon, the seat is very well made and sturdy. We also really like the material that Britax uses for the seat, it cleans up well. :-)

Adjustments to the shoulder straps are cake, and the handle to alter the back piece is very easy to use as well. Overall, we think this is the best car seat we've used and it will serve our daughter well for a very long time. Easy 5-stars...
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Material: cleans up well

Review: I wish I could upload pictures of the differences between the seats but my phone isn't letting me for some reason. I have purchased two britax car seats for my babies. My first back in 2015 and one last year. I know that Britax has changed their design slightly and it's enough to make me very concerned and doubtful I'll ever purchase another car seat made by them again. Quality of materials is poorer in my 2017 model than my 2015 model. The plastic isn't as strong, I can squeeze and have actually dented the newer models plastic, the seat base is different containing less of the protective metal than the older model. And I think the assembly was much much sloppier in the newer model car seat than the older one... There are those black round metal fasteners that are completely missing on the head protector. It is secured by tape only. I do not like these changes, seems like alot of changes to save a buck or two... Well you just lost a customer Britax! I'll turn everyone I talk to about car seats away from your seats from now on.

Review:
Purchased it as we were going on vacation and needed something light and easy to set.
PROS:
- Easy to carry around, not only because it’s light but due to the backpack bag it comes with.
- It has 2 different ways you can select from to set up in the car. Either the anchor belts on the sides or by putting a seat belt behind it. After doing some research I found that you have to pick one of the two securing methods, it’s not recommend to place both at the same time unless you car manual deems it necessary. Reason being that certain pressure points were tested on each method and those can be off if you secure the seat using both methods.
- Easy and fast to set up in car
CONS:
- The belt that goes between the child’s legs to click onto the shoulder belts is very short. I’m not sure if there’s a certain extender they sell after realizing they might have miscalculated when creating it but I’ve read many parents have complained about the exact thing.
- There’s no place for a child to put their head on the sides if they’re sleeping.
- Too Expensive for a seat your child won’t be able to comfortably use on a day to day
- The belts used to tight the anchors of the car seat to the car as extremely difficult to tighten. We tried tightening it while pushing down the side button and it was very difficult we also tried without pressing the side button and it was equally as difficult.

Overall we like the seat for travel because of how light it is, but I wish it was more practical so I could continue using it as my everyday car seat. Unfortunately, because of the short belt between the child’s legs this isn’t a car seat I could realistically use with my child for long as he’d be too uncomfortable.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: anchor belts on the sides, seat belt behind it
Harness Type: belt that goes between the child’s legs to click onto the shoulder belts, short belt between the child’s legs
Material:

Review:
When our son became too tall for his infant seat (the Chicco keyfit 30) we agonized over which convertible seat to get. I wasn't overly concerned with pricing but really wanted to get the seat that was the safest for him. It's such an overwhelming decision compared with the infant seat, which was a piece of cake. So many options.

Consumer Reports gave this one the highest marks for safety so we went with it. I can now see however why it didn't score highest marks for ease of use. Once you know what you're doing, it's easy enough to install (although I haven't yet tried it in the back of a taxi while the driver taps his foot waiting for me to finish). We put it in the center position of my 2013 Subaru Outback because that's the safest position although it means using the seatbelt rather than the LATCH system. I can't wait until it's standard to have LATCH in all three rear seats of most vehicles.

The biggest annoyance with this seat is the strap tightening/loosening mechanisms. They're just poorly thought out and make it a frustrating process to get your kid properly buckled into the seat. I also wish there was a way to hold the straps to the side of the seat so that my toddler doesn't sit in on them every single time he gets in it, and I then have to dig them out from underneath him to buckle.

Size wise, it seems to be middle of the range. Sure it's heavy, but not so heavy that I can't lift it. It's also not the widest I've seen although I know there are a couple of others specifically designed to be narrow (the Radians I believe). My son is 17 mths, about 22lbs and 31" and he has a decent amount of leg room rear facing.

We're now looking for a second seat for my partner's car and we won't get the same one. I want one that's easier to use, and that comes with a built in belt lockoff in case we're in taxis etc that do not have auto lock seat belts (I don't want to mess around with a belt clip). I also want one that's more conducive to air travel.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: seatbelt, LATCH
Harness Type: strap tightening/loosening mechanisms, straps
Weight Range of Child: 22lbs
Seat Type: Rear facing

Review: This car seat is great, specifically because the functions are easy to use and it's actually lightweight. The colors are gender neutral, so that's a plus. There's a lot of cushioning, making the seat comfortable for the child. There is a latch in the front that adjusts the bottom of the seat, changing it from infant and toddler position. The latch is conveniently located in the front so you don't have to lift the entire seat to do it. Also, the head rest slides up a few levels, by pulling it up to the desired level- there is no removing and having to take anything off to adjust things. My favorite part is the straps, they can be adjusted to different level by pulling them up or down and making sure they snap at that level. That is so much better than removing the car seat and taking the straps out and re-adjusting them. You don't even have to take the child out of the seat to do this. Overall, it is a great car seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant and toddler position
Installation Type: latch
Harness Type: straps

Review:
I love my Safety 1st Guide 65 Convertable Car Seat and so does my son!

Pro's:
- Stain free
- Smell free
- Very comfortable and soft (see image of cushion compression)
- Easy to buckle baby in with the lower buckle as opposed to other brands (*ahem* Baby Trend) with the inconvenient lower clasp that takes both hands and plenty of concentration. The larger chest plate seems to stay put easier and the lower buckle can be clasped one side at a time
- Easy installation
- Compatible with any (safe) vehicle because of its compact yet full coverage design
- Stylish and versatile color palette
- Every bit of bang you can get for your buck! This is cheap but high quality!

Con's:
- Uh?
- Doesn't come in a size that mom fits in too! I love it so much that I want one! (I'm joking of course)

Bottom line - EXCELLENT DEAL. Hits every quality I look for in a good purchase.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertable Car Seat

Harness Type: Easy to buckle baby in with the lower buckle, larger chest plate, lower buckle can be clasped one side at a time

Review: Our toddler really likes this seat after growing out of the standard car seat. It seems comfy with some head support, it reclines slightly, it has a cup holder and arm rests.  It keeps the seatbelt across the hips and in a good position across the shoulder.  It is very easy to buckle up and move from car to car. This seat folds.  I gave it three stars for safety only because compared to the car seat, the booster seat does not seem to be as solid. There is a big difference between the two.  In my opinion the car seat sort of cocoons the child while the booster seat is much more open. I know that is by design but I just did not expect such a difference.  Also, it is important to note that the design that makes the seat easy to buckle makes it very simple for the child to unbuckle.  We are using a seatbelt latch cover to keep our toddler from unbuckling.

Review:
Installation was weird but whatever.

I love the size and lightweight-ness of this car seat. My partner and I have smaller vehicles and so we were really concerned about getting a big car seat so the dimensions were the key thing we were looking at. THIS WAS PERFECT. Also it's smaller than the infant snug lock version even in rear facing.

We have a 2-door and subcompact so leg room for the first passenger was something we wanted to save space on....or rather savor.

Now my only thing is the installation. Not easy. Not simple. Kinda annoying but we got it done. Def would like something that didn't take so much time to figure out. It wiggled a lot and then it wasn't leveled so we kept at it for awhile. Again, my main concern was the size and that it fit both cars since we have smaller cars.

This did that.

My son loves the car seat too. Super comfy and the cup holder is a plus for both he and I.

We have an early 2013 model, and some reviewers have said there have been changes made... but the straps have some horrible flaws: A) they are not long enough... especially if your child has a jacket on... you have hardly any working room to get them tightened B) the awful shoulder pads, need I say more... read other reviews C) you cannot move the straps out of the way before putting the child in, so you will be digging underneath your child to find the straps, and in the process you will end up getting the slideable buckles reversed on the straps... this is a great joy to have to fix while your kid is squirming around let me tell you...

Other than that, the padding material looks very comfortable and holds up well... maybe a little hot for summer time... but it looks like it is quality and wont get broken down for a long time...

Review:
This carseat is THE BEST seat out there. After researching online and personally trying out dozens of car seats in stores, I finally came across this gem. The full-size canopy is superb. The padding and cushion on this seat beat every seat in the stores ... I have tried them all. It is even cushier than the Chicco Keyfit 30, and the newborn support is excellent. The latch system is just as easy as they describe (see video on the Evenflo website for a live demo), and not having to rethread the straps is priceless. The one downside is that it is heavy (11.6 lbs without the base) but the handle is so comfortable for carrying that it seems much easier to carry than other brands and models.

Ordered from amazon in February 2012 and received a carseat manufactured in December 2011. Perfect. Couldn't ask for better service.

Review:
Our 18 month old had out-grown her rear-facing Graco car-seat with stroller. We saw other Triumph 65 models at various local stores but the price on here was much better. This is a huge upgrade from her old seat in comfort and sizing. We rally have only three minor complaints:

1. The cup holder is pathetic. We didn't even bother attaching it.
2. It was a little difficult to get tightened down to the van seat when rear facing. I ended up using both the anchor clips AND the seatbelt to tighten it down.
3. The strap loosen/tighten mechanism some times jams and makes it a little difficult to loosen the straps to get the child out.

Otherwise, we are very happy with the purchase. From placing our child in comparible seats in-stores this one seemed to be the most comfortable one that actually had a legitimate (although not extremely easy to use) recline feature. Some of the others say they recline, but the degree of recline is so laughable on most of the other models that I would be ashamed to even list it in the product features.

We currently use it as a 5 point booster for our daughter, but our son uses it with the head piece and a seatbelt.  When he gets a little taller we'll just use the base with a seat belt.

He doesn't seem to be comfortable enough in other car seats. I know this ia the preference of a person that still messes in their pants, but his likes and dislikes are directly related to the amount of sleep I get in a night. And this car seat is easy to get my little one in and out of, secures very sturdily in the car with room to spare (I drive a 2009 Honda civic), and the buckles are easy to operate with one hand but not easy enough that the child is going to accidentally unbuckle themselves. All in all a great car seat.

Review:
We didn't purchase ours from Amazon, but I got it at Target. It was a bit of an emergency, as we'd had a Maxi-Cosi Pria 70 that we discovered was a defective product and couldn't be used safely anymore, so we needed a new seat ASAP.

I am so, so, so happy with this purchase. This thing is built like a tank. It means it's a fairly heavy seat, but that doesn't bother me. It takes up less room front-to-back than the Pria did, and the install is insanely easy (especially compared to the Pria). It's so easy to get a rock solid, perfect install on this with no wiggling--I love that.

The fabric is high quality and is actually quite cool in the summer. We have had a little bit of issue with tightening the straps, as mentioned, but it's gotten better with time, and I did learn to pull the strap hugs down a bit before which helps. My son is really comfortable, and is still rear-facing at 14 months (and has plenty of room to continue doing so for a long time to come).

I will absolutely buy a second NextFit for our next child!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-facing

Installation Type: install is insanely easy, easy to get a rock solid, perfect install

Also was in need of new boosters because our current seats were near expiration anyway.  Worked out perfectly.  Traveling back home with them was a breeze too.  My girls strapped them to their rolling suit cases, and drug them through the airports themselves.  They fit perfectly under the seats in front of them in the airplane and when we got home, I scrapped the expiring seats, and replaced them with these.  Easy peasy.

Review: This is the best brand car seat I have ever purchased. My son loves it and I feel like it is great quality! We started purchasing safety first when my youngest turned 6 moths. Our son was wanted one so we got him one too. The cheap transition seats went in my husband’s car. Well now it’s time replace those due to height and weight. The new Mickey one is in my van and our son loves it! We have gotten compliments on it from multiple people too!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
I researched car seats extensively before buying this seat. I decided I did not want to spend $300 on a Britax. Out of the seats that got respectable safety and quality ratings and reviews, this one had the highest shoulder strap slots (I literally measured several seats myself). By the time my daughter turned four she was 43 inches tall but only 37 pounds. Major problem: her shoulders were too high for the five point harness, the shoulder straps of which were now just below her shoulders, but the car seat isn't supposed to be used as a booster seat with the car's seat belt until the child is 40 pounds. The car seat is useless until she grows, creating a gap in use.

LATCH Problem: There is a secondary strap sewn to the main LATCH strap that keeps the LATCH strap looped through the correct part of the back of the seat, but in a Ford Focus, a Chevy Suburban and a Mitsubishi Montero it is in the way of properly tightening the strap so I had to use the car's seat belt and a locking clip in those cars. The LATCH strap does work in my Honda Odyssey.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 40 pounds
Installation Type: LATCH, seat belt
Harness Type: five point harness

Review: I bought this to replace a cheaper Cosco seat my daughter was using. I wish I'd have just purchased this from the get go!  It fits in my Honda CR-V very well. My daughter seems comfortable and no longer complains in the car. It's easy to install and adjust too. I recommend it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: easy to install

It took patients just like any other car seat does. The assembly was hard for me a small and not strong however my fiance was able to get it to firmly click together.

Review: It was very fast to snap the top to the bottom. My 9 1/2 year old is very tall and thin and doesn’t really care for no car seats. It’s hard to sleep on trips and she slides around in the seat and that nakedness me nervous. I had gotten the Diono Radian since it was a 5 pt harness. She liked the secure feeling until the last month when her shoulders wouldn’t fit. The radian fits my 5 yr old perfectly and will for sometime. So.. we tried out this Monterey XT. It still has lots of room before we max out the head rest height, the width adjuster was fine without adjusting it yet which means lots of room to grow! It reclines very easily with the seat itself without clicking or being restricted. It will go as far back as the seat will I think! Before a trip, we always recline the kids seats so they can sleep. Now they both have the safety of the diono, headrest to sleep and both have room to grow!!

Review: This is a fantastic Highback Booster Seat and a replacement for the first Graco Carseat we purchased.  We have a very tall 5 year old and even though our original seat could be converted to a highback booster he looked cramped.  With this seat he has plenty of room and it will be much cooler and breathable in the hot summer.  He absolutely loves the snack cup.  I don't understand the complaints with regards to the latch system as my husband and I found it very easy to install and very secure; I am glad I disregarded the negative reviews and ordered this seat.  I just placed an order for another one for our second vehicle and I intend to get a third seat for his grandmothers vehicle.  Great value and the safety and security of the Graco product line behind it.

We have tried everything - we've spent hours taking it apart and putting it back together but cannot get the straps to extend enough to close around her - and she is VERY PETITE, weight in at only 30 lbs. I wish I could return this carseat, I am so dissapointed. We have several Britax convertable carseats which are much easier to take apart and put back together, but they are very bulky. I've ordered a sunshine radian xtsl to replace it as I heard that one is much easier to put together if taken apart.

Review: My husband and I purchased this seat for our son who, at 7 months, was 20 lbs and 27 inches.  He just looked too squished in his infant seat.  He has plenty of room in this seat, almost to where he looks small again!  He seems to enjoy this seat more (he screamed in the car on most trips in the other one) as he can see out the windows now.  Our state requires him to be a year old as well as 20 lbs before he can sit front-facing so it's been nice to have that option for him while he's still stuck looking at the back of the car.  We've had the seat for just over a month now and it went in pretty easily and fits in the middle of our Acura TL but my husband can't drive if it's behind the driver's seat.  It fits really well in our MDX however, even though it is a little bulky.  That seems to be the case with most convertibles thought and we noticed the same thing with our friend's Britax when we had both seats in the TL.  We have noticed his head dropping a bit at the beginning when he falls asleep but nothing a blanket tucked in couldn't fix and he's seemed to have adjusted as it doesn't seem to be a problem any longer.  Overall, I was impressed with the reviews and safety ratings and our son seems to be comfortable in it.  The only downside is the size, which again, at rear-facing seems to be the case with most convertibles.  I would recommend this seat overall.

Weight Range of Child: 20 lbs

Review: Bought the plus version of this seatand one of the latches will not work. This doesn't make the seat unusable, but I did pay extra for the functionality.  Called the support number and was roles to file a warranty claim on their website, which I did.  1 month ago and to contact from them. 5 ⭐ for the seat, 1 star ⭐ for the warranty

Review: I bought one of these for my son 2 years ago and now one for my daughter (7 months old).  The knob for tightening the straps took a little getting used to but after using one rear facing that had a strap, I much prefer the knob on this car seat.  It is great and easy to use and my son enjoys it.  The cup holder is pretty much useless but that's ok with me.  I also LOVE the way the straps can easily be adjusted for height--I feel this allows for the best fit all of the time.  It is a pretty wide seat so if you want to get more than 2 seats across the back of a car or would like to be able to fit someone else in the back seat with them then this is not the seat for you.  (We have a Pontiac Vibe.) Anyway, love this seat and the price is great compared to some other brands.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Harness Type: straps, knob for tightening the straps, straps can easily be adjusted for height

Review: Works great in the back seat of a Tesla 3. The Chicco one we used to have was too wide and covered the seat belt fastener making it very difficult for my son to get buckled. This one is a way better fit but my son says it’s not very comfortable.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: I loved the idea. But using this on 4 separate planes with two kiddos was more work than it was worth. I was pretty quick at getting it all together but the suitcase simply isn't made to hold that kind of weight. I felt like the handle would break. If you have a younger toddler then it'll likely be ok but any kid over 25 pounds is gonna put a big strain on the handle. Next time I'll just buy the car seat cart thing and carry on a backpack. I would only use this again if we are not checking bags and have to take carry-on luggage.
Attribute_Related_Content: Weight Range of Child: over 25 pounds

Review:
COLOR DOES NOT MATCH PHOTO - I bought this as a present - We have a similar model for our son and it full fills as Graco promises. it's been more than 2 yrs and still up and all ok. While the gotham color seems Bluish, the one that came is grey.... sadly with WHITE pad!!! that for who ever that had carried kids in a car knows is a burden....
It came grey the first time, asked for a return as I've thought it was a mistake, received the replacement very promptly all cool with the return process... but same color. Now came to read the comments and see that someone else commented on it....
oh well can't change it again, cause need to travel with it... I'm sure the product will be fine, but if you are picky with colors you'll be disappointed.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: COLOR DOES NOT MATCH PHOTO, gotham color seems Bluish, the one that came is grey, WHITE pad

Review:
I havent used this car seat yet so will update accordingly at a later date. However, out of the box, I'm thoroughly impressed.

Purchased for my 6th baby. So I'm no stranger to carseats and features. This one had every feature important to me.

The fabric is great. T shirt type material, soft. Lots of padding. Which was important to me as we are very rural and baby needs to be in the seat for extended periods of time. I had issues in the past with my babies fussing in other seats because they were hard and uncomfortable. So I appreciate the extra comfort. With that, I anticipate this seat to hold heat tho.

One handed handle operation. This is a great feature. All too many times, mamas are holding a sleeping baby and trying to transfer to a car seat, only to find the handle forward as we juggle holding baby and trying to get a handle back with 2 hands. The one handed operation is a timesaver. I've played with it enough that I dont foresee a problem accidently moving the handle.

Adjustable crotch snap. This feature is wonderful for a growing baby. Too many carseats have the buckle set in one place and lil babies are slouching and bigger babies are pinched. So to be able to move closer/further away with growth is a great security and comfort factor.

No puzzle lock. OMG...who's idea was that anyway? I detest puzzle locks. This one buckles in, straight, from each side without having to twist and turn the 2 buckles together before inserting into the latch.

The headrest and buckles seem to be easy to move. Just a button to press and pull to adjust. I've had too many carseats that straps had to literally be removed and rethreaded. It's a pain. I already appreciate the ease of adjustments with this one. Same with the harness. A button to press to loosen and tighten when putting baby in and removing.

The boot. I live in cold weather. The boot is a great extra feature. My complaint on this one...it doesnt securely attach. Merely clips on. I can already forsee it sliding. So we will see. I may make some amendments to it to attach it more securely.

The canopy is the best. You can literally pull it down completely to the boot. No more sunshine beaming in babys face. There is a mesh window towars the back for airflow and to let you peek in.

The base seems simple and solid to install. It also includes a feature to lock a seatbelt into place that would otherwise slide, requiring an additional metal lock, in the past, to be placed on seatbelts to circumvent. Yes, latch is included as well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: fabric is great, T shirt type material, soft, lots of padding, anticipate this seat to hold heat
Harness Type: harness, a button to press to loosen and tighten
Installation Type: latch, lock a seatbelt into place

Review: Really like the seat itself....the cushioning where the seatbelt slides through is so thick that the belt gets stuck and I have to manually slide it back and forth which is very inconvenient feeding the seatbelt back into the compartment it comes from....would have liked a little more space in the red plastic part and cushioning where the seatbelt goes through....had I known this ahead of time, I probably would have purchased a different seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review: I bought this car seat for my 5th child, so we've been through a lot of seats. This one is fine, but the buckles are tough to buckle and the straps are harder to get tight than other car seats we've owned.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: buckles are tough to buckle, straps are harder to get tight

Review: THIS PRODUCT IS JUNK!!! I cannot stress this enough! This car seat's unique and main idea is that it holds the seatbelt down instead of lifting the child up like what a booster seat does. This idea allowed them to make a compact seat that easily travels. But what happens when the part called the QuickClip that HOLDS the seatbelt down snaps in half? You have a piece of JUNK! I do not understand why the founder, designer, engineer, and Q&A thought it was a good idea to use a flimsy, brittle piece of plastic for their patented QuickClip, which this car seat design revolves around. We unsnap the Quickclip and it snapped...in half at it's thinnest point. Needless to say the Mifold is going straight to the garbage can.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: holds the seatbelt down, QuickClip that HOLDS the seatbelt down, unsnap the Quickclip

Review:
It's a little bit of a pain to install if you're having to transfer between vehicles that make it so you have to keep adjusting the length of the latch belt. Otherwise, it's easy to install if you're just moving it from one side of your backseat to the other side.

My toddler loves her new car seat from the color to the extra leg room. She tends to prefer to sit with the bottoms of her feet together versus her legs stretched out. She likes it that she can do both comfortably. The only thing she doesn't like is that her head hangs down onto her shoulder when she falls asleep. I know that all of the toddler car seats allow a lot of head room versus the infant car seats. So, I'll look into getting her something to make her more comfortable for when she chooses to nap in the car seat. Otherwise, we both love this car seat. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAR SEAT. It's steel frame was a big factor in my choice of car seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: a pain to install if you're having to transfer between vehicles that make it so you have to keep adjusting the length of the latch belt; easy to install if you're just moving it from one side of your backseat to the other side
Material: steel frame

Review: I love this car seat. The color isn't my favorite. In the picture it looks more gray, but it's definitely tan and black and not matching the other interior in my car. Maybe I'm a little OCD but I don't like that my car seats don't match. Other than that it's super comfortable. The cup holder is a must and my kids really use that. The storage compartment is a little hard to slide out for kids. So we don't really take advantage of that feature very much . My son is two and a half  years old  and really tall for his age. This car seat fits him just right. I have the same one for my older daughter and she still loves it. We have to move car seats in and out of cars all the time and so this is an excellent choice since it's super light an easy to transfer.
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review: I really like this seat compared to the other carseats Ive had. My 3 year old fits in it well and likes that he can actually climb up in it easily on his own. It came fully assembled which is nice. You dont even have to put the cover on it. The strap cinches easily. With my other carseats, I could never tighten them just using the strap in the front. I would have to reach behind the seat and pull them there too. With this one, I no longer have to do that.  The latch system tightens way better than other car seats I have used also.

Review: Easiest install (latch push and go) of ANY car seat I've encountered. I LOVED this car seat. Unfortunately, I got in a car accident and when I ordered new ones I ordered the wrong model which doesn't have this push down to tighten feature... I really miss it :(

Special Features: Online Chat: Chat with our ParentLink customer service experts online in real time, Live Video Installation Support: Schedule an appointment to have a certified car seat safety technician guide you through a proper vehicle installation
Review:
As a parent, safety is my top priority when it comes to car seats for my children. That's why I was thrilled to find the Evenflo EveryFit 4-in-1 Convertible Car Seat. This car seat is designed to grow with your child from infancy through the toddler years, making it a great investment for the long term.

One of the features I love about this car seat is the 4-in-1 design. It easily transitions from a rear-facing seat for infants, to a forward-facing seat for toddlers, to a high back booster seat, and finally to a no-back booster seat. This means that I can trust that my child is always in the safest position for their age and size.

The car seat also has a 5-point harness system and energy-absorbing foam for added protection in case of an accident. And the adjustable headrest and shoulder straps ensure that the seat is always a perfect fit for my child.

Overall, I am extremely satisfied with the safety and versatility of the Evenflo EveryFit 4-in-1 Convertible Car Seat. I highly recommend it to any parent looking for a reliable and safe car seat for their child.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible Car Seat, rear-facing seat for infants, forward-facing seat for toddlers, high back booster seat, no-back booster seat
Harness Type: 5-point harness system

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: Wow! So many companies design holders that hold your car seat to your luggage.. but those can be expensive. When I'm talking about holders, I'm referring to actual plastic adapters that the car seats fit in with wheels. This product is really just a Y shaped nylon string that is very durable. It is expensive for what it is, but is much cheaper than buying those car seat adapters. We recently used this on a flight from the DC area to Hawaii and it worked wonders. We were able to attach our car seat for the airplane directly onto one of our carry on luggages. We just adjusted the straps on the car seat and then tightened them once it was connected to the luggage. It was a life saver to help us get around the airports.

Review: I bought this so I would always be ready to transport my granddaughter.  I like this seat very much.  I find it very easy to get her in and the release on the straps makes it very easy to get her out.  She is very secure when strapped in and I really like the side head padding.  My daughter and son-in-law approved this before I purchased it and once it was here they liked it better then the ones they already had!

You place it as the directions say but it does not replace a booster seat, this does not work at all, my 6 and 8 year old used it and I had to buy another booster seat so they could really be safe. They should ban this!!

Review:
My son has been using this seat since he was 6 months old (2013) and had grown out of his other infant seat. I love the seat! It seems to be very comfortable for my son and he almost always falls asleep in it and he is now just over 2. The only problem as of recently, is the tightening strap and release button unit keeps popping out when I go to tighten it. Very frustrating. Have to try and contact company for warranty info.
I have contacted Chicco and they are sending a new seat right out. They were very helpful and are based out of USA. They didn't not have the right color but you can change the cover.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: tightening strap and release button unit keeps popping out when I go to tighten it

Review: Compared to the previous "regular" carseat, I couldn't believe how incredibly easy this was to install! I've only used it a couple of times but my grandson really seems to enjoy it. Also much easier to get him in and out.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: incredibly easy to install

Review: We've been using this carseat since our little one was about a year old, and we love it. All you have to do is look at and feel it to know it is SO much better than your average plastic carseat. It is bulky, and it is heavy, but I feel that's a good thing, makes for a safer seat. It's easy to adjust, but I usually "click" it more than once. Don't rely on the "click and safe" feature to tell you when the straps are snug enough. They will stop at a coat, etc., so you need to manually snug it around Baby's legs, then make sure straps are snug at shoulders. I think this is way worth the extra money, think of it as an investment in your baby's safety. Also, it should work until Baby is big enough to go straight to a seatbelt, so there's no booster seat to buy later. We did use a "bucket" carseat until Baby got bigger. We're expecting #2, and intend to buy another Britax Advocate, and possibly just an infant insert, so we can try to use it straight from birth. We love this carseat, it gives me peace of mind knowing that I got the best seat I could find. I highly recommend it!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: from birth, until big enough for seatbelt
Installation Type: Clicktight
Harness Type: straps
Material: plastic

Review: We needed a booster to switch between cars & for grandparent use. They are not the best with car seats, so the ease of use with this one was key. The height adjustment has made it great for several kids to use and the belt guide is very obvious and easy. ( Again, great for those not super familiar with car seats/boosters ). The only complaint we received after a long car trip was the lack of cushion on the upper back. It's not as comfortable as their everyday Diono seat, but not uncomfortable. Great booster, super lightweight and I know my child's safety is ensured when I use any Diono.

The material is really nice and smooth and looks very high-end, but the headrest tilts forward and pushes my child's head forward.  I tried it with both my 8 month old and 3 year old.  It looks uncomfortable. I am debating on whether to return this or not.  I just ordered a Maxi Cosi Magellan and will see if that one is better than the Graco.

Review: This carseat is horrible! I used the Sungride Classic with my older two children. We were in an accident and the insurance had us order this new Sungride, because it had to be the same make and model. Apparently the Classic is discontinued, so they paid for this SnugRide Click Connect 30. This is not the same. It doesn't fit my stroller or other base. It is also a nightmare to adjust the straps. It only adjusts in the back and they do not secure in place on the tallest setting. My infant is 6 months old. She was able, after one use, to wiggle the straps loose. I called Graco and since it was brand new, they said to take it back to the retailer for a refund. Do not buy this. The straps are supposed to be tight on the Baby, there should never be slack, especially additional slack as the day goes on. The only thing I liked was that it is light weight, which makes it easier to carry. The material also made my daughter sweat, pretty heavily.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: SnugRide Click Connect 30
Installation Type: base
Harness Type: straps
Material: made my daughter sweat

Review: This is a well made car seat with some nice features without breaking your pockets. I bought this to be a seat in my husband's car. Our daughter usually rides with me but it's good to have an extra seat around. The fabric isn't quite as plush as I would have liked but it is still soft. The dual handles for adjusting the harness do take a little strength, not as easy as the one handed version, but still gets the job done. My husband's car doesn't have LATCH and it's a good thing because the seat has the anchor clip type of latches and not the push button, which is a real pain. The fabric and cup holder come off easily for cleaning and the fabric can be dried in a dryer. My daughter loves sitting in this seat and it seems to give her a lot of leg room in the reversed mode. For about $100, I don't think you'll find better features.

It was easy to put together and works great in my car.  My Son loves that he now uses a "grown up" seat belt.  The seat is easy to keep clean and easy to move around if needed.  I'm not sure how comfortable it would be for long trips, but short trips are just fine.  Happy with the purchase and would buy again.

Review: This is our 3rd infant car seat with our 3 different kids and I have to say it has been my favorite. My older kids are in Britax seats and I love them so it doesn't surprise me that I'd love this one as well since they make a great product. My son sems to be really comfortable in it and it is very easy to switch the base between cars. It's on the heavy side but they all are. You won't be disappointed with this car seat!

Well, it neglected to say that it needs a towel or something to go under the carseat for rear facing under a certain weight to reach the level needed for rear facing. Which also did NOT include anything to get that incline for rear facing. (Honesty putting something under the carseat does not seem safe at all!)I only found that bit of information in the manual. So if you have a little one, do NOT get this carseat. Unless, your kiddo is forward facing. I guess so our money isn't wasted, we will have to keep this carseat when our daughter gets older.

I do like the foot extender as my grandson is tall for his age and when my daughter-in-law lets me forward face the seat I think the foot extender will be wonderful.  I would recommend this.

Review:
I like this booster, the best part of it that it latches!
The part that is not convenient is that it is maybe too wide and my daughter has troubles buckling herself - we have Nissan Rogue 2012. Almost all the time I have to buckle her up. It stays in the middle. She is ok unbuckling. We are buying the same one for the second car

Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: latches

Review:
I'm singing the ClickTight praises now. We have this seat and the Boulevard G4. I bought the ClickTight for my car, as it is our primary vehicle. We got the cheaper G4 for my husband's vehicle. At first, I was regretting my ClickTight purchase. This sucker is HEAVY. I also felt that it was difficult to uninstall (tip on that later). That said, it offers more cushion and side protection than the G4, so I stuck with it.

Fast forward to a recent trip with a rental car...I wished that I had the ClickTight functionality with me. We brought the G4, as it is lighter. While it was nice not breaking our backs through the airport, I broke my back and more trying to install the dadgum thing in the rental car. Even the LATCH anchors were a pain to click into the sedan (Toyota Corolla). Then, I decided to move the seat to the middle and install with a seat belt. It took 45 minutes, multiple crying jags, and several terse words thrown at my husband before I got an unsatisfactory install. The ClickTight would have taken all of 3 minutes (yes, I've timed it now).

Pros:
-Incredibly easy install
-Comfy ride for kiddo
-Will last my kid for years
-Super safe

Cons:
-HEAVY
-Can be hard to remove (made MUCH easier by putting a knee into the seat before twisting the ClickTight knob)

If you want the ultimate in protection and ease of install, this puppy is for you. If you plan on toting it through the airport regularly or from cab to cab, think again. The heft isn't worth it. If you need a seat that can be popped into Grandma's/the babysitter's/your SO's car with ease, it's a no brainer. Get it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: ClickTight, LATCH, seat belt
Weight Range of Child: Will last my kid for years
Material: more cushion and side protection

Review: great quality and easy to ajust. also easy to set up, and take out. and set up again. my daughter loves the cupholders for toys or cup. although i do wish it had the extendable foot tray, like others i looked at. but i know my daughter is safe in this.

The seat belt positioner is great at keeping the belt in the right spot. Arm rests are a little short, and hard to rest your arms on if there is a cup in there...oh well!

Review: This carseat is really nice! It is very easy to install. It's very comfortable, and durable. It's well worth the price! I like that it had the shoulder harness pads and the pad where the belts clip in, so that they aren't digging into the babies legs. If you're not sure which car seat to get, this is it! I did so much research online and decided on this one, and now I am so glad I did!

Review:
It was a great price for the value, it seems like it will last baby a long time. It's easy to remove and replace in the base. Extra bases are available, although a bit pricey.
It feels safe, and it looks good. It's easy to adjust the straps, but a little hard to adjust the threads.
It's a little heavy after a while, but baby seems comfortable in it. I will likely use britax for all things concerning baby's transportation.
Definitely a fan of this product.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: base
Harness Type: straps

Review:
I've had this carseat for 3 months now. I replaced a Safety 1st Alpha Omega elite car seat with this one, and I'm so glad I did.

Pros:

Strap adjustment: So easy. Simply slide the strap loop end off the hook, pull through the back of the seat, stick it through the shoulder heighth you want, and then slide it back on the hook thing. No complicated re-threading, and yet it's still a very secure connection. Also very easy to tighten and loosen. In fact, everytime I put my child in the carseat, I loosen the shoulder straps, buckle him in, and then tighten the straps around his shoulders. It only takes a second, and I'm sure of a secure fit every single time.

Comfort: This seat sits high. If your car has low ceilings, maybe that would be a nuisance getting him in, but I'm putting my kiddo in the back of an extended cab 4door pickup which is very roomy. The seat sitting so high off the bench makes it very easy for my son to see out the window. He likes that. The padding is comfortable and the seat is wide. My toddler is average height & weight (50th percentile). The seat also is angled back a little more than the Safety 1st one we had. So if my son falls asleep, he is a little more comfortable.

Safety: This carseat feels sturdy. The wings on either side of my toddlers head give me piece of mind about side impact. The child sits more deeply in this seat than our old one, so I feel like he's better protected.

Practicalilty: This seat is easy to wipe down with a damp cloth. The fabric doesn't hold crumbs.

Cons:

Size: This seat is huge. It DOES fit in my Nissan Sentra, but it's huge. I have 2 of these in the back of my nissan and you cannot use the 3rd seatbelt. You also cannot put them right next to each other in the Nissan, however you CAN put them next to each other in roomy cab of the pickup and I've put them next to each other in the back of a Suburban and they fit. Also, if you want to use it rear-facing in a small car, you'll have to either use the center seatbelt or move the front seat really far foward to fit it on a side seatbelt.

Summary: If you have a larger vehicle, you can't go wrong with this seat. Comfortable, easy to adjust, safe, and nice looking. If you have a tiny car, you won't want to try to fit 2 of these in there. And rear facing is limited where it will fit in a small car.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: strap adjustment, easy to tighten and loosen, shoulder straps
Material: easy to wipe down with a damp cloth, fabric doesn't hold crumbs

Review: I read a lot of reviews before purchasing this seat for my 11 month old daughter. We've been very happy with it so far. Just some information that may help potential buyers - My daughter is a little over 20 lbs and 29 inches. We took out the top insert around the head area but left the bottom insert for now, and she fits comfortably and seems to like it. We use it rear-facing in the middle seat of our 2006 Toyota Highlander, and I was able to fit another forward facing car seat and a high-backed booster on either side to transport a friend's children. I like that it comes with belt covers where the belts touch her neck, and it seems durable and like it would be easy to clean. We paid around 170, but I saw it on sale later for 135 and wish I would have waited. 170 was a little high. We have had no issues with accessing the release lever that loosens the straps. I would definitely purchase this seat again, but I probably would wait for it to go on sale because I'm cheap!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 20 lbs
Installation Type: middle seat

Review:
The good:
✓ Very easy to assemble (I only cracked open the instructions after I had it in place)
✓ Takes only seconds to install thanks to the single-latch system
✓ Comfortable with memory foam like padding
✓ Bench seat Friendly narrow profile
✓ Clean design
✓ Fabrics surfaces are easy to remove (great for cleaning if/when they get soiled)
✓ High safety rating

The meh:
☹ No metal parts on hinge, when putting high-back into place I was a bit concerned about breaking the joints.
☹ While removable, the armrest height isn't adjustable and kids grow fast

Conclusion:
I'm happy to recommend this booster seat. This model compares favorably in safety, features, look and feel to booster seats that cost twice as much from "designer" brands. While I wish they included some metal on the critical parts to improve durability, I doubt I'll be moving it much from one car to another.

---
Edit: Can't find the cup holder?
For those (like me) who don't bother reading the instruction manual when setting up the chair, the cup holder arrives tucked away under the seat.

Installation Type: single-latch system
Material: memory foam like padding, Fabrics surfaces are easy to remove

Review: We have three of these seats for our boys (ages 5, 6, and 7). These are great seats for travel, as they collapse and fit inside a carry bag. Perfect to throw into your carry on or suitcase! I could also have really used these when we had two in car seats and one in a booster. Many vehicles are too narrow to fit three seats across (unless you have a slim seat like a Radian), but these are perfect because there are no hard plastic edges around it that would prevent it from squeezing in a small pace. Our kids think these seats are comfortable, too. We don't use these as our everyday seats, as I do prefer something with a bit more structure (and has a cupholder); however; these are great when you are traveling so you don't have to lug a big booster around with you. They are also great if you are going to be traveling without a rental car, but will be riding in a taxi/Uber etc. Highly recommend!
