Review:
This is an ok car seat. I bought it for my 4th child, and I already want to get rid of it. I am sure it keeps the child perfectly safe. It is definitely the worst car seat I have own. Here are the major engineering flaws:

- the seat cushion is cozy, but it has a lot of overlaying flaps, instead of being one piece of fabric. This means there is several obscure places for food to unnoticably collect.
- under the seat there are crevices for food and any spilt drinks to collect. You may think you cleaned the spill, but unless you pull the cover apart and clean under the cover, deep into the crevices, the split drink will saturate the hiding food and make for a perti dish of pure nastiness.
- the spongy material does not dry quickly and is not easily removing for washing.
- when forward facing, you can no longer use the latch system. You are on to the seat belt latch system. For $300, it should be engineered to latch both ways.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: Latch, Seat Belt
Material: seat cushion, fabric, cover, spongy material

Review:
If you are a serious safety person, buyer beware. In general, this is a well built product with good looks and nice, comfortable material but it has an issue with the belt guide. There is a long story here but the short version is that Diono has not worked out the problem with the belt guide (please note the date of my review) which doesn't reliably retract when a child leans forward and then back. I bought two of these and they were both slow to retract, one worse than the other. Diono sent me their "fix," a new headrest with a supposed redesign. The replacement headrests and belt guide looked identical to my eye but the company rep. told me her engineer inspected my emailed photos and could see the difference. (I thought they sent me the old ones by mistake.) So, I installed the new headrests. One seat performed the same - okay just a little slow to retract. The other performed much worse than the original, binding up and not retracting when my son leaned forward then back. After almost a month total of back and forth at this point, we had a long driving trip coming up in a few days so I decided to reinstall the original headrest. It isn't perfect but it did better than what they called their "fix." I am a safety person and I don't love that we have this product with a question surrounding it. Buyer beware. I wouldn't buy these boosters again. Take a look at the difference between where the belt guide is for the Graco products and where they are for the Diono Monteray (tucked behind the headrest wings) and it will explain why the seat belt can't glide freely. The Monterey would be a great product with the Graco belt guide design.

Update: 6/19/12 I sent my two Diono Monterey seats back. I may never see the $69 in return shipping but I figure my kids are worth more than that. I ended up losing my last thread of confidence in the boosters after braking hard when a vehicle stopped short in front of me. I asked my 5 year old son if he was okay and he said, "My head almost hit the back of your seat, Mommy." That was it for me. I ordered the older version of this seat instead - Sunshine Kids, Monterey, as another reviewer suggested. It's almost exactly the same seat but the belt guides are bigger and lower allowing the seat belt to glide well. I am very satisfied.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: belt guide
Harness Type: seat belt

Review: Received my daughter's Britax Advocate 70 car seat in Serene and I am extremely happy with it! First off, we previously had the Britax B-Safe travel system when our daughter was a newborn and she's used it up until now and she is about to be 1yrs old. She can still fit in it, but I wanted to get her a new one as she's a longer and needs a little more room. It'll also be easier for me to put her in it since I'm still going to have her rear-facing in the middle of the backseat as long as possible. We've been so impressed with the quality and safety with all the Britax car seats and so I knew we would stick with Britax for many years and babies to come! The Advocate itself was clearly well made. You can feel the sturdiness in it and the quality. I chose this particular model because of the extra side-impact protection. It is definitely on the wider side, so if you have an SUV or van, this seat is ideal. While this would still fit into a smaller vehicle, other passengers in the back might be a little cramped. Anyway, be sure the read up and refer the Britax's main website for the additional safety features. In person this car seat is everything I had hoped for regarding safety, quality, longevity, and aesthetics. The serene color is perfect for our cream leather interior and for warmer climates (we travel back and forth from CA to FL) versus the darker black/gray versions. I highly recommend!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-facing
Weight Range of Child: about to be 1yrs old
Installation Type: rear-facing in the middle of the backseat
Material: cream leather interior, serene color

we upgraded to the marathon last week and it has been such a relief. the seat was a breeze to set up. there is a luxury of space for DD and she is so comfortable in it. Review: I bought two mifolds for an upcoming trip. I think I discovered a problem that those who only purchase one don't experience: the red side belt clips/slips are supposed to lock in place (expanded to rear size) when the child is belted, but one of our seats did not. Thus ensued major frustration from my 7yo and myself, trying to get the seatbelt out of the belt clip. As soon as I expanded it, we got the belt and my child out easily. I will be sending that one back, hopefully to get a non-defective one in return. This is a very easy quality-control test that clearly wasn't performed. Both belt side slips easily pushed back in without having to use the red tab, which my other apparent non-defective mifold required to get the belt slips in AND out.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: belt clips/slips are supposed to lock in place; one of our seats did not; Both belt side slips easily pushed back in without having to use the red tab

Review:
I purchased this seat as a backup for my husbands car. I wanted something comfortable and safe, but I didn't want to spend a ton since my daughter only rides in his car a few times a year. This seat is okay. It seems sturdy and my husband was able to install it easily into his civic coupe. This seats works great as a backup, but I wouldn't want it as my main seat as the padding is pretty thin and does not seem very soft or comfortable. Also the straps constantly get tangled and my daughter gets super impatient while we try to untangle them with her in the seat. If you can remember to untangle after you get your child out or if you have a more patient child, then this may not be an issue for you. Overall, I would recommend this seat if you need a backup like us or if you are looking for a sturdy budget friendly carseat.

Pros:
Affordable
Sturdy
Installs easily and feels solid when done correctly
Cute pattern and colors

Cons:
Thin padding
Straps tangle easily
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: Installs easily
Material: Padding is pretty thin, does not seem very soft or comfortable
Harness Type: Straps constantly get tangled

I really like the adjustability of the car seat. I tried another that didn't have the ability to adjust as much as this Graco Slim Fit and had to return it. The other car seat (facing backwards) leaned too far back and would not allow the front passenger seat to move back to a comfortable position (we are tall people). This seat is comfortable for baby and front passenger.
I gave it a 4 star rating because the straps can be hard to tighten if they are not evenly distributed.

Review:
We have had this seat for about 2 years and I absolutely love it!!!

The install on this seat is rock solid. It fits perfectly in my van and looks sharp.

My son is 3 yrs, 7 months and 36 lbs. He is still rearfacing in this seat. My goal was to rearface until 4 yrs old and thanks to Britax, we will likely make it (my son is tall and would have had to flip around in most other seats by now; this seat has one of the highest RF height limits on the market).

I also love the extra side impact protection on the advocate. We drive a mini van that does not have a middle seat in the second row. Having to seat my son outboard made me very nervous but this seat gives me some peace of mind.

Speaking of peace of mind, the steel reinforced frame is awesome. I know they say all carseats are the same as far as safety, but...come on....steel over plastic seems like an obvious choice here.

This is just an all around great seat. My son is comfortable in it, it looks great, and I am confident that I am doing everything in my power to keep him as safe as possible in the car.

Seat Type: rearfacing
Weight Range of Child: 36 lbs
Installation Type: install
Material: steel reinforced frame

Review: She calls it her “comfy seat”. We also have an Evenflo Chase and a Dream on Me. The quality is somewhere between the Chase & the DoM, but definitely a better value. I might purchase another and get rid of the DoM as it just looks uncomfortable.

Review:
After doing a lot of research I decided on the Britax Roundabout 55 so I could get the safety features and high quality from the Britax name without spending a lot of money. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I have a small car (Honda Fit) so my major concern was finding a convertible car seat that would fit in my car rear facing while allowing the passenger seat enough leg room. This carseat fit wonderfully and actually allowed more leg room space than our infant carseat did (Graco Snugride). I love how the tether feature adds stability to the car seat and it was easy to install.

On top of the safety features, it seems like it is very comfortable and my 8 month old son seems to love it. The fabric is soft yet breathable so he does not get as hot as he did in the Snugride (we live in SW Louisiana). It has a pad for the groin area so he can wear shorts without the buckles pinching his skin and the shoulder pads on the straps prevent red marks from appearing on his neck which was a problem with the Snugride. I also love that I am still able to recline the seat enough in rear facing mode so that when my son falls asleep he does not have his head dangling forward. I am very happy with this seat!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible car seat, rear facing mode
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: easy to install, tether feature adds stability
Harness Type: shoulder pads on the straps
Material: fabric is soft yet breathable

Review: When my daughter outgrew her Chicco KeyFit 30, it was time to get a convertible car seat. I think all convertible seats are more of a hassle than the infant carriers. It took me nearly an hour to install this seat in my car (Prius). I purchased a seat cover too but soon discovered that the cover made the car seat slide so I removed it. In order to tighten the seat properly into the car, I had to climb into the seat. This was only possible because I'm petite. I do not know how someone larger than me could get at the right angle to secure the seat. The Extend2Fit feature is nice because my daugher's feet don't kick the seat. However, the trade off is that when fully extended, it pushes the car seat to the edge of the back seat. This in turn means that the front seat has to be pulled forward. I'm short so it wasn't too much of an issue for me. Might be better in a larger SUV or minivan. It is nearly impossible to properly tighten the harness. It tightens around my daughter's legs and is loose on her chest. The buckle strap is incredibly short. If you are used to the ease of use of the Chicco KeyFit 30 harness, you'll be very frustrated with this seat. Also, removing the padding to clean is a big chore. My daughter vomited in the car and I managed to contain it to just one area on the seat. But the process of removing the padding and harness was so difficult, it spread the vomit everywhere. I had to completely dissassemble the seat down to the booster to get it clean. One plus of the seat is that my daughter was thrilled with the cup holders.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible car seat
Installation Type: install
Harness Type: harness, buckle strap

Review:
Maxi Cosi is high end European brand trying to make presence on the US market. I’ve seen some of their other products but this car seat, Pria 3 in 1 tops it all off. Firstly this car seat is a TANK. It’s sturdy, it’s strong, it’s protective. So how do they do it? Infant to 10 years old? It’s a lot of padding. It’s customizable as other convertible seats we’ve seen, you remove the infant inserts to convert to toddler but adjustable head rest is what’s making it suitable for big kids. It’s quite brilliant actually. The seat itself doesn’t go through any adjustments so it’s still solid seat body that will protect the child in case of impact. Padding is DENSE, it’s not just soft cushion, it’s really dense and firm. It’s easy to install but it’s big, I wouldn’t recommend for the small car. My 2year old is very comfy in this seat which just replaced our Britax Boulevard. Where we live is hot and humid and my boy doesn’t get got, we do use moderate AC in the vehicle.
I couldn’t be happier with this seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: Infant to 10 years old
Installation Type: easy to install
Material: padding, dense and firm

Review: I was skeptical at first, but after using the mifold booster, I LOVE IT. But more importantly, my granddaughter loves it. It's so simple to install & use. I will be purchasing another one when my younger granddaughter gets old enough for it.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
We own different brand of high end car seats but this is my first time to lay my hands on the Diono carseat.

When the box was delivered I thought it was toddler bed because it was a lot heavier than I would expect from the car seat. Our other car seats are noticeably lighter. This is great in terms of safety but if you need to switch the vehicles quite often you will get frustrated rather quickly. I didn’t find installation complicated, it’s about the same as the other seats but because of the weight it was harder and kinda felt like exercise.

Everything about this car seat is premium, from fabric to buckle. It converts from infant carseat to booster and this easily done by adjusting
1. Recline
2. Backrest
3.Shoulder Straps

Cushion is DENSE, comfortable but more importantly it feels as it can absorb some serious impact. I like to test my seats by tossing them against the concrete on my terrace, if it can’t take some abuse it’s not suitable for my child. Yes I did it. There was no clanking at all, just one loud thud.

Suitable for kids from 4lbs newborn to 120lbs. How do they do it? Cushion, lots of it. Infant insert is beautiful and well packed and dense. Newborns can practically lay flat which is ideal and this is accomplished by a wedge behind the baby back. As the child is growing the seat offers 12 different headrest positions so the head will always remain protected.

It’s the tank yet it’s slightly slimmer (on the sides).

Mom tip: If you choose this seat for a newborn baby you will still need a way to put newborn in the stroller. Usually infant carrier cerseat is the way to go because you can take it from the vehicle and snap it in the stroller. You can’t do that with this carseat but if you get a stroller that converts into basinet you will not need infant carrier. That way when you take the baby out of this seat you can lay him/her flat in the stroller. Regular strollers don’t recline completely flat and are too spacious for newborn. Thankfully these convertible basinet strollers are the “thing” nowadays and pretty much every brand offers a variety of it.

This way you can truly use one carseat until the child is 120lbs.

I do recommend this seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, infant carseat to booster
Weight Range of Child: 4lbs newborn to 120lbs
Installation Type: installation
Harness Type: Shoulder Straps
Material: fabric, cushion

Review: I love this car seat! My little man grew out of his original infant car seat and needed a convertible at 8 months. Yes, I have a giant baby. Anyway, this is easy to install, so much easier to adjust and significantly more stable than the infant Safety 1st seat he'd been using. Also, even rear-facing and at the lowest angle, if I have someone in the passenger's seat they don't have to have their seat angled almost forward for it to fit. Huge improvement! I also love the additional stabilizer strap, and that it tightens down so much via the latch system. I'm very confident baby is safe and secure in his new seat.

Review: I ordered the Pinnacle 90 to replace an older Roundabout which we loved but my child was starting to outgrow.  I was a bit hesitant to order the Pinnacle 90 simply because it looked really big and I was unsure if it would install properly in my tiny 2-door Honda Civic.  It installed just fine in my small car in a matter of minutes.  Installation was a breeze - I love the new clicktight system which lets you install the seat with the regular seatbelt quickly and securely - my car has the Latch system, but we are approaching the weight limit on that as well, so being able to install a seat well using the seatbelt is great.  I also love the adjustable harness height which allows you to adjust as your kid grows taller without having to take the whole seat apart.  Some previous reviews mentioned that the button for the strap adjustmen is too deep - personally I think this is great as it means my child cannot loosen the straps himself!  i have pretty small hands and was able to adjust the straps without any trouble.  All in all I am very pleased with the Pinnacle 90 - another great buy from Britax that gives me added peace of mind that my child is as safe as he can be.

Installation Type: Clicktight, seatbelt, Latch

Review:
First of all, I'm an Art Director in advertising. So I understand doing things to make a product shot more appealing. But the photos of this seat are so misleading I felt I had to write a review. Let me start by saying, "Shame on us" in the first place. We were so overwhelmed at Baby's-R-Us by the over-abundance of options that we just went with a name we new and picked a color. So, I guess what I do for a living is working. I suggest you really explore these things at the store if you can. Also take this with a grain of salt as I'm a MAN and just expect things to work.

In the photos (and even in the display model at the store) this seat appears very cushy. Padded. Even "Snug" in fact. However it has felt very flimsy and hard ever since we got it. There is nothing SNUG about how our baby sits in this seat.

Yesterday we had a little "blowout" in the car seat (if you don't know what that is yet, you'll find out; Daddies of the world). In having to take all the "cushions" off, I realized just how bad this thing is. It's a hard plastic shell with a hard piece of Styrofoam. Assuming that's passable for the Crash Test Baby's, there's barely a baby blanket of padding in the actual seat cushions. The piece in the photo that appears to be a nice padded head restraint is a flat piece of junk that is not attached to anything and falls down behind our baby's back. It has less foam than the earphones on my 1982 Walkman and provides NO support around her head. Whenever she falls asleep, she is hunched over with a clear future with Daddy's chiropractor.

This morning while re-assembling the "pads" (yes, I'm physically doing air-quotes while I tell this story) I decided it was finally warm enough to put away the fleece cover we'd bought and ad the canopy back on that came with the seat. Well, if this wasn't enough of a disappointing product in the first place, the canopy will make you wonder how this hasn't ended up in a sitcom already.

As a man, and a gear-head I don't mind tinkering with things I want to modify or give MORE POWER (insert Tim Allen grunt), but when I buy something this simple, I expect it to just WORK. If I were to simply leave the handle in the carrying position (like in the fine photos of this product), this long-winded rant would not exist. But the Powers That Be in the world have made it very clear that the handle needs to be folded down while in the car and when you sit the car seat down... oh HEY, side note, speaking of The Powers That Be...

I just realized this photo also doesn't show the 15+ CYA (Cover Your Ass) legal stickers and patches (in both English and Spanish) that are not only all over this seat including the cushions, but they are in no way REMOVABLE! So whatever beauty this thing might have had when it was designed is gone! But hey, at least there are plenty of reminders (in two non-removable languages) that Graco is just another behemoth company with a staff of attorneys that don't give a damn about the safety or comfort of my baby girl.

So back to the canopy...You can't MOVE THE HANDLE when the canopy is on. It will only go part way back and nowhere near the position required when you set the car seat down.

In short (I know. I know)... for $140 I'm in the upper price bracket and expected to be in the higher quality bracket. You'd be FAR better off spending a little more for a much higher quality car seat, both for your sanity and your baby's comfort and safety.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: appears very cushy, padded, snug; felt very flimsy and hard; hard plastic shell with a hard piece of Styrofoam; barely a baby blanket of padding; flat piece of junk; less foam; provides NO support; canopy; fleece cover; cushions; pads; 15+ CYA legal stickers and patches; non-removable

Seat Type: handle in the carrying position; handle needs to be folded down while in the car; can't MOVE THE HANDLE when the canopy is on

Review: My wife and I did a ton of research before purchasing this car seat. We were considering a few other ones, then we read all the positive reviews on Amazon. Review: I bought this to upgrade my 3 year old to a "big girl" seat so her baby sister could have her Chicco Nextfit seat. I wanted something to fit our budget, and after researching quite a bit, I chose this seat. It was easy to assemble out of the box, except for adjusting the crotch strap position. I fought with that sucker for a good 20 minutes. It was pretty easy to install in the van, except when I realized I needed to take it back out and adjust the straps some more. The buttons to release the anchor straps to make them long again are hard and I fought with those too. The headrest is just high enough, that I have to remove the headrest on the van's bucket seat so the car seat fits properly. Also, any downward pressure on the top of the headrest causes it to lower slightly, almost like it won't click into place. That concerns me when we move to the belt positioning mode, and we have to feed the seatbelt through the red hooks which are attached to the bottom of the headrest. Overall, it works, my daughter seems to like it, and I hope it lasts through the next kid too!
Attribute_Related_Content:

The main buckle release has become increasingly harder to release, at times close to impossible.  Last night mine would not release at all.  We had to cut the seat belt off.  Quite awhile before this we realized we had to have a knife at the ready in case we were in an accident that would require getting the child out immediately.  So for $157.00 I got a car seat that lasted for 10 months.  There is a serious defect in the buckle.

I did extensive research for the carseat with the highest safety record for $200 or less and this one appeared most often. Because of the level of safety it provides, I decided to deal with some of the not so favorable features:

- confusing install and usage instructions
- sits really high in the car, making it more difficult to get my 3 year old in and out of the carseat
- it also sits further forward in the car so his feet can kick the back of my seat

I do love that it can be made incrementally taller as he grows and the tilt can be adjusted with his age.

There were other carseats that rated almost as high in safety that I wish I would have tried instead.

I am re-writing this review:
Original review:
This is a great product at a great price. For some reason the straps seem to get stuck- so sometimes I can’t tighten it as tight- it was sort of difficult to install but once we got it figured out it was easier.
All in all I feel like my daughter is safe and that is what’s important.

Current thoughts:
This car seat is so hard to get in and out, the straps get stuck on SOMETHING idk what and we have looked and re done them and reinstalled over and over again. Without the newborn insert my daughters back seems to be rubbing on something so if we go on long drives she has a bruise by the end.

Review:
listen. we bought these for both of our children due to their roll-over and side impact testing.
we were recently in an accident where my car was in neutral and was rear ended by another car at 40 mph and then subsequently pushed into the car i front of me.
my daughter was 100% unfazed and looked up o. e we came to a stop and said “what was that” (2yrs),
my son was asleep at the time so he was less happy but he only received one minor bruise from the accident and immediately stopped crying once removed from the car (1 yr)
i truly believe the car i was in coupled with such nice car seats saved my family from potential major injuries or death.
if they weren’t in the accident i would of even kept the seats the only damage they sustained was that one lost a cup holder.

It’s cute, my baby sits real comfortable in it, I love the adjustable headrest/seat strap thingy, and this installation is the easiest *high five!*. Review:
I bought this car seat almost two years after researching car seat safety for a long, long time. My granddaughter isn’t with me everyday but spends enough time with me that I need a car seat in my own car every day. When she was infant I used a Chico infant seat for her . It was fantastic and I really thought I’d purchase another Chico when she was ready for a bigger seat.
All my research led me to Britax and the Advocate. I wanted the safest seat I could get for her. I am not very handy, so I needed something easy too. The ClickTight sounded pretty perfect. So I decided to go with the Britax Advocate ClickTight, after reading every review I could find.
Let me say it is a heavy seat and I don’t like to move it around. That’s why I never move it unless there’s a great reason to do so. I was a little intimidated when I first tried to install in my car. When I felt frustrated I just went back to manual and even googled some things I couldn’t quite picture. Installation and adjustment was amazingly simple!
Every time I need to adjust, I refresh my memory with a quick google video or the Manuel and it’s so easy...once again, let me tell you I am not good at this type of thing. My only problem getting baby in seat has been when she’s being playful and won’t sit still so I can buckle her.
It does take two hands to fasten and unfasten the belts on her seat but that just keeps her safer, in my opinion- meaning she can’t get out by herself.
I’ve washed the cover and replaced it on seat. I did get really confused at one point and thought, “this is crazy! This can’t be right!” When I read instructions on replacing cover. Well, after I reread a couple of times I realized I was trying to put the cover on the wrong place. Yep, it was me doing it wrong! After two years I just can’t say anything bad about this seat. Thankfully, we haven’t been in any accidents so I can’t speak to that. I love this seat, even two years later. It looks great, works great and keeps my love safe.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: ClickTight
Harness Type: belts
Material: cover

Review:
We got this seat for our 3 year old moving out of a Britax Advocate. These are our first impressions after a couple of weeks.

It was easy to install with LATCH.
It has 2 cup holders and 2 little square holes behind them from snacks, which is great.
I was worried about the armrests being in our kids way, but they seem very comfortable for him.
The harness (only used as 5-point) is easy to adjust, and has padding at the shoulders. He can almost put in on himself, the straps gets very long, but he can't open it.
Our son really likes the red accents on the seat, makes him think it looks fun, while the dark colors still make it look nice in the car.

I really like the fabric, unlike the Advocate which is cloth, this is more like a clothy polyester like fabric. It is soft and comfortable, but it feels liquid repellant, and you can easily wipe it off. Big bonus!

we have not used this as a booster yet, but so far we are very satisfied.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: 5-point
Material: clothy polyester like fabric, soft, comfortable, liquid repellant, easy to wipe

Review: Purchased in early September of 2011 and it worked like a charm. Whenever I needed to go out I would dress my daughter first then put her in the carseat, put the carseat on the rocker base and then go handle getting myself together. My daughter who was barely 3 months old would fall right to sleep or sit quietly with her pacifier or bottle while I got myself together.  Then after a Thanksgiving trip my husband changed the batteries which we thought had died and found that it wouldn't come on.  Of course he says nothing to me about that fact so when I picked it up to use it a few days later I heard something rattling around inside. He said he heard it when he changed the batteries. I managed to get it open and found the arm that moves the tray back and forth was not attached to anything and the screw which should have been attached to the arm and the base was what was knocking around inside the unit.  $40 bucks down the drain!

Review: My wife and I were at Babys R Us (Sorry Amazon) looking for a new car seat. The pleasing to the eye looks and padding that makes the seats in my SUV jealous made the decision for us. The seat comes preassembled and is VERY sturdy! I'd seen advertisements for the seat before but seeing it in person made me better believe in the hype of how safe the seat it. The pads on the belts seemed big, but fit my daughter comfortably and she has been very happy to take her afternoon naps on our way home! I definitely suggest this seat to others. If anyone doubts the extra money for it, please don't make the same mistake I almost did. I can pinch a penny and thought my wife had talked me into something that I'd regret...but I've been proven wrong and happy for it! Makes my little girl happy and my mind is at ease with her in it.

Review:
If I could return it I would but the box got wet. Since transitioning to this seat we hate going anywhere because our son can not tolerate this carseat. On top of the crying baby that now cries nonstop, It is very hard to tighten and loosen the straps. I'm not a wimp but getting any movement when you pull the strap to tighten the baby's shoulder traps is almost impossible. I pretty much only travel with my husband now because I don't feel confident in being able to this seat on my own it is that difficult.. Loosening the straps is just as bad. Apparently this is the case with the seats with the feature that clicks so you know it is tight enough. I worry about getting him out quickly in an emergency. With the other seat it wouldn't have been a problem. As it stands, after owning this for around a month I still have the same difficulty using it. It has not gotten any easier.

The fact of the matter is we went from having a content 7 month old who was happy in his infant carseat (Chicco kefit 30) and actually enjoyed car rides despite it being too small and cutting into his shoulders at the highest setting, to a 7 month old that cries the entire time he is in the seat unless someone sits in the back and distracts him with food. I never get to sit in the front when we travel any more and I won't go any place with the baby on my own because the difficulty of use and the crying. We took the shoulder pads off and that helped some so he isn't crying like he is in pain constantly and we reclined it as far as it goes and that also improved it as far as it goes. Traveling has been a nightmare with this seat. We even tried swapping back to the other seat and he was fine for traveling in that, he is just too big for it so it is not safe.

I will be saving up to buy a different seat. I just feel I wasted my money on this. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE even if it is on sale. I got this for $190 on a lightening deal. I suspect it was a deal because of these issues.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: very hard to tighten and loosen the straps; getting any movement when you pull the strap to tighten the baby's shoulder traps is almost impossible; Loosening the straps is just as bad; the feature that clicks so you know it is tight enough

Review: This is the third different booster seat we've used, and it's definitely the best. First of all, it's the first one to actually have latch. (finally!) It also comes apart very easily. All the other boosters have been a struggle to take apart and reassemble. This one is a snap - just lean the top all the way back and slide it out. The kids haven't complained about it feeling any different, and it comes with all the same features you'd expect from a good booster like side impact protection. It's got a built in cupholder and a little slide out tray (which will probably end up being filled with stale cheerios in about a week). The tray and cupholder are much easier for the child to reach than the alternatives in the body of the car, so that's nice if you want it. Overall a great booster.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: latch

Review: This was purchased for my 4 year old granddaughter who is too big now to sit in a regular car seat.  She sits upon this willingly (in the back seat) and can fasten the seat belt of the car around her all by herself. I fortunately have not been in an accident so I can't say how protective it is, and I hope that's something I'll never have to judge.  She loves the design and the colors and I feel good that she is restrained by seat belts properly.  It's just the thing.

My other car seat is from chicco and it my kid gets all warm and sweaty if she sits in that for too long. But the Britax car seat is way more comfortable than that. The only drawback for me is that this car seat is quite bulky and occupies a lot of space. But overall am satisfied with this product so I give it 4 stars.

Review: This is my second Marathon 70 car seat.  It is quite easy to adjust the height of the shoulder strap as the child grows.  I did not use the latch system as my grand daughter (in the other Marathon seat) weighs more than 40 lbs.  I used the same installation method for both Marathons.  I was able to install both car seats in my VW Golf, with the seatbelts.  For the installation, I had a second person's assistance to pull on the seatbelt as I pushed hard on the car seat bottom.  This procedure insured perfect tightness of the installation:  no movement at all in the seat.  My grandson appears quite happy in that car seat as he fell asleep in it during the first 30 minute car-trip.  I don't think there is room for a person in between the two car seats in a Golf.

Had trouble from day one. Our baby was born 8lbs 15 oz and it was challenging getting her in and out of seat. She is just 3 months old now and we need to upgrade due to her shoulders being squished and the buckle is so tight against her pelvis it leaves terrible indentations. Plus she screams when buckling her in. Must be painful. And this buckle is almost impossible to release in a hurry. You really have to press HARD. Seat is not good for bigger babies. And as another reviewer stated, big warning stickers everywhere do look excessive compared to other seats.
The clips dig into her thighs. The buckle is through the second slot. I know I have a large baby so just warning buyers with larger babies to beware.

Review:
I purchased this accessory so that we could take my 2 year old's Britax car seat on an airplane ride to Disney World. We knew we would be lugging around this car seat through two different airports each way and looking around on the internet there aren't a lot of options that where in a reasonable price range for us until I found this. I will be honest and say that I seriously had my doubts about this product, mainly because of it's simplicity, but it really knocked one out of the ballpark! We had no trouble hooking it up to our carry on and I swear it made having to travel with a car seat a pleasant experience, definitely handy when having to chase down our little escape artist. However, I cannot attest to how it travels with a toddler sitting in it since our toddler was ready to run after a two hour plane ride.

I would highly recommend this item for anyone that wants to be sure their infant/toddler is secure and safe on an airplane ride, but lacks the 20 arms that a parent needs for such a journey. It is definitely one baby gadget that I'm glad I invested in!

Review:
My 5yo sometimes hates change.
We used this seat with her after a long time of wanting to get one.
There is a nice amount of cushion on the seat which I like. My daughter said it wasn’t comfortable - I think she was complaining just to complain.
I didn’t find the seat super intuitive to install but it’s not easy.
The size is amazing and once we start traveling with the kids more it will be great to have with car ride companies.
Once you’ve installed it once its easy to know how to install it again.
It’s great that it can install easily on either side of the car, left - right - or center.
I think part of the problem with the seat my daughter uses this seat in is the seat in the back dips down so this I fold actually sits perfectly into the lower dipped part of the seat - making it more level/flat.
This seat isn’t going to be as safe as a full back booster but I feel like it is as safe as a booster with no back.
It’s a ton more easy to use and travel with than a booster with no back.
I will be buying another if my youngest and oldest both need boosters at the same time!

Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: install easily on either side of the car, left - right - or center
Material: nice amount of cushion

I'm not a newbie to car seats, but this one was a hassle. It does seem secure, well padded and well made; you'll just have to be OK with going through the learning curve in exchange for saving $$ on car seats and boosters as kid ages.

We had a bad stomach bug run through one time when we were on vacation, and the ride home involved a lot of unpleasant eruptions. When we got home, the carseats were a disaster. Fortunately, taking it apart to wash, and then reassembling again was a breeze. I can't say enough good things about this seat. I read all the reviews before deciding to purchase, and I'm pleased to have chosen this one. Very happy!

Review: I really wanted to like the two identical Diono car seats that we purchased for out twins, but were sadly disappointed when the kids began to grow and we needed to adjust the head rest height. Put simply, the headrest on both car seats refuses to stay in place once raised. On numerous occasions I was forced to stop the car, raise the headrest only to have it fall back down within 10-15 minutes. I tried contacting Diono and they suggested that I uninstall the seats (fun!) and try tightening the head rest bolts located on the back. After tearing both seats out, re-tightening the bolts, the headrests immediately failed to maintain the desired position for each of our kids. When I contacted Diono again they said they would send out some sort of "remedy plate" which would require additional time to install with no guarantee of a permanent fix. At that point I declined the offer and threw both seats in the trash. Happy to say our Graco replacements are working great, have a headrest that easily locks and are a fraction of the price of the Diono model. Hope this review will be helpful to others

Review:
We liked this car seat, but ultimately it didn't end up dethroning our favorite.

There's a lot to like about this seat. It's well made, the baby is comfortable in it, and it grows well with your child. Material and workmanship both seem very nice and honestly we wouldn't be concerned about carrying our daughter around in it now that she's a year and a half old.

We weren't thrilled with other aspects of the seat. We use the LATCH system, and was disappointed that this uses the old clipping mechanism instead of the newer quick release straps. If you're moving this between cars a lot, this will definitely slow you down. We also felt like the seat was a bit TOO spacious for a very young infant. There wasn't nearly as much lateral (side to side) support with this seat as there was with our chosen seat. Our daughter was born under 5 pounds, and even when she was 5 pounds, I wouldn't trust putting her into this seat until she got over 12 pounds or more. Just feels like there's too much wiggle room - even using the inserts.

We also felt like the cupholders were an odd choice. They aren't terribly deep and the elastic, while being a clever idea, just didn't work as well as a good, deep cupholder.

As far as the comfort goes, our girl seemed to like it, but we didn't really notice any difference in the "comfort mesh" than with any other seat we've tried. Their back is going to get sweaty, period. (At least if you live in the western states.)

Despite our concerns, it IS a good, well built seat. We just don't think it quite justifies a full 5 stars as there were just one too many things we weren't thrilled about. Still, as one of the more budget-friendly seats, it's good for what it is and we can recommend it - but only if your child is a little older.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: LATCH system, old clipping mechanism instead of newer quick release straps  
Weight Range of Child: under 5 pounds, over 12 pounds  
Material: comfort mesh

Review:
I recently traveled by myself with a newborn and a toddler with a layover, and this product made my life so much easier! My toddler HATES strollers and always tries to escape. But she LOVED riding in her car seat as it was strapped to my roller. I have a Britax Marathon and it fit nicely with my carry-on. It was very stable and secure! It made going through security much easier than having to take down a stroller. Because of this strap, it made one less bulky item "aka: stroller" to keep track of.

This, coupled with my Baby Bjourn for my infant, made travel less stressful. Even several flight attendants commented on how it's about time someone came up with a product like this.

NOTE: As a reviewer commented before, it fits secure if your roller is packed full, but not too full. I had to over-pack my roller on the way back and that made the car seat lean to one side a bit. That made it harder to pull, and get on and off at security, but it was still very stable.

Review:
I've been using this for years with my first born and now my 2nd child. We travel alot because my parents lives across country. This made our life so much easier to travel with kids. We place our Britax seat and securely lock it on there and we sat our little in her carseat & BUCKLED her up and roll her through the terminal. No need to carry our child through the airport and No strollers needed. The best part is the wheels rolls (glides) so smoothly over everything. Once we get to the aircraft all we had to do was unlock the seat and fold it up. Its nice and light to store right in the over head bin. I also paid for my child’s seat so i would bring her seat on board to sit her in it. I used this cart up until she was 4yrs old with her car seat. Better than checking in her car seat and they toss it around like it’s nothing. When we get to the aircraft I check her seat at the craft’s door & just wait for it right after we get off the plane, i’ll Put the seat back onto the cart and wheel her thru the airport without any delays of having to maneuver thru the crowds with carry ons & helping a little human that takes 2 steps vs your 10
Steps.
I definitely recommend this cart it’s a life savor for any parents traveling with toddlers. I’ve used this for my first child and 2nd and it has held up! 2nd child i used it with the cosco seat and it works just fine.

Review:
I used to not be a huge fan of this carseat; however, after extended use, my opinion has really changed. I now LOVE this carseat!

When I was first researching an infant carseat to purchase, I went back and forth between the Gracco Snugride and the Chicco Keyfit. I ended up choosing this Chicco mainly because it seemed much more comfortable than the Gracco (and more attractive). Well, I'm glad I did for numerous reasons. First of all, it really does seem like a very comfortable carseat. Our son has even spent a few nights in it when he has had a cold and couldn't lay flat comfortably in his crib. On those rare occasions he sleeps soundly for 12 hours and always wakes up happy. That tells me that the carseat must be pretty comfortable. He is also always very happy in his carseat, and doesn't get fussy when we are out running errands and such.

Also, the release button that lets the straps in and out is a Godsend! Also, I like that even though it is a 22 pound carseat, it still holds a baby up to 30 inches. Some of the competitors 22 pound seats only go up to 26 inches. Therefore, I expect that our 7.5 months old (who is very tall) should be able to stay in it for another month or two. Just for reference, this carseat should be technically be able to hold even the largest babies, for up to 6 months. 22 pounds and 30 inches is above the 95th percentile for a 6 month old baby.

I've also had some experience carrying infants in other carseats, and I'd say this one is much lighter and easier to handle. At 17 pounds, our son is starting to get a little too heavy to carry around in the carseat, so I'm glad we did not go with a larger 30 pound seat. I can't imagine carrying around a baby that heavy in a carseat!

The only thing that I still don't like about this carseat is that it doesn't have that little notch on the bottom that allows it to fit into the front of shopping carts. Also, it didn't seem to fit our son very well when we took him home from the hospital at 5 pounds. We ended up folding up a burpcloth and putting it behind his back for the first few months. Otherwise, he seemed to "sink" into the carseat. However, I definitely think the pros outweigh the cons!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant carseat
Weight Range of Child: 22 pound carseat, holds a baby up to 30 inches, 22 pounds and 30 inches, 5 pounds
Installation Type: (No explicit mention of installation method)
Harness Type: straps
Material: (No explicit mention of material)

Review: We purchased this car seat while staying with my father in law in Florida on vacation. We have used the chicco key fit for everyday use for both our boys, and this product truly does not compare. It is scarily light weight.  We used this with a 13 pound baby, as well as a 19 pound baby. It truly felt like the plastic carrier could crack, or the handle detach, at any moment. Also, the sun shield is a flimsy joke. The seat is made if light weight plastic and there is NO padding or styrofoam between cover and molded seat.  On the plus side, I still believe this is a Safer choice then renting a carseat on vacation or sending your everyday carseat through checked baggage to be tossed around. Also, it was easy to install. In truth it reminded me of the plastic infant cabbage patch carrier I had as a kid. In closing, I would recommend feeling and seeing this product in person before purchasing as a carseat that will be used with any regularity.

Review:
We have 4 between our two girls. I was always taught that your car seat is only as good as the install and these car seats are wonderfully easy to install. They are also super comfy rear and forward facing.

Someone did mention that there is a sticker right smack dab in the middle of the seat - on the child's back and that it gets hot in the summer. That's right we live in Phoenix, AZ and we leave ice packs covering the plastic and metal parts of the straps while we run errands etc during the summer, and I just have a small washcloth I will cover that sticker with to avoid burning my children. It’s fine, no big deal.

Yes, the straps are hard to adjust at first until you wear them in. No big deal. I think car seats are like that.

Great seat otherwise. I researched so many seats and this one finally made me feel comfortable.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear and forward facing
Installation Type: wonderfully easy to install
Material: sticker right smack dab in the middle of the seat, plastic and metal parts of the straps

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review:
This is a very easy seat to install. It works like most seats going in (attaching to the seat anchors and whatnot). HOWEVER, upon tightening the seat, I don't have to sit on it and shove my legs against the driver's seat and squeeze as hard as I can to get it to work correctly. The ratcheting lever is phenomenal and is a really slick way to tighten the seat. It does take a few ratchets back and forth, but it is a simple motion and the length of the lever helps with the torque needed.

Then to release the sides, you just pull on the red straps with very little effort. 10/10 attachment mechanism. 50 stars. Yes please.

I've seen 2 downsides:
1. when I'm ratcheting the seat down, if I'm not careful, I can get the ratcheting mechanism squished up against the seat. This can be remedied by watching what you're doing and adjusting the ratcheting mechanism.
2. In rear facing mode, my kid doesn't really lean back a whole lot. I could tell the first several rides were uncomfortable for them. It's fine and safe, so that's what matters, I suppose.

TL;DR: Nice seat, easy to install, easy to remove, at first may be a bit awkward for your kid.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: easy to install, ratcheting lever to tighten the seat, pull on the red straps to release
Seat Type: rear facing mode

Review: I love this thing!! I have a town and country minivan with stow n go seating and the hindge for that hels keep this nice and tight and in place! Its fully adjustable and you can arange it different was to cit any carset as the child grows. I choose this one over the newer model because it just looked more sturdy, and it is very sturdy.

Seat Type: Convertible

Review: I love this car seat! We got it to replace one that was damaged in an accident and insurance paid for it, otherwise I would've had to go with a much cheaper one. Anyway, my 4 year old son loves it- says it is comfy, and he loves the cubby holes for putting toys in. Our last car seat had a removable cup holder that attached to the side, so I love that this one is built into the arm. The colors (green and grey) are very nice looking, and the material is soft and cushy. It is fairly easy to install, although I would like to see better LATCH attachments - for this much money you would think they would use ones more like the First Years one that we replaced. The one handed harness adjustment is awesome- just push the button and pull it up. Also very easy to tighten/loosen straps from the front. The sides allow my son to sleep in the car without his neck being in an awkward position or his head falling forward. The seat does recline with a one handed button on the front, but I believe you are supposed to take it out and adjust the recline then reinstall. The only downside to this that I have had to work on is the buckle on the chest clip, as many other people have said. When I first got it, it was absolutely impossible to unbuckle the chest clip with one hand. It is a little easier now, but still a very difficult buckle. The upside to this is that my son isn't able to unbuckle himself. Overall I highly recommend this seat to anyone!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 4 year old
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: one handed harness adjustment, easy to tighten/loosen straps from the front, buckle on the chest clip
Material: soft and cushy

Review: works great and has multiple options on how to install it in your car. rear facing was a little lacking in leg room and the moment he got to state requirements where i could turn him around i did because the poor guy was cramped back there and shoes always got stuck on the cup holders when putting him in during the rear facing. love it for the forward facing. its slim but just not as slim as i thought it would be in a 3 seat row you really only are going to be able to fit the car seat and one adult comfortably. otherwise it needs to be skinny people sitting next to the car seat and if there is another car seat you only can fit 2 not 3 next t one another.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: multiple options on how to install it

Review: We've now used this car seat for almost three years. Never again will I buy a carseat with so many hidden crevices and compartments. Kids puke a lot, you can't just wipe and go. The whole 100 pound seat needs pulled out, taken apart, scrubbed, washed, and put back in by someone stronger than I. I need a car seat saver to go over it and block all the crevices from food, puke, potty, drinks, etc. It never gets fully clean, my hands cant reach every hole and crevice. It is a huge pain on a weekly basis.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: so many hidden crevices and compartments, never gets fully clean, my hands cant reach every hole and crevice

Review:
There are so many things to like about this car seat. It's very well designed and strongly built. The base has built-in levels to get proper installation. The base also has room to keep the user manual. But the manual isn't really needed: Instructions (which are very clear) are also printed on the seat and base! The interior fabric is very soft and it's evident the design and manufacture emphasis is on both comfort and safety.

This listing only has both the car seat and modular stroller, or car seat only. As of now there's no option on this listing for purchasing the modular stroller only, for those who have the car seat without the stroller, are impressed with its quality, and want to add the stroller. However the stroller is available here on Amazon in a separate listing. Just search for Summer Infant Myria Modular Stroller (32952).
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: proper installation
Material: interior fabric is very soft

Review:
I was a Britax-only person until I received this. Concept is awesome, but it doesn't work the way it's designed. The idea is to lift the seat cushion of the car seat to full opening, pull the seatbelt across the opening and buckle in, then close the seat. Sounds easy right? It's not. If you pull the seatbelt tight before you close the seat cushion, it will not fully shut because the seatbelt blocks the seat from fitting into place. You have to leave the seat belt loose and then shut the seat. But then when you try to pull it tight, it only tightens one of the layers of the folded belt. The top layer is pulled taut, but the bottom layer remains loose with slack no matter how hard you try. This, to me, is very dangerous.

Secondly, the loosening and tightening of the harness straps is very irregular. One will loosen while the other will not, the one that does loosen does not loosen fully, and the straps constantly get uneven where one is loose, but I cannot tighten anymore on my daughter otherwise the other strap will hurt her and be too tight.

Lastly, there are rubber guards on the chest connector that always slide down and refuse to remain in place. It becomes a huge hassle when trying to move the chest connector up to its correct position. I'm worried the guards move the chest connector down out of position, too.

So not only is the design a poor execution and incredibly difficult and inconvenient to maneuver but it's faults make the seat unsafe. We will be returning the clicktight and buying the regular version.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Clicktight
Harness Type: harness straps, chest connector

Review: We have enjoyed this booster for over a month now. After 5000 miles of riding in it, my daughter has no complaints. We are buying a second one for one of the grandmothers to put in her car. The belt at the base to attach the booster to the car seat is a nice addition, but make sure your car has those loops in it. Our Lexus GX460 did not, but I realized that is probably because the backseat slides on rails like the front ones. A great feature if we move it to one of our other vehicles, though.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: belt at the base to attach the booster to the car seat

Review: My sweet baby girl has cried in her infant seat since the day she was born. As soon as I installed this new “big kid” seat in my car it has been sweet silence. It doesn’t matter where we go, she absolutely loves being in her new car seat!!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
Part of this seat has broken and it is only 3.5 months old with moderate use. It has rendered the seat unusable as it is a safety issue. I am actually hoping for a return or replacement, but I am not eligible as it is not within 1 month of purchase. I have a call and email into Graco but I have not received a response yet. My daughter is without a car seat until I can go out and buy a new one. Unfortunately I will need to buy a new one and cannot wait to have this rectified by graco because I have kids to transport. It's 10pm and so I need to wait until tomorrow. This is a HUGE pain and I'm baffled that it broke.

The metal thing that holds/releases the straps got jammed and looks like it has come loose. The strap is folded over and it's all completely jammed up. The strap looks a bit frayed/chewed up. The seat was purchased new on February 17, 2015, (received 2/19/15) so it's only 3.5 months old. I have always had trouble tightening, and sometimes releasing, the straps. However, I didn't think it was a problem. I suppose there could have been an issue all along.

2 other parents that I know on facebook have had this EXACT problem with this seat in the past few weeks. We are filing complaints with the NHTSA because this could lead to a recall.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: The metal thing that holds/releases the straps got jammed and looks like it has come loose. The strap is folded over and it's all completely jammed up. The strap looks a bit frayed/chewed up. I have always had trouble tightening, and sometimes releasing, the straps.

Review:
My 1 1/2 yr old son never liked to be strapped down. We couldn't last the shortest car ride without him crying to get out. I usually have to bribe with lots of snacks and fill my car with lot of toys. When we switched to this seat, my son loved it. No more fuss. We had this seat for sometime already but today's 40+ miles really teasted this. My son not only did not fuss... he slept through the ride to and from my destination.
5 stars all the way! Great Job Graco!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: We ordered these car seats for our 2nd vehicle.  This is my first experience with Graco seats and overall I'm impressed (our other seats are more expensive brands).  It was very easy to setup and install in the car, and they look really sporty and cool (as cool as a carseat can look) in the back of our family sedan.  The seat is big enough that it will protect the kids, but compact enough that it doesn't overhang the edge of our car seats or block our view in the rearview mirror.  As others have said, the strap that goes between the legs is very short and not adjustable.  My children haven't complained, but it does make buckling the seat a challenge (kids have to lift their rear off the chair so that I can reach the buckle).  And the plastic chest buckle is difficult to take off, but it keeps my kids from letting themselves out.  My kids love having their own cup holders to put their stuffed animals and toys in.  The seat seems pretty well padded and my son fell asleep in it yesterday after 5 minutes so it must be comfortable.  I like how the seat will work for us for the rest of childhood... converting to booster seat options.  Overall I'm impressed with this affordable seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: for the rest of childhood
Installation Type: easy to setup and install
Harness Type: strap that goes between the legs is very short and not adjustable, plastic chest buckle is difficult to take off
Material: well padded

Review:
I purchased this all in car seat for my latest grandson. They are quite pleased with it.

I purchased one over 6 years ago for my oldest grandson from another company, and I absolutely love it. Definitely worth the money and you only have to purchase one item. It’s still in perfectly good condition in my car 🙂

We own an airplane ( cessna 206) and we travel ALOT!! These have been a life saver. We have 4 kids and 2 still in booster seats. The only way for us to get around town is by UBER or taxi. Taking 2 booster seats with us is a pain, esp if you are sightseeing. In the airplane my kids sit in their normal booster seats, so they can see out the windows. We leave the booster seats in the plane and Travel around town with the mifolds. I wouldn't use them for long car rides as they don't boost the kid up to see out the windows.
We absolutely love these for traveling!!! We have been using them since they were on kickstsrter, so about 2 years now.

Aside from that, it's perfect; we will be ordering the same one for our second child when she is ready. It's bulky but not as heavy as I thought it would be! My son is happy therefor my husband and I are ecstatic!

Review: I purchased this as a transitional car seat from the stroller carseat that I used when my son was a newborn. I love it. Surprisingly to fits better than the newborn carseat I used and I have this new car seat rear facing. My husband is tall, so he needs to push the seat all the way back. With the new born car seat, I always had to re-adjust it because of him. Now, he can push it back and we still have space.  It has adjustable straps for the shoulders, so you don't have to worry about re-treading when your child grows. It literally took 10 minutes to install from taking it out of the box to inside my car. It comes with car seat latch system, which almost all cars that are 2010 and higher has. So, it is two clicks, tighten it up, and go.

Review:
I have had 3 other car seats, and the Maxi Kosi Magellan by far is the nices, safeist, and well made.

This has the convenious of being a 5 in 1 car seat which converts from birth to as long as a child will be in a car seat by safety laws and regulations. Booster included.

The material is soft , sturdy, comfortable , and Very Cozy the 3 1/2 year said. This is easy to take apart for cleaning .

I had a bit of trouble getting this in my Suv as you have to make sure the head rest piece is all the way up to be able to pull the seatbelt through to latch it in.

This is a heavy car seat compared to other brands. But understandable because it is a 5 in 1 car seat.
Also you won’t be spending a lot of money buying different car seats as your child gets older, this has it all.

This also has A build in Level into the frame on the bottom side that tells you the proper way it’s sitting in your vehicle depending on what stage of the car seat your using for Your child.

The straps are All adjustable , has Two cup holders , one on each side.

There is a book that comes with this and easy instruction written on the side of the seat.

We could not ask for more on this Safe car seat for our 3 1/2 yr old.
I would buy this one again.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: 5 in 1 car seat, converts from birth to as long as a child will be in a car seat, Booster included
Weight Range of Child: from birth
Installation Type: seatbelt
Material: soft, sturdy, comfortable, cozy, easy to take apart for cleaning

Review: I never submit reviews but I was really disappointed with this product. We brought it on one vacation with us and it was great. But we went to use it a few months later and it basically only holds air for one usage. It's still usable, but you have to add more air to it every time.

Review:
I was really excited to get this car seat.
As a car seat - no complaints!!! the car seat is super! and I am sure the baby (will arrive in April) gonna be comfortable in it.

BUT:

in the instruction book they say that stroller adapters on both sides can be removed by screwing out the screws (2 on each side).
So I tried hard - couldn't remove them :( I want to use different stroller (not B-Agile), and these adapters are not necessary.
Moreover the screwheads are going to be damaged if I continue trying to remove them. Therefore I don't add a last star to my review.
Don't know what to do at this point. :(((

probably someone can suggest a way out.

Review: These work perfect in our 4runner for our twins. The seat has about an inch of room in the most reclined position (1) so it’s not touching and I am fairly tall. There’s actually enough room in the middle for an adult with the cup holders in the “in” position. I also love that I don’t need a “beach towel or pool noodle”  to prop underneath to get level like the previous car seat we bought and returned. The straps are amazingly easy to adjust. No feeding through the back just an easy click up and down on the headrest. My girls feel comfortable and the seatbelt doesn’t dig in as much as the other ones I tried. The instal was super easy to get level. The trick is pulling the tightening strap trough the inside of the seat like the manual suggests. This is the 3rd set of convertible car seats we have purchased and it started to get exhausting. Wish I would have got these from the beginning
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Harness Type: straps are amazingly easy to adjust, easy click up and down on the headrest

Review:
It's a great car seat with fantastic safety ratings for the price, but it has some problems:

The buckle (the crotch strap) is too close to the back of the car seat. I feel like there should be more space. We have a difficult time buckling my child into the 5 point harness. Also, it's hard to buckle it, period. The clips don't slide into the buckle easily. You really have to put some muscle into it. It's also bulky and heavy.

However, over all, we've been satisfied with this car seat. But if I could go back and do it over again, I would have bought something different.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: buckle (crotch strap) too close to back, difficult to buckle into 5 point harness, clips don't slide into buckle easily

Review:
I switched my tiny 15lb 9 month old out of the standard carrier to this Graco.

PROS :
- I like the different recline positions - love that they are perfectly labeled on the side
- I thought install was easy to get into the car. I feel like people tend to complain about taking seats in and out of cars and it’s not that bad
- LOVE that there’s holders for the clips to get baby in and out without the harness in the way
- everybody loves cup holders - and TWO of them
- cover comes off
- price is reasonable

CONS
- I have to adjust the crotch strap and I am not exaggerating that I was sweating trying to get it out of the hole it comes in
- cover, although it comes off, is a pain to get back on
- this is not a small car seat
- instructions aren’t clear on when to remove the padded inserts
- the seat tilt is in a weird location so it’s hard to get your hand in
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 15lb
Installation Type: easy to get into the car
Harness Type: crotch strap, harness

I’ve had to fight with car seats in the past to get them to not rattle when my kiddos are not with me but this seat doesn’t rattle at all! It’s very soft and cute for my daughter too!

They both seem very comfortable, and have plenty of room, etc.  We've been using at least one Nautilus since soon after they were first introduced, more than 2 years ago.  That seat cover has been through the washing machine numerous times, and still looks great.  I love the sturdy, built in cup holders, and my kids love the little 'toy holders' built into their arm rests.  And my 5-year old still is very comfortable in her 5 point harness, which makes me feel more comfortable as well.  Highly recommend.

Look for the information sign on the side of padding or YouTube :)

Review:
This is marketed as an easy remove cover. But actually you have to uninstall it to remove it. Seems like false advertising… If I had known that I probably wouldn’t have bought it. I have two Graco slim fit lx (also sold by Walmart under a different name- true fit 3 I think?) that you can just snap off the bottom cover to wash - so easy. Be sure when you wash the diono that the velcro is velcroed because otherwise it will destroy the mesh lining.

What I really like about this Diono is how spacious it is for the kid - they can push down the sides around the thighs and move around, and no giant things around the head, so they can look around. Whereas the gracos really close them in. I also love that it can be folded for storage! And the pink is so cute! The other downside is that the shoulder strap height has to be adjusted manually (have to at least partially uninstall the seat to access the straps) whereas the Graco adjusts the shoulder straps with the click of a button while installed. The slim profile on the diono is visually pleasing and if the kids aren’t in the car I can haul more stuff on top of this seat as opposed to the gracos. I have a civic and they all fit 3 across.

I have it forward facing for my older kids as would have to buy the diono angle adjuster to get it to take less room rear facing. So I put the Graco rear facing for my toddler as it takes up less front row room while rear facing.

Lastly i like that to uninstall the latch you pull a ribbon loop as opposed to pressing a button. And the padded seat seems really comfy. It’s definitely less of an eyesore than the gracos but not as practical.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: forward facing  
Weight Range of Child: older kids  
Installation Type: latch  
Material: cover, mesh lining, padded seat

Review: I love Diono. I have two Radian xt and hands down love. So when I needed a booster I went for this. Absolutely the most beautiful perfect purple color, my daughter was soooo excited. Not heavy but definitely not light weight but I appreciate that quality construction and it reassures me how safe and quality it is. HOWEVER, I had to unfortunately return it. The seat is soooo wide that it wouldn't fit in my Toyota Sienna with two Radian xt car seats, which if you don't know are the fit 3 across narrow. I'd hoped the 3 across could be this booster as well but not. In my Sienna, Chevy Equinox and Chevy Traverse in the captain seat or single seat, it is so wide it covered the seat belt mechanism. My child recognizably is long and thin so the seat itself swallowed her up. This would fit a larger child well more than likely. Not a bad product by any means, I just wish it were the width of the Radian xt to fit 3 across and not cover up the seat belt mechanism. I'm now looking for a narrower booster to fit with my other car seats.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Weight Range of Child: larger child
Installation Type: seat belt mechanism

Review: We already had two of these when my mother in law wanted one we had to go with this one again.  love the seat.  The only thing that isn't so wonderful is the chest straps..... so uncomfortable and very hard to get the child in and out of the seat with.... we had to remove them.

My boys can buckle and unbuckle their own seatbelts, which is a huge win for us, and the seatbelt shoulder loop does a fairly decent job of keeping the strap safely positioned across their body fronts. Compact enough that with 2 chairs in the backseat, an adult can still fit in the remaining space. We like the cupholder, but have yet to try the hidden snack compartment. Only had for a few weeks, but so far overall, would definitely purchase again.

Review: We have 4 kids and have been through a lot of car seats this is my favorite through all the years. The only downside is the price and we chose to do the cheapest version since with so many kids we didn't really need a 4 in 1. But honestly this does it all and I would have bought this again had circumstances been different. This is also the only car seat I recommend. I got another graco convertible one that I hated and the cheap ones we have now don't even compare. The size isn't too big when fitting other seats next to it. It's comfortable for the kids, this seat has been easy for them to sleep in. I love the drink holders. I've washed the seat fabric multiple times and have never had a problem figuring out where they go and they all keep their shape. The install between cars has always been easy and I love the easy adjust head height as well. Very happy.

Review:
Have had this product for about 5 years. It is great and still in great condition. Still works and functions like the first day. If you are looking for a car seat that is easy to use and durable, then look no further. Highly recommended.

One thing to note is that it is a bit bulky, so if you have a very small car, the fit might be tight.
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review:
I bought this car seat in 2012 after reading the excellent reviews. I am sorry to say that I absolutely hate this car seat.

1) Its difficult to remove and attach across cars and I always have to have my husband do it. The hooks in the back are so tight that I can never remove them. I don't have problems with the car seat of my friends when we car pool etc. My husband complains too when he has to remove or install since I insisted on getting this car seat.
2) My daughter is thin and petite but putting the buckles is always a problem. I always fear that I am going to pinch her on the thighs when putting the buckles as I have done it a couple of times. When she is wearing bulky clothes during winter its a PAIN!!
3) When my daughter falls asleep in the car seat, her head falls in front even though I have the car seat tilted (Front facing). I wish the headrest could be adjusted in such a way that her head could rest on it. This is not a problem on short drives but longer drives I don't want her sleeping like that. I have been buying all kinds of pillow head rest things for her.

I wish I had returned it when I could.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Front facing
Harness Type: buckles

Review: When installing the seat rear facing, I found the sides protrude over the lower anchor belt, making it nearly impossible to get tight in a small vehicle.  I am not a small man and pulling as hard as I can on the anchor belt does not make the base any tighter to the seat. Tried another anchor belt from his previous seat to no avail, nearly impossible to get the correct angle on the pull cord. The actual seat belt from the car works better in my application. Hoping in a couple months when he I can spin the seat around to forward facing that I have different results.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: Lower anchor belt, Seat belt

Review: I attempted to install this seat rear facing for over an hour and could not accomplish it successfully. I tried both the latch and seat belt approach and just did not feel comfortable that I could get it tight enough. Every attempt seemed too loose and too wiggly. The seat belt install felt slightly better than the latch, but due to the angle of the rear facing the entire seat was lopsided; the side with the belt (opposite of the buckle side) was tipped up since the belt was pulled so tight it lifted the entire seat up so it was slightly off the seat cushion. That didn't seem right at all. Not to mention my kid would be lopsided. The latch was even worse as it was almost impossible to get tight - and when I tried to get a better angle to pull it (as described in the instruction manual and online official videos) the entire arm rest/cup holder broke off! I have 2 kids so am not new to car seats by any means. I've installed quite a few in my years as a parent. I had to return this since the piece broke when installing and I couldn't get installed anyway.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: latch, seat belt
Seat Type: Rear Facing

Review: Absolutely love this car seat. It came ready to go and my son loves it! We bought the Graco 4ever when he was around 6 months old to get him out of his infant carrier. It never seemed very comfy and it was $300. Not to mention the latch system clips are a pain in the butt to get to clip and the car seat is SO HEAVY and bulky.. So when it came time to get him a second car seat for his dad's vehicle I got on Amazon (initially to get another 4ever because of the fact that it grows with him and I never had any other brand to compare it to). But while browsing I saw a comparison between this one (the safety 1st) and the Graco 4 ever. After a little research and looking at the price difference, the decision was easy. Ordered this one and it came within 2 days like it said. Not to mention, it was 100% ready to go. Instillation was so much easier, the seat itself is big and safe but not too heavy or bulky, and my son seems to like it better. He's 16 months old today and still rear facing and he has plenty of room to kick back and enjoy the ride. Thanks safety 1st for your awesome product! And thank you Amazon!

Seat Type: rear facing

The product information states it can work starting at 5 lbs. My daughter was 6 lbs 11 oz and we couldn't adjust it small enough to strap her in safely. Thank goodness we brought an old backup carseat. Other than that, the various types of strap adjustments are pretty useful, but you have to seek out and watch the instructional videos to really get the hang of them. This carseat is taller, which my 2 year old likes so she can see a bit more out the window, even when riding in a rear-facing position.
