Review:
This car seat has been a great choice! My husband and I are both over 6 feet tall and our child is well on his way to being tall as well. At 4 months old, he grew out of our infant carrier and we needed a larger seat but still keep him rear facing. This was a great, inexpensive (comparatively) option that we feel confident with to keep our child safe.
We have a Toyota Camry and because we’re both so tall, our seats are pushed all the way back. This car seat almost fit behind the passenger seat. If we moved the seat up an inch or so, it would fit easily behind the passenger. Because we do a lot of traveling and like to keep the seat all the way back, we did move the car seat to the middle so it wasn’t touching the seat in front and there’s plenty of room. Our son is 28” and so far we haven’t had to use the leg room extender, but we love that it has that option!
Using the latch system, the seat is super easy to install! Using the seat belt method, it was definitely a little trickier, but it wasn’t impossible.
The only downside is that because of the cupholders, while rear facing, it is a little wide. A booster seat may fit next to it, but definitely not another car seat. We have it in the middle of the car and it’s manageable for two slim adults to sit on either side, but it’s definitely a tight squeeze in a sedan. We also used it in a larger pickup and we were able to fit the seat and two adults comfortably.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Weight Range of Child: 4 months old
Installation Type: latch system, seat belt method
Harness Type: leg room extender

I’m trying to contact the seller but I don’t know how. Hopefully the one we get in exchange for this one isn’t defective.

Review:
Overall this car seat gets the job done. I previously had a Chicco and chose this carseat because it's the lightest carseat around and I loved the the color options. My review is mostly comparing the two.

Pros: It's light.

It's good looking.

Snaps easily in and out of the base.

Cons: It's very long. Whoever sits in front of this car seat has an uncomfortable ride because they will have to pull their seat so far forward.

It's awkward and uncomfortable to carry. There's no padding on the handle and it's hard to carry for longer than a run from the parking lot to the cart.

The canopy doesn't move easily, is floppy, and sometimes gets in the way of locking it into the base. Due to the stiffness in moving it I am now the proud owner of a replacement because the canopy hub cracked and wouldn't hold the canopy up.

The strap to tighten or loosen the harness is also awkward. You push it down, but to get good leverage on it you end up holding down the very strap that you are trying to loosen. On that note, it's also difficult to tighten.

When I called for a replacement part for the canopy I was told that there is no replacement but since it was still under warranty I'd get a replacement. Cool. In order to get a replacement I needed to send in 5" of the safety strap, a 5" square of the pad, and the serial sticker and once they received those they would send me the new seat. Wait, what? You don't have a second car seat? Then they charge you a hefty deposit that they will refund once they receive those items from you. Seems slightly wasteful to destroy a perfectly good car seat that has a cracked canopy hub.

If I had to choose a carseat all over again I'd go back to the Chicco (which is only 1lb heavier) for ease of use, functionality, and ability to fit in our vehicles (out of our Pontiac G6, Chevy Avalanche, and an old Mercedes we all fit comfortably in none if them). Maybe the designers can work a few of these kinks out for the next model.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Snaps easily in and out of the base
Harness Type: strap to tighten or loosen the harness, difficult to tighten
Material: no padding on the handle

Review:
Updated 5/2020:
A year later - still not great but fine enough. I do like the cup holders built into the seat arms. We now have another car seat next to this one and both cup holders are still useable, whereas one of the the flip up cup holders on the Nuna are now blocked by the second car seat. But otherwise, it’s still awkward for him to sit in this seat at almost 3. If I could have gotten two Nuna I would have.

Updated 7/29:
Now using daily and I am no longer a fan of this car seat. The straps are lopsided - one tightens more than the other, can’t resolve, and I’m sure one loose strap isn’t safe. The straps have to be really low behind his back for his head to be in the “head area”. If straps are at a comfortable, normal spot on his shoulder, the “head area” is above his head. Other reviews mentioned this, but the buckle is so short, it’s hard to buckle the straps and not catch his clothing, legs in it. Argh!

Updated 5/29:
We have now flown with this car seat on an alaska airlines flight, and installed it in two cars. Used a car seat dolly in the airport and with a 25 lbs kid it was just fine as a “stroller”. The car seat fit just fine on the window seat with the arm rest up between it and my middle seat (I am 5’10” and sat comfortably next to it).

Somewhat difficult to install in the cars because we can’t get the seatbelt tight without the car seat being incredibly lopsided. The bottom harness straps are really awkward and wide - instead of going straight to the back, they go wide and cover his legs. Not sure how to explain this any better but it’s really weird, seems uncomfortable, and maybe not safe?

Original review: Purchased it because we needed a second one for another car, and to use after he maxes out of his primary seat.

Graco may allow for rear-facing longer (I hope - you never know with height, and I’m not sure if or how the leg extension will work). The Graco extends higher than MCM and is easier to install. Graco seat looks more comfortable - it’s flat, whereas the MCM dips down quite a bit. The MCM was slightly “beefier” and I liked that the side impact was also adjustable - but hard to say how child will fit in this car seat later so I liked the backless booster option on the Graco as opposed to possibly having a high-back seat that is very uncomfortable or not useable for older child. They have the same height limit, but Graco becomes backless booster 100-120lbs, MCM is high back to 120lbs. The cup holders on the MCM were small, I couldn’t fit the Thermos funwhatever bottle. The Graco cup holders pull out quite easily, toddler enjoys doing this...sigh. I don’t think the Graco fabric/color chooses are attractive, but can live.

Purchased May 2019. The Graco seat was manufactured in Feb 2019, the MCM in December 2018 (I was worried discounted price = much older seat).

It was hard to choose, as they are similar prices, but other reviews of the seats helped me (Graco rattling noise? Ugh, hope ours doesn’t. MCM fabric pilling? Guess I won’t know) so I hope this helps you.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, backless booster option
Weight Range of Child: 25 lbs, 100-120lbs
Installation Type: seatbelt
Harness Type: straps, bottom harness straps, buckle
Material: fabric

Review:
My son is just transitioning out of an infant seat and into a convertible, so I researched my options exhaustively. We were on a budget, so Graco was pretty much the number one choice. There are some good and bad things about this seat, but overall I am pleased with it and will keep it barring any manufacturer defects that arise out of actual use.

Pros:

Baby is comfortable
Fits well in our Honda Civic, even fully reclined
Love the clip pouches; wayward straps while putting baby into the infant seat was my biggest peeve
6 recline options
Nice looking seat
Headrest adjusts straps too, so no rethreading.
Cup holders are nice

Cons:

Installation was insanely tough
Strap tightening is difficult and requires a few tries to get it tight
Most reclined position is still very upright in our car and we were worried it might be too upright for our 11 month old. Would not put a baby with poor head control in this seat.
Strap covers slide down, so the straps might abrade baby’s neck when being tightened.

Installing this was a nightmare. My husband first tried and gave up because the LATCH tightening system is set up to require at least two people - you have to simultaneously press the seat down, hold a button down on the LATCH strap and pull that strap with all your might toward the seat. I eventually ended up sitting in the car seat to weigh it down and performing some sweet yoga moves to get my hands in the right position to tighten the strap to where I felt comfortable having my child in it. It’s lucky that the seat stays put, because I wouldn’t want to do that again, and it’s certainly stopped me from buying another of this brand for the person who will be watching my son while I’m at work; she is older and would be unable to put the seat back in her car once it’s removed. We’ll be shopping for another seat that easier to install for her.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: LATCH tightening system, requires at least two people, press the seat down, hold a button down on the LATCH strap and pull that strap, tightening is difficult
Harness Type: strap tightening is difficult, straps might abrade baby’s neck, headrest adjusts straps too, so no rethreading
Seat Type: convertible

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review:
Well, this is the only option for us to get 3 kids in the backseat of our 2009 Subaru Outback. When we carpool, we have 2 kids in Bubble Bums and 1 in a 5-point Britax Frontier. We have had the BB for 2 years now and both have holes in them. I am actually back to this page today to buy 2 news ones - I would rather not, but it truly is the only solution for getting 3 kids in our backseat. One BB had a hole after only 6 months of lite use. The hole is so big (and completely unfix-able as the air bladder is fully encased by fabric) that you can hear the air seeping out upon inflation. The second BB just started to leak last week. Total bummer.

We also thought we could use one for travel but they are not comfortable on long drives. Our daughter much prefers the lowback Graco booster seat when we travel.

So, I give the BB 3 stars because at least I can fit 3 kids in the backseat now. But minus 2 stars for having no way of repairing them after only 2 years of occasional use.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Special Features: Includes LATCH connectors that attach to vehicle, keeping the booster seat secure when not in use., The backrest on the Viaggio HBB 120 can be removed for easier travel and transport.
Review: Love this booster!  Much smaller footprint than our convertible car seat, and kid loves that she can buckle herself in without assistance!  Previous reviewer was right about getting a seat like this one without armrests so that kids can buckle and unbuckle themselves.  And it’s so easy to install and remove.  Seems to have less impact on the seat below - fewer indentions made in the seat.  Can’t wait until kid 2 is big enough to upgrade to this seat!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: easy to install and remove

Review: This is a pretty bulky carseat, the only thing I really wish is that it had a headrest piece so when they sleep their poor little head isn't cocked so crazy to one size.  Other then that seems to be a great car seat!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Material: No headrest piece

Review:
I have two toddlers and we were taking a long trip. I had the original gogobabyz which I used with my oldest child when he was a toddler but it didn't fit my new larger britax seat, so I bought this britax cart, thinking it would be better because it was made by the company. On taking it out of the box, it looked like a "dolly" you would use to carry boxes. The latch attachments clip to these rectangular fixtures on the base and it sits a bit high off the ground (several inches). It felt a little unstable despite the fact that the seat was secured we'll to the cart. The issue seems to be the center of gravity being higher. Also when taking my child on a little test run around the house, when we rounded the bend into the kitchen, the latch attachments shifted to the side of the rectangular attachments and the whole seat tipped over. I figured I needed to install it like in the car, with more pressure. So I decided to tryit on the trip anyway.

Meanwhile, I emailed gogo babyz to see if they had a kit to make my old travelmate fit one of my kids marathon car seats. They did not have a retrofitting kit so they sent me a new travelmate that would fit my larger britax car seat - this is 6 years after I bought the original travelmate! That is some seriously unusual customer service! The car seat I installed quickly and felt very secure. It sits right on the floor and is quite stable. I loved the original and found this newer versionn even more secure and easier to install.

So off we went, with both kids in their car seats, one on the britax cart and the other on the gogobabyz. The britax cart tipped over repeatedly, injuring my son (however mildly), and terrifying my husband and me. the gogobabyz has larger wheels and a smoother ride. It corners like a porche. It does not tip. Clearly the britax engineers could learn something from the little company that invented the travelmate.

I sent the britax cart back and bought another gogobabyz travelmate. [[ASIN:B000JJK9EY Go-Go Babyz Kidz Travelmate]]

Amazon is great - full refund. Bought my new travelmate through amazon too,
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Marathon car seats
Installation Type: latch attachments

Review: I bought this since it costs $10-20 per day to rent a carseat with a rental car. My daughter enjoyed the novelty of riding through the airport, and it was easy to pull. To save time at security, we asked for a hand check, and didn't have to take the carseat off.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: We got this as a travel or back up car seat but actually I like it more than the Britax one we had before. I picked it because it is a bit lighter than some of the other options. It also fits really well in smaller cars. It has two cups holders that fit our son's sippy cups. It's amazingly easy to install, I love that there are hooks to store the straps when it's not in use. Our son is comfortable and I trust that he is safe in this seat. So happy that it will adjust to grow with him for the next few years! Would definitely recommend
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: will adjust to grow with him for the next few years
Installation Type: amazingly easy to install
Material: lighter

Review: We like this chair and it stays in one car at all times. It seems to be sturdy and it was easy to install. I like the drink holders and options to move the head rest and turn it around once our child gets a little bigger and is ready to face forward. Legroom seems a little limited on the rearfacing side but will be better when our child faces forward.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Installation Type: easy to install

Review: Wow! This has got to be the best thing ever! Comes in a nice drawstring travel bag and is so convenient for travel. It literally blows up with a few easy breaths and is solid. I'm very impressed with the quality and my child was very comfortable in it. A must have for families that travel!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: LOVE this! My son hated his carseat now he likes sitting in this one, when we switch cars and bring the carseat inside he likes to sit in it and watch tv its so comfortable. Very safe as well. Would recommend to everyone with children.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Awesome carseat. Have used as rear and now forward facing. Good amount of padding with 5 point harness. I like that it has different reclining positions for specific weight when rear facing. The Right LATCH system is quick and easy to use. It's a safe carseat for my 2 year old.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing, forward facing

Review:
Purchased this as an upgrade for our baby's car seat after she out grew the old one.

Works pretty well, and would recommend. Very sturdy. She puked on it a few times but it was pretty easy to clean.

A little on the heavy side, but feels very safe.

Review: Now that my son is able to sit on his own, I am in love with this carseat! It is perfect, although it takes up a lot of room, and the passenger in my car is unable to move much in their seat... it's still perfect! My son loves it and I love it... i would recommend this, after your baby is able to sit... because it is unable to be taken out of the car and placed in the shopping card or highchair.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: able to sit on his own

Review: This is a nice-looking, sturdy car seat that is easy to install and adjust as your child grows.  My daughter loves her new "big kid" seat with cup holders, and we love that she is so safe in the seat.  There are two major problems with this seat, however.  First, with all of the stuff on the harness straps (HUGS chest pads, shoulder pads) it is very difficult to get the straps tight enough to be safe. You really have to pull on it hard to get the straps to tighten up.  Second, it is difficult to reach the place you have to push to release the harness straps and your child.  The good thing about this is that your child will never be able to take off her harness herself.  But it is difficult for mom to reach, too.  Overall we are happy with the seat but at this price it shouldn't be so hard to work the harness properly.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: difficult to get the straps tight enough; HUGS chest pads, shoulder pads on harness straps; difficult to reach the place to push to release the harness straps

Review:
Love this car seat. Finally figured out it is supposed to be done with seatbelt not latch system and that it is equally safe (probably more safe) with seatbelt. SO ridiculously easy to install rear or forward facing with seat belt! We have one for our son (now forward facing at 2.5 years) and one for our daughter (who actually isn’t using it yet, but will soon!) highly recommend!!! Best car seat. Reclines so great, comfy for kids, easy to install, super safe- can’t beat britax!

Previous review(late 2016): My son seems to like it (he is 1.5 years old) and I like that we can use it so long. Great safety ratings. The reason I gave only three stars is the (rear facing) installation is a nightmare. Trying to guess how tight to make it, then close the seat, then do it again until it is correctly installed- not, not good. Will definitely be looking into easier to install brands for next child's convertible seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Installation Type: seatbelt, latch system

Review:
I am so impressed with this car seat. Rear facing to 50 lbs was what made me interested in this seat as I want my toddler to rear face as long as possible.

This is the car seat I would recommend to anyone, and here's why.
*Extended rear facing to 50 lbs.
*Different levels of recline for kids to rearface or forward face.
*Covers to prevent seatbelt scratching neck.
*Height adjusting is easy.
*Simple to tighten and loosen straps.
*Two cupholders. My one year old loves to store his treasures there.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear facing, Forward face
Weight Range of Child: 50 lbs
Installation Type: seatbelt
Harness Type: straps

Review: We bought the 70 CS to replace our son's infant car seat. This seat is extremely well made and doesn't take up too much space in our Prius. I like the safety features and extra padding on the shoulder straps and across the belly.  Although the cover can be removed easily, it must be hand washed and line dryed. The washing instructions are a definite negative in my view, but, not enough for me to rank the seat less than 5 stars.  I am unclear on what difference (if any) there is between the new 70 CS and the old model. I'll leave other reviewers to comment on that. Overall, I'm very pleased with this car seat. My son likes it too!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: extra padding on the shoulder straps and across the belly, cover can be removed easily, must be hand washed and line dryed

Review: This car seat is light and convenient to carry around. My son is 6 months old and we are still using it. However, when he was a new born and couldn't support his neck, my mom had to sit next to him to hold his head because many times we found his head fell forward and got very worried. Even until now, I still found his head falling forward after I stopped the car sometimes. The adjustment for the straps in the back didn't bother me too long once I got ised to it. It's quite easy. I would recommend to pay a bit more money to get a more comfortable one for your LO. I am switching to a convertible one sooner because of this.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: convertible
Weight Range of Child: 6 months old
Harness Type: straps

Review: This seat was recommended as one to fit into my vehicle BUT would not tighten up enough to be safe.  It was much lighter weight than a more expensive one and could literally be pushed back and forth on the top.  We returned and bought a higher quality one (yes, more expensive) and sometimes you do get what you paid for.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review:
I researched convertable carseats FOREVER before deciding on one. I went back and forth between this seat and the Recaro Pro-Ride. I actually bought the Recaro Pro-Ride first. When installed forward facing, it is a tank. You child will be protected. My daughter, though, is not ready to ride forward-facing yet. So, I needed this to rear-face for a bit. I could not get the Recaro to safely install in a rear-facing position in my Volvo XC90. (See my review of the Recardo Pro-Ride for more info.) I ended up returning the Recaro and getting the Britax Marathon 70-G3. This seat installed wonderfully in my car in the REAR facing position. No noodle was needed. It has a strap for the rear facing position that lets you connect the top of the seat to the floor of the car, which prevents tipping, which I really like. It is nice and comfy and soft for the baby. It has these plastic covers on the straps, that make it hard to get the straps tight if your baby is tiny, but you can get it to work. I will say, though, that the Britax head proection is not as good as the Recaro. Plus, the Recaro is deeper - your baby sits down in it more, so they are more protected from side impact.

Bottom line for me: This is a great seat for REAR facing. But, I think when I am ready to put my baby in a FORWARD facing postiion, I am going to spend the money and get the Recaro.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear facing, Forward facing
Installation Type: strap for the rear facing position that lets you connect the top of the seat to the floor of the car

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: This was a last minute purchase for a recent trip after a friend recommended it. Previously, we traveled with our backless booster and I carried it throughout the airport. This was much more portable and I just inflated it quickly upon arrival after getting our rental car and deflated it when we returned to the airport. You should check it frequently to make sure it is still properly inflated while using it.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: We got two of these, one for each car.  Installation was easy enough, and the seat is very comfortable for our child.  The only criticism I have is that the main buckle does not buckle, or unbuckle, easily.  It is always a small ordeal to get our child out of the seat.  Both sides stick, and the button to push to release them does not press down easily at all.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: main buckle does not buckle, or unbuckle, easily; Both sides stick, and the button to push to release them does not press down easily at all

Review: It works. No plug and play seat booster. The most complicated part was attaching the seatbelt guide. But if you’ve ever used a belt you won’t find it too difficult. Plus it has 2 cup/snack holders. Great for McDonald’s French fries or insulin needles.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: seat booster
Installation Type: seatbelt guide

Special Features: Transforms in seconds from a compact fold to a full-size booster seat, without compromising safety or comfort
Review:
We chose this model for the compact fold/straps because we were planning plane travel with driving on the other end for our 5yo who is not mature enough for a bottom seat only booster for any significant distance.

The fold is great and compact. The provided straps are just webbing, and There was no way we’d use them for more than a minute. I found some clip on backpack straps on Amazon that were more comfortable, but it sits at an awkward angle. You’re better off using some bungee cords to strap it to the handle of rolling luggage if you’re going very far.

We gate checked it for our flights but you may be able to put it in an overhead bin.

Since the back does not detach, it’s easy to quickly install and remove from an Uber. I had trouble getting the isofix latch connectors to work in one Uber (Toyota sienna, I believe) but it was a short ride so we went without them completely attached.

We also like that the sides of this seat expand like the other Monterey models because my son is tall with a long and wide torso and would likely have cramped shoulders by the time he ages out of a standard booster seat. What I didn’t realize until we got it is that the width expands as you raise the headrest, not independently like the other models.

Overall we like it but unless you’re planning some travel that includes Ubers and/or flights where you’ll rent a car or ride with family/friends on the other end, save your $$. We have the $100 XT model in our other car and it functions just as well if you’re installing it once and leaving it there (and it still has the expandable back panel). If your child is average height/weight/build, you can pick something even cheaper.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Weight Range of Child: 5yo
Installation Type: isofix latch
Material: expandable back panel

Review: It's beautiful and safe! I love it!! We have 3 kids and bought this carrier for our third. We have only ever used Safety 1st brand. We feel confident in the protection these seats provide and the price is reasonable. Very soft fabric. Will continue to shop Safetly 1st in the future!!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: Very soft fabric

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: These are really good in a pinch.  We don't use them full-time (still in 5-point harness in our main cars), but these are perfect for travel.  The kids think they are comfortable, and they are easy and compact and a cinch to pack in a carry-on or suitcase.  They take up very little space. Recommended!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Works great my son loves it only 2 problems I have with it are minor. I feel like the high back portion detached a little too easily from the base. And the second reason I only give it 4 stars is that I wish the wings on the side of the headrest were a little larger my little one still falls asleep in cars and his poor head rolls around a little too much for comfort. His car seat had much larger ones and it worked perfect for car trip snoozes. Overall a great seat though!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: High back
Material: Wings on the side of the headrest

Review: Love this so much! The best seat ever for kids capable of buckling up on heir own but can’t sit to bulky seats and small cars. The best thing ever for traveling for a solo traveling mom of 2! Now I can’t wait for my youngest to be old enough to buy another.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: I do not often write reviews, even for products that I love, I just felt lead to leave this review. We had the previous version of this car seat (Graco 4Ever 4 in 1) that did not have DLX in the name. We transitioned our 18 month old to this car seat from her carrier when she was approximately 9 months old. I still had her rear facing. Last night, she and my husband were in a crash in which the car went off an embankment and rolled over. Every airbag in the car deployed (including roof and curtain airbags in the backseat), and it is undoubtedly going to be a total loss. However, my daughter is miraculously unscathed. I have no doubt the safety of this car seat played a huge part in her wellbeing. I will definitely be repurchasing this seat.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Rear facing

Review:
This is my second Graco car seat for my granddaughter and if I was smart enough this could be the only one.It was easy from A to Z, from taking it out from the box to instalment.It holds my two year old head perfectly which the first one was not.
If this is your first car seat to buy dont look for anything else believe me this does the job all the way.I have to say i bought this because my daughter got hers two years ago and was very happy with her purchase.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: easy instalment

Review: Very happy in Colorado with the Britax Frontier 85! It is a bit wider and sits taller than our previous 5-point restraint system, but the piece of mind is absolutely worth it. Ideal for larger vehicles with wider seats- not sure how it will work out with multiple car seats. Instructions for installation are easy to understand and include a few points I had not read with previous car seats (i.e. check the vehicle manual for maximum child weight for anchor points). Our child transitioned easily from the old car seat to the new Britax, and he loves the cup holders for storing his Hot Wheels.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: maximum child weight for anchor points
Installation Type: anchor points
Harness Type: 5-point restraint system

Review:
For small babies, this seat is great. Our twins were in the 4-lb range and our hospital wouldn't let us take them home in a carseat rated at 5 pounds and up - most car seats are. This carseat is 4 lbs and up. Consider this if you're having twins, who are usually low birthweight and a bit early!

We like it and find it very easy to manage. The strap on the back gets stuck sometimes when you are putting the baby back in, and that's annoying, but otherwise it's good.

Two things I didn't know as a first time parent:
- You'll have to get a new car seat (a convertible carseat) in about a year. This is only for a little baby. FYI - maybe everyone else knows this already but I didn't
- You can use the carseat without a base in a pinch! You do it with the seatbelt. I never knew this until my sister showed me. I might not have bought a spare base if I had known this because we didn't end up switching cars very much. The bases are for convenience - it's faster and less of a pain - but not strictly necessary.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 4 lbs and up
Installation Type: seatbelt

Review: [[VIDEOID:8d49ef367a436ebda1f5edf8080598f9]] I purchased two of these in March of 2018 for my infant. She is in the 75th percentile for height and weight. I have a CRV it sits in the middle portion with enough room on either side for 2 teenagers (small framed)  We are riding snackers and clean up is still quick and easy.  All the machine washable parts slip off without having to dismantle or reassemble the seat,  nor take it out of the car.  There are (what I call snack crumb catcher) under the seat which require a little more effort cleaning by reclining the seat back but a little cleaning detergent and paper towel does the job quickly.  😄 the cup holders are a rubbery/ silicone feel material and is still in perfect condition. The fabric does not appear worn despite the frequent machine washing.  Thankfully it's never needed to perform the main task it is designed for, but we are very comfortable now in the booster seat position. The chest and crotch buckles are all in great shape despite its constant usage.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat position
Weight Range of Child: 75th percentile for height and weight
Material: machine washable parts, fabric does not appear worn despite frequent machine washing, cup holders are a rubbery/ silicone feel material

Review: This car seat has been perfect for us the past year.  It has a much smaller profile than our previous carseat and our son has been pretty happy.  We have not had issues with the crotch buckle being too close or with the button being too difficult to press open.  It takes a little force to press the button down -- which is enough to prevent a child from being able to open it themselves.
Attribute_Related_Content: Harness Type: button being too difficult to press open, takes a little force to press the button down

Review: Great car seat and Amazon processing was superb as usual - came on time as promised. Car seat is unique in that it will convert to a booster as the child gets older. Has all the straps needed to connect into an older car as well.

Seat Type: Convertible to a booster
Installation Type: Straps to connect into an older car

Review: I've always bought really cheap car seats until this one. I see that more money gets a much heavier, sturdier feeling seat. I love the way it fits in the car, seems to sit a little higher up, and the narrow width is great since we have much more room in the back seat now. Love that there are no side "wings" that just make it easier for crumbs and toys to hide in there - stays cleaner.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Material: sturdier

Review: I absolutely love this carseat. It is super easy to instal rear facing or forward facing. You can adjust the straps with the press of a button (more like a pull but you get my gist). I love that it has two cup holders and how comfortable it feels. Honestly I want to order two more to put in our other vehicle.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing, forward facing
Installation Type: easy to instal
Harness Type: adjust the straps with the press of a button

Review:
The customer service team was able to help with this and refunded my money allowing me to purchase another seat.

I love the convenience of this and justified the additional money because of it. We purchased the seat in July. In less than one month the swivel ability jammed and we were unable to fix it.

The day to day convenience is not worth the potential danger and the huge inconvenience of fighting with the seat in an attempt to fix it and then dealing with not having it functioning at all. Customer service would not assist without the model number that I did not have access to because I was at work during their hours of operation.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Very nice material, like the sleekness of it. Easy to install and put together. We bought this car seat as an additional carseat so we do not have to keep switching the one we have out of our cars and this is worth the money! Plus, my son loves the cup holder and cubby holes in the seat for storing his snacks and toys !
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: Very nice material, like the sleekness of it.
Installation Type: Easy to install and put together.

Review: This carseat has all of the safety features that is required by the law and mom!  It's also beautiful to look at and the leather covered handle makes it a bit more comfortable for carrying.  This is a great carseat for the newer vehicles that have the rich leather interior.  This is an infant carseat up to 32 lbs.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant carseat
Weight Range of Child: up to 32 lbs
Material: leather covered handle

Review: Besides being easy to switch between cars, and secure. We were recently involved in a 70 mph crash when a person ran a stop sign and fell asleep. The booster seats high back made the frame of the seat take the impact. We rolled and landed driver side. My daughter was suspended by seat belt, frame of booster took brunt of impact. She has minimal bruising, but because of booster seat design, she wasn't strangled by the seat belt. Highly impressed and happy for daily usages as well. Will definitely be replacing our old one, with the exact same one. I am incredibly grateful and blessed we choose this model and company. God bless whomever designed it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat, high back  
Installation Type: seat belt  
Harness Type: seat belt

Review:
Very pleased with this seat. Love the extra head support (my toddler does a lot of napping in the car so this was important to me). We've kept our toddler rear facing, and this seat was simple to install using the latch system or the belt path. We previously had an older Recaro, and it was extremely difficult to install rear facing, this Britax is much easier. Straps tighten and loosen easily, and the fabric is soft but seems durable. Another reviewer complained about the large sticker right at their back, but it's not really a sticker, it's made of fabric and doesn't seem to bother my toddler.
We also own the $50 Evenflo Tribute as a spare, and though I believe it would do its job in a wreck as well as any other seat, the Britax is def worth the money in extras. The Evenflo has zero head support, so they slump forward when napping, and the straps require some definite muscle to tighten/loosen, not mention there are no strap covers so if you're not careful you will give your kid a strap burn across their neck. Installation is a pain...even the latch system in the Evenflo sucks. All of these things, in my opinion, make the Britax worth the money.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Weight Range of Child: toddler
Installation Type: latch system, belt path
Harness Type: straps tighten and loosen easily, strap covers
Material: fabric is soft but seems durable

Review: I absolutely love this seat! I can't say enough about it. This seat will fit most newborns great and will last them well into ages close to 5+. The install is easy and fast. My son loves this seat he just looks so comfy in it
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: newborns, ages close to 5+
Installation Type: easy and fast

Review: We love graco car seats! We usually get the nautilus model but we needed a rear facing seat for our daughter. She is too small to forward face but too big for her infant seat. This is awesome! It’s SO easy to adjust everything on this seat. The recline, the foot extender, the head rest. I’m so happy we found this and at such a good price! 10/10, highly recommend

Review: Fits my tall baby great so far! She was too big and too antsy to stay in an infant seat, so we moved her to this at 6 months. Now at 10 months, I love that the headrest adjusts for her height! Color is cute too. And it is super easy to move from one vehicle to another since all the straps are easy to use

Review: This is a wonderful seat but it is not rear facing (which is what I searched for) it should not be catergorized as one but I also should have looked into it more myself. I'm stuck with a seat for another year I can't use👎👎
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: not rear facing

Review: This is a great solution for getting your small schoolkid from the airport to the resort in an Uber if you don't have a shuttlebus option and don't want to carry a giant booster seat for a few short trips, or even short rental car travel if packing space is super premium.  But as others mention, the lack of ability to keep it unfolded & flat makes it tricky to get a consistent harness length to hold the shoulder belt down.  It's particularly prone to folding and scooching up the back in a seat with any bucket to it.  Also, the shoulder belt harness is just backwards -- I wish the clip and slack in the strap was toward the back, away from your kid's body, to make it easier to secure & stow as they sit back.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Weight Range of Child: small schoolkid

Review: This is our second purchase of one of these seats (we started off with just one to make sure we liked it). Extremely happy with this seat. My son is super comfy in it and it is so simple and smooth to recline when he falls asleep (and he is a LIGHT sleeper!). Heavy duty (definitely not a seat I would want to be passing between vehicles constantly) and durable construction. Would definitely recommend!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review: Very impressed. I have used our Britax ClickTight (easiest install ever) and needed another car seat for the grandparents vehicle. We decided on this and am very impressed. It fits well in a 2 door Pontiac G5. We installed using the lower LATCH system and top teacher (forward facing) and it was quite easy to get a solid tight installation. The quality is good and the seat is comfortable for my child. I would recommend this seat to anyone. 10/10
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: lower LATCH system and top teacher

Special Features: Rear Facing Seat, Machine Washable Seat Pad, LATCH Compatible
Review: Got this because of the safety ratings as well as reports that it fits in small cars. I drive a fiesta and never had problems using this seat in it  We did have to put it behind the passenger seat so the driver could adjust as needed but it worked out great. Got an extra base and those were extremely easy to install. Felt baby was secure and Safe. Personal preference is that the canopy was cheap and wasn’t long enough. Didn’t hold in place. But that’s minor compared to keeping the baby safe and ease of install for me.
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review: I hate this carseat. I grumble everytime I have to place my son in it. The straps are cutting into my son's thighs and I now have to buy a new carseat because customer service cannot replace the straps. My son is only 18 months. Save your money and buy another brand.

Mifold has been amazing, already in just a few days we have used it several times. It is strong and sturdy it feels very well made and is surprisingly heavy for a small seat. Quite a remarkable product and I recommend it especially if your child is often in cars with other people.

Review: Happy I bought this for my daughter! I like how big and bulky it is. It make me feel as if she is safe. Also like that I don't have to purchase another seat for her as she grows seeing as this one is convertible.

Review:
This booster seat is awesome. It didn’t think much of the latch, but in hindsight, I am so glad I got this. It makes all the difference for my son when he gets in. He reaches in and pulls himself up with the arms and there is no movement. It took a couple tries to get the latch down tight, but since then it hasn’t moved. The little hiding spot draw is great, but my son sometimes has issues opening. It is more user error than chair error.

The booster seat itself is light and easily fit in the seat for a BMW X3. No issues with width. The height is right up to the headrest, so I just raised the headrest one notch.

Review: I gave this four stars instead of five only because my 14 month old daughter hates being in this. Despite it being uncomfortable for her to be in. It is very easy to install. But it isn't a good option for families whom travel excessively.

Review: I bought this for my daughter who will be turning 5 soon.  I have done a lot of research on different booster seats out there and this one was the best one with all the features I was looking for.  I like the fact that it has a 5-point harness.  I would like her to use a harness until she is ready for the seat belt.  Also love the use of the Sure Latch.  It was very easy to install.  You just click both sides into your car's seat and it's secure.  It's very light and the material is very nice and easy to clean.  It has two cup holders but she uses one for her snack cup.  My daughter loves it.  She feels so grown up sitting in it.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review: We got this as well as a car seat bag with wheels. I was not going to pay $200 for a car seat/stroller combo, so we picked 2 alternatives. I was hoping that the Traveling Toddler would be great, but I found that it too much torque and stress on the suitcase. To add the weight of my car seat (a Britax) and my 22 pound 1 year old was just too much weight for the handle of the suitcase. It felt awkward and unstable. The physics of it just did not work. So, we put the seat in a bag with wheels and dragged it behind us. The bag was also better for our trip because we fly stand-by and wait and see what seats are left. There was no more window seats available on one of our flights, so we gate checked the seat and I was happy to know that it was protected.

I did a lot if research was originally going to do the diono but I love that this has recline options for both forward and rear facing.

It is super big but we still manage to fit it in our Kia Serento (2019). The driver (or passenger which ever side you keep the car seat on) seat does have to be very pulled up forward to be able to recline it (not reclined all the way in the images because my husband was driving and can’t pull his seat up as far as I can). Review: My daughter, age four, but on the petite side, is much more comfortable in this booster seat than in her previous booster seat.  The "wings" keep her head from bobbing up and down if she falls asleep in the car.  The deeper torso allows the lap belt to be properly positioned.  The belt guide at the top of the car seat keeps the belt away from her neck.  The headrest is adjustable, so it will "grow" with my daughter.  The only drawback, which has nothing to do with safety, is the cup holders which are really too shallow to hold anything.  Highly recommend!

Review: This car seat is the best seat out there in my opinion. I have spent many hours researching car seats for my children. I work in law enforcement and their father is in EMS so unfortunately, we are exposed to how tragic traffic collisions can become without the proper child restraints. I am hoping to become certified in the next few weeks as a CPST. With my research, I discovered that the key is a proper installation and because of this, I decided that I would buy a separate seat for each of my 2 children in each of the cars we routinely drive as well as their grandparent's vehicle. For my son who is 3.5 years old, I have owned several seats ranging from a basic Cosco front facing seat to Graco convertibles to Britax convertibles. My daughter is 7 months old and recently began to outgrow her Peg Perego infant seat. I decided to begin transitioning her to this seat in my primary vehicle and plan to purchase a couple more convertible car seats for the other vehicles over the next couple of months. I could not be happier. She is in the middle seat of my 2015 Nissan Pathfinder so I had to use a seat belt installation instead of LATCH. This made me super nervous as I was concerned about getting a secure seatbelt install, but the click tight technology has been very user friendly. She seems to be very content in the seat and a good fit. I'm not sure if budget will allow us to purchase multiple of this particular model of Britax, but I do think it was worth every penny in our primary vehicle and will be researching other similar seats thoroughly for the other seats she needs.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 3.5 years old, 7 months old
Installation Type: seat belt installation, LATCH, click tight technology

I would assume it would fit her okay. We added the small cushion it came with for a little bit of lift and now she is used to it. I would not recommend for a tiny infant but overall feels safe, which is the most important.

Review:
This was a great purchase! I’ve traveled twice since I purchased this and it was a life saver especially when you don’t want to have your child on your lap the entire plane ride. The only thing is of course you have to purchase the child their own seat. The book bag is light weight and it’s convenient when walking through the airport and storing the empty bag in the over head compartment. The bag has enough space for a neck pillow and even some pampers lol.
The only thing I would have liked is if it had a head strap for when the child is asleep because my daughter’s head was slumped over. I ended up buying a head strap from Amazon and it fits around the car seat perfectly. So with a combination of her neck pillow and head strap she’s good to go!
The other gripe is that I got approached by the stewardess a few times on connecting flights to ensure the car seat was flight approved and I had to point to the tiny airplane symbol on the car seat. They should have a tag or something to show it is airplane approved.

Review: Very compact as advertised. Convenient and compact alternative to other booster seats on the market. I like the extra room it frees up in the row. I'm knocking it one star because it is a little tricky for my 4 year old to manage by herself. I am frequently having to bend backwards into the middle row to help her get the seat belt into and out of the side restraints. There are 3 adjustable positions, but it doesn't stay in the position. A slight bump can push it all the way in essentially trapping the strap between the adjustable restraint and the mifold itself. When my daughter is sitting on it, it is extremely difficult for her to get her finger underneath the mifold in order to press the release that allows the adjustable restraints back out in order to undo the seat belt. Perhaps later production models will fix the issue, but that is my primary complaint. I would recommend to others and would most likely buy again, especially if this issue was remedied.

The clip-on side cup holder is EXTREMELY flimsy and breaks EASILY! The mechanism that tightens straps makes constant rattling noises which keeps my baby awake on LONG car rides. She can never sleep for very long because of the rattling noises.

The only downfall, and perhaps I haven't adjusted it correctly, but she has a hard time with the straps on her shoulders. It all seems very cumbersome. Review: We bought this car seat for our 9 month old daughter because she is a very long baby and doesn't fit in her infant car seat any more. I didn't read any reviews because I was too excited about getting such a good deal on the seat and the other seat we have is Graco and we love it. She obviously still has to be rear facing until she is 2 according to the laws and the fact that her neck muscles wouldn't be strong enough to withstand a crash if she was forward facing. My husband and I spent 3 hours trying to get this seat in our car. The instructions say to place rolled up towels under the front of the seat to create an incline. With the towels under there we couldn't get it to tighten enough with the seat belt or the in seat latch hooks. We tried taking the towels out but the placement of the straps is so far at the front of the seat that if i slammed on my breaks the seat would be able to tip up towards the back of the car no matter how tight the belts are. We turned it around and tried to see if it would go in well forward facing and it did a great job. It was completely secure. Unfortunately it sat in my garage for over 30 before we attempted to put it in the car so I couldn't return it, otherwise I would have. But now we just have to find something else and we will be able to use this one when she is two. I wouldn't recommend it if you are buying for an under 2 year old.

Review: This chair is super easy to install correctly. But the sides are so high, it’s hard to get my one year old in and out of it. We have this car seat in a sedan and there just isn’t much space between the chair and the roof. The longer we have it, the more I hate it for the day to day use because it’s so hard to get my baby in and out. I do appreciate knowing it’s installed correctly. It does seem very comfortable for my baby once we get her in.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: super easy to install correctly; knowing it’s installed correctly

Review:
Extremely disappointed and will probably NEVER own Britax again! I am a twin mom that immediately purchased B-Safe carriers for my twins, the double B-Agile stroller, then when they turned 11 months old I purchased them both Pavilion 70-G3 convertible cowmooflage print car seats. I loved most everything about them until yesterday.
We went on a road trip over the weekend and one of my girls got a little car sick. We had cleaned it all up but I wanted to wash the entire cover when we returned home to ensure it was clean. When we removed the cover we found that the head restraint 'wings' were severely cracked, like nearly torn off. So we checked the other car seat immediately and found that both sides were completely broke off. This really stressed me out knowing my kids were just on a car trip in these seats and the totted safety features are completely broken.
I started calling Britax this morning and their phone number was temporarily unavailable. I finally got through this afternoon and was told my seats are outside of the 1 year warranty but that I could buy new wing pieces. I told her that the seats are minimally used, my toddlers do not fight getting into them and we have never had an accident. She informed me that they are made of the same foam that is in your cars bumper and are made to break. I said but this is less than normal wear causing them to break, not an accident. She told me the car seat was fine without them but that I would have to pay to replace them.
So if you are looking to buy a car seat and reviewing the extra safety features that make Britax sound like they are worth all that extra $$$$, think again. Those features are meant to break and may have never been keeping my children any more safe than the Chicco or Graco's. What a bunch of misleading marketing or a really great way to ensure they continue to suck money out of you from the constant purchase of replacement parts!
My children do not go in the car daily and sometimes only once per week. We live in the country and prefer to play and roam at home. So this happened in 2 years of our use, imagine how quickly it can happen if you use them daily and have a child that fights getting in the car how quickly it could be happening to others.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: cover, head restraint 'wings' severely cracked, broken, made of foam

Review:
This seat gave us 17 months of infrequent use before the Clicktight (CT) feature rendered the seat unusable. Because we don't have a dedicated vehicle and instead use car-and ride-sharing services, knowing we would be able to safely, correctly, and quickly install a seat with a standard seatbelt in any vehicle, anytime, anywhere was what sold us on the Marathon CT. We were willing to pay more for the CT feature and lug this beast of a seat into Ubers and Zipcars, through airports, and on planes because we believed its quality and supposed ease of use was worth the extra weight and hassle. We still stood behind this seat when its quirks started showing (the harness tension was always slightly uneven no matter how many times we reset it; the harness adjustment area became a repository for crumbs and curious fingers; the selected recline angle was deceiving and would usually decrease once the CT system was engaged; the lower harness straps sometimes left marks on my child's legs; and so on).

Unfortunately, the CT system proved to be the demise of this seat. More often than not, the CT dial would only partially engage when I pushed the panel down with my hands, especially when all slack was removed from the seatbelt as instructed. Instead of clicking shut, the panel would bounce off a taut belt. A gentle kneel was almost always needed to fully lock or disengage the CT panel. The seat also was difficult to rear-face in our preferred rear center position in certain vehicles, with multiple attempts needed to ensure a no-budge install.

While attempting to install the Marathon CT rear-facing in the rear center position in Toyota sedan last weekend, I encountered my typical issue of the panel not fully engaging when pushed down. I gently kneeled on it to click it shut and the dial became displaced under the panel, making it inoperable. Because we were away from home at a special event, I looked for other ways to install the seat without using CT and found that using LATCH on this seat is (1) absolutely horrendous and (2) impossible to achieve safely without having a functional CT panel, as the LATCH belt path runs under it. We were grateful to make it home safely by doing a makeshift LATCH installation in an outboard seat (kind of like how you attach a seat to the Britax wheeled travel cart, which incidentally ALSO broke the same day - so much for Britax quality!). The LATCH belt was very difficult to loosen and it took 15 minutes for my spouse and I to remove the seat from the car. Worst of all, the seat is no longer safe to use.

I have since looked for information in the installation manual as well as on Britax's site about whether kneeling on the CT panel during installation is acceptable and have found nothing discouraging or forbidding it. The seat is no longer under warranty, but I reported the issue to Britax and am awaiting a response. If anything, the CT malfunction has greatly diminished my once-high regard for Britax's safety and durability. I am very disappointed and am looking for a non-Britax replacement.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Clicktight, standard seatbelt, LATCH
Harness Type: harness tension, harness adjustment, lower harness straps
Seat Type: rear-facing

Review: If you looking for something compact...this is totally the way to go.  If your looking for lots of bells and whistles,  this isn't for you.  It's compact b/c it cuts out all the extra frills of a carseat...but leaves the important details.  It's super comfy, it lays your baby back enough so if they are a sleeper when they ride - they can do so without their neck breaking.  My baby is 9 months and 19 lbs and she still fits comfy with the insert in...so I'd say she has plenty of room to grow.  NOW...your going to read a lot of people with issues with the seat flipping up in rear facing,  in the anchored / tethered position.  Well this is true, but I took the tether strap that runs from the back (the one you tether in fwd facing position)..and ran it under the carseat,  tethered it to a seat anchor and this thing isn't going anywhere!  It's the most solid seat I've had yet!  You just have to do your homework before installing.

Review:
As mentioned, I am a happy father of 5 beautiful children ranging from 13 years old to a new born. We have used, abused and relied upon mountains of, and thousands of dollars worth of different "Kid Gear" throughout the years. This is my second Britax car seat now.

This item is a good one to invest in. It isn't the cheapest, but as a former police officer, I will tell you, don't cut corners on getting a safe car seat for your child even though they are overpriced. And make sure it is anchored properly! No car seat is safe if it is not anchored the right way. Pull the belt out all the way and crank that dang thing in there tight. Your kid is worth more than the leather on your back seat.

This seat is bulky but rated well for impact. It has good anchoring options and instructions too. The only criticism I have besides the cost (I'm sure the mark up on car seats is huge!), is the belt clips under the cushioning are too tight. If you anchor the seat in tight, there is no way those plastic clips will snap in place. This could lead a consumer to think those weak clips will hold the seat to the actual seat belt. Not true; even if they improve those clips. And on a shoulder belt, those clips are worthless. Add clearance to the clips and that would be great, or just get rid of them.

And by the way, this seat is designed so you don't have to have your wife or another one of this kids with tiny hands to thread the belt through the seat. My recommendation is, don't buy this seat from Target or Walmart, it is not the same seat! Pay the shipping and get this exact model. Priced right for the quality in comparison to the others. Good job Britax
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: anchored, belt, shoulder belt
Harness Type: belt clips

Review:
I read some of the reviews and thought this deserved one.

I bought these for my two boys because I needed something that was not too bulky for my European car and that can easily be stowed away if I had adult passengers. Also, the obvious, easy to travel with and move from car to car.

Main issues that I read were:
- Seat-belt positioner on each side (red ear thingies), locking and folding mechanism: I agree that it is somewhat of an annoyance that you often need to pull the latch on the bottom to readjust their width. They would have been perfect if you also needed to use the latch to retract them, but it is something I learned to accept. Extra 5 seconds is not a big deal in my opinion.

- Seat-belt positioner on each side (red ear thingies), inner hook: This is to prevent the belt from sliding out. I admit that it takes some practice to get used to handling these (my wife still cant), but I like that it is this way because the kids also cant play around with it and unbuckle themselves at will. I don't mind this feature at all. You can get used to it. (I just wonder sometimes if rescue people would find it difficult to unlatch in the case of an accident (God forbid), but yet again, they'll probably cut the belts.)

- Behind the back belt hook: Can be tricky and a little uncomfortable if they were not at the required level. But once set, they stay and are not a problem.

- Sliding off the seat: I only found this issue when trying it with kids that are under the required height. People might find this an issue because with regular boosters, this wont happen even with a shorter/smaller/younger kid.

All-in-all, I love this product and looking forward to traveling with it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Seat-belt positioner on each side (red ear thingies), locking and folding mechanism, pull the latch on the bottom to readjust their width, latch to retract them, inner hook to prevent the belt from sliding out, behind the back belt hook
Weight Range of Child: under the required height

Review:
With our daughter outgrowing her infant car seat, we researched and decided on the Britax Boulevard 70 (2012), which we purchased at a local store and put into our SUV, which we drive more often. When it came time to get the second car seat, we purchased this 70-G3 for my car, only because the 2012s were no longer available at as good a price. This one is in my 2-door sports coupe and it still fits rear-facing and in the center seat. I worried it might not fit there, or that it might be hard to see over when looking in the rearview mirror, but all was for naught. It fits great, and it doesn't obstruct my view at all.

Between the two versions we have, the main difference that I've noticed is that this 70-G3's straps don't lengthen as much as the older version, meaning we have to work a little harder to get our daughter's arms through when buckling her in. This appears to be a safety feature ("Versa" Tether related). Otherwise, it's a great seat so far. She sweats quite a bit in it sometimes (living in AZ), but car seats are not breathable anyway, so I imagine this would happen in any car seat, especially when rear-facing. The head support is plush and this has the true side impact protection, as well.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-facing
Harness Type: straps don't lengthen as much

Review:
I wanted a seat that would fit rear-facing behind the driver seat without having to sacrifice leg room. My husband is 6' and I am 5'10 and we drive a 2009 Toyota Camry. This seat fits!! In recline position "3" the bubble-level indicator is just within the rear-facing bounds and I didn't have to move the driver's seat at all.

I really like the force-multiplying latch install, this is the first time I've ever installed a car seat without breaking a nail/doing yoga in the backseat/swearing like a sailor.

The other seat I have for comparison is the Graco MyRide 65 and I like this seat WAY better. It's heavier, but less bulky. MyRide didn't fit rear-facing. The NextFit's padding is cushier and I like the fact that the cupholder comes off so I can clean it.

Review: In each airport during our last trip, we had people mention what a great idea this was.  I agree with them.  This makes it easier to have more carry on baggage while traveling with a little one, which has already saved me enough checked baggage fees to justify the cost of the strap.  It is hard to have a full size carry on if you're pushing a regular stroller.  Besides, if you're lugging along the car seat for the child to use on the plane, then you may as well put it to good use in the terminal.  Even if you are travelling with an infant on your lap, you can just check the car seat planeside.  And, in either case, you can still check a stroller in your checked baggage for no cost.  So I really didn't see any downside to this product.

Review: I bought this before there were any reviews and I hated to take that chance but I like Chicco products and it looked like a good option. And as portable booster seat goes, it's great: it's very compact and portable. In addition, it's a study seat so it's great for travel. However, our intention was to use it in the house and our table has about a 4" vertical "rim" under the top (there's probably a term for this but I don't know what it is") and if the booster seat is raised up at all, we can't then pull our daughter up to the table. As such, our only option is to use the booster seat in its fully-lowered position and that then raises our daughter up about 2 inches over simply sitting in the chair which leaves her sitting too low. The seat needs to have the ability to raise up to a point in between its fully-lowered position and its current lowest raised position; since it doesn't have this, it's not workable for us. We'll keep it in the car and maybe use it at restaurants but unlike some other reviewers, we're okay with restaurant high chairs (we just wipe them down) so for us, this was a bad purchase (but it's not fair to call the chair itself bad, which is why I'm giving it 3 stars).

Review: We have have used these since our little ones were little all the way up. Our one year old and our seven year old are both in these! I wish I had a picture of the wreck but I don't. We were t-boned in our Acura directly where the car seat was and the interior panel of the car knocked our little girl sideways but she wasn't even crying and there wasn't a mark on the car seat or her. Review:
Bought 2 of these for my grandkids. Installed in a 2018 Ford F-150 crew cab. The seats are nice and the kids say they are comfortable. They are easy to install. I do wish they had a strap from the top of the back of the seat to hold the seat more in place as it only has the 2 lower straps on the rear bottom. The seat moves around a little, even when fully tightened. I have these on leather seats and I'm afraid the way the seats move around with kids in them will scuff the leather. Also, in a 2018 F-150 crew cab, the rear upright of these seats will not fit properly with the headrests on the rear seat of the truck. I had to remove the headrests to fit properly.
Update: After having the seat in my truck continuously for 6 months, I took them out for a trip when not needed. First, the seat base design leaves a perminent indention in the rear seats of the truck. The leather wasn't scratched or torn, but the seat foam now has perminent indentions in it and looks bad. Second, upon inspecting the seat cushions of he Diono car seat, I removed the front of the seat cover and found that the seat cushion material is actually a styrofoam material about 1/4 inch think and is really hard. I instantly realized what my granddaughters meant when they said the seats are not comfortable. How could they be? Third, at the request of my granddaughters, I removed the backs of the seats and am now only using the bases and the girls say they like the seats a little better. Lastly, if I buy more booster seat(s) in the future, I will buy a different brand.

I do have some issues though. The lap belt guides push back in so easily, and are a pain to extend again! This makes unbuckling my son so difficult due to having to slide the button on the bottom of the booster in order to extend the guides and slide the seatbelt out. The booster also slides around the car seat and my son always ends up in an awkward position.
I would have given this 5 stars were it not for the inconvenience of the lap belt guides constantly sliding back in to the booster.

Review: I have always used Britax seats and then purchased another brands booster - big mistake! That seat ALWAYS “falls down” when in a high position. I have not had any issues with the Britax booster dropping positions. I wish I would have just order this one first because of my previous experience with Britax products. I would highly recommend this seat.

Review: Like many of the other reviewers we also own a Britax Marathon. Love it...not one complaint. We were looking for a backup carseat for our Cherokee and thought this would be great since we do plan on having other children. We figured we could just move our daughter into this seat and put the new baby in her Marathon. At first, she was thrilled over the cupholders and storage compartmets in the armrest. This new seat excitement quickly diminished during our first car ride of maybe 20 minutes. We immediatly noticed her struggling to get comfortable pushing on the armrest trying to force the headrest back. We thought maybe it would just take some getting used to so we kept the seat. She still hates it and fusses alot (9 months later). If she does happen to fall asleep her chin is resting on her chest which never happens in the Britax. Wish we had returned the seat. Glad it's only a backup. If you truly want comfort and safety fork over the dough for the Best Britax you can aford.

It is on the bigger side (I have a mini van so its not much a problem) but I feel very confident driving around with him in his seat. I am able to fit this car-seat next to his big brother's front-facing booster seat (he is 3 so it still has the buckles across his chest). Honestly I only have great things to say about this car-seat, I love everything about it!

Review: We moved from a chicco keyfit 30 infant car seat to this and I have to say it has been smooth sailing.  It takes some getting used to but after the first week you'll appreciate the whole click tight system. I feel like the click tight system is way sturdier then the whole latch system, after clicking it in this thing seriously doesn't move. No more messing about trying to pull the side latches as tight as possible, a simple feed through of the belt and push the seat down till the click tight button is level and voila all set to go. Be warned though this car seat is built like a tank so be prepared for how much it weighs, I personally don't have a problem moving this thing back in forth between cars but some people will. All in all an excellent car seat you'll feel comfortable sticking your child in.

Review:
I have a now-adult daughter and two grandkids, one a new-born. Because of the spacing of the various births, I’ve had several child car seats over the years (decades, actually).

I think this is the best one I’ve ever had.

The first thing I noticed, even before removing it from the box, was its weight. This thing is heavy, make no mistake. But that’s due to its very solid and robust construction. Frankly, I’ve never seen anything like it. It’s a tank! And it’ll protect your munchkin like a tank protects soldiers.

It fastens in place in the car very easily, with a simple click-snap. Bingo, you’re done. No fiddling endlessly with seat belts, trying to reach into deep unseeable recesses for adjustments.

It can be used for kids all the way up to 65 pounds, so it’s good for quite a few years of your kid’s growth. It provides protection from forces that can come from any direction, and allows a lot of ventilation to circulate around your child so he or she shouldn’t become overheated under normal conditions.

I can’t overstate how impressed I am by this car seat. I’d give it 6 stars if I could.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: up to 65 pounds
Installation Type: simple click-snap

Review: Love the car seat, wish the company would make a better variety of feminine colors, but we had to settle for this print. It's actually fun and lovely in person, just like the photo description. Because of the impact something-or-others on either side of the product, it is VERY large and wide! Much larger than we'd imagined, but definitely worth it knowing that our daughter is that much safer in case of an accident. Unfortunately we had to return the product because we'd meant to order the Advocate Click Tight, and this was the Advocate Click n' Safe. Whoops!
Attribute_Related_Content:

Review: I ordered this for my grandaughter for christmas, and its really a nice carseat, has so many nice features and looks really nice.very plush, and amazon was free shipping and plus about 10 bucks less then I have seen it other places. very nice.

Review: We like this car seat so far. My only complaint is that it seems a little snug around the head area; but it doesn’t seem to bother my daughter at all. So as long as she’s happy and safe then I’m okay with it!
Attribute_Related_Content: Material

Special Features: Includes LATCH connectors that attach to vehicle, keeping the booster seat secure when not in use., The backrest on the Viaggio HBB 120 can be removed for easier travel and transport.
Review:
I'm a car seat psycho (for safety) and I've tried multiples of every version of seat (infant, convertible, HBB...) to find the very best of the best. After 3 different HBBs, this Peg Flex is the holy grail. Here's why:

It doesn't have arm rests so your kid can actually do the buckle unassisted. This is huge because you go from a kid that can do their convertible seat straps to a kid that needs to be assisted in finding the buckle every.single.time. in every boosterthat has arm rests. This seat and the Maxi Cosi Rodifix are thus winners in this category.

The Flex has a more narrow footprint than others because it doesn't have armrests. Need 3 kids to ride? Need 2 to sit next to one another? You're golden. You can park the Flex next to a variety of seats without issue. I have one next to a Nuna Pipa and a Clek Foonf in a Land Rover Discovery (which doesn't have the broadest back seat).

The Flex adjusts in 4 directions so your picky big kid can decide exactly how the seat is best for them.

As with all Peg Perego products, the fabrics are OUTSTANDING. We have the "licorice" version of the Flex, which is a combo of really soft, highly padded fabrics touching the body and edges with really gorgeous leather finished with white top stitching. This seat isn't more expensive than its competitors, buy it looks and feels like it should be. Super gorgeous, even if you have a luxury car-quality interior.

This seat "makes my buns feel the happiest of any car seat I've ever had!" per my 7 year old. If that isn't a rousing endorsement, I don't know what is.

The seat belt shoulder clip is well-designed so that the belt easily pulls through and retracts without issue (this was a constant issue with the RodiFix, the Oobr, and, to a lesser extent, the Britax Parkway in both my Honda Odyssey and the Discovery).

The folding mechanism seems like a "so what" feature, but is actually really handy. I've used it a handful of times in only a few weeks as I've found myself suddenly needing cargo room. I just remove and fold up the Flex, park it on the front floor, and collapse it's 2nd row seat. Super easy and quick. The latch release and install lever is also delightfully straightforward to use.

All in all, there isn't anything to complain about with this seat. Not even the little pull out cup holders. They're not indestructible, but most European-made seats don't even offer an add on option (like the RodiFix). I also don't mind that there's no bottom as I won't ever have to discover some sort of weird goo science experiment at the bottom of one!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: HBB (High Back Booster)  
Installation Type: latch  
Material: fabrics, leather

Review: This car seat is very heavy duty, seems comfortable and well made except for the button to loosen the straps.  When the car seat is in rear facing position there is no room to get your hand in and push the button to release the tension!  Very, very frustrating.

My only complaint on this seat is the back come apart from the base when you take the seat out...why can't it stay connected?

Installing was super easy using the latch system, probably the easiest time I've ever had installing a car seat. Definitely easier than infant bucket seat systems and very easy to tighten and secure.

The LATCH system is impossible to tighten in rear facing installation - this was an issue in both my Jeep Cherokee and my husband's Dodge Ram truck. The seatbelt can be used, however then the seat tips slightly to the side (or a lot to the side in the truck), which is irritating at the least, if not unsafe. The LATCH system is also just the metal clips you have to hook through. There is no seatbelt lock off to use either. I am stuck with this car seat but the second one I purchased, I am returning.
On the positive side, when in the most reclined position my baby was comfortable when he was sleeping.
