Review: This is a wonderful car seat......left off one star because it is so bulky that it does not fit well in my old Volvo station wagon.  It does, however, fit well in newer cars and SUV'S with roomier back seats.  My husband and I just traded cars for when we have the grandchild.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: bulky

Review:
We really liked the Portabout 5 Evenflo infant carseat we had used with our 1st child but unfortunately we couldn't find that base when we were expecting our 2nd child. So we went with Evenflo Brand again with the Discovery.

I do like how it is rated for a little bit bigger child up to 22lbs / 29" vs the 20lb / 26" limit on the Portabout. Both my boys have been big (9+lbs and one almost 23' long at birth) So the infant carseat won't work for them for too long.

I never had a problem with either handle not staying where it was supposed to.

Discovery is a bit harder to manuver a sleeping baby in and out of the car. The hook on the front of the carseat needs to be tipped forward to hook in, then the back snaps down, so if baby is sleeping they are tipped forward to get hooked in. The portabout didn't have to be tipped as severly forward because there wasn't a hook it needed to hook into. Some claim the Portabout was hard to get in and out, I never experienced this.

The only real complaint I have with the Discovery is the flat piece that holds the 2 straps together tends to slide down. I follow the instructions to slide it up to Baby's armpits height, but even if he's sleeping that piece slides down to about his stomach area, in a short 5 mile car ride. I would say the seat would be greatly improved and rank a 5 star if they just replaced the sliding connector with the plastic clip one they used in the Evenflo Portabout. Wherever I slide that one into position I find it stays put. Personally I found a new base for the Portabout on the web and have ordered it. I'm going to go back to the Portabout carseat. The connector concerns me that if I were in an accident, I am not convinced he would stay in the seat very well. I'll take the reduced size limit and get my 2 year old a booster seat combo and move my youngest into the convertable carseat when he gets too big for the Portabout.

Hope this helps you make a safe decision for your little one.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant carseat, convertable carseat
Weight Range of Child: up to 22lbs, 20lb limit
Installation Type: hook on the front of the carseat needs to be tipped forward to hook in, then the back snaps down
Harness Type: 2 straps, flat piece that holds the 2 straps together, sliding connector, plastic clip

Review: Very easy to get a secure install with the latch. Haven’t tried installing it with the seatbelt yet. I got this to use temporarily until I can get the more expensive seat I wanted more. This seat is light, looks and feels amazing, and is a good price. Pics are of it rearfacing in the most upright then the headrest at its highest and lowest.

Review: I like the little pockets that hold the center buckles in place for easy of buckling down a squiggling tot. Over all the seat is easy to install and move from car to car, which seems to come up a lot. That is where the stars start to fall off. The strap that goes over the seat to the rear anchor point, once you graduate to front facing, is really hard to loosen and tighten. I've had three of these seats and it's not a seat to seat issue. All of them are hard to work with. I didn't really know any better until I tried a borrowed car seat and it was so much easier to deal with that center strap. That's the only real drawback in this seat. If you can set and forget then you'll have a 5 star experience. Bopping from car to car and you'll know too.

This is the best car seat on the market for extended rear facing! My son is 4.5 years old, 44” y’all and roughly 45 lbs and he’s still completely comfortable rear facing in this seat. It’s so easy to raise the headrest too, no need to rethread the straps.
Extended rear facing is so much safer for our precious kids. This seat is a great deal and makes it easy to continue rearfacing to the maximum!

Review: This is our forth Britax car seat (one infant seat and 2 earlier models now discontinued). It is definitely my favorite. The straps are easy and it is big enough to feel safe but not so big that it is uncomfortable to sit next to in the back seat.

Seat Type: Forward Facing

Review:
I was excited with the idea of a 3 in 1 car seat and that it reclyned. However, the reclyner is extremely useless. It makes no difference what so ever. In fact, I had to even put a pillow under my daughter's butt because she sinks in (a child won't be able to sit up straight at all). As a result of the sinking in, her belly was getting a bit compressed I guess and every time she sat on this seat, she was vomitting withing 10-20 minutes into our drive. This was happening from when she was 8 months until 2 years. It got better when I began putting the pillow under her.

Also,she is now 2 1/2 years old and weights 28 lbs. Guess what? She hates the seat even more because the straps are too short and there has been times that i've accidently pinched her skin between her hers. I don't understand why they would advertise this seat as a seat that has a 5 point harness up to 65 lbs.

Finally, whenever she fell asleep, she had no head support on the sides, so I had to put a stuffed animal or small pillow to keep her head comfortably.

One good thing about it is that it's very durable and easy to clean. I think I've cleaned this seat more than anyone in the world (due to all her vomitting)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: 3 in 1 car seat, reclyned (reclined)
Weight Range of Child: 2 1/2 years old and weights 28 lbs, 5 point harness up to 65 lbs
Harness Type: 5 point harness, straps are too short
Material: very durable and easy to clean

Review: I purchased this car seat because it has great reviews, an easy to compare website, and to be honest my 'friends were doing it'.  I felt pressure to spend more on a car seat and I guess I equated safety with price...not sure I feel that way anymore.  We purchased a second car seat for my husband's truck and spent half the price for a quality, safe car seat. My only advice is to spend what you are comfortable with and don't worry about brand names or what your friends are buying.

I've recommended them to everyone who travels with kids needing booster seats plus then they're more sanitary than whatever option the rental company is offering.

I'm sure it's as safe as any other carseat but the plastic feels flimsy and the fabric is thinner than I'd like. Cupholders are nice I guess. Review: my daughter (14 mo) seems very comfy in this seat. it is HUGE, so make sure that your vehicle is large enough. the ONLY disappointment is the fabric, which many are using now. what's w/the shinny stuff? some claim it's more heat tolerant. i'm not so sure about that. on really hot days, my daughter's head still gets pretty wet. plus, it seams to really show water marks. i haven't washed the pad yet, so maybe those come out. all-in-all a great purchase for us. it appears to provide my child with a safe and secure ride. plus, no recalls on this one so far. i would buy it again, but would try a different fabric.

Review: This is a fantastic car seat. The material feels great, not cheap like other seats. Definitely worth the price. However, the seat itself is very heavy and I had an issue with neck support! I stopped being able to lift my newborn in it at about 4 weeks. So if you are on the tinier side, not terribly strong, or recovering from a c section, you will not be able lift it yourself. Suppose that could be a deal breaker for some so I wanted to point it out. In addition and more importantly, my little one's neck looked terribly squished in it as the pads that hold their body and head have a large gap in between. I fixed this by placing a small washcloth in that gap so his head wasn't squished forward into his chest. So not the best on neck support...but an easy fix if your creative. I still would reccomend it for the quality and impact safety ratings.
Attribute_Related_Content:

Weight Range of Child: newborn, about 4 weeks

Review: I've been looking for a couple of years for a nice, smaller seat. This works wonders. I have a 2018 Jeep Compass, it has 60/40 rear fold down seats. The car seat is on the 40 portion and the other side can fold down with no issue and doesn't bump against it. My 5yo boy fits in perfect. The leg room is pretty good as well (with the passenger seat pulled up far). Plus, the LATCH system is xtra easy to install. I would highly recommend this seat for smaller vehicles.

Review:
We've been using this booster for a couple of months now. It was easy to travel with, and install, and our kid hasn't complained about discomfort. Over-all it was worth the money and does its job pretty well. I'm mostly satisfied.

I have only two complaints about it, and they are minor.

There is a strap included that is used to tension the seatbelt and hold it in the right position. It is easy to use, but slightly annoying for two reasons. First, the buckle that attaches it to the seat belt slips a bit over time, you you have to readjust it occasionally. Second, if you want to travel, there is no good mechanism to retract this strap into the body of the booster. There is a place for the buckle to attach for transport, but to use it you have to carefully slide the strap into a slot a bit at a time. It's not a show stopper, but it is annoying and time consuming.

I'm including these complaints not so much to dissuade customers from buying the booster, but to encourage Chico to improve their product.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: seatbelt
Harness Type: strap

Review: I’m so happy with this car seat. After hrs of research & going back and forth I’m so happy I picked this one. The straps are sooo easy to adjust. Haven’t installed in yet, will be doing that today. I will recommended this carseat to others. And a bonus is it’s super cute!

Review: Decent seat for the price. Installation is a little trickier than my NextFit (when it comes to tightening the LATCH) and the straps are set pretty wide. My child is 2 yo average build, still rear facing and even with correct chest clip position and strap tightness I have to fuss with the strap placement at her shoulders every time she gets in. I have never had this issue with any other car seat that I have used regularly (5 so far) and its enough of an issue that I don't really want my husband to use the seat. This car seat feels very sturdy, safe and very heavy.
One complaint would be that it's difficult to remove the base from my tiny car and my other complaint would be that it takes up so much room in my Fiesta that the front passenger seat is almost unusable.

We have the new car seat behind the driver seat so the driver isn't crushed up against the steering wheel and this car seat is behind the passenger seat which gives me just enough room to slide in sideways and leaves my knees scraping on the glove box, I'm about 5'4".

Review: The carseat is just as promised except for one thing.  It doesn't come with the plastic cupholder shown on the child's right hand side.  There is the little pull out compartment shown on the child's left hand side and then just a round, elastic opening on the right side where you would think the plastic cupholder would slide in.  I bought a red and a purple model from two different sellers and they both came without the plastic insert even though it is shown on the picture on the box.  Very bizarre.  My kids put their water bottles in the elastic slot and it works, but it would be nice to have the rigid cup holder as shown.  I would have rated it 5 stars with the cupholder.

Review: We've had this seat for about 3 years now.  The seat is great in almost every way.  The materials are nice, the 5-point harness is easy to tighten and loosen, and the cup holders are a nice feature.  The 3-stars are for the AWFUL latch loosening system!  Tightening the car seat down is easy enough.  Just clip in and pull.  But if you want to take the thing out, prepare to shrink your hands, and gain Hulk-like strength, because you basically have to apply outward pressure to loosen it without anything to brace the mechanism against.  So you're basically using the belt tension to try to pry off the buckle to loosen the belt.  Imagine trying to remove a nail from a board that flexes away from your hammer every time you pull.  Redesign the latch system and you've got a 5-star seat.

*LATCH tightening system is superior to other seats I've used. Great for moving in and out of different vehicles.
*Tall seat will rear face my child past age 2 and forward facing hopefully until 6 as the packaging states it's intended to.

Cons
*Buckle and straps are always lost beneath the child.
*It's a little challenging to tighten the harness properly. On a positive note it loosens well.
*The seat cover cannot come off at all. On a positive note the bottom seat pad unsnaps for potty accidents.

Review:
We have owned the Graco Nautilus for almost 2 years, we bought the Frontier because she outgrew her seat in our other vehicle. Honestly, we thought to just buy another Nautilus but were impressed by the reviews for the Frontier and decided to "upgrade" if you will.
Great decision. Here are my favorite points...SAFETY! The frame and features that Britax offers seem unmatched at this price point. Hopefully, we never have to find out how well they actually work.
EASE OF INSTALLATION: The manual was a quick read, set-up was a breeze, and installation took less than 5 minutes. I especially love the ease of use with the up and down slide of the shoulder straps. The latch system is easy to adjust and it tightens down snugly.
HEAD POSITIONING: In our Nautilus and every other car seat we have owned, her head is not supported if she falls asleep. However they have built this seat, her head does not flop over AT ALL!! I couldn't believe it. We often take road trips and she sleeps many hours in her seat, so this makes a big difference.
QUALITY OF MATERIALS: Super soft materials, not sure about stain resistance...yet...but seems okay so far. The fabrics are much nicer than the Nautilus.
And finally, its the little things that make a difference...two cup holders. :)

We are glad we put a little more money into this seat. We are satisfied with the product.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: shoulder straps
Material: Super soft materials, fabrics are much nicer

Review:
The cart itself looks and feel sturdy - but there are other more practical options that are just as well made and more well priced. The key - and only - selling point for this cart is that it will fit down a narrow airplane aisle. While I have never needed to use it on an airplane, I am certain this claim is factually true. However, one needs to worry more about the child car seat than the actual cart, as the average child car seat is wider than the cart itself...
Be advised that the cart uses rollerblade wheels. Anyone who has ever roller bladed *knows* that such wheels are intended for FLAT, SMOOTH surfaces. Airports provide plenty of such surfaces, but it is getting to the airport where this cart is useless. One needs to walk super slow and needs to be ultra careful to avoid every bump, crack, twig, etc to not send the cart and any cargo strapped to it flipping over to its side. In my case, it's only been an empty child car seat that has been sent tumbling over. No one got hurt, but it was an embarrassing inconvenience as you have to stop and readjust and clean everything before resuming your trip at a slow plodding pace.
I have since (quickly) replaced this crappy britax with a less expensive luggage cart from PFC. The luggage cart has larger wheels and a wider base, about as wide as the child car seat at its widest point. This makes for a much more stable and reliable transport option, one where I can walk at a much more natural pace.
Final note: It is much easier to secure the child car seat to the pfc luggage cart than it is to the britax. This is due to the fact that the pfc is wider and it is easier for the security latches to reach the brackets by the cart's wheels. The britax is noticably narrower and i am literally stretching the safety bands on the security latches to secure the seat to the cart.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: child car seat
Weight Range of Child: 
Installation Type: 
Harness Type: 
Material:

Review:
I read through alot of the reviews and just like any product online, it's always a gamble. I have traveled on my own with my son and it was a nightmare (don't get me started about that airline!). Anyway, I knew I had to take extra measures to be able to do it again. Which is why I chose to get this product. My son was 2.5 when it was used the first time in Oct 2012. I have to tell you, this is a wonderful product! Yes, going through security can be sucky (with or without this product, with a child). Is it worth it? Absolutely!

I read some of the reviews that mentioned they wouldn't have felt comfortable keeping their kid in the seat while pulling or pushing the suitcase (I have a soft suitcase-which it needs to be filled completely for this to work properly). I didn't have that concern at all! I have another trip this x-mas with my now almost 4 year old. I would rather keep him sitting where I can watch him instead of holding my hand. So we'll see how it goes since he's 40 lbs now!

Update-9/14/14-We again did not have any problems with him being 40lbs. Still love the product.

Review:
[[VIDEOID:6b72bf74b6810d874fb015b276cb8d75]] I initially thought the cup holders were missing, they spin around after being slightly lifted 🤦

Overall absolutely LOVE this seat. Wish we would've bought this instead of the Forever seat because it's not as large. Both excellent choices though!

Review:
We purchased the Graco ComfortSport at Target in Sept of 2010 as an emergency replacement for our previous carseat after an accident. (We actually got the Creighton model.) I have 3 major concerns about the safety of this seat:

1) The shoulder straps do not tighten evenly. After looking at the back of the seat I realized this is due to the design of the set yoke; most seats have two individual hooks for the shoulder belts, tightened by a single pull strap. The ComfortSport overlaps the two shoulder straps under a single hook and one strap will always be a little looser than the other. This also crates the potential for the overlapping strap to slip out of the hook, as it is barely held in place by the hook.

2) The chest plate is easy to unbuckle, even for young children. I looked up advice on how to solve this issue on Graco's website- apparently many parents were having the same issues and Graco's response was that parents should just explain to their children why they need to keep the belt on. After pulling over 10+ times on a two-hour trip because my 2 year old didn't understand my explaining on why this belt was intended to keep him safe, I settled on buying self-adhesive Ace wrap to wrap around the buckle so he couldn't mess with it.

3) The tightening plate on our model broke after only 11 months of use. I was tightening the strap, as usuall, and the single screw the holds the plate in place pulled out and flew somewhere in the car. If this had happened during an accident, the shoulder straps would have been loosened about 2 inches and greatly reduced the protection of the seat.

I had contaceted Graco regauding my concerns about the seat, and asking for a refund. They sent me a letter stating that if I had problems with their product, I should ship it to them at MY expense and they would replace the seat with another one of the same model- no refund. Needless to say I just went out and bought a different, better rated seat for my son.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: shoulder straps do not tighten evenly; overlapping strap under a single hook; shoulder straps would have been loosened  
Harness Type: chest plate is easy to unbuckle  
Harness Type: tightening plate broke

Review:
For so long, my girlfriend and I have been needing to upgrade our child's carseat. Being that our child's legs are long, it helps to keep them lower and allows them to hang freely and not be pressed up uncomfortably against the back of the passenger seat. The cup holders, armrests, and fact that our child can use an actual seatbelt are all added bonuses.
We often go for long car rides and adventures through the mountains, so this really is made for comfort as our child has fallen asleep countless times in just the short span that we've owned it. It looks safe, is incredibly light-weight, feels, and looks cool. As our child gets taller, the back support can rise and even come off and simply transition to a booster seat. Being able to wash it all also makes it so much more durable and clean. We are extremely excited that the latches for the base/booster seat are so easy to clip in and take off. With our previous setup, it was a chore, but this has been nothing but a delight and smiles all around.

For what it's priced, my family and I truly feel this is an excellent product designed to ensure safety, comfort, style, and ease of use for the adults and kids alike. Highly recommended.

Review: I love this carseat, there is no doubt in my mind that it is the best but the cover is cheap.  I have had this for about a year and the cover is starting to shred.  I noticed about 2 months after we got it that a hole was starting and I stiched it up.  I figured it was just a small defect.  Now, one year later, the white piping is totally ripped open and there are several more holes in the cover.  I think that the gray material is not sturdy enough to hold.  The fact that it cost 70 to replace the cover is ridiculous.  I will be buying 2 more of these for my younger daughter but I will not be getting the onyx version.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: cover is cheap, cover is starting to shred, white piping is totally ripped open, several more holes in the cover, gray material is not sturdy enough to hold, cost 70 to replace the cover, not getting the onyx version

Review: Not the best car seat. If you are on a budget- sure go ahead, but it's nowhere near great. The material is cheap, the seat is lightly padded (so it's very uncomfortable looking and feeling, and the base sits and attaches very lazily to the car. It seems very unsafe. I honeslty use this when I go to restaurants and I need something to rock my infant while I am eating. Please give yourself peace of mind by skipping this purchase and buy a better quality car seat. Yes people rave about how light it is, but it's light because the quality is lacking. Not a good car seat for your previous bundle.

The recliner makes it easy to to convert from rear to front facing ensuring your seat is installed properly for maximum safety.

Review:
Our 28-inch six-month old grew out of his infant seat, so we needed to buy a larger car seat. We purchased this car seat based on the glowing reviews. I wish I would have also looked at reviews from other websites. It is a great seat (installation was simple, it looks comfy and he can look out the window), except for the buckle between his legs is WAY TOO SHORT. There is no way to lengthen it and he is sitting almost right on top of it when I put him in the seat. Each time I buckle him in I have to make a concerted effort to avoid pinching his tights (which aren't even very chubby).

We ordered the Boulevard and the strap between the legs is a couple of inches longer and works much better.

Weight Range of Child: six-month old, grew out of his infant seat

So when I seen this I knew 100% I would get it for my son.  I’m so glad I don’t have to turn him around too soon.  And will keep him rear facing as long as posdible with this seat.  Thanks Graco!

Review: I did a lot of research before purchasing this convertible car seat a year ago.  Safe, good reviews - I was sold.  One year later I am so fed up with this car seat that I'm buying a new one.  It's extremely frustrating considering how much this cost.  My issue is the straps will NOT release consistently.  You might get one side 1 out of 10 times.  The rest  of the time you're just struggling to get everything undone and your child out.  Getting him back in is even harder!  I try releasing the straps with him in, I try releasing them with him out, I try releasing them one at a time.  Nope.  I end up having to jam the buckle in with my son in the car seat, making it extremely uncomfortable for him and for me, since I have to spend minutes trying to get it to buckle since the straps won't release properly!  I contacted Britax but they would not replace this carseat even though something is obviously wrong.  So I will say good bye to you Britax USA Advocate ClickTight, and I will celebrate not dreading every single time I have to put my son in a carseat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: straps will NOT release consistently, straps won't release properly
Installation Type: ClickTight

Review:
We got this car seat for my grandson, who at 10 months old, was larger than the average 2-year-old. We knew he needs to be rear-facing for another 14 months or longer, but most car seats will not accomodate such a large child (34" and 31#).

This GRACO car seat has room to spare! It has wonderful cushioning. The removable cup-holders are very handy on a long trip. And adjusting the straps upward for this growing boy is a breeze! Not to mention, the foot tray is WONDERFUL, the baby isn't squashed uncomfortably into a little basket-y looking seat any more.

If you have a big/tall baby, or you want a seat that will really work for multiple ages and sizes, this carseat is a great deal. We checked, and my daughter (5' and 105# -- yes that tiny girl is the baby's mother!) does in fact fit in the booster seat. So we guess it will fit my giant Grandson for at least another 6 years LOL!

Seat Type: rear-facing
Weight Range of Child: large child (34" and 31#), big/tall baby, multiple ages and sizes
Harness Type: adjusting the straps upward

Review:
When my daughter was close to outgrowing her car seat, we purchased this seat and the Graco Nautilus to see which one was better for us. The Britax Frontier, in my opinion, is a higher quality and more desirable seat.

The biggest thing that stood out immediately when we were adjusting the straps in both seats was that my daughter, who was 2 at the time, already needed the bottom strap with the buckle to be set in the last slot to be a comfortable fit for her in the Graco seat. In the Britax seat, we only needed to put the buckle in the 2nd slot, with plenty of room to grow. I knew I wanted to leave her in the harness as long as possible instead of switching her to the booster as soon as she hits the minimum weight, as many parents do. Since she was already in the last slot at age 2, I am sure that she would've ended up sitting on the strap instead of having it come down just in front of her as it should. I know this wouldn't be comfortable if the straps were tightened appropriately and it really doesn't seem all that safe.

The next advantage of the Britax seat vs the Graco seat was the method to adjust the height of the harness shoulder straps. In the Britax seat, you just push a button on the back of the seat and pull the headrest up. On the Graco seat, you have to completely unthread the harness straps and rethread them in the higher slot. This isn't really hard, admittedly, but it is a pain in the butt and Britax's system is so much easier.

The installation of the Britax seat is not as easy as that of the Graco. The angle of the belt path and the LATCH system buckle is awkward. What I've found works is actually getting into the car, putting a knee in the seat and using my weight to push the seat tightly against my car seat while I tighten the straps. This is the only way I've been able to get a really secure fit. I cannot pull the straps tight enough to keep the seat from wiggling more than the recommended 1" without using my weight to push the seat down first. I drive a full sized SUV so I have plenty room to do this but it might be pretty awkward in a smaller vehicle.

The cupholders on the Frontier are fantastic. It is so nice to have one for a drink and one extra for a snack, or a toy, or whatever. Really, it seems like a small thing but it does make a big difference. I often bring along an extra small cup to hold snacks neatly in the cupholder. A snack in a cup in a cupholder is much, much less messy in a car than a snack held in a small child's lap. The Nautilus had some very cool secret compartments in the arm rests that my daughter really loved but I, personally, prefer the functionality of the cupholders.

The HUGS system that holds the chest straps in place seems pretty gimmicky to me. I don't think that they help all that much. I still have to adjust the chest buckle every time I buckle my daughter in and it is kind of annoying to have to adjust the HUGS thing, too. I also accidentally pinched the skin on my daughter's neck when it got caught between the firm plastic HUGS system and the strap as I adjusted it up. It wasn't a serious injury but it made her cry and it has made me resent HUGS even more. The padding around the straps to protect the neck, on the other hand, are great. They stay in place, are very soft, and my daughter has never complained about being uncomfortable.

You do have to remove the straps completely to remove the covers on both seats so there was really no advantage either way in this category. Since purchasing the seat, I've started using the Summer Infant Deluxe Piddle Pad. It is easy to remove and clean that pad instead of the whole seat and it was fantastic when we were still potty training. Even though we haven't had a potty accident in the car in quite some time, we still use the pad in case of occasional food or drink spills.

We've had the seat now for about 6 months. It still looks brand new. We've actually purchased a second seat just like it for the other car. The Graco Nautilus went back to the store.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: adjusting the straps; method to adjust the height of the harness shoulder straps; push a button on the back of the seat and pull the headrest up; HUGS system that holds the chest straps in place; padding around the straps to protect the neck
Installation Type: LATCH system; angle of the belt path and the LATCH system buckle is awkward; tighten the straps

Review: I would highly recommend a travel cart in general--it made it so much easier for us to get through the airport, especially when all our two-year old wanted to do was escape and "run around!"  I had a hard time deciding whether to order this cart or the Gogo Babyz cart, but ultimately decided on this one since some of the Gogo Babyz reviews indicated problems with the wheels coming off in the newer model.  I have not tried the other brand to be able to compare, but I can say that we had NO issues with the Britax cart not being stable, tipping over, or otherwise.  We asked to have the car seat, still attached to the cart, hand-checked when going through security, which was not a problem at any airport we went to.  We did go ahead and detach the car seat from the cart before boarding the plane, as we have a wide Britax marathon car seat and I do not think it would have fit down the aisle if we had rolled it on.  My husband found it easiest to lift the car seat completely over his head to get it to our seat.  The cart folded up and fit under the seat in front of our toddler.  We left her in her "special stroller" on the buses and trains at the airports.  My husband and I agree that this product was a definitely lifesaver for our trip, and we would highly recommend it.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Britax marathon
Installation Type: attached to the cart, detach the car seat from the cart

Review: I love love love this Car seat! I orginally ordered one in 2017 for my son since i planned to do extended rear facing. Well fast forward to 2020 the crazy mess of a yr and we totaled my car. My son was in his seat and perfectly unharmed! I can’t say enough about the seat. Well insurance gave me money to re order and when i ordered the Manufactoring date of the “new car seat” was only 3 months newer then my one i replaced. I was hoping to get at least an extra yr or 2 since we got a brand new seat but that didn’t happen. Amazon gave me money off the seat which was great but when it arrives please check Manufactoring date since the car seat only last 10yrs from that date.

Review: I have to admit that I wanted to love this car seat since we have the old Britax Marathon and loved it.  However, was disappointed to find out that the bottom seat belt strap (the one that comes up from the bottom and goes in between my daughter's legs) was too short.  It's much shorter than on the other two Britax ClickTight car seats and the hard plastic pieces dig into my daughter's inner thighs and hurt her.  Even with the cushion that comes with the car seat. Since it's so short, it also makes it difficult for me to put on and take off the seat belts.  I tried to use this for a week but do not think it will work for us. I am returning it and getting the Advocate instead since that bottom strap is longer.  I went and compared them at Buy Buy Baby. Love everything else about the car seat but I just don't understand why that bottom strap is so short and you can't even extend it.

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review:
I was initially skeptical about this product, but after reading the reviews on Amazon decided I didn't have much to lose for $14.99. I just got back from a trip to San Francisco with my 23 month old daughter, and I have to say that I really appreciated being able to attach the carseat to my roller suitcase (regular, business-size suitcase) while going through the airport. It was especially helpful navigating the airport after the red-eye flight. I didn't know if I'd be able to maneuver the carseat attached to the suitcase successfully or safely with my daughter sitting inside, but it really worked beautifully, and I overheard a few "what a great idea" comments as I walked through the airport.

A couple of cons--it is a little cumbersome to attach the carseat to the suitcase, only to have to remove it while going through security and then re-attach it on the other side. Also, together with the suitcase, the car seat (Britax Diplomat) was almost too wide to wheel down the aisle of the airplane, but it just made it.

All in all, though, I really appreciated a product that I could easily attach and then stow easily when not in use.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: attach

Review:
[[VIDEOID:a128f1aa93a8691307e102076882e525]] They rattle. Model CC138-DWVA Safety First Grow and Go 3-in-1 Convertible rattles where the adjuster handle meet the bar that it lifts to raise and lower the headrest. It's really bad when the seat is empty. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me 2 new ones (I bought 2 of them originally) and they have the same problem.
I do not recommend modifying your car seats. On the one we are throwing away (they verify you disable the seats when doing warranty replacements) I found that a 3/4 inch of 3/8" fuel line on the adjuster lever behind the seat could make it stop rattling. I don't know why they don't rubberize it. I did it as a test to show them via skype.
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: Convertible

Review:
What do you do when your 3-4 month old keeps trying to sit up in her small infant seat?..... Buy a convertible of course! I researched for a week or so until I decided on this seat. I bought mine at Target because we had a gift card there.

I own an older model (2001) Toyota Camry and it fits perfectly in it (even without LATCH it doesn't budge) without having to compromise the front passenger seat. The seat is HIGHLY padded that I kind of just want to sit in it myself sometimes. Seat belt holders are very convenient when getting Baby in and out (and taking cute pictures without the seat belt!). What's not to love about this seat? My 4 month old (25 inches/16 pounds) fits perfectly in here as well as my 5 year old son (not that he needs a comfy ride since he's stuck in school all day).

I highly recommend this seat to anyone with a small car.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 3-4 month old, 4 month old (25 inches/16 pounds), 5 year old son
Installation Type: without LATCH, seat belt
Material: HIGHLY padded

Review:
My daughter, 6-7mo gets car sick whenever we use this car seat. I think it's because she can see outside and that makes her sick, or dizzy maybe. IDK.

Also, when she sleeps her head drops in a way that makes me concerned about asphyxiation. Definitely better for an older kiddo, but it works so far. I just have to put up a blanket in front of the window.

Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 6-7mo

Review:
We have two of these and like them and would highly recommend them. We have had one for 3 years and another for 1 year. However, there are a few things you should know.
(1) Admittedly, not many 6 or 7-year-olds use a 5-point harness. Even the 4-year-olds seem just to use booster seats. But we feel better about our kids being in the 5-point harness. The result is that some of their friends say, "Why are they in a baby seat?"
(2) However, the thing about a harness is that you need to be sure they don't have it too loose and have it squared up across their chest.
(3) Two complaints about our new Nautilus that we have had for a year. The gray plastic button on the LATCH anchor and the gray plastic button on the tether that are supposed to be used to loosen those don't work. You press the button and it does not loosen. You can force it looser but it is tough. Our old one had a metal buckle that worked easier. Also with the new version the harness buckle is too hard for anyone but a very strong adult to buckle. In other words, even the 7 year old cannot buckle himself in at the crotch with this so an adult has to help them.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type: 5-point harness; harness buckle is too hard for anyone but a very strong adult to buckle; need to be sure they don't have it too loose and have it squared up across their chest
Installation Type: LATCH anchor; tether

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately

Not only did I NOT have to carry our toddler through two airports, but she got to ride in her seat in comfort and style. It's such a simple idea, you'll be mad you didn't think of it first. Buy this - you won't regret it!

Im hoping reclining it may work but my husband said the bubble on the indicator wouldnt be in the safe spot so i will try to figure something out. But my daughter seems to like it and i know its a safe seat and thats my top priority.

Review:
I read and read reviews before purchasing this car seat. I read that people loved it and those that didn't had issues with it that didn't affect me so I decided to save about $100 and ordered this seat. I was excited but the more I've had the seat, the less thrilled I have been with it. Here are my likes/dislikes.

Likes:
It has a handy dandy cup holder.
Has a harness and converts to a booster "this will be the last seat my son may need!"
Did I mention the cup holder? yeah? ok...

Dislikes:
The latch system.
Ignorance is bliss... If you have only ever used this brand perhaps this isn't an issue for you. However- I think every parent should know that there are MUCH MUCH better latching systems out there. These little metal clips are junk and the fact that in order to get the latching systems's belt pulled tightly I have to try to thread it through the seats back and try to pull the strap to the side (the direction of "out" of the car) all while kneeling in the seat to ensure its in snug is a pain and usually requires the help of another person. Pretty annoying for a do it yourself-er or someone that travels solo with the kids and doesn't enjoy doing this in an airport parking lot... or at all for that matter. We don't move the seats all that often (some parents transfer seats often- this seat would be a pain if you planned to use latches)but enough to be completely annoying and worry some. I'm a stickler for having my seats in snug with little to NO wobble.

Seat Parts-
So- kids are dirty. This seat was made to be able to wash the pads/cover Yay (oops that should be a plus) BUT- after removing the seat pads and pieces a foam piece on the headrest that states DO NOT REMOVE fell right off. (its not attached- just sort of hangs there). Ok, no big deal- pop it back on. Well- not a big deal until your child comes by and the piece snaps in half (I swear he barely touched it). My first thought... ok maybe 2nd. First thought was gee I'm pissed. Then- okay- quick- give a call and order a new one! Not open and before and after I tried calling I tried their web page. Followed the directions in entering the model and serial number and its not working. Must be an issue because after the first of many tires there was a pop up to call the 800 number.

so- third negative- difficult to get to the parts ordering section of the web page with this seat's model number. (are those Ohs or zeros? hmm neither work! What about a space here, one there? nope, nope nope.

the crotch buckle-
yup, I read about this in other reviews. I had put my kiddo in the seat in the store and figured- eh, I can adjust it and it will be fine! Wrong-O! They gave approximately 4cm of wiggle room in the belt... perhaps that is one of the ways they save costs on the seat??

***This part isn't Graco's fault but if you're a parent and you don't realize this- you need to b/c I've seen/talked to people who don't know better and it freaks me out. Yes- this seat has a harness NO your 9 month old who can sit up or who is 20lb already should NOT use this seat yet! Should STILL BE IN REAR FACING. I've even heard/read people saying something about 6 mo olds. YIKES. NO!
And- the "recline" handle should read TILT- if your child is both old enough and big enough to use the forward facing seat they do not need to be reclined (adults aren't even supposed to ride reclined in the car) this tilting is to adjust the seat to your car peeps.

In reading many many many of the reviews- I read some Britax haters. One commented that people that have Britax just like to throw around the name... First I was like really? Hmm, maybe so. Maybe I too am being a Britax snob. Maybe I don't need to spend the extra money....and Now- I tell them why Britax (or another better brand)... Because the Britax seats FAR surpass the quality and user friendliness of the Graco seats. Those that have used the bucking latch system that has release buttons to remove the seat and ***a strap on EITHER side of the seat to tighten it in***. This is important- because getting your seat in snug and tight is the whole point of a car seat. To keep your babies stable should anything happen.
Other brands have the same button release latches that self tighten now!!! YOu just latch, kneel/sit in the seat and push back and no tugging belts! yay!
SO- when looking at a seat- study the latch system, the clips across the chest- many of these things are better quality in the pricier seats. Some say- oh you're just paying for better fabric in those seats. Its not just the fabric.
You get what you pay for. I re-learned that lesson with this seat :(

Happy shopping!
(go get something else)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing, Convertible, Booster
Weight Range of Child: 20lb, 9 month old
Installation Type: Latch system
Harness Type: Harness, Crotch buckle
Material: Pads/cover, Foam piece

The car seat is well built, attractive, easy to clean, easy to install and easy to adjust. Our baby appears comfortable during long rides and we believe it will keep our child adequately safe if we are ever in a wreck.  I appreciate that this car seat should last until our child is 60+ pounds and ready for a booster.  Excellent!

Review: I have owned this car seat for almost a year.  It does its job in keeping my child safe and keeping him comfortable in long car rides.  However, one of the reasons I bought this seat was because the cover is removable and can be washed in the washing machine.  I have had to do that three times now, and every time the foam padding in the cover gets so wadded up and distorted that I have to rip out the seams for the 6 or 7 different panels, fix the foam padding, and then sew them back together.  It wouldn't be that bad except there are three different layers that need to be sewn together, and it is very easy to miss one of the layers in the process, leaving a gaping hole after you think you have finished.  If you plan on never having to wash your car seat cover, then this is a good car seat.  But if you do think you'll need to wash it, skip this one.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: cover is removable and can be washed in the washing machine; foam padding in the cover gets wadded up and distorted; three different layers that need to be sewn together

Review: I ordered this while my daughter and I were out of town, my husband installed it and picked us up at the airport with this seat. He said it was easy to install and fit rear facing without any issues in our Equinox. Our daughter, who hates being strapped into anything, didn't fuss when we first put her in this seat and even now a month and a half later still doesn't mind the seat. Between that and the safety rating, that left me less annoyed about the price.

Review:
My son is so much happier in this seat than he was in his Chicco Keyfit 30 (which I loved if you are looking for a bucket infant seat). I love that he will be able to rear face for many years to come and that there are 3 angles for which he can be in at the moment. He is currently 19 lb 10 Oz and 27in long. The seat is rated to 4 lbs I wanna say but we just started using it so I'm not sure on how well a new born would fit as I feel even my son seem small in it.

Installation was not the easiest thing but luckily I was able to get a car seat tech to help me out. I would recommend seeking one out if you are having trouble installing this seat.

Also good to note that it is a large seat. We have an F150 so there is more than enough room and no other children. But it would be tight with two of these in there or in a small car.

I am very hopeful this seat will last us for many many more years to come.

Review: This is my second Britax car seat, the other is the infant B-safe car seat, which I love, but my large baby grew out of it rather fast. I am quickly realizing how wonderful Britax car seats are. This is my second baby and I've probably bought 5 or 6 car seats already! I am now realizing why I didn't like any of those. Two BIG reasons: Ease of use and COMFORT. My 2.5 year old is in a Graco Nautilus 3 in 1 which I thought was PERFECT until I bought this convertible Britax for my infant. The Marathon is sooooo cushy and comfy for baby. I even took out the insert because my baby didn't need it and it didn't take away from the comfort at all! I just love how padded it is! Now when I put my toddler in his seat, I realize how HARD his seat it and REALLY lacks in padding. Seems like a minor thing but we take many road trips and I can only imagine how that must feel on his legs and bum after awhile. The Marathon also feels so solid and safe and I LOVE not digging the crotch buckle out from under them for once. I am just so in love with the safety, comfort, and user friendly features (i.e. the buckle and harness!)of Britax car seats! We are definitely Britax fans now! I am now seriously considering the Britax Frontier for my 2.5 year old for our primary car and moving the Graco Nautilus to my husbands car.

Harness Type: buckle and harness
Material: padded, cushy and comfy, hard, lacks in padding

Review:
It's always a huge challenge to find the right car seat for VW Beetle. I feel bless that one of the best 5 points booster works! I have ordered 3 brands from the updated best-bet list and return one and put the other in VW Passart.
Also great that it reclines OK enough for kiddo to fall as sleep, no tilt (back seat of Beetle is really upright).
And since the seat is so flat unlike those bulky convertible seats, kiddo can seat himself and that makes life easier to get him in and out too.
Has been a year now (2nd bday to 3rd) and see long way to go... Worth every penny!

Don't want to let go beloved Beetle, must try!

Seat Type: booster

Review:
We spent a lot of time reviewing convertible carseat options for our 2000 Corolla. It was crucial to us that two adults could sit comfortably in the front seat and one in the back seat with the carseat installed. We also wanted a seat that was easy to install with the seat-belt and that provided good safety features. After a lot of research, we felt that the cocorro delivered on all our criteria. We have been mostly happy with it. The installation is fairly easy and straightforward, although it took a while the first time. The rear facing fit with the seatbelt, on the corolla, is extremely tight. The fabric feels nice and the light green color insures my son won't get as hot in the summer. A few reviews complain about pilling/dirt on the fabric but I haven't noticed those issues, even after a airline travel with this seat. My son seems very comfortable in this seat and he generally falls asleep (unlike in his infant seat where he would just cry).

One problem we have had is that it is fairly easy to crack the headrest foam during installation. When pressing against the sides of the car seat during installation, we heard a crack. I'm not sure if it was the EPS foam cracking or un-gluing from the frame. We continued using it because I read that slight cracks in the foam does not impact performance, but the plastic shell should really extend around the headrest.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear facing
Installation Type: seat-belt
Material: fabric, light green color, foam, plastic shell

Review:
This carseat is large. I have a 2006 Honda Odyssey and the carseat fits fine even for my long legged 4 year old. I don't think this would do well in a car.

Last year, we drove from Washington state to Maryland and then took another trip from Maryland to Chicago and back. I'm so glad we had these seats for my one year old and 3 year old.

The seats recline a bit so their heads don't fall awkwardly forward or to the side while they sleep.

Their are two cup holders which makes it easy to insert snacks from the front seat.

Their is a detachable pillow for added napping comfort.

I had another more expensive carseat before the big move across country. I had to borrow my sister in-laws van and I used her carseat (this one). I fell in love and bought two for my kids to travel with.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 4 year old, one year old, 3 year old
Installation Type: fits fine
Material: detachable pillow

Review: Two of my three kids recently moved up into booster seats. We were traveling and needed to rent car seats while we were traveling. Being able to take two of these boosters on our trip saved us so much money! My six and four year old also found them comfortable, and they were pliable enough that we were able to put an adult in between them in the back seat. I definitely recommend reading the directions and figuring it out before you need to use it. It's not the most intuitive. We only needed to use the shoulder strap clip on my 4-year-old. It was easiest when he was actually sitting down comfortably, and then I could pull the shoulder strap to where it fit for him. He did complain a little bit that the clip was not very comfortable on the back of his shoulder. Also, what other reviews say about the white clip around the laugh about portion is absolutely true. I found it easier to avoid putting the seat belt through on the buckle side of the seat belt. On the far side, it definitely made sense because it kept the lap belt in a good position. These were great to fold up and put in their backpacks for carry-on forthe airplane. They did add weight to the backpack, But what we saved in space and cost it was worth it. Definitely recommend this product! We have also used it when we have friends come to visit, or pick a friend up to go on a weekend excursion. It saves so much time and transferring boosters! One last comment and then, I promise I'm done! We have friends that have the cushion travel seat. I have noticed that it does not keep the kids high enough where the shoulder strap doesn't bother them. It also seems like they do not grip on the seat as well as these do. Granted, our friends may not have had access to this product when they purchased theirs, And of course every family has their needs. For us, this was the perfect product! I was very happy with this purchase!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seats
Weight Range of Child: six and four year old
Harness Type: shoulder strap clip

I have a Pria from before this seat existed and It’s SO similar but we like the E2Fit better! We just did an 18 hour road trip with two toddlers(2&4) and the extend to fit is noticeably more comfortable! Highly recommend! We tried out many other seats in our Durango but for rearfacing/long term use this seat was the best hands down!

I must say there's 2 things that bug me. 1 the belt straps dug into my child's neck I actually bought belt strap covers separately for that issue. 2 it is heavy. I think heavier than need be. With my previous 2 kids I lugged them around in their carseat. With this carseat I prefer to get her out and carry just her. If i had to do it again I'd probably just buy a "grow with me" carseat since I'm pulling her out of it anyways instead of carrying her in it.

Review:
I will begin by stating that I’m a bit of a car seat safety fanatic. These seats can literally mean the difference between life and death (or serious injury) for our little ones, so I am unwilling to compromise on safety.

With that being said, these are my thoughts...

-Relatively easy to install, compared to others
-Plenty of cushioning for the child, which likely adds comfort for many (although I do not value comfort over safety)
-Does not allow extended rear-facing for as long as some other models (rear-facing is the safest way for a while to ride)
-A little difficulty getting this seat to fit snugly in the car, without moving more than an inch when shaken
-I guess the cup holders are bonuses for some buyers but are not very important to me (and keep in mind that anything in them can become a projectile in case of accident)
-Materials seems easy to wipe clean

All in all, I think this is an okay car seat. There are others on the market, at a similar price point, with higher safety ratings.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear-facing
Installation Type: Relatively easy to install
Material: Materials seems easy to wipe clean

Review: Overall, this works great and my child is comfortable. But, this is misleading as you are not buying factory packaged. When this arrived, it came in a plain cardboard box with a couple labels on it, not the original packaging. When I opened the box, the unit was just sitting in the box without any packaging and filler material. Not the quality I expect from Amazon or Safety 2st.

Review: The car seat is great!!! it's a bit bulky but definitely sturdy and well built. I am a first time mom and everything I purchase I have to make sure that it's top of the line no matter what the cost is. I want the BEST for my son and this car seat is exceptional! you will not go wrong with this car seat. The only thing I have to say is that it's a little difficult to install because there is so much that goes with this car seat (gadgets, handbook, etc). I ended up taking my car and the seat to a certified car seat inspector to install the seat and my husband and I learned so much from the installation itself. If you decide to buy this seat you have made one of the best and most safest purchases in your child's life.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: a little difficult to install

Review:
Overall, I think this seat is great and I'd recommend it. There are parts about this seat that I really love and other parts that are frustrating - things that could easily be changed to make this seat awesome!! This seat is way too innovative and good to make it only an occasional-use / folding / "grab-and-go" seat. I believe the inventor should re-think the seat and make it a regular-use seat that focuses on ease-of-use instead of the folding & traveling aspects. What do I mean?

1. Well, we've been using this as our primary seat for our 6-year-old so we leave it permanently "installed." The word installed isn't exactly accurate since the seat isn't strapped down & latched the way a baby's car seat would be. Instead, this seat sits on the regular seat of the car & uses the seatbelt each time - but... we've been leaving the shoulder-belt strap guide always attached to the belt and the right-side of the lap belt always stays in the right lap-belt guide (the shoulder part of our seatbelt comes over our daughter's right shoulder and the seatbelt buckles next to her left hip). The problem comes when the seat slides back and folds up each time she gets out. So, everytime she gets back in the car, she needs to reposition the seat and get it to sit flat while the shoulder strap is pulling slightly upward, making the seat fold. Also, as little kids do, she sits down on the edge of the seat and then wiggles herself backward and onto the seat. This also pushes the seat back and into a semi-folded position that she needs to flatten under herself.
What do I suggest? Make the seat non-folding... or at least offer a non-folding version... or create a locking mechanism to keep it open & flat. The folding aspect is cute but only necessary when you need to toss it in a backpack or store it somewhere small. However, for regular use the whole seat is tiny already, even when it's open / flat.

2. Next issue is something a couple of other reviewers pointed out - the lap-belt guides slide inward way too easily but require you to unlock them with a tab to slide them outwards. Also, that locking mechanism tab is underneath the seat so that it can't be easily released without standing the child back up. This seems silly to me - the lap-belt guides get bumped into easily when sliding the lap belt into them and when other kids in the car are shifting around. I think that the lap-belt guides should be locking in both directions and prefer the locking tab to be accessible (if possible) from the top. Again, if we're thinking of a regular-use seat that doesn't need to easily fold up for travel, then we can re-imagine the lap-belt guides a tad. Maybe there's some adjustment that could be made to keep the lap belt in proper position in the right belt guide (in my scenario) so that when she gets back into the seat it won't require a whole repositioning?

3. The shoulder-belt guide strap - as I said above, we always leave this attached. However, when you take off the belt the shoulder-belt strap guide (that red plastic piece) just slides down and needs to be repositioned the next time our daughter gets back in. What I've been doing is inserting a section of the strap into the guide as a second layer inside the guide along with the shoulder belt. This keeps the clip of the plastic guide from slipping downward. However, again, if we re-imagine this seat as a regular-use, non-traveling seat, then maybe we can come up with something better to keep the guide from sliding down or requiring any repositioning each time the child gets back in?

Enough about my suggested changes... What do I really like about this seat?
I love that this seat is so compact - not a bulky thing that makes it absolutely impossible to fit 3 boosters or combination of boosters and baby car seats in a row!!! Our daughter has a small body that didn't require a huge area but all of the other boosters were fixed with wide seats that took up essential room for no reason. Before this seat, the booster barely squeezed into place and made buckling the seatbelt an absolute misery! Now, with the mifold, there's so much room, it's a pleasure! As I said above, the seat is so compact (and adjustable) that we can easily give up some of that in order to make it a regular-use / semi-permanent seat.

Also, I love that this adjusts for the child as opposed to the one-size-fits-all boosters that assume all children need to be boosted up a very precise amount. The adjustable width of the lap-belt guides and adjustable height of the shoulder-belt strap makes this seat great. Oh, one last thing... this child seat shouldn't be called a "booster" at all... it doesn't boost the child up but rather pulls the seatbelt down to position it correctly for the child... awesome!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: seatbelt
Harness Type: shoulder-belt guide, lap-belt guides

Review: Bought this car seat for my mom's car since she usually has my son while I'm at work. This car seat is very padded, and very comfortable, I was shocked because its very inexpensive! My son is so comfortable in this seat, he loves going in grandma's car! Installation was very easy, & it fit great in my mom's Jetta! She still had plenty of room in the front (even with the car seat reclined all the way or to "3") . Only reason this car seat is getting 4 & not 5 stars is because In my Lancer it didn't fit at all. because the way the base is set up, it just didn't fit right. When installing it in my car, the seat was all wobbly, and very unsafe. But if it fits in your car, we definitely recommend it! Its inexpensive, and very comfortable!
Attribute_Related_Content:

Installation Type: Installation was very easy
Material: very padded, very comfortable

Review: My husband and I decided to purchase the Mifold for international travel so we did not have the big bulky carseats to deal with at the airport.  It is small enough that it fit in our son's carry on backpack.  When we got the car rental place they tried to charge us 30 extra dollars a day for a seat rental.  When I had my son pull out the mifold we were authorized to leave the rental agency.  It is so small and conveniently fits anywhere when not in use.  On return stateside my husband decided to buy another one to keep in his car for Uber rides.  He can earn a bit more money by having an extra car seat and when he doesn't need it, it packs away easily leaving lots of room in the trunk for his passengers luggage or groceries.  Only one Negative  Aspect is that our son complains that he cannot see out of the window.  So we decided that for longer trips we pull out his old bulky car seat.

Review: I'm on the fence about how many stars to leave. I love that it is small and was so convenient to take on vacation. It was semi-easy to use but I can see how people who have kids who buckle themselves in don't like this so much. It would be hard for a child to do by themselves but I still buckle my 4 year old in so that's moot for now. On that note, this is a pretty bad car seat for a 4 year old. We are definitely pushing the lower limits on height and weight and maybe it works better on bigger kids but it was super unsafe on my 4 year old. The strap in the back would not stay put so most of the time she slid her arm out and let the seat belt go around her waist. Also if your car buckle doesn't already have a lot of backward pull, this isn't great. For it to work it seems like the seat belt already needs to be pulling back against their chest a bit... this device will help lower it to the right height I guess. She sat in the backseat of a minivan and the seat belt did not pull back on her well (it was sort of even with her chest from a side view if that makes sense). Will probably keep it for vacation purposes when she gets bigger but wouldn't use this on a day to day, especially at her current weight and size.

Review: We were involved in a highway accident. Something happened to the tire, I lost control of the car at 70 MPH, we did a 180 and slammed into the concrete barrier (on the rear side, where my kids were). I have three kids, my two daughters were on the side that got hit. My 22 month old daughter is in this carseat, and my 3-year-old in the older model boulevard. They walked away without a scratch. My almost two-year-old slept through the whole thing! She only woke up because my 3-year-old was crying (because she was scared, not hurt). My sister and I were in the front seat and we are okay, but very sore, whip lash, etc. I'm amazed that my children aren't even talking about the accident, and they aren't even the slightest bit sore, even though they were a lot closer to the place of impact! My husband and I don't have much money, but car seats were something that we weren't going to skimp on. Now I am so thankful that we did. We will definitely stick with Britax forever.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 22 month old
Installation Type: Clicktight

Review: I love this car seat!  I already had one but after an accident that totaled my car I decided to replace it and my Maxi Cosi Pria 65 with two more of the Evenflo Symphony.  I have a one year old and 4 year old, both very big for their ages (28 and 56 pounds, with height to match) so it was important for me to find car seats with comfort and longevity.  The infinite adjust feature means with one hand I can adjust the seat as they grow without re-threading straps.  I could also adjust to fit the other child just as easily.  Personally I like this color combination of gray and green.  What I couldn't tell from the photos before purchasing is that the gray fabric on the left and right sides is a sort of vinyl material.  This is a positive for me as it will easily wipe down but it's not where they'll be resting against while seated which would be hot.  I LOVE the quick latch connectors and only wish I'd had them on every car seat we've owned over the last 4 years.  While I'm hoping these are the last two car seats I'll ever need to purchase I do recommend them highly to anyone in the market.  I think the only criticism I have is that some of the fabric is a mesh over a base fabric (the green on the Porter for example). I haven't had any problems yet but it just seems like crumbs might get stuck in the fabric.  I do think this car seat would be very large if rear facing in a smaller car though I haven't tried that.  I have mine installed in a Toyota Sienna minivan.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 28 and 56 pounds
Installation Type: quick latch connectors
Harness Type: infinite adjust feature, without re-threading straps
Material: gray fabric on the left and right sides is a sort of vinyl material, fabric is a mesh over a base fabric

Review:
Car seat came in damaged. The straps are twisted behind the back of the seat so you cannot loosen to put the child in the seat. Very disappointed that I now have to pack this seat back up and ship back then look for a replacement.

Update:
The replacement is perfect!! No issues! Clicks in super easy and much tighter then the Graco.

Review: I have the original Mifold. I do not use these as my regular booster seats but I do use them to travel, when I have extra kids or when my 7 yr old daughter needs a booster to take with her somewhere. This is nice for the extra padding, she also loves that it's purple. I will say that this takes time for kids to figure out and it's not as easy as a booster since she has to loop the seat and the clip behind her. So it's convenient but it's not. This is not for toddlers still in car seats! I stress this DOES NOT REPLACE A CAR SEAT for toddlers!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seats
Weight Range of Child: 7 yr old
Harness Type: loop the seat and the clip

Review:

The car seat comes on and off the base easily

Cons: extremely heavy
Not comfortable for the baby as the headrest pushes the baby's head forward

the seat is very hot in the summer

Review: Only a 4 because it's a little hard to buckle but I've gotten used to it the longer I have it and it's not that big of a problem. It feels secure and is a lot easier to install then some of my other seats.

Review:
This seat is quite large. Beware though. The weight range says can fit as small as about 5lbs. This is not true! My son is up to almost 7lbs now and still can not safely fill out the buckles. I'm a carseat experienced mom and I've had several other experienced mothers look at it to make sure I'm not missing something. The straps are sized as small as they could go and he would still need quite a bit of mass to fit. Due to this, I had to purchase an additional temporary seat. This an expense I wasn't expecting! This is the reason I rated a two.

If you are purchasing for an older child, it looks like a decent carseat.
Attribute_Related_Content: Weight Range of Child: The weight range says can fit as small as about 5lbs. My son is up to almost 7lbs now and still can not safely fill out the buckles.

Review: We have used this seat for two of our babies and I plan on using this model again for our next kiddos. As a car set tech, I always have this seat on my recommended list. This model fits newborns well, is easy to adjust with the front adjust strap, lighter to carry than most, and is easily cared for and assembled. Occasionally the straps become uneven, but it is an easy fix of just loosening the straps all the way and then re-tightening. This seat is outgrown in height before weight (in most circumstances), so please take note and read your manual.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: fits newborns well
Installation Type: 
Harness Type: front adjust strap, straps become uneven, loosening the straps all the way and then re-tightening

Review: We looked at tons of baby seats when our son outgrew his infant seat. I wanted something that would still fit as he got bigger. It has the added bonus of being airline certified, so if we ever need to fly somewhere I know that he will be buckled up safely. My husband says that it's a dream to install and we can switch it easily to grandpa's car. I also like the peace of mind knowing that it has a high safety rating. It was very expensive, but I believe that it's worth it and it is good up to 100lbs, so I plan to use it for several years.

Review: LOVE this car seat! I purchased this car seat 3 separate times. One for my car, my husband's car, and nanni. This is by far the most comfortable for my daughter, lots of room for growth. My daughter loves the cup holders, perfect fit.

Review:
Here are the pros and cons of this carseat as I saw them:

Pros:
Looks cool
Drink holders!
Head padding for the baby

Another pro our car seat installer lady mentioned was that it is good for kiddos with hip dysplasia and they can fit the cast in there because it is so wide!

Cons:
VERY big. Hard to fit 2 people in the backseat with this carseat.

The biggest con that I can not get around is the tightening of the straps knob is wedged against the back of the seat when it is backward facing, making it a huge production to tighten the straps every single time! It's really a hassle!

I would not buy this car seat again, just because of the convenience factor.

Macy May Marcus, Author[[ASIN:B011M6ZE92 Rant of a Retailer: True Stories from a Retail Manager]]
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Harness Type: tightening of the straps knob

Review: I went into labor at 35 weeks and hadn’t got a car seat yet. After searching for weeks prior I decided to go with this one, and man am I happy I did! We took my son home weighing 4lb 6oz and he fit beautifully in it. The fabric is so soft and comfortable to touch. The one button on the handle is also extremely convenient! I drive a Honda CRV and it also fits perfectly! You won’t regret getting this carseat

Review: Our vehicle was in an accident so we had to replace the car seat for our 18 month old grandson. We are very happy with this Graco for several reasons. He is very comfortable in it, first and foremost, and he is a tall baby so his feet were already bunched up against the back seat. With this extender, he can stretch his legs out and still has room to grow........which he will! The seat itself is also much lighter than the one we had before, and the clips that lock it into your car's latch system are SO easy to put in and take out that Grandma doesn't have to yell for help every time. We bought two of them and we are glad we made a great choice.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 18 month old
Installation Type: latch system
Material: lighter

Review: Good carseat. I have a 5 yo son who I wanted to keep in a 5 point harness for as long as possible. He's small for his age. He weighs about 36 lbs. Not big enough to just use the car seatbelt. He has no complaints about the seat. The only thing I would say is it would be nice if there was one more slot for the buckle to make the crotch area roomier. I've seen alot of negative reviews about this. You can adjust it though. It has 2 slots for the belt buckle. It is very easy to thread the buckles! And super super easy to install. When installed you seriously cannot wiggle the seat. It is very secure. It has a cup holder and slots for toys. I like that it converts from an infant seat to a harness high back booster to a regular booster that you use the car seatbelt with. Good price for this seat!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, high back booster, regular booster
Weight Range of Child: 36 lbs
Harness Type: 5 point harness

Review: Bought it as a baby shower gift for my sister in law. She loves it and has been using it since her baby was born. They chose to get a convertible car seat from the get go and skip the infant car seat.

Review: This seat looks very nice both online and in person, it is large and looks comfortable. That being said, I found it difficult to install. The instructions are confusing and encourage you to use a rolled up towel to prop the seat to desired angle. Seems questionable to me.

Review: I don’t recommend this car seat we’ve got it because it was rated five stars and the reviews were amazing however my mother-in-law ordered the same exact car seat and we are having the same exact problems. Sometimes when you go to tighten the straps it gets jammed and you cannot tighten it it doesn’t matter how hard you pull it will not tighten you have to really loose in the entire car seat and start over and pray to God that it tightens. Me being the one who uses the car seat more than anybody else has the most problems it’s not something that I can tighten with my strength. I messaged amazon 3 times and they WONT answer me. So i missed my window to return the item. So now i am out all this money and have to go buy two more car seats. 🙄🙄🙄

The only thing that is a little tricky is getting used to the harness release button you press down on after sliding a finger or two under the front end sleeve to reach it. Can be a little weird with rear facing against the seat but it’s doable. Now if they only made driver seats this comfortable...

Carriers seem to have this better, but other than that...no complaints. This car seat is very well made and easy to use. It’s not a car seat to put in and out of a car. It needs to be put in and done. If you want something mobile, get a carrier. great investment!

First the positive, I like that it fold up nicely quickly and with the ease of a button push. I like that it is sturdy and fits nicely in my dining chair.
I DO NOT LIKE that the tray snaps into place over the baby instead of sliding on like the typical tray does. And I DO NOT LIKE that the way the straps to secure the child are manufactured I cannot put my baby in the seat without a shirt or the straps scratch against his back! Review: I bought several carseats, kept the one I liked best (this one), and returned the others.  The cup holder being integrated is a must.  You might not think so when you have an infant but you will wish you had it later.  Very comfortable.  My son outgrew his infant carrier at 5 months so I had to switch him.  He is now almost 9 months old and about 24lbs and still loves it.  He can still see out the window and he can reach what I put in the cupholder (a toy or pacifier for example).  Adjusting the headreasts also adjusts the shoulder straps ( which is awesome- it was a whole project to adjust shoulder straps when my big kids were little).  I was also looking for a carseat that let the person in the front seat have some extra room.  You would think since I drive a Suburban it wouldn't be an issue but it was.  It's still a tight squeeze because all of these carseats are enormous when you rear-face them.  But this one was the lesser of the evils anyway.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 24lbs
Harness Type: shoulder straps

Review:
This car seat is amazing. Perfect for newborn and up.
We bought this for our third baby and man, I wish I knew this had existed prior to baby #3. It nests them in and makes them feel snug and cozy so they sleep good in the car. It is an expensive car seat but I truly think it is worth the price point considering this is the only car seat they will ever need. I love the safety features and how sturdy it is. It also was extremely easy to assemble and install. I did it just days before my due date (not the lifting though, it is heavy).

The seatbelt does rub against a foam part sometimes making an annoying noise, but I think it’s when she leans forward or is in a certain position. Would buy again for sure! Review: Ok, so first of all I'm an avid review reader. When picking this seat I read all the reviews and compared it to many seats like it along the way. From what I could see this seat was the seat that best fit our needs. It fits our car comfortably  (2016 Sienna) & my son seems to like it . I did read on some other reviews they disliked the shoulder pads, but we use our are they seem to fit our baby well. The straps are super easy to adjust, and I don't have any problem reaching the seat to take the baby in and out (I'm 5'4"). At this point my baby is 9 months old and in the 75th percentile for Hieght, he is rear facing and looks very comfortable. After reading the reviews and ratings on all for me it was between a Britax Marathon,  Graco my ride & forever, or the Chicco Nextfit. I mainly decided on this because it seemed to rate higher overall and I read a lot of reviews that said it didn't seem as bulky as many other convertible seats. We have ours behind our driver seat and neither My husband or I have any issue with the leg room. If I am able to update my review tomorrow with pictures in the car I will add them. Hope this helps,  happy shopping :)
