Review:
I just got this car seat today and, so far, I am very satisfied with the product. I was a little concerned about the installation, because I had read so many reviews stating how hard it was to install and listing it as a con. But, I must say, that after watching a video on Youtube a couple of times on how to do the "long belt path", it was quite a breeze to install in my 08 Toyota Camry. In fact, I had to uninstall it once because the harness wasn't quite right, and re-install it (without help!). And it took me less than five minutes both times. The seat is solid! It hardly moves half an inch when I try to shake it. The seat belt barely made it to the latch, that's true. But, once clipped, that seat wasn't going anywhere. I strongly suggest watching a couple of informative videos on how to use the seat. They helped me a great deal.

The ONLY thing that was kind of tough was moving the crotch harness from the first slot to the middle one (I also tried the third). I had to use a screwdriver to push it through because it just wouldn't budge. But other than that, I have no complaints as far as set up, installation and, of course, quality. It is pretty heavy, so even though it is FAA approved, I would buy a lighter seat to tote around the airport.

My three year old son also gave it two thumbs up. Loved it! Especially the cup holders.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: long belt path, seat belt, latch
Harness Type: crotch harness

Review:
Bought this as a travel car seat for my one-and-a-half year old son. We have Graco 4Ever car seats that we use in our vehicles at home, but with five weeks of intense travel this summer (four separate flights, thousands of miles on the road), we needed something much more compact. My main concerns were getting a seat that would be easy to install on a plane, and something compact enough to easily carry through an airport.

Generally this seat did the trick. Installing on the plane wasn't always incredibly easy. Airplane seat belts were at times a bit tough to feed through and would rest right underneath my son's bottom. Sometimes I also couldn't get the belt tight enough, but the seat being wedged between his plane seat and the seat in front of him kept it in place.

It was very easy to install in our rental cars even without all the bells and whistles that our normal Graco seats at home have. Outside of a bit of the struggle on the plane to install the seat, the only other main complaint is no padding around the neck area. At times it seemed like the straps were digging into my son's neck a bit.

But all things considered, the price definitely makes it worth it and you shouldn't expect to get a luxury car seat for this price. It did great for us during summer travels and we'll be sure to use it the next time we fly.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: easy to install on a plane, easy to install in our rental cars, installing on the plane wasn't always incredibly easy, Airplane seat belts were at times a bit tough to feed through, couldn't get the belt tight enough, the seat being wedged between his plane seat and the seat in front of him kept it in place
Harness Type: straps were digging into my son's neck a bit
Material: no padding around the neck area

Review: I bought this car seat as a spare; because I didn't want to have to lug my sons seat out of mine and in between my husbands and mothers car. His main seat is the Graco 4ever- which I absolutely love. I wasn't sure if I could afford a second, great quality seat; but when I came across this one- I was so shocked and excited. Bought it right then and there. And I LOVE it. Obviously the 4ever is amazing, but I definitely couldn't afford another one of those. So this met every single one of my needs! My son is 10 months old, 25 lbs and 30 inches. And he fits so great!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 25 lbs

Special Features: Car seat and suitcase sold separately
Review:
I can't believe no one thought of this before! Once we figured out exactly how tight the LATCH straps needed to be getting the car seat attached was a breeze and it was so much simpler than lugging and individual car seat, stroller and luggage through the airport with a toddler in tow (we had done that 3 times in the past and were pretty banged up after each trip)! On our one trip we got at least a dozen inquiries from other parents in the airport. This is the best 15$ a parent who travels could ever spend.

My only issue was if the luggage is older it can definately work againt the pull handle on the suitcase and cause it to collapse while in use. This can be alleviated by pulling the suitcase behind you instead of pushing it in front of you like a stroller. Happy travels!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: LATCH straps

Review:
The concept is good, however on leather seats it slides around, not easy to get into the right position to fit and the seat belt fitting is cumbersome. The worst part we found is when trying to get the child out of the seat the system locks the seat belt mechanism and you couldn’t get the child out the car. It literally took several minutes.
Not impressed at all and will be sticking with more conventional car seats and boosters. I wouldn’t recommend this seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt

Review:
Just bought my second pair of these carseats. I had bought some a little over a year ago after someone had backed into my car with my old convertible ones. I had done research and purchased these ones for my daughter (now 6 but the small for her age) and my son (now 7).
Yesterday while visiting my in laws in LA they hit a COW on the interstate (at night going 70) and spun off into a power pole. Aside from a bruise on my son's arm where he hit it on the car door, they are both completely unharmed!! The police, emts and fire fighters all were all impressed and attributed everyone being unhurt to my father in laws phenomial driving in the situation and these carseats. Which the officers/fire fighters inspected prior to my sister in law picking them up and said they seemed to be completely undamaged, although they recommended replacing them.(honestly, i had already ordered the second pair ;) )
At this point, you could not pay me to put my kids in different booster seats.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seats
Weight Range of Child: 6, 7
Installation Type: undamaged
Harness Type: 
Material:

Our other car seat is black and silver and looks cool, this one looks ugly. But it's not worth returning it for that, nor would I knock the product for it, I should have paid closer attention to the description. Review: Finally, I have found a carseat that is perfect. I have 2 sons, and I have owned many carseats. They had outgrown the 45 lb weight limit on thier carseats, so I was in search of new carseats with the harnesses, since I am not ready for them to be in boosters with regular seat belts. After doing alot of research, the Graco Nautulis seemed perfect, yet was a little more money than I wanted to spend, since I had to buy 2. We bought another product that was about $30 cheaper. After being very disappointed with the other product, we returned those and purchased 2 Graco Nautulis carseats, in the Matrix pattern. I could not be more pleased. My boys LOVE them. They seem to be very comfortable, and fit them very well. They are both big for thier age, and the Nautulis fits them very well. Also, my husband says they were simple to install and fit well in our SUV. If you are looking for a front facing car seat for your toddler, the Graco Nautulis is the way to go. They also turn into high back boosters, then no back boosters, so we will never have to buy carseats/boosters again. I wish I would have gotten these car seats a long time ago, and I will recommend them to all the moms I know!!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: front facing
Weight Range of Child: outgrown the 45 lb weight limit
Harness Type: harnesses
Installation Type: simple to install

Review: The buckles on this seat are just awful!  This makes taking the baby in and out of the seat a serious chore.  One feature makes it a keeper.  It has two positions for rear-facing.  One is full recline for a small infant.  The other is more upright and takes up a LOT less space in the back seat.  This is so great, as we can finally put her on a side, near the door which makes it easier to get her in and out of the seat.  She's a heavy baby and lifting her over to the middle of the truck's back seat was killing me.  I have replaced the buckles from our other forward facing seats (I am NOT recommending you do this) and it is now the perfect seat.

Review: Our first Britax survived 12+ months with our first daughter and is now being used by the younger daughter. The only complaint I had with that one was the difficulty of getting the cover to fit properly after removing and washing it. This one seems to have a better fit and finish with more material wrapping around the shell in the right areas. I think this one is even easier to load and unload the toddler. The stiffer belly pad and tounge are partly the reason. The other part is these rubber shoulder strap additions that make the whole harness a little less floppy. "Armies in!" and "Armies out!" is considerably easier.

Review: This is a great booster seat. I got this for my four year old when he was ready to transition.  I originally got him a cheaper booster and used the car's seat belt, but he is  small for his age and very active, therefore he was often hanging out of it or getting out all together.  I feel SO much better about the harness on this seat.  He is secure, comfortable, and loves his new seat!  Unlike other seats in this group, this seat is not overwhelmingly huge.  Don't get me wrong, it's not small, but it is not as wide as others I have seen.  Love this and would buy it all over again!

Review:
- UPDATE -

4 years later and I now own 2 Graco Nautilus (Nautili?). While the Britax Boulevard went up to 65 lbs, my DD's shoulders out grew it when she was only 50 lbs (5 years old.) I have just now removed the harness, my daughter it 8 1/2 years old and 62 pounds. While the crotch strap may seem short, this never gave her a problem or irritate at all. The two problems are that the straps would twist annoyingly, but not too bad, and her head continues to fall forward if she falls asleep. We are still using it as a high-back booster. I continue to love this car seat and if you are looking for a more cost-efficient harness to booster seat, this is a great one.

-Original Post -
We purchased this car seat as my daughter's back up seat in her aunts car. I have a Britax Boulevard in my car and my husband has a Radian 65 in his. I was looking for something that met all my safety standards, but was not going to break the bank. I LOVE this seat, I definitely prefer it over the Radian. It ... Read more

Review:
We bought this and on the first use our son was transported to a parallel dimension when we stopped too fast. We have only been able to get text messages from him since this happened. Thankfully he was using my wife's cell phone when it happened and now we can only text because we happened to have a shared data plan. I am especially worried that the phone will de-charge and we will not be able to hear from our son anymore. Also, even though we are on a shared data, the power requirements for each text have caused us to have to keep the cell phone plugged in all the time. So not only was our son shifted into the parrellel, we also can't use the phone when we are driving around looking for quantum portals. How are we supposed to contact him to know if we find the right one.
This has been very annoying, also, I think the shift may have caused our son to grow ten years in age, because the text messages he has been writing are way beyond the 4 year old scribbles he was doing before. Does anyone know very much about quantum physics because I am at the end of my rope. Thanks a lot Graco, you need to make sure your quantum quality control gets a strong reprimand for this.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

You could if you had an anchor on the floor of your vehicle. Also a word of caution. The liners are washable but I strongly recommend NOT putting them in the dryer. We put the first one in the dryer and some of the seams busted open. I have always air dried the ones in my truck and have had no problems.

Also it is extremely complicated to put this seat back together after it is dismantled for thorough cleaning. They need to improve the design of the car seat cover so that no mess escapes through the sides and leaks into the interior portions of the car seat and base. Then it would save us the frustration of having to disassemble and put this thing back together again each time.

This foam is much plushier that my previous seat. For those with infants and toddlers, you will love the magnetic chest harness! So much easier to get on and off and no struggling searching for straps. Like all of these car seats it’s expensive, but I found that the convenience in so many of these features made it worth it and it’s the same price as all of the other higher quality seats. Review:
I hated this seat and will 100% not use it for my next child. As the reviews state it is very fancy looking which is what drew us to it but the MOST important thing is 1- your baby's comfort and 2- functionality. This seat is very tight and deep so it is not comfortable for the baby once they grow beyond a newborn size and we ended up buying a new seat when he was 6 months because both our son and my husband and I hated this seat. From a functionality standpoint, because of the size of the seat it was extremely hard to put even a very tiny baby in and out of the seat which was brutal for me. Everything was so difficult to attach and click in

Maxi Cosi also sells an adaptor kit to attach this seat to an uppa baby stroller. When you attach it to the stroller the seat leans forward so the babys head flops forward and given newborns sleep all the time this made the attachment to that stroller unusable.

I wouldn't recommend this car seat to anyone. Don't be fooled by the good looks, you and your baby will hate it!

Review:
We needed to purchase a second car seat and after much research, I came across the Go and Grow 3-in-1 and felt that it would be perfect for our needs. Out of the box, this is a very nice looking car seat and it is very well padded. Those are about the only nice things I can say.
I have several frustrations with this seat, but my main one is that I cannot get the latch to release the seatbelt. It has a round button, not a square one like my Graco seat, but even when using both hands it takes all my might and several attempts to unlatch the belt. Another major issue is tightening and loosening the belt is extremely cumbersome. At one point it took 2 people pulling on the belt to get it tight because the belt seems to keep getting caught. I am afraid that I will hurt my son using such force to tighten and loosen the belt. The chest restraint is also very wide on this, which is an issue for my 17lb baby. It has left marks on his arms because it's wider than his chest. My son also seemed uncomfortable in the seat. He doesn't love being in the car, but he usually doesn't cry the entire time, and every time he's in this seat he cries. Unfortunately, this was not the awesome find that I was hoping it would be and I am returning it for another Graco.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: 3-in-1
Installation Type: latch
Harness Type: belt, chest restraint
Material: padded

Review: The car seat is very nice. Our baby is a big boy, only 3 months old. The straps don't have a very long extension so we aren't sure how long it will last since our baby is a chunky one. I have extended the buckles as far as they can go and it isn't always the easiest to get him in it but we love the car seat and this product as a whole.

Review:
I cannot say enough good things about this car seat. It has so many safety features that none of my other car seats have ever had. It is so sturdy and well built! Here are just a few reasons why I am in love!

The bottom of the seat is rubber! (so it doesn't slide around)
The shoulder straps have an added strap that connects to the additional rubber chest pads(used in front facing)
When tightening the straps, it clicks, letting you know when it is snug "enough"
There is added padding everywhere (at least it seems that way)
It has a steel frame
The car seat is not as wide as it looks, yet roomy. (if your child is pretty chunky, it would be a tight fit. However, I would think this is a good thing unless the child is uncomfortable.)
The side impact things move up and down as your child's height adjusts.
The pink print is simply beautiful! Very girly yet classy.
The seat also comes with tether straps in the back that are supposed to indicate when there has been too much wear and tear to the car seat ( i guess this would also depend on how much your are taking the seat in and out of the car.)

I have owned graco and the newer evenflo convertible car seats and they have NOTHING on this seat. The quality is just so much better here and the evenflo doesn't seem to have half as much padding or quality fabric as this britax symphony has.
I was very reluctant to spend so much money on a car seat, but now, I wouldn't purchase any other one. When it comes to your child's life, I'd take the chance and trust that these extra features and quality will provide that added safety. (ps. I have 3 kids so money is tight, but this was well worth the extra cost.)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: tether straps
Harness Type: shoulder straps, chest pads, tightening straps
Material: rubber, padding, steel frame, fabric

Review: This carseat is beautifully designed and has wonderful safety features. The extension for when baby gets too tall is an added bonus I was excited about for sure, and the 6 position recline is nice for babies who are used to being in a reclined position in their infant seat, however; I have an Acura TSX and although the car seat fits in the back it has to sit straight up and down which is uncomfortable and there is no room to put out the extension, rear facing. I would recommend this seat for children able to ride front facing in a smaller vehicle or for use in an SUV.

Review: We have two of these for our toddler twins, and we've been using them for about a month.  We had to use a pool noodle under the seat to get it to sit flat, and we had some trouble getting it installed because the LATCH attachments in our car were narrower than the car seat.  Once installed, the seat seems very secure.  I like how easy it is to move the shoulder straps up and down.  My only complaint is that we have a hard time getting the straps to release and loosen for getting our kids in and out.  Also, we aren't very tall, and in our mid-sized car, my husband has his seat almost against the rear-facing baby seat.  I think if we were much taller, the seats might cause a problem.

Review: Easy to install and inexpensive but the corners where my son rests his head when he falls asleep are hard and uncomfortable for him. It makes it hard for longer trips in the car or if you drive just to put kids to take a nap. Keep this in mind if purchasing.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material: corners where my son rests his head are hard and uncomfortable

Review:
We recently switched my 8 month old to this seat from his infant bucket seat.

Pros:
Very easy to install in our 2016 Honda Fit using the premium push-on Latch connectors. It fits behind the passenger seat with room to spare without the front seat being pushed all the way forward. (We did recline the back of the backseat to help with fit.) We took it to the car seat inspection at the local fire station and they said the install looked great.

We like the "headwings" for side impact protection and the somewhat deeper sides of the seat, especially since he's outboard in a smaller car. It makes him seem more protected. It seems like a sturdy seat. Some people may not like the deeper sides because you have to lift the child over, but it works for us.

It must be comfortable, because my son falls right to sleep! We did take out the extra head pillow and infant insert because they made him fussy (probably felt too restrictive) and according to the manual, they were not required at his size. He seems to enjoy the seat just fine without them!

The no rethread harness that adjusts with the headrest is very nice and easy to use.

Our son is tall but thin, and we like that this seat should be able to accommodate him rear facing for several years.

Cons:
The main con we have seen is that the harness can be difficult to tighten when putting the child in. I use a trick I saw online to pull the harness down from the back and then tighten. I also try to avoid loosening the harness when taking him out. Doing this, I've consistently been able to get it properly tight (passes the pinch test).

Overall, we really like this seat. It's got some of the more premium features without the premium price. If it wasn't for the extra effort needed to tighten the harness properly, I would give it 5 stars.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Weight Range of Child: 8 month old
Installation Type: Latch
Harness Type: no rethread harness that adjusts with the headrest

Review:
I have three at three and under to fit in a third row of my van. I bought a Diono for my three year old and was not happy with how difficult it was to install so that it doesn't move around. I cannot install the Diono rear facing so that it wouldn't budge, and so I bought two of these for my 18 month old twins who've outgrown their baby carseats.
Installation was easy and the level guage is very helpful. My kids seem comfy in these, and they just fit three across with one in the middle row middle seat of the Honda Odyssey. I was a little irritated that there is a width requirement for Latch clips and mine seem to just barely be wide enough in that middle seat. The cupholder is a nice feature because you can either open or close them. My kids are too little to care now, but I'm sure they will appreciate later on.

I got these on Prime Day sale and that was the icing on the cake for me.

I took off one star because the harness buckle is kind of weird to undo, it's hard to describe but the buckle isn't standard from other carseats I've had and I have to work harder to unclip it.

Review: I love love love this car seat! It's the best purchase I have made for my son and wish I had made the investment sooner. This car seat fits my 32 lb. 4 year old perfect. He is pretty tall (and skinny) for his age and we have no problems with the latching mechanism for the 5 point harness. (Referring to those who previously complained of the crotch buckle being to close) He also buckles himself in with no problems, however he does need assistance with getting out (which I appreciate) I did a ton of research before purchasing this product and I am incredibly satisfied with the car seat and would recommend it to all. Putting the seat together and installing the car seat was pretty easy, if you take 20 minutes to read the mfg. instructions you will be golden! We installed it into our 2013 jeep wrangler (4 door) it fits properly in the seat and does not tip as we have encountered that problem before. My son also loves that he has storage for his cars/toys and snacks.

Review: We registered for two of these seats when our first baby was born. We had a Graco Stylus stroller/car seat combo set but because we had a huge baby she was into the Britax by 4 months old. We have one Britax Roundabout for each car. We love this seat. The cover does pop off the side on one of our seats, but not the other. It really doesn't bother me. We bought an Eddie Bauer for my mom's car which is not as soft and does not latch in as safely as the Britax and is much bulkier. I recommended the Roundabout to my best friend who just had twins and she bought two and also loves it. The Roundabout is RF until 40 lbs which is great. Now at 20 months old and 30 lbs, our girl still sits RF which is the safest position in a collision. We will be purchasing two more for her little sister who will be here in October (one for each car). My husband can switch the seat out in under ten minutes now that he's familiar with the seat and it's incredibly sturdy.

Review: Horrible! I can't believe they still sell this. Our Britax Car seat does not attach securely to the trolley so it tumps over easily. The whole design of thing makes no sense. It's next to impossible to get the carseat latches to tighten on the frame and the manufacturer did not consider that the seats angles do not allow it to rest right up against the 90 degree frame of the trolley.  This trolley made our trip an absolute nightmare. The trolley tumped over with our son in it when we were trying to get through the parking lot of the airport. If you hit a bump or even make a quick turn the whole thing tumps over! The GoGo Baby trolley with the ratcheting system is a MUCH safer option and hasn't caused us any problems.

The most recent had to be replaced due to being in an accident and that’s when we switched from the Graco TriRide to the Graco 4Ever DLX SnugLock. It is the best car seat!! It’s SO EASY TO INSTALL and with the SnugLock feature I didn’t struggle at all to make sure it’s as secure as possible. Typically I had to have my husband finish by muscling the straps tighter, but not with this one! It’s also so much more spacious for our little one and she loves how comfortable it is. No more complaints on road trips :) My only wish is that the cup holders were a tad larger to fit a standard kids water bottle/thermos. Otherwise we love love love this car seat and highly recommend it!

We were in a bind and needed the seat so it was cleaned best we could, and used. I called and talked to Amazon customer disservice and was told would did I expect from an open box.  WHAT!!!!  I was shocked by this response. When it says open box excellent condition I expect that. An item in excellent condition with an open box. DO NOT FALL FOR THIS AMAZON IS PURPOSELY MISLEADING YOU TO BY GARBAGE!!! Very unimpressed by this and feel it complete and total fraud!!!!

Review:
As a die hard Britax fan, I automatically bought the car seat when my son was old enough to switch from the infant carrier. The seat is very large, plush and seems to be comfortable.

It does, however, lack adequate adjustment and range of motion. It also doesn't fit in my car so it went into my wife's SUV-where it still didn't fit 'out of the box' and required a rolled up towel to be properly adjusted. Maybe it's just me but when I spend this much money for a safety seat, I shouldn't have to add anything to the seat to make it work as designed.

The area around my son's head on the seat is rather wide and doesn't provide what I'd consider to be adequate support for his head/neck when he falls asleep in the car.

After noticing these issues, I did additional research and bought a Chicco NextFit for my Mazdaspeed3, which is more compact, more comfortable for my son (he doesn't seem to thrash around as much when put into the seat or try to get out immediately after the buckle is released like he does in the Britax), and most importantly, doesn't require a rolled up towel or pool noodle to be properly adjusted. The NextFit works in both cars and is MUCH easier to adjust, install and remove as needed.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Material: Plush

Review: I was one of "those" moms who kept her kid rear-facing as long as possible, but finally, when my son was 3 y 4 mo, he was too tall for his rear-facing carseat, so I got this one to replace it.  I ended up installing it in the parking lot of the store where I bought it, at dusk, with no help.  First, let me say that even under those less-than-ideal conditions, it was easy to understand and follow the installation instructions, and it fits perfectly in the (shallow-depth) back (passenger side) seat of our Blazer.  Second, it's a snap to adjust, but sturdy and functional for my big boy.  I love the fact that the straps are readily adjustable when he's wearing a bulky coat.  Finally, the boy loves the cupholder, although we've discovered that it is EXACTLY the right size to get a softball permanently stuck, until you find twine to thread around the ball and pop it out....

This seat is great because it has the high back which is adjustable for taller children. And I can remove the back later if needed. It has a place to put the seatbelt through so it isn't choking your child, and I really like the way the headrest sticks out on the sides so my son has somewhere to rest his head when he falls asleep. Review:
There is a lot to like about this seat. First, it looks nice. It doesn't feel cheap, and the materials are soft, and well made. Removing the fabric is easy, and is machine washable as advertised. This is handy, since kids sometimes make small messes, and sometimes throw up all over the entire car seat. Ask me how I know.

My daughter seems to find it comfortable. She falls asleep most rides. She is very tall and heavy for her age. At 18 months she was as tall and heavy as an average 3 year old boy. She still fits perfectly rear facing in this seat.

Now the bad. When you tighten the shoulder straps, it's very hard to pull tight. The straps go over the child's shoulder, and around the back of the seat, where they connect with a metal buckle. This buckle gets hung up on the bottom of the seat. In order to tighten the straps correctlt, I'm forced to reach around the back of the seat, and use my hand to slide this metal buckle over the spot it gets stuck on. It's pretty annoying. I can see other people leaving it looser than necessary because of this design flaw, which could be dangerous.

I want to like this seat, but I wish it worked better. It's not a huge hassle now since my daughter is rear facing, and the back of the seat is open. When she's front facing, it will be near impossible to reach behind the seat to adjust the straps.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: materials are soft, well made; fabric is easy to remove and machine washable
Seat Type: rear facing; front facing
Harness Type: shoulder straps; metal buckle; straps go over the child's shoulder and around the back of the seat

Review:
We purchased a Diono Radian RXT in 2018 because we wanted to buy a car seat with high safety standards. We installed and used it exactly according to the instruction manual, and used it in normal city driving conditions. The other week, we noticed that the "headwings" that are supposed to protect your child's head from side impact had slid down from their adjusted height and were pressing into our toddler son's shoulders. We had not lowered the headwings at all, but they had slipped to the lowest setting. We adjusted the headwings again to their proper height, and over the course of a week under normal driving conditions, the headwings again slipped down and pressed into our son's shoulders.

We contacted Diono "Customer Care" and sent them a video of our issue. We were told that the steel plates in the seat can wear down over time and that is what was causing the headwings to slip down. We were offered a DIY "remedy kit" and told that we could try to fix the problem ourselves. Unbelievable. Not only were we told that we had to repair what is clearly a manufacturing defect ourselves, but moreover, they did not currently have this so-called "remedy kit" in stock at the moment and that we should use a "back-up car seat" while we wait for this DIY "remedy kit."

We told the Diono Customer Care rep that we did not think it was appropriate to put the responsibility of fixing a manufacturing defect onto the customer who does not have any kind of formal training in car seat repair. This is the kind of thing that should be handled by an experienced Diono technician. We told them that we did not feel comfortable with altering the car seat ourselves and "hoping" that we did it correctly. We asked them to either replace our car seat with a new one or pay for the shipping so that we could send it to them for repair. The Customer Care rep said she would have to talk to her "supervisor's supervisor" and that she would call us back. She called us back and informed us that since our car seat is out of the one-year warranty window, they would not send us a new car seat, even though the problem we are experiencing is due to a manufacturing defect and/or design flaw and their choice of weak steel.

Our car seat is barely two years old. We used it exactly according to the instructions. This company boasts that their seats can last up to 10 years, but will not even fix a manufacturing issue themselves.

We look up Diono on the Better Business Bureau and there are similar complaints to ours. This is not a small cosmetic defect but a major flaw of a safety component that is supposed to protect your child's brain side impact in the event of an accident. The fact that they offered a DIY "remedy kit" to try ourselves at home to correct this issue in addition to reading about similar complaints from other Diono seat owners leads me to believe that this is not an isolated issue but serious design flaw that the company is trying to pass off onto the customer. They never issued a recall, or sent out any alert to the Radian RXT owners of this flaw. It seems that Diono has known about the flaw enough to produce these so-called "remedy kits" but did nothing to alert the owners. Rather, they have stayed silent and in doing so have willfully endangered children who use their car seats.

DIONO DOES NOT CARE ABOUT CHILD SAFETY AT ALL. Given the response of the customer care team, it is clear what the company's priorities are. They would rather risk the safety of your child than offer you a properly functioning car seat or even have a technician fix it at their expense. This company only cares about their bottom line, not the actual work of protecting children.

DO NOT TRUST DIONO with your child's safety. They have no problem with you using defective car seats and will not alert you of possible malfunctions. When your car seat does malfunction due to their manufacturing/design flaws, they will not send you a replacement or offer any help in fixing it themselves. I will never purchase anything from them ever again and will be alerting other parents of not only their horrible customer service but also their willful neglect of child safety.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Material: steel plates

Review:
This car seat has so many excellent features, but the 2 difficulties I had are so significant, they were deal-breakers for me and I have to return.

Pros:
Rear faces to 50 lbs
Lightweight and compact compared to so many simply GIGANTIC convertible car seats on the market
Steel reinforced frame
Easy to install, adjust recline, and adjust harness up and down with child's height
Upgraded latch connectors
2 built-in cup holders
Aesthetically, the Spire color is very tasteful. The fabric seems very easy care and not to "plushy" where it would get too hot in warmer months.

Cons:
Like other reviewers, I found it extremely difficult to get the harness to fit tight enough to pass the pinch test. I had the harness height adjusted below my child's shoulders, as instructed for rear-facing installation, and no matter how hard I pulled, I could not get the harness nearly tight enough to pass the pinch test. It was a hard stop preventing further tightening. So I figured I must not have the harness height adjusted properly. I (easily) adjusted the harness height further down, well down below her shoulders. This helped significantly, and I was able to get the harness much tighter by pulling down on the straps behind the seat while simultaneously pulling HARD on the harness tightening strap. But it was still not tight enough to pass the pinch test. Adjusting the harness height even further down below her shoulders would have made the height of the car seat too low for the the top of her head to be adequately protected. Having to wrestle with the seat to get the harness to just barely approach being tight enough is a both a safety concern and a chore for me. My child is very long and lean, and perhaps a seat where the seat height and harness height adjust simultaneously just won't fit her well.

Also, the lever to release/loosen the harness is located deep inside the seat under the fabric and very difficult to access when installed rear facing. I can see how this might be an advantage as far as food not collecting in this area. However, I found it so much more difficult, compared to her infant car seat (Chicco Key Fit 35), to loosen the harness to get her out of the seat.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear faces
Weight Range of Child: 50 lbs
Installation Type: Easy to install, latch connectors
Harness Type: adjust harness up and down, harness height adjusted, harness tightening strap, lever to release/loosen the harness
Material: fabric seems very easy care

I ended up returning the car seat and asked some help from amazon customer service and they  were so nice and helped me about everything.

Review: I was so excited about this car seat. It has everything I wanted in a car seat for my toddler and would have been something I used for her lifetime. I am so disappointed, however, because it was so impossible to install that I had to send it back and purchase an entirely different car seat. The tethers are just hooks instead of clicking right in to car tethers they only hook on. No matter how hard you or the strongest man in your life tries, you cannot tighten this car seat to sit safely in the back seat because the belt twists and turns and never tightens properly. It moves at least 3 or 4 inches from side to side no matter how much you try to tighten it. The same issue occurred when you use the seatbelt to install instead of the tethers. In addition, there was no where to store the excess clip belt (that is only used when it is forward facing) when the seat was in rear-facing mode. So the metal clip would just flop around and become a dangerous projectile for the toddler. All in all this thing looks like it is top of the line amazing best car seat ever... Until you can't install it and it becomes obsolete. I encourage safety first to keep all the features of this comfy car seat but to please fix the installation issues so that families can use it the way it was intended!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: tethers are just hooks instead of clicking right in; belt twists and turns and never tightens properly; use the seatbelt to install instead of the tethers
Harness Type: excess clip belt (that is only used when it is forward facing)

Review: I will agree with another reviewer on this seat.  There is hardly any cushioning in this seat.  It is all harder foam and the cover has hardly any cushioning.  I choose this because I have the Diono Radian RXT(2018 model and a solid seat)which has a little more padding.  My son is 8 and has out grown the 5 point harness of the RXT(he is small for his age).  The RXT does convert to the booster, but I chose to get this booster because it looked to be more specific for the purpose, and cost is not as much of any issue for me when considering my son's safety.  This booster has the larger sidewalls for side impacts.  This is important to me because I will be moving my son from the center seat(unfortunately, because of my truck not having a shoulder belt in the center).  Looking at other brands, I don't feel like the other seats would be that different in regards to comfort or cushioning, and this one seems safer looking to me.  I like the look of the Monterey versus other seats because the sides and the head protection seems to be the largest that I have seen and it is reinforced with aluminum.  It looks like a Nascar seat.  If it's good enough for Nascar, it is good enough for my son.  I will say that I did add about a half inch of "luxury" cushioning to every part of this seat to provide more comfort and, I feel, more safety.  I cut and molded them to fit perfectly.  There was plenty of room under the cover to do this and I think it filled it out more.  The cover seemed loose without it.  I am like BASF.  I don't make the products that I buy, but I make them better, ha!  Another reviewer stated that he did not think this was a safe seat, because he said when you pick up the seat from the back part, the bottom falls off.  I will say that they could have designed this better to snap together so that doesn't happen.  The other reviewer also said that he was afraid that the back would come off in impact.  That is not possible, because of the way it goes together, and once you put it in the car and "latch" it in, the back cannot come off.  It only comes off when folded backwards to the flat position, which happens when you pick it up from the back.  Again, this could have been designed better for transitioning to another vehicle or just removing and carrying it.  Overall, I think this is as safe of a booster seat as you can get and I like the Diono products versus others in regards to design and safety features.  They could do a little more in regards to comfort and padding for additional safety, so I would not have to modify it.  A little extra padding would not cost that much to add and would definitely make this seat the best on the market, along with a locking mechanism for the back rest to the base. .....just my 3 cents.  I will have to see about the buckling and shoulder strap issues that others have expressed once I have used this more.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Material: hardly any cushioning, all harder foam, cover has hardly any cushioning, reinforced with aluminum
Installation Type: latch

Review: Have had this car seat 7 months now and we love this car seat got it when our daughter was 7 months old!!! It's so easy to use, install, and clean! My daughter seems to love it and falls asleep in it regularly and doesn't mind being in it on long rides so it must be pretty comfortable to her. Our only complaint is the cup holders don't stay in good at all, they come out so easily....my daughter has made it a game to grab them and throw them around the car so we haven't been using them since she is breastfed and wouldn't take a bottle or a cup for a long time but now that she has a cup and we are trying to figure out what to do so she can have her cup there but she won't be able to get the cup holder out and throw it around....that is my one and only complaint though, the car seat is absolutely amazing and I love the spots to put the buckles so they are out of the way and out of the sun so they aren't so hot.  My favorite things about it is how comfy my dauhter seems to be and how easy it is to take out to clean it up (if you don't need to clean the actual car seat you can take the cushion off without taking the car seat out it's so simple).

Review: I have been using Britax seats for the last two years and have been very happy with them.  When it was time to buy another seat I decided to buy this one so that I could use 5 point harnesses for my 45 and 75 pound kids instead of just going directly to the booster seat.  I read the reviews about the seat being hard to adjust after it was installed and that is true.  However, all that I had to do was to release the click tight and adjust it then push the click tight back down again.  My click tight is pretty easy to get secured, it does not take a lot of force to get it to snap in.  And releasing the click tight is very easy, I just lift up on the back cover of the seat and you can easily see exactly where to place your fingers and squeeze to release it.  Adjusting the bottom strap was not intuitive when I was trying to put the seat in on a cold and dark evening and I ended up having to open up the owners manual to read it first but then it just took me about 1 minute to get it adjusted.  Both of my kids have tried this seat and like it so I am ordering a second seat.

Review:
I was really on the fence when we needed to get a larger carseat for our 3.5 yr old daughter. It was between this and the Britax Frontier 85. We opted for the Graco and now I wish we spent the extra dollars for the Britax. We always used Britax carseats (Marathon and Roundabout)but when the roundabout got too small we bgt the Graco. Overall I think the Graco is safe which is really the most important thing, but it's the small things that are annoying. First, the straps have a tendency to twist; drives me nuts. Second, the installation is a pain. The Graco seat only has one belt to pull up on and it feels next to impossible to get it tight enough. I always ask my husband to tighten it further so it doesn't wobble around. I also really like the Britax velcro tabs on the side that hold the belts away from the seat so my daughter can get in without sitting on the belts. Graco does not have this feature.
The cup holder is nice as are the little "cubbies", but if I had the chance to do it over again, I would buy the Britax.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Installation Type: Seat Belt
Harness Type: Straps

Review: This is a great product. I just went on a plane ride with my daughter and she loved rolling in her carseat through the airport. The TSA and the airlines seemed to be very familiar with this item so they just put the cart and carseat on the conveyor belt as one item through security. The airline (Southwest) just took the entire thing from me at the end of the jetway (I didn't even need to put it all in a carseat bag or unattach the cart or anything). My carseat and cart were ready for us when we got off the plane. I was able to just strap her into the carseat and go!
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
This seat has it all!! Only reason for 4 and not 5 stars is that its HUGE! We had a Dodge Caliber and it fit behind the passenger seat only but adults could no longer ride comfortably in the front passenger seat. It has also been installed in a mini van and full size can and fit great! We currently have it our chevy traverse and it is fine behind the passenger here as well, but not the drive if the seat needs to be all the back for tall folks! It also worked well in the impala, but we bought the traverse ;)

As for the features, they are plentiful and awesome! It has independent recline, so if it is installed you just pull the handle and it adjust without ever having to install or uninstall and the recline works for forward facing as well! The base is awesome, and you can order extras, that way you just pop the seat out and into another car at will. Plus those who have worked at installing a big seat know it is not super easy but with the base this seat is!!! It is heavy and very well made! The seat cover comes off for washing without taking the seat out of the car!!! That's right no more threading straps everything is removable whole the seat is in place! This is not an infant carrier so the child has to be taken out and put back in every time you get out of the car, for us this was great it was what we wanted! Our daughter was five months old and about 12 pounds when she stared using it and she fits great! The only other draw back is the cup holder, although you don't have to install it, it only fits on one side and cannot be moved! Again we love this seat so much it doesn't matter!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible, Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 12 pounds
Installation Type: base
Harness Type: straps
Material: seat cover

Review: As I know many moms are always concerned with their babies safety and comfort. I know I am. This car seat provides me with sense of safety and security when my baby sits on her car seat. Along with the the comfort level that it provides her with adds a special touch as well. Well worth the money
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
Since 2001 I've been hooked on Britax car seats. The quality and ease of use of their seats puts them above their competition. When I was presented with the opportunity to review the Britax Pavilion 70-G3 I jumped at the chance to see how it compared to the Britax Marathon 70-G3.

The first thing I noticed when I pulled this seat out of the box was it's weight. This seat isn't one that you're going to want to transfer from one car to the next on a regular basis and I certainly wouldn't want to have to lug this seat through an airport.

My initial impression of the seat is that it was the overprotective parent's dream come true. I'm all for a super safe car seat for my child but this seat almost feels like overkill. The wings that protect the child's head in the event of an accident also keep the child from being able to turn his or her head and look out the window or at a passenger riding next to them. It also makes loading a child into this seat in the rear facing position a bit difficult. My nineteen month old who is used to riding in a Marathon 70-G3 and a Roundabout 55 Classic is not thrilled with the seat. In the past I have not been a fan of the HUGS that are on the harness for the Marathon seats, and I expected the new Safe Cell HUGS to be even more of a pain with regards to loading and unloading my child but they're actually a great improvement on the old HUGS feature.

The harness for this seat deserves some attention in this review. For about five months I put off using and reviewing this seat because I had difficulty loosening the harness when I first took it out of the box. I've handled a lot of car seats in the eleven and a half years that I've had children and this was the first seat where I had a lot of difficulty loosening the harness enough to get my child in the seat. I was so irritated by the seat that I put it out and my garage for several months and figured one day when I had more time I'd play with the seat a little more. When I finally got back to the seat I figured out what I was doing wrong. I always pull on the harness at the shoulder/chest clip area to loosen the harness (the hang tag instructions for this seat suggest pulling on the chest clip). Because the HUGS are tethered to the car seat shell doing this means the harness can't be pulled from the top. I found that if you pull the harness from the lap area the straps loosen with no problem. So I absolutely understand the frustration that many other parents have had with the harness.

Tightening the harness is simple. Just pull the center strap on the front of the seat and it makes a loud click when the harness is within an acceptable range of tightness. I think it's a great feature that will help those parents who tend to leave the harness too loose learn how to properly secure their child.

Harness height adjustment on this seat is a snap compared to the seats where you need to rethread the harness. You simply have to squeeze and pull (or push) to adjust the height of the harness straps. The ease of use for this function is on par with the simple adjustment of the back on a Graco TurboBooster.

Just like the Marathon 70-G3 the versa tether on the Pavillion is energy absorbing and works to reduce forward movement and rotation in a crash. The seat also has the EZ-Buckle System which keeps the harness buckle in a forward position and keeps your child from sitting on the buckle. I can tell you that this feature is quite nice. I had been using a Roundabout 55 Classic with our nineteen month old and I can't tell you how often she ended up sitting on the buckle and freaking out while I try to pull it out from under her. The new design really works nicely to keep the buckle out of the way when loading the baby into the seat. The design reminds me of the harness buckle on our B-Agile stroller.

Installation of this seat was a snap. I installed it both rear and forward facing in my Toyota Sienna and it was easily and securely installed in both positions. The seat is on the larger side so it is possible that this seat may not fit well in smaller cars when used in the rear facing position, but I think it's a bit more compact than the Marathon 70-G3 and Roundabout 55 Classic. Using this seat rear facing I have noticed that my toddler has less leg room with the Pavillion than she has with both the Marathon 70-G3 and the Roundabout 55 Classic.

Overall, this is a great quality seat that will keep your little one safe, comfortable and secure for many years. If you can deal with the ease of use difficulties with loosening the harness and your child doesn't mind having his or her view obstructed by the wings around the head then this seat is a very safe option with will offer optimal protection for your child. In the eleven and a half years that I've been using Britax seats, I have found each of them to be worth the price. While the Pavillion is a good seat, I prefer the Marathon 70-G3 for ease of use.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type
- difficulty loosening the harness
- harness can't be pulled from the top to loosen; must pull from the lap area
- tightening the harness: pull the center strap; loud click when within acceptable tightness
- harness height adjustment: squeeze and pull (or push) to adjust; no rethreading needed
- HUGS on the harness (Safe Cell HUGS)
- chest clip area for loosening (per hang tag instructions)

Installation Type
- installation was a snap
- installed both rear and forward facing
- easily and securely installed

Seat Type
- rear facing position
- forward facing position
- convertible (can be used both rear and forward facing)

Material
- wings that protect the child's head
- EZ-Buckle System keeps harness buckle in forward position

Review: The head rest "energy-absorbing" (polystyrene) foam broke in less than 2 years. Cost of replacement is $15 + $5 S&H. This car seat is supposed to last until the child is 65lb (9.5 years old on average, per growth charts). It is disappointing and unacceptable to have that important part broken for the remainder of the car seat's lifetime. The car seat is also extremely heavy, making it an annoyance when there is a need to switch cars.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: head rest "energy-absorbing" (polystyrene) foam broke
Weight Range of Child: last until the child is 65lb

They are awkward and take up much more room. I highly recommend this seat!

Review: This convertible car seat is easy to install and remove from vehicles.  It seems comfortable for my great granddaughter and has been easily adjustable as she’s growing.  It is easy to remove and reassemble cover for washing purposes.  We toss her cushions, straps, everything in the washing machine and dryer (low heat, of course).  We wash buckles (plastics & metals) by hand in the sink and dry immediately.  We have two, mint/gray and black/dk. pink, because it is heavy and inconvenient to switch from one vehicle to another daily.  This seat easily reclines to stabilize baby’s head/neck while sleeping, very convenient for longer car rides.  My 5 year old grandson also has a Graco Convertible (very similar) that my daughter has been very satisfied with.  Of 11 Grandies, they’ve all used Graco, and the Convertibles are the BEST!!  Reasonably priced and well constructed for overall protection of our little people!!  ❤️

Adjusting the straps by cranking the knobs on the sides isn't hard at all. We plan on purchasing another one!

Review:
I bought this to replace a Marathon that my 7 yr old son outgrew. Knowing that children are much safer in a 5 pt than a regular seatbelt made it easy to decide to purchase another Britax seat with a higher weight limit. Look at this product's specifications. They are wonderful. It wasn't that hard to install and my son says it's so comfortable! It is a larger seat but it fits fine in the backseat of my 2002 Taurus with the Marathon that my 5 yr old still uses.

If you are looking at a child safety seat, seriously consider this one. Don't balk at the price...if you spend money on anything for your children, a quality safety seat should be one thing you don't skimp on. After all, you can't control other drivers and your precious children need all the protection you can give them! Visit the Britax website for more product specs, videos and safety information too.

I love this carseat. The extra money it costs is WELL WORTH IT. It is extremely portable, folds up into a backpack and is super light. It takes a minute to decipher how the seatbelts work, but once you do the straps and buckles are so adjustable it's like a custom fit for every child.

Plus it's approved for use in both airplanes and cars, so when we travel it is great to bring right on the plane with us. Fits into overhead or you can buckle it right into the seat to use for your child.

15/10 highly recommend.

Both have great safety ratings and would grow with my son, who is now 2 1/2.  We had gone into retail stores to look at them and had my son sit in each of them.  We had pretty much decided on the Nautilus when I read the reviews on Amazon.  All the reviewers with sons mention the crotch buckle and how far back it is.  When we looked in the store, we hadn't buckled my son in the seats.  We went back and buckled him in and he was already sitting on the crotch buckle.  No room to grow like I had hoped.  We decided to spend the extra on the Britax for his comfort.

Review:
Summer or winter, our baby daughter is always sweating A LOT in this seat. Even after a 30 minute ride, her back is soaked and we have to change her top. On longer rides, she is just swimming in her own sweat. She does not have this problem with cheaper, portable seats. The material of the Britax Boulevard 70 -G3 is not breathable. We always keep the A/C on, do not use blankets when she is sleeping, but it does not help. We always have a spare top to change her in after she comes out of the seat. I imagine it is pretty uncomfortable for her.

Otherwise, it is a wide, comfortable seat and it is higher quality that similar seats from other manufacturers. Easy to buckle in and easy to instal.

Review:
So I did lots of research before buying a new car seat. As I kept reading, the Graco Milestone kept coming back as a popular choice within many reviewers, so I decided to order it. So far, so good.
I wanted a car seat that allowed me to rear face for a long time, this one allows me to rear face up to 40lbs. Now, I do have to mention that my kids are on the smaller side, my 6 year old weight 42lbs now, so If its for a child that might reach the 40lbs limit quicker there are other options like Graco Extend2fit that allows you rear facing up to 50 lbs. For foward facing the weight limit is up to 100 lbs.
This car sear has a nice soft material, my son doesnt get all sweaty like he did on his infant car seat.
Installation was very easy with the EZ tight latch system. Just connect and press down so it can get as tight as it can be.
As for size, I feel like its on the bulky side. We have it behind the drivers seat and it doesnt give my husband much space to move his seat back, but, its an easy fix, we can always move the seat behind my seat since Im shorter. Not a big issue.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing

We hope britax comes out with some cooler covers but other than that we love it.

Review: Looks nice and it’s light weight but it is IMPOSSIBLE to get to install tightly. I have installed many different brands and types of car seats.  I first tried using the latch system and tightened the belt as far as it would physically go (meaning I used the entire length of the belt) and the seat would still move 5 to 6 inches in either direction. Then I tried installing with the seat belt and it was even worse. I put my entire body in the seat trying to get it tight and attached the tether as tightly as possible and still it was unacceptably and dangerously loose. I went back to my heavy Graco seat but at least I feel like my child is safe.

For most cars we used to install the car seat (taxi, rented cars, etc) none of them has the option spot that we can latch it on.

Review:
At first I was skeptical, but after trying to fit my Britax Advocate 70 on a lesser luggage cart, it became obvious that the beast of a carseat had specific needs. This car seat dolly fit perfectly, and we managed to transfer the seat (with sleeping baby) from the car to the cart no problem at the airport. It's not obvious from the picture, but the handle part extends to about twice the length shown, and the car seat JUST fits on the bottom section. There is no room for extra luggage. Still, at $10/day for a rental carseat that may or may not be complete, safe, or clean, taking along our own trusted seat with this cart made good sense. We got the Jeep bag for the seat, and gate checked it no problem. This cart fit in the overhead nicely. A word of advice though, it's better to go up the aisle with this thing on wheels (put a carry on on it) than carrying it - it kept whacking the seats on each side of the aisle...oopsy!
I do wish it had some kind of stabilizer, to keep the angle steady when rolling (more of a stroller frame would have been perfect). I felt like I was jerking him around a little, since the handle was slightly too short for me at it's max height. I'm 5'8" and I had to walk slightly bent over to keep the ride smooth... and for sure, when stopping, use your foot to keep it from rolling backward and jerking him forward in the seat. A slightly longer handle would have been nice, since I wanted him out in front of me, rather than dragging him along behind me, where I couldn't watch out for crazed commuters in a mad rush to get on or off of the train.
I'm glad I got it, and my super skeptical husband is too.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing
Installation Type: Clicktight

Review: Since the birth of my first child I have tried out and been disappointed with so many car seats. I have bought evenflo, graco and safety first... They all pale in comparison to the Britax. The Britax Advocate is worth every penny you pay! Best car seat I have ever purchased! My daughter loves it and seems so extremely comfortable. It is a large carseat so do take that into consideration before purchase but I can tell you that you will not be disappointed. I have a very tall 2 year old (32 inches tall) and she is so comfortable for short and long California car rides. I can't say it enough, this is the BEST car seat I have ever purchased and I am now a Britax mom for life!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 2 year old
Material: comfortable

Review: I needed a car seat for my 11 month old grandson in case I need to pick him up from daycare.  There was no need for an expensive seat and this one had good reviews.  When it came I was very surprised and the bottom of the seat...it's just narrow plastic edging; no real "bottom" on it at all.  If you don't want to ruin your car seats be sure to buy a seat pad for underneath.  Just FYI, the car seat does move around a bit on the reverse position no matter how hard my son-in-law worked at it; the seat will not go level.  We think it will be OK for very short trips for emergency pickups but i don't think I would want it to be my regular car seat.  We think it will be better when it's in the forward facing position.

Review:
Not thrilled.
First of all, the LATCH hooks can't be adjusted to be tight enough because there are these huge buckles that get in the way. The only way I could find to do it, was to remove the entire car seat and guess how tight the LATCH straps need to be, then re-install, then remove and tighten or loosen, then re-install, etc. There is no way to simple install the base and then tighten as instructed.

Installation was a HUGE pain overall. And it doesn't come with a locking clip so you can do it the "old fashioned" way. So if you don't have LATCH, you'll have to order the stupid clip.

It fits nicely into the top of the coordinating stroller, but it doesn't release easily. I find myself yanking and jiggling it to get it to release.

It's nearly impossible to press the red buttons on the sides of the carrying handle in order to move the handle out of the way (so you can get baby out). You have to squeeze them REALLY hard and at times jiggle the handle around to get them to release.

The cover for the baby's feet? It was all ripped up on the inside within two weeks. Who knew a newborn could destroy a carseat with her feet. Then she gets little fuzzy things all wrapped around her toes and it makes her cranky (don't judge; it was summer and what baby actually agrees to wear socks? I don't know any)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: LATCH hooks can't be adjusted to be tight enough; doesn't come with a locking clip so you can do it the "old fashioned" way; if you don't have LATCH, you'll have to order the stupid clip.
Seat Type: It fits nicely into the top of the coordinating stroller, but it doesn't release easily; press the red buttons on the sides of the carrying handle in order to move the handle out of the way.
Material: The cover for the baby's feet was all ripped up on the inside within two weeks.

She was very excited when I a surprised her with this new seat. She loves it. The seat is very sturdy and does not move around when she is sitting in it. The seatbelt passes through seat belt hole perfectly. I feel very safe with my title girl using the seat on a daily basis.

Review:
This is a product the whole family can enjoy. It easily fits my baby into the seat, straps are easy to adjust but secure so I don't worry about it. The base has to be one of the best parts you can just leave it in the car and snap the seat into it. We don't have a second base, and my husband has no trouble putting it into his car. Its quick and has a guide for the belt.
We often use it as a seat when away from home you can place the handle back to prop the car seat up, less to lug around. A plus about this car seat is it fits into many restaurant booths so you don't have to place it in a busy walkway.

Review: Wife and 3mth old just got in an accident that totaled our 4Runner. Baby girl is still here and I owe it to this car seat. Just ordered my second car seat from them to replace the one that was in the crash. Can’t put a dollar sign on my kids life

We have a Peg Perego Skate stroller which we love. We needed a new carseat for our newborn so we got this because it clips into the stroller.

Overall we like this, with the following exceptions:

The handlebar is sometimes hard to move back and forth.
You have to lift STRAIGHT up (not angled in any direction whatsoever) to get this off of the carseat base.
It's heavy.
It's hard to remove the upholstery should you need to clean it, and the directions on how to do so are lacking.

Review: I bought this at a brick-and-mortar store back in May as a shower gift for a coworker. It made a huge hit with everyone and many commented they haven’t seen a seat like that before. My coworker had no trouble setting it up and collapsing it for travel. She also appreciated how easy it is to clean.  I just bought a second for my boss and his wife.

Review: After reading numerous reviews we decided on the Graco Highback as well.  So far so good.  Feels pretty secure.  Cup holder is a nice bonus. Our son is 4 plus years old and weighs about 43 pounds.  We purchased this one for dad's truck but for his main transportation he's still in a 5 point harness seat.  We actually will be purchasing another Graco Highback for my parents.  Great price.

Review:
We bought this seat 8 months ago for our son's first birthday. We have it rear facing and have used it in both a Hyundai Elantra and a Honda Odyssey. Obviously it fits better in the Odyssey, but we had no problems with the Elantra. It was a little bit difficult to install the first time we used it, but we had to switch it back and forth between cars several times before we got the back-up seat for my husband's car and once you know what you're doing, it's super easy.

Little Guy is 25 pounds and 31" and it very comfy rear facing. I noticed that he does tend to get a little sweaty on long rides in the car, but we do not have the same problem in the van, which has A/C vents in the back. He sleeps well in it when appropriate (and sometimes when I wish he would've waited the three minutes until we got home) and his head is more likely to drop to the side onto the headrest than to drop forward.

This was affordable and has been easy to use and comfy for the Little Guy. I would definitely recommend it to a friend and buy it again if need be.

**Update** The cover was SO EASY to remove and wash and just as easy to put back on. Such a blessing after little guy squeezed an entire yogurt tube in his lap on a trip.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear facing
Weight Range of Child: 25 pounds
Material: cover was SO EASY to remove and wash

Review: We returned another car seat as it was too tight in the back of our Audi A4.  This seat fits perfectly even with my seat back. I took off 1 star as the seat likes to tip down (toward the back seat while rear facing) which others have mentioned.  A towel underneath or between the seats should correct this.

Watch the video on the last slide on pictures of the product !!

Its cute and WIDE enough.... BUT there is little to no room as far as the belt straps.
My 1year old loves to take naps in the car and I’m sure she won’t be comfortable, am I supposed to stop and adjust the car seat every time? (Which means she’s either straight up or straight back) Having it “converted” takes up way to much space!

Might delete this later but right out of packaging I have some concerns.

Review: My daughter had this same car seat for my grandson who used it for a long time.  It never wore out.  As my daughter became -pregnant again after seven years, she found the old seat wondering if she should use it again.  The old seat was fine except for snacks that had dirtied up parts, but the seat itself was still in good condition.  At her baby shower she got a NEW car seat exactly like the old one and we all feel that it was the best choice.
Attribute_Related_Content: No

Review:
Up until now, I've had Evenflo car seats for my toddler because of their Consumer Reports rating, however, my husband and I were never really thrilled with their ease of use. She's about to outgrow the 40 lb. weight limit on them, however, and it was time to find a car seat / booster that would grow with her until she was big enough to sit in the car by herself. This car seat was perfect for that!

I researched for a while before selecting this car seat. I purchased one to try it out before purchasing another 2 so that we'll ultimately have 3. (One for each of our cars, plus one for our babysitter's car.) I'm thrilled with the seat and am now purchasing the other two!

The things I like:
1. The car seat just feels and looks well made. The fabric is nice, the arms are built well, the chair is a good size, but also fits perfectly well in our car. Cup holder is built in and sturdy, not flimsly like the other's I've had.

2. Easy to size with lots of slots for the internal harness and lots of positions for the headrest. The adjustment to tighten or loosen the harness is also very easy to get to and adjust.

3. Great headrest. I love the "wings" on the headrest...gives my toddler something to rest her head on when she falls asleep.

4. The internal harness buckles are very well made; buckle and release very smoothly. I also like the padding for the upper part of the harness (never had these on my other carseats.)

5. Easy to install in car. It was also very easy to tighten...it fit well on the seat and tightened up very easily. Car seat didn't even budge once I had it tightened.

All in all I'm more than pleased with this purchase. Amazing price (plus free Amazon shipping) for what you're getting!!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Weight Range of Child: 40 lb. weight limit
Harness Type: internal harness, adjustment to tighten or loosen the harness, internal harness buckles, padding for the upper part of the harness
Installation Type: Easy to install in car, easy to tighten, fit well on the seat
Material: fabric is nice

Review: I am so sick of wrestling off the fabric for this thing.  first you have to take off a protective cover to unhook the straps, to thread them through the mechanism to take off the rubber things to fit them through the small fabric holes to wrestle the cover over the head protection.  then take off the head protector.  And that's just off, on is worse.  I'm not a crazy neat nick, but I'd love to clean the covers every other month or so.  Instead, I'm trying to see if I can just soak up the urine that leaked out of the diaper because getting the fabric off and on takes so long! But I'm sure you're not a busy parent and have 30-40 minutes to dedicate to each seat each time you want to wash it.  And that doesn't count the laundry machine.  Same for the boulivard.
Attribute_Related_Content: Material

Review: This car seat was recommended to us by fellow parents and it truly is great!! My daughter was to the point that she would fuss when getting into her car seat, but this one is more open and she seems to get into it a lot easier. We spend quite a bit of time in the car and she seems to be comfortable and safe. I would recommend this car seat to anyone in the market and looking for a good one!!
Attribute_Related_Content: Seat Type: more open

Review: Great car seat for a growing toddler.  We have an above average height 3 year old and this car seat is perfect for the transition from car seat to booster seat.  The only issue is the lower clip.  There is two positions and there really needs to be three.  It is a tight fit between the diaper and the clip.  I find myself loosing the upper straps in order to loosen the tension against the "private parts."
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 3 year old

Review:
While cleaning out the car I noticed that there was some wear on our son’s Grace 65 car seat so I purchased this to replace it. I’m a pro at moving that thing around and I’m not a meek woman, but I could not get this thing in tightly. And I’m not sure if I got one that’s defective or not, but if you have nails you will be unable to apply enough pressure to the button on the bottom restraint to open it. I had a brief moment where I thought I might have to cut him out.

I’m the event of an emergency, I am unsure if I will be able to release my child safely from this seat. My husband is going to give it a go and there’s a slight chance that it will end up in his car instead, but I can’t operate this in good conscience.

Hefting around 60-100 pounds of weights, gear, or kids - I’m fine. I’m the one they call to open difficult jars. But I can’t handle that poorly designed red release button.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: could not get this thing in tightly
Harness Type: unable to apply enough pressure to the button on the bottom restraint to open it; can’t operate this; can’t handle that poorly designed red release button

Review: The only thing that is problematic about this car seat is it takes up so much space while rear facing that the front seat of my minivan has to be pushed all the way forward. That makes it pretty tight for the front seat passenger. Otherwise we really like it and you cannot beat the price! Our local hospital gives these car seats out to low income families and they feel very confident in it's safety rating. Further, it was well rated on Consumer Reports.

Review:
I just completed a 3500 mile road trip with my daughter in this seat. Absolutely no complaints from her (about the seat anyway.) We moved my daughter (3 1/2) up to the Frontier out of a Britax Roundabout. The Frontier fits her much better and the armrests and retractable cup holders are nice. I preferred the nylon seat fabric on the Roundabout for cleanup, but this seat fabric seems to be doing well so far for snack crumbs and pet hair. The minimal use of velour reduces pet hair sticking as well.

I love that the straps, buckles, etc are identical to the Roundabout (now used rear-facing for my 8mo old.) The stow-away feature for the LATCH clips is fantastic for dragging this thing through and airport and not having straps dangling everywhere. The automatic shoulder strap height adjustment with the head rest is also a great feature. No complaints so far.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing
Weight Range of Child: 3 1/2
Installation Type: LATCH
Harness Type: straps, buckles, shoulder strap height adjustment
Material: seat fabric, nylon, velour

And honestly love it! I prefer the milestone over the 4ever. Easy to install. Looks great in the car. Very convenient getting our son ( 6 months old) in and out of it. We give it an A+

Review: It is amazing the difference in this seat compared to my Graco Snugride!  The seat is just fabulous and soooo secure in the car.  I was a bit upset because my 2010 Subaru recommends that the seat be installed in the rear passenger position and not in the middle...but I think that it is still sooo much better than what my son was riding in.  Apparently Subaru doesn't like the crash test results when the seat is in the middle position...........although you could choose to install in the middle with the seatbelt instead of the latch system.  I chose the latch system with Subaru recommendations for my son.  Overall really happy that I upgraded to a Britax!  The construction is much, much better than anything else I have seen and the padding is plush compared to what he had before!  Recommend....

Review: We bought this seat for our daughter, after a very problematic experience with Sunshine Kids Radian.  I have 3 kids, and I put a lot of thought into our car seats.  Weeks upon weeks of research and reviews.  This is by far the best car seat we've ever owned, and we've owned some amazing seats.  I don't think I've ever seen a seat get the kind of install that this seat gets.  You literally cannot move it at all.  I love the top tether set up, the LATCH, and the seat belt clamps.  No matter if I use the LATCH in our mivivan, or the seat belt in our older SUV, this seat is 100% safe.  Not only that, but I would imagine that this seat will easily fit into most cars, even smaller models.  My daughter will be rear facing for a long time in this seat.  Britax just cannot be beat.

The sensor safe feature is an awesome feature, I like that tells you the temp of the car, if the clip falls out and that I have the manuals all on the app! I think its a great car seat.

We plan to have 2 next to each other in the middle row of a minivan, and that should not be a problem with this car seat (from the research that I have done).
