Review:
We have been using this car seat for the last five months. I ordered this when my daughter was 10 months old and was getting too heavy for the carrier in the Graco Click Connect travel system. She loved the transition. I like that we will be able to use it long-term and it will grow and adjust with her, while rear-facing and front-facing.

I absolutely adore this car seat. My daughter falls asleep in it within minutes of being put in the car. We are doing extended rear-facing. My state requires to rear-face until 1, but we are waiting as long as we can (at least 2, but trying to until 4, depending on her height and weight by then). Usually while rear-facing, the seats are horrible to install and adjust. I have a Graco (this one) and Safety 1st for our vehicles. My mom has an Evenflo. My dad bought a Cosco. The Graco ComfortSport was, by far, the easiest to install and adjust. The Evenflo is the worst. We all use the Latch system in our vehicles.

It is easy to install, easy to move of switching vehicles, very easy to adjust.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rear-facing, front-facing
Weight Range of Child: depending on her height and weight
Installation Type: Latch system

Review: It is very light weight, which I love, but as many people have pointed out- not having a front strap adjuster is super inconvenient. I also feel like it gets lose on it's own all the time and makes me feel like it isn't safe. My baby is already outgrowing it after almost 5 months so we'll need another anyway, but even if he wasn't I don't think I would want to continue using it.

It provides excellent support in the back but it isn't heavy. Plus, it's his favorite color and that is all he cares about haha. Review:
I bought this so I could tote my nieces and nephews around - ages 4 through 10. The younger ones use it with the (adjustable) back in place and the older ones use just the booster. Their mom lets them ride without a booster and the seat belt behind their back... I wasn't comfortable with that and they weren't comfortable with the seat belt cutting their neck - this was the perfect solution. They're big fans of the drink holder and the secret treasure compartment too! The peace of mind this offers me is invaluable. Plus if there are stretches of time when they're not in the car with me, it easily stores in my trunk since the back is removable. Incredible value!
However, I haven't had to wash the cover on it, so I don't know how it would hold up to that.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster

Installation Type: seat belt
Material: cover

Review:
I have two of these car seats; one for my two year old going on three daughter and one for my just turned one year old son. I bought the first one two years ago and I liked it so much that I set a price alert for the second one and I just bought it less than a month ago. The installation is a breeze, it feels sturdy when secured. Even though is big enough for a three year old kid, it does not feel cramped and it doesn't occupy the whole back seat.
If my review helped you in any way, please let me know by clicking the "helpful" button below. Any questions you may have, feel free to ask… Thank you!

Review: I absolutely love this seat, it’s very light and install was a breeze. Always a reminder to read the manual before installing, I’ve read a couple negative reviews on here that were definitely due to them not reading the manual. One of them was where the individual was checking for movement elsewhere and not at the belt path like your meant to do. The other was the individual didn’t comprehend that you can rear face face until 22 pounds depending on your state laws and when you think your baby is ready if you decide to move them to forward face but you can also decide to rear face to 40 pounds despite your state laws, it’s recommended children stay rear facing as long as possible but it’s parents discretion at 22 pounds as well if state laws recommended it. We will be purchasing a second one soon!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: 22 pounds, 40 pounds
Installation Type: belt path

But just looking at the design and seeing all the features makes me feel safe putting my daughter in it. Seat attachments to the base made with more steel than any other seat I have seen. Large tethers to the anchors in car that actually tighten unlike some seats I have see. Easily adjustable for front, rear, booster. Five point is great and seat seems comfortable for my daughter. Unlocks from base esier than our last one but not because attachment is cheesy, just alot better design. Great seat highly reccomend.

Review: Perfect booster seat for my 4 year old son. Black color easily hides food crumbs and juice splashes. Very lightweight and easy to assemble. He loves the cup holders for his toys. Delivery was faster than expected which was a pleasant surprise!

Review:
Ok so, at first the directions were a bit confusing, but once I understood that we have the option of using the seat anchors or the seat belt to anchor the seat. Recently we purchased a new vehicle, and it was so easy to switch the car seat to my new vehicle. I would say it took less than 5 mins, but It seemed like it took less than 2.
I purchased this car seat for my grandaughter who is not with me very often, so I went for price. Then Covid-19 happened and I have to babysit her everyday. The carseat was very difficult use at first, but once the clasps were broken-in the buttons have become easier to push. Now, we can go for car rides almost every day, (she has to nap), she really enjoys the ride and she is high enough to see outside my car. She loves it and so do I!

Review:
Like most people, I can’t stand installing baby seats in my car. They’re always a hassle and you constantly worry that they aren’t installed correctly.

This thing was an absolute breeze to install. Took just a few minutes to go from box to ready to use.

My one issue is the location of the button to loosen the straps. I understand you don’t want it accessible to your child, but you have to stick your finger down a tiny hole at your child’s feet. My wife has small hands and finds it hard to reach the button at times.

Review: I’m a CPST instructor and tried out the BubbleBum backless booster with my 8 year old daughter. I normally keep her in a Britax Frotier 90 with the harness, however for her 8th birthday she was going on a trip with two of her friends and she was going to be the only one still in a "car seat". I decided to get a BubbleBum seat for the trip. We made a two hour drive each direction.  The pros- My daughter said it was comfortable for her, it fit well having 3 kids across the row.  At $25.00 It’s economical. The only con I could find was that the seat slipped when she was getting into it. I wish it had latch attachments to hold the seat in place. My daughter also needed assistance and reminders to use the seatbelt guides which if she was in a high back booster she would need the reminders/ assistance. All that being said this is great for those that do car pooling or having an extra seat for grandma/ grandpa. Overall great seat.

I turned left and my son and the chair both turned also. I might not understand how to install it so someone please let me know but I will be ordering another one with the hooks at the bottom to secure his Seat in. Doesn’t seem safe enough if they make them with the hooks And this one doesn’t have it. Waste of money.
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: This car seat has no safety feature to attach the chair to the car besides a seatbelt. I will be ordering another one with the hooks at the bottom to secure his Seat in.

Review: Great booster!  I love the seatbelt guides on this seat.  2 guides on either side of the hips guides the seatbelt where it should lay and NOT across the belly, and 1 additional guide keeps the shoulder belt where it should be.  Very easy to switch between cars.  Surprisingly with it's small size, ease of use and it's compactness this booster gets one of the highest ratings for safety!  I actually had to call customer service for Bubble Bum and I spoke with a very cheerful and helpful British guy.  I would definitely buy again!  Also FYI, even though the picture isn't updated, I DID receive the seats with the newest updated seatbelt guide style that are easier for kids to use.

Review: Nice quality car seat. We purchased a pair of these to go into the back of a 2018 Camry in place of our Graco 4Ever seats because based on what we have read, these slimfit would be slimmer which may have allowed us to fit a small adult in the center back seat. We got these slimfit seats in our hands and realized, they are not any more slim than the 4ever. The 4ever seat is a little nicer and more feature packed. We will be returning these slimfit since they do not live up to their name....SLIM. They are 18.5" wide at the shoulder wings. We could not fit 3 across in a new toyota camry with 3 of these seats forward facing but likely could with 2 forward facing seats in the outer positions and a rear facing in the center position.

Review:
This booster was great for our son! He’s almost 4 and is almost at 44 inches tall and he found this to be very comfortable. We bought it in May and I was hesitant about it because I realized after opening it that it only used the seatbelt to secure him, not a five point harness. He fit the size parameters though and so we ended up keeping it and using it in my van. Earlier this month (July), we were on a road trip and drove 22 hours to get to our destination. He was comfortable the whole ride. I gave him a little travel neck pillow and he stayed upright and the belt fell perfectly in place on his shoulder. He never tried to unbuckle the seatbelt and seemed very happy in his booster.

The day after we got there, someone rear ended us. It was a hard enough hit to cause damage and whiplash (for me) but my son was fine in this booster! Not so much as a bruise or red mark from the seatbelt! Graco states you must replace it once in any accident so we went ahead and got another one just like it (only in a different color as this one wasn’t available in the local store). Our insurance reimbursed us for it. We used the new one to drive all the way back home and again, he loved it and handled it well. As he outgrows his other seat in my husband’s truck, we’ll replace it with another one of these for sure! Thank you Graco for keeping our most beloved little person safe!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: seatbelt
Harness Type: five point harness

Review:
I have always loved Graco products, but this one isn't up to par. Everything is great EXCEPT the part the seat belt goes through by the shoulder. Its horribly designed. It twists the seat belt EVERY SINGLE TIME! My son use to be able to buckle himself in his old back booster seat. But this one is because of the poor design, I'm back to buckling him again. It is very annoying and makes the product undesirable in my opinion. If my son cant buckle himself, you better believe its losing multiple stars!
I always shop Graco for car seats, stroller, high chair, pack n play...everything!...and I've never been disappointed until now.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: back booster seat
Installation Type: seat belt

Review: I boought this booster car seat for my 2.5 years old daughter after extensive search and comparison. Overall, I like this product and my daugther too, particularly the cupholder and storages under the armrest. The two areas I would like to see some improvements are the recline design and the headrest. The 3-position recline design is not really a true recline. It doesn't change the angle between lags and back. It is just like one putting a bath towel under the seat. This is my main complaint. As for the headrest, when my daughter sleeps, her head keeps falling down forward, rather than resting on the headrest or the back of the seat. This is probably related to the recline function since there is no way to tilt the angle of the headrest. For me, it would be a perfect product if Graco could resolve the two concerns.

There is no way to adjust it well to the point that the seat doesn't move at all. So, that doesn't feel nearly as safe as the previous seats.

They seem comfy, adjust quick and easys, they install quickly and easily and the covers come off easy for quick washing. I love the little bum pads so that if my child wets her pants, I can just pull that out and wash it instead of washing the whole seat. I think my kids have TONS of room to grow. My average height three year old is still on the smallest forward facing setting and has alot of room above her ears. This will be what I buy for every one of my children from now on! I have NO complaints about this seat - only praise!

Review:
I purchased this seat for my mother-in-law's vehicle. My 6 year old daughter loves the pink and also finds the seat comfortable. The back easily slides up and down to adjust the height with the help of a grip in the back. We love that the cup holders are elastic and can fit multiple size cups. The belt guides keep the seat belt in the correct position on her. It's not bulky like the Nautilus she's in in my car, so she is able to buckle herself. The thin profile also makes it great for either fitting 3 across or if you have 2, there would still be room for a passenger. The seat is also pretty light and easy to assemble so it's great for travel.
Safety Note: Guys....just because a 3 or 4 year old can fit in this seat, doesn't mean they should! Even if they are large for their age, they are still too young. Their bones are not ready and they really should be harnessed. Please do additional research before you make potentially unsafe decisions. This seat is excellent for a 5+ year old that is mature enough for a booster!

Seat Type: booster

Installation Type: seat belt
Harness Type: harnessed (for younger children)

I will buy another one soon for my new car. I will never buy anything but Britax. They saved my daughters life.

Review:
I saw inconsistent measurements for the UberBoost, so for the record, fully inflated the booster is 14x14x4 inches. The cover visually appears slightly wider, but the measurements are what matter if you need to fit this between other passengers or car seats.

The competition BubbleBum is 12x12x3.75 inches. Because it doesn’t contain any foam, the UberBoost packs down slightly smaller than the BubbleBum. Both are bigger and less heavy than the MiFold.

I needed a very narrow booster for the middle of the back row of our 3 row Subaru Acsent. The child sitting there is skinny and wears kids size 6. The MiFold fits, as does the BubbleBum. The UberBoost is too big for the space. However, the UberBoost would fit a wider child much better than the other 2.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Weight Range of Child: kids size 6
Material: foam

Review: I love this car seat, after doing tons of research I found this is one of the safest. The fabric is very soft and cushy and the cupholders come out for easy washing. It adjust in so many ways, like the to for hight and the angle. One thing I found was amazing was in the front were you go under the fabric to tighten down the harness the fabric magnets back into place for easy adjustments. The harness release button is easy enough for me but will be difficult for little fingures. Its so amazing my mother in law bought one as well! It is a little large so I'm not sure how it would fit in a car with another car seat but it'll fit in both my husband's sonata and my pt cruiser.

My son is over 14 pounds and is almost 3 months so we will be carrying it around with him sitting in it for a while! Will stick with chicco products from now on.

Review:
This is our second Britax Marathon Clicktight car seat. I chose it for my oldest based off reviews I read from Babygearlab.com. I had no reason to not choose it again for my youngest.

We love the quality of the seats and ease of installing. They are heavy seats so I wouldn’t recommend this for someone who travels often or switches between cars because that could be tiresome.

It is thoroughly padded which makes for a comfortable ride. I remove all the pieces and machine wash them occasionally because sometimes they need a good washing. I try to air dry them but will sometimes throw them in the dryer on low heat if I need them done quicker.

There are labels on the car seat to reference when installing it and a bubble level. I found that I needed to recline the seat more once I placed it in my vehicle because the captain seats are slanted. Otherwise, the seat would have been too far upright for a rear facing baby, if that makes sense.

We start using these seats on their first birthday because we feel they are safest in their infant car seats until then.

We are pleased with our car seats. This is what I recommend to my friends looking for convertible seats.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: ease of installing, labels on the car seat to reference when installing it and a bubble level, recline the seat more
Material: thoroughly padded, remove all the pieces and machine wash them, air dry them, throw them in the dryer on low heat
Seat Type: convertible seats

I would have waited a few years to purchase but we should get all the use we need out of this seat before it expires.

Review: I do like that you can click the arm straps up so that they are not in the way but the buckle will not stay in place so you have to dig that out from underneath the kid anyway.  My biggest issue...you cannot get this carseat installed tightly.  The straps that you tighten it with do not move at all when installed with anchors.  Even if you have the car seat out of the car, the tightening strap does not work.  And so we tried the seatbelt installation and while it is a tighter than using the anchors, it still does not get tight (it moves a lot more than an inch).  We bought this to be moved from my parents vehicle  when they take care of him and it isn't worth the hassle.  I spent $150 and feel like I wasted my money.  And trust me, I looked at the reviews.  I didn't see any issue with installation not being tight.

Review:
I really wanted to love this car seat. It looks and feels high quality. I purchased it to go into my Mazda 3. We installed it in the middle seat using the seat belt installation. It took some time to get everything installed and some muscle to get it tight enough. The fit in the car was tight but doable.

The problem with this seat was when I put my son into it his head was pushed forward. He was uncomfortable and I was uncomfortable with the angle of his head. It seemed unsafe. He never fusses in the car but he started fussing and coughing as soon as we put him in and he didn’t stop until we took him out soon after.

I’m sure this car seat would work great for older kids and forward facing, but for my 7 month old son- rear facing it didn’t. It didn’t matter what angle the seat was at, his head still pushed forward. So we returned and purchased the same brand his infant seat was.

Review: Overall, this is a great car seat. I bought it because the buckle strap placement is adjustable and it has solved our problem (the strap on the buckle of our old car seat was too short and made the seat uncomfortable for my son). I like that the seat converts to a booster and is as big as it is. I am definitely happy with the seat - it is much more comfortable for my son. The one (minor) complaint that I have is that the shoulder straps are close enough together that they were irritating my son's neck occasionally - the fix for this is easy though, just velcro some fabric around it and then it doesn't rub. I definitely would recommend this seat.

Seat Type: converts to a booster

Review: We were gifted this infant seat for our daughter, after researching tons this is the one I registered for. This is my 4th baby, so I’ve used my fair share of car seats and I knew I liked graco & urbini. I decided the graco bc I really wanted the ease of the snuglock, but that is literally the only easy thing about this car seat. I wasn’t very impressed from the time I’d opened it because instead of the soft material everyone else described mine felt scratchy, cushioned enough, but not soft. The strap pads didn’t fit well on my baby at all, thankfully this seat allows for use without those so we tossed them. The one hand adjust is not just a smooth adjustment from positions 1-4, you have to stop at each position and restart from there. In order to adjust the straps you have to press a button that’s usually right under the cover, I’m not one of the people who whines about having the adjust button on the inside, but this one is ridiculous. It’s so far down, and it’s not even with the hole in the cover, so you can barely get your finger in it & since it’s far down you have to thread the strap through on the inside with one finger in the tiny slot because if you don’t it just bunches up at it when you push it through. My baby isn’t comfortable in it either, which is a problem I’ve never had with any of my kids. And the most annoying thing, it sticks in the base. I’m 5’1 & I drive a Toyota Sienna, every single time I try to lift this seat of the base, the front end gets stuck and I have to maneuver it and yank it around to try to get it out all while squeezing the back release handle. Good thing she’s too uncomfortable to sleep in it otherwise I’d be waking her up. My 6’3 husband has less of this issue, so maybe it’s just a height thing, but nevertheless annoying. Material also gets super hot, my babe sweats like crazy in it. Totally wish I would’ve went with urbini or maybe even a simpler model graco. I gave it 2 stars bc it is lightweight, and the snuglock is a great feature.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: infant seat
Installation Type: snuglock
Harness Type: strap pads, one hand adjust, adjust the straps, adjust button
Material: soft material, scratchy, cushioned, Material also gets super hot

Review: In theory, this would be a good product...if it actually stayed aired up. We had to blow it up every time we stopped. It had a slow leak after the first day of use. Very disappointing. Would be a great product if it didn't leak.  Ended up returning.

No idea how it would work when forward facing and we no longer have open access to the the straps behind the seat. Will return and buy different brand.

Special Features: Super Easy, Car Rental inflatable packable portable luggage travel
Review: We used this during a one-week trip overseas and it takes no space nor weight in your luggage. We never had to inflate it during the entire week. We also use it as a backup booster when picking up other kids. This is a great booster seat!

Review: Looooove love love this car seat! It is so cushy and sturdy. It was INSANELY easy to install! And I am seven months pregnant! It is the first seat I have not needed help from my husband to install and that is including before I got pregnant. Our son seems perfectly comfortable in it. Sinching in the LATCH system straps was ridiculously easy and fast and the seat did not budge when I tried to wiggle it around. We normally would not choose to spend so much on a seat if we don't have to. We are always on a tight budget. But we decided to go with this seat because our car is sort of compact. It's a Scion xA. And our son is a tall child at only 2.5 years old. We were not comfortable with forward facing him so soon and this seat has a great height/weight limit for rear facing especially for tall, lean children like my son and it totally fits rear facing in our little car. I needed to be able to safely sit in the front seat in front of it and I can with no problem. I also love how customizable the recline setting is on the seat! It's fabulous. And adjusting the height of the straps at the shoulders is also incredibly easy. This seat is very well made, very user friendly, very safe, and seems to be very comfortable! We plan to buy a second one for our second child due in October since we love it so much and it works for newborns as well! :)
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing, Convertible
Weight Range of Child: great height/weight limit for rear facing especially for tall, lean children, works for newborns
Installation Type: LATCH system
Harness Type: adjusting the height of the straps at the shoulders
Material: cushy

Cons: I wish the extension of the belt could be longer. It is working right now but I am utilizing almost all the length of the 5 poing harness belt. My child is about 38 inch tall and 32 lbs weight, I don't know this may be an issue in future once he grow taller and I need more belt length.

Review: My son HATES being in the car and this is the only carseat that he tolerates. This carseat is awesome! easy to install and super safe. I also love the fabric because its very breathable ( super important in florida weather with a baby that sweats when you take him out for 2 seconds). Since my son is so picky about being in the car one thing that was super important for me was to be able to recline the seat to where its not laying down ( only option with a lot of rear facing convertible seats), Im able to recline him to a comfortable position to where he is not trying to pull himself to try to sit. Take it from the parent of an extremely picky child when it comes to the car, this is the BEST seat you can get!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Convertible
Installation Type: easy to install
Material: fabric because its very breathable

Review:
So far we love the car seat. My daughter has been using it for about a week. This included one long trip to an out of town doctor. She enjoys being able to look around and see out the windows. Everything amazes her since she could see that well from her previous car seat.

My daughter is almost two and actually has long legs and she has plenty of leg room now (and we don't even have it set to have has much leg room as this car seat can give of course). In her old carseat she propped her legs up on the back of the seat.

The car seat sits very securely rearfacing. It doesn't seem unsturdy at all. I have Dodge Grand Caravan and it's in one of the middle seats. In a smaller vehicle I could see issues with this car seat not fitting, though. It fits snuggly in my van.

It can be an issue to get her to sit up straight to fasten her in, though and if she isn't sitting up straight then she has that issue of her chin being tucked into her chest that other people have complained about in reviews. She doesn't seem to mind it but I feel like it is safer for her to be sitting up straight when fastened in.

The only negative and the reason I am giving it four stars instead of five is because she can't sleep fall asleep easily in it. She DOES fall asleep and is able to sleep okay in it but it takes her a bit to figure out ways to sleep and she has to be extremely sleepy to do it. I do believe that this would be an issue with almost any up right car seat though. She was use to her reclining baby seat. So, this is just different.

Oh and it did take my husband a little while to install it but he was able to get it installed securely and without getting annoyed with it. So, it must not have been to bad.

My daughter is special needs and has a weak spine and weak muscles. She needs to rear face as long as possible as it will take her longer to get strength in her neck and spine. So, I chose this car seat for its ability to rear face to 50lbs. And for that I do love it.

Final consensus is that it's safe and my daughter likes it. So, while I wish she could sleep (and drink her bottle) easier in it overall it's very worth the money and we will likely be purchasing another one of these for our next baby.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: rearfacing, ability to rear face to 50lbs
Weight Range of Child: rear face to 50lbs
Installation Type: install it

Review:
I was skeptical, not because of reviews, but how this would work in "real life" going through the airport security.
We just got back and this cart has proved it's worth 10x over. I did NOT want to be stuck at the rental car agency rummaging through cheap car seats as I have in the past. So here's what I did...
I ordered one cart and EASILY strapped in my Britax Marathon 70. Since my kids are happy to walk, they would not be riding in it, I took the other childs Marathon 70 and plopped it right onto the other seat. The side straps don't reach the cart but the top belt reaches and all just cinch that real tight and you now have both seats on 1 rack. It was so good we used it as a cart to pull around our carry on with no tipping or other problems.

Security was a breeze. We told the ticket counter we needed to gate check the seats which was fine (AirTran). When we got to security, I motioned right away to the TSA guy these were oversize and he took it through the door. On the way out the one guard asked I separate the seats (1 minute later, done), on the return they said it was fine as is. They took it aside, hand checked it while me and the family walked through. No problems.

At the gate, we went straight to the counter to get tags for the seats, and folded up the cart for overhead carry one - and that was that, next stop was dropping/picking up at end of the walkway. It may have helped we flew off peak times so we didn't encounter lines.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: strapped in, side straps, top belt, cinch

Review: This carseat does not properly recline to fit rear facing in our yukon, equinox, or crew cab dodge truck. The harness also loosens significantly after a short drive. I tighten it very snug in my child and when we arrive at our destination 10 minutes later it's so slack he's got his whole arm behind the chest clip with room to spare. The cup holder also only fits in the left side and because our child is rear facing in the passenger side I cannot use the cup holder at all because it sticks out so far we can't close our vehicle doors. And yes, we tried rolled up towels to assist in the leveling and even with 2 thick towels it still would not recline enough. I have ordered a graco convertible 65 to replace it, as the graco 65 we already have fits in all of our vehicles great and seems to be a much higher quality and better overall design.

Review: Looked at it in the store and was very impressed.  There are only two things keeping me from choosing it for my fourth child: 1. it's expensive, and 2. I absolutely hate the chest clip on Graco models. You have to pinch the plastic with the tip of your thumb and index finger to release the clip, but can't get a good hold. I'm always terrified I'm going to painfully break a nail (and I keep 'em pretty short anyway). I don't mind paying a little more for a great car seat, but if that clip is going to make me nuts, I'm not going to purchase.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Harness Type
- The reviewer hates the chest clip on Graco models, describing difficulty in releasing it and fear of breaking a nail.

Review:
When it comes to my 3 daughters, safety is the most important factor in choosing a car seat for them. For that reason, I own 4 Britax carseats and been very happy with their products. When I needed to shop for a booster seat with 5 point harness for my 2 1/2 year old, I was all set to buy another Britax Frontier SICT. Then I saw how popular the Graco Nautilus 3 in 1 was and what a great rating that Consumer Reports gave them. When I saw that it was literally $100 less, I placed the order. I'm disappoined. At first I was excited by a few of the features, but the practicality or lack there of takes the precedence in my mind.

The latch system on this seat is far inferior to the Britax technology. It was much harder to situate the seat properly in my van. And the tighening is only on the right side of the seat and very awkward. I couldn't get a good angle to tighten the seat. I much prefer when the latch on the right and left are independent of each other. It is much easier to tighten them that way.

The crotch strap came with a really nice cover, which I thought was great at first to save little legs from being pinched. But, then when it either came off or covered the buckle ever singe time I needed to put my daughter in the carseat, it was annoying, so I took it off. Now, the crotch strap falls through the pad on the bottom of the seat every time I put my daughter in/out. So we have to dig it out from below the pad and feed it back through the hole. ANNOYING! I keep hearing my husband and I saying "Augh! This carseat!"

The straps and buckles feel cheap...especially the chest clip. It is hard to get them to click because they are so flimsy.

Finally I've seen my sweet little girl fall asleep a few times now in this seat and everytime, her little head is dangling down because the seat doesn't tilt back far enough to help her head stay in between the rests. She looks SO uncomfortable. While the Britax wasn't perfect, I wish I had spent the extra money and gotten that seat instead. Buyer's remorse. :-(
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: latch system, much harder to situate the seat properly, tighening is only on the right side of the seat, latch on the right and left are independent of each other
Harness Type: 5 point harness, crotch strap, straps and buckles, chest clip
Material: straps and buckles feel cheap, flimsy

Review: I liked the way this car seat easily snapped into the base, stroller, and shopping carts, but I hate hate hated the handle and dreaded having to carry it for any length of time.  I'm glad that we got rid of it before our third child.  We bought the Baby Trend Flex-Loc infant car seat this time with the triangular rubber grip handle that is much easier to handle and much more comfortable to carry.
